d84622ee962cb937.title: Social Media Manager
d84622ee962cb937.description: About usMore than ever people are struggling with their mental health and wellbeing. This has resulted in an exponential demand for our services. UKTG is a specialist referral website that matches clients with the best properly-trained and qualified therapists across the nation and overseas.Our objective is to become the largest mental-wellbeing platform in the UK and to help millions of people in this country find meaning and purpose in their lives. We are committed to promoting the concept and advantages of therapy and aim to carry the message of therapeutic catharsis. Quite simply, we aim to make a difference to the lives of those struggling by making possible the opportunity of a positive therapeutic relationship.We are a platform that manages therapists and clients. As a start-up no two days are the same. While there may be continuous tasks to complete throughout the working day, you will also be able to assist on new projects and help implement processesAbout the roleThe Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing and delivering strategies focused on brand awareness, follower growth and engagement. We are looking for someone who is passionate about our brand and full of ideas to be able to develop creative solutions to key business challenges.What you will be doing: Design, deliver and implement social media strategy including channel-specific strategies for different platforms eg. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Youtube, Tiktok, LinkedIn (and new channels if relevant for us)Create social media plans for initiatives such as product launches, campaigns, webinars, events and monitor their performanceYou will work with a diverse mix of teams across our business - including Editorial, PR, SEO, Product, Commercial, Data and Operations - to gather a rich variety of data & research, and increase the brand awareness and community engagementManaging social media budgetOverseeing customer service to our social communities by closely monitoring and responding to comments and mentionsCreate and manage the social media calendarLead on content strategy, including text posts, video and images on all social media platformsKeeping track of industry and platform innovations to fuel future growth of our channelsCompetitors analysis and demographic research within our sectorCollect and analyse data from multiple sources eg Google Analytics, Hotjar, Hootsuite etcReporting on your efforts to Exec team, considering metrics like brand perception, follower growth, click rates and impressionsEnsuring our social channels are aligned and consistent with our brand and marketing strategiesWhat we are looking for: 1-2 years in a social media roleA proven track record of growing and engaging communities across social mediaProficiency with social media management tools, such as HootsuiteExperience in creative development and copywriting with outstanding written and verbal skillsPassion for mental health and/or psychologyHigh degree of integrity and personal responsibilityGoogle workspace experienceDesired: Previous experience of working in a tech startupCanva experienceA university or relevant college qualificationReasons To Work With Us: 22 days holiday - plus bank holidays and your birthday off!Lovely office with chilling areasFlexible working pattern after successful probationThe role will be based in the Head Office in Fulham, LondonFull time permanent positionSalary range: £30,000 - £35,000Work remotelyTemporarily due to COVID-19Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £30,000.00-£35,000.00 per yearBenefits:Discounted or free foodFlexible scheduleGym membershipPrivate dental insurancePrivate medical insuranceWellness programmesSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)Experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 year (preferred)social media: 1 year (preferred)

51e80d19f79b77d2.title: Brand Manager
51e80d19f79b77d2.description:
Job title: Brand Manager
Responsible to: VP A&R/Brand Management
Department: Bravado
Location of work: 4 Pancras Square, Kings Cross


Music is Universal

It’s the passionate and dedicated team at Universal Music who help make us the world’s leading music company. From A&R to finance, legal to digital, sales to marketing, Universal Music is the place to grow and develop your career within a truly commercial and innovative business that leads in everything it does.

Everyone is welcome to apply for our roles, and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment because of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, belief, age, marital status, background, pregnancy or caring responsibilities. We also recognise the importance of diversity of thought within our teams and are fully committed to embracing the talents of people with autism, dyslexia, ADHD and other forms of neurocognitive variation.

We will always seek to make appropriate adjustments to recruitment, workplaces, and work processes to be fully inclusive to people with different needs and working styles. If you need us to make any reasonable adjustments for you from application onwards, including alternatives to the online form or to disclose a neurocognitive condition, please email UniversalMusicCareers@umusic.com


The A Side: A Day in The Life

Part of the Universal Music Group International Bravado is a fast-growing Music Merchandise company. They acquire and actively promote merchandise rights for UK and International music acts, celebrities and entertainment properties.

Bravado works closely with new and established clients to create innovative products and marketing plans carefully tailored to each artist or brand. Clients include over a hundred music brands such as Kanye West, Spice Girls, Elton John, The Who, The Rolling Stones, Bob Marley, Sex Pistols, Sam Smith, Take That, Skepta and Guns N’ Roses.

Bravado is currently looking for a Brand Manager to oversee a number of Bravado’s music brands. This individual will work with the unique needs and challenges of our clients to deliver full-service support in a variety of categories including strategic planning, brand development, consumer marketing and creative development. This person will be the central owner of the brands and will work cross-functionally with sales, tour, licensing, direct to consumer and operations teams to develop creative plans and ensure they are executed flawlessly across the globe.
The B Side: Skills & Experience

Be Managerial
Define vision, mission, goals and strategy for each brand
Develop a global brand building and marketing plan that fits with the client/brand vision
Work closely with artist and their management to develop merchandising strategies resulting in best revenue opportunities.
Awareness of the brand’s P&L and how your strategy can drive revenue
Work with sales and direct-to-consumer teams to develop integrated product/marketing campaigns around artists
Develop and execute non-traditional marketing campaigns around artist merchandise
Monitor and analyse business metrics in order to optimise product line and maximise commercial opportunity
Work closely with Sales, Licensing, D2C and touring departments to develop product lines and ensure artist strategy is executed
Develop artist brand standards and usage guidelines
Oversee the development of existing and potential client presentation materials

Be Organised

Ensure campaigns and strategies are executed to the highest standards globally
Oversee the management of the product portfolio for each brand including product development, creative identity, style guides and internal approvals
Obtain and expedite all approvals required from artist

Be Creative

Oversee development of creative materials for artist roster
Develop and test new product concepts
Ensure all materials are consistent with strategy, on time and within budget, legally compliant

Person Specification


Necessary
Demonstrate capability driving brand growth and brand equity with smart and creative marketing plans
Experience working cross functionally to drive brand and product initiatives from concept to execution
Proven track record of consumer engagement planning, innovative thinking, program development and execution
A strategic approach to brand building programs
Overall leadership and management of brand growth through sound strategic thinking and excellence in execution
Awareness and interest in current fashion trends and styles
Interest in music, especially pop/classic rock/urban
Knowledge of delivering memorable brand experiences, social media campaigns, advertising campaigns, media
Planning and brand tracking tools
Experience in multi-cultural marketing
Foster and develop a strong partnership with the client
Strong experience with brand planning and marketing support
Experience in managing innovation and new product development
Experience coaching employees and being coached
Experience in owning and tracking P&L and budget items with emphasis on ROI
Independent self-starter, flexible, comfortable working in unstructured environment, and able to manage multiple priorities effortlessly
Excellent communication skills verbal/written, meetings and presentations
Team player with collaborative style and good listening skills
Proficient in Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Bonus Tracks: Your Benefits

Group Personal Pension Scheme (between 3% and 9%)
Private Medical Insurance
25 paid days of annual leave
Interest Free Season Ticket Loan
Holiday Purchase scheme
Dental and Travel Insurance options
Cycle to Work Scheme
Salary Sacrifice Cars
Subsidised Gym Membership
Employee Discounts (Reward Gateway)
Just So You Know...


The company presents this job description as a guide to the major areas and duties for which the jobholder is accountable. However, the business operates in an environment that demands change and the jobholder's specific responsibilities and activities will vary and develop. Therefore, the job description should be seen as indicative and not as a permanent, definitive and exhaustive statement

d3e99b3882f4da28.title: Senior Social Media Manager - Travel
d3e99b3882f4da28.description:
Senior Social Media Manager - Travel
London
Our client, a leading Travel group, is looking for a Senior Social Media Manager to join their team in London. This is a permanent position.
The role will require you to be in a London office a few days a week, so you should be within commutable distance. It is paying up to £63,000 depending on experience and the salary is not negotiable further than this.
The ideal person will be focusing on implementing the social media strategy and you should be able to manage one direct report as well as agencies. You will be a strong story-teller and have a strong creative aptitude. You will help to drive conversion and social engagement, and have the ability to implement brand and influencer campaigns, with proven experience of increasing conversion and ROI.
You will be data driven and deliver regular social media insights using google analytics and social media listening tools. You will set up the Social Media and Influencer Marketing strategy, do an audit of the current strategy in place and manage the content agency and internal team members to produce highly creative content.
The ideal person will be able to work well within a team and in a fast-paced environment, with ever-changing priorities. You will have strong stakeholder management skills, be able to work to deadlines and manage direct reports effectively.
If you match the above, please apply.

eeb3182153b35cac.title: Social Media Manager
eeb3182153b35cac.description:
We are Wireless: Driving digital innovation, our people create award-winning national and local radio and podcasts which are must-listens for millions across the UK, Ireland and beyond. Life sounds good with Virgin Radio - home to Chris Evans at Breakfast and Graham Norton at the weekend. talkSPORT, the world’s biggest sports radio station, delivers the very best live sport and analysis and is truly powered by its millions of fans. Launched in June 2020 Times Radio brings together the peerless journalistic expertise of The Times and The Sunday Times with world-class broadcast talent including John Pienaar, Aasmah Mir and Michael Portillo. And talkRADIO is redefining speech broadcasting on digital audio platforms, connected TV and beyond.

The Team:

The talkSPORT website is viewed by millions of people a month, while we have 1.6 million followers on Twitter, a Facebook page with three million likes and a YouTube channel with more than 900,000 subscribers.

We are now looking for a Social Media Manager with a real passion for sport to join our expanding digital department.

The Role:

As Social Media Manager of talkSPORT.com, you will lead a small team and manage the day to day running of our Twitter, Facebook and Instagram accounts. You will come up with creative ways to promote our website content to a wide audience online and work closely with the editorial team, ensuring they have sufficient insight to produce internet-friendly stories.

This is not an entry level role, we're looking for candidates with experience within the area, please review the criteria for the role before applying.

Day to day you will:

Edit and maintain talkSPORT’s social media channels to a high standard
Create and manage posts across all social platforms
Break news stories quickly under pressure
Generate creative content ideas
Monitor trends and offer insight to editorial team
Use analytics tools to improve understanding of audience
Analyse data and share performance with senior management

What we’re looking for in the ideal candidate:

Passion for sports journalism and creating engaging content
Strong editorial judgement
Previous experience in a similar role
Proven ability to grow social media accounts
Immersed in social media and always up to date with the latest trends
Able to prioritise tasks and excel in a fast-moving, pressurised environment
Team player with an exceptional work ethic
Experience of using photo editing tools
Happy to work flexibly, including evening and weekend shifts

Life at Wireless

We champion diversity and inclusion, we strive to maximise and encourage every individual’s potential and ensure everyone feels valued. We support this through our Diversity Board, D&I strategy & training, creating more diverse content and our intern and apprenticeship programmes. We also have 8 employee-led networks; Cultural Diversity, News is Out, GenZ, Sustainability Champions, News for Parents, Women in Tech, News UK Christian Fellowship and we are awaiting the launch of our Women’s Steering Group.

We take pride in looking after our amazing talent at Wireless supporting the Health and Wellbeing of our staff. We offer private medical insurance covering pre-existing conditions, discounted gym memberships, ClassPass at Home, weekly virtual HIIT, yoga and run club classes, and a ‘Bikes for Work’ scheme, as well as offering opportunities for physio/massage, counselling and legal support.

In addition we also offer:

A generous pension scheme with employer contributions of up to 5%;
25 days holiday and up to 4 volunteering days per year;
Maternity leave up to 18 weeks full basic salary & paternity leave up to 2 weeks;
Wide range of training available, plus full LinkedIn Learning access.

We want to ensure that everyone we meet has the opportunity to perform to their best when interviewing, so feel free to let us know, at any stage, whether you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, and we will do our best to accommodate.

We are a diverse team and strive to maximise and encourage every individual’s potential. We want to create a productive environment where everyone feels valued, and where talents are fully recognised, utilised and celebrated.

News UK is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to providing equal opportunities for all its employees and applicants. We oppose all forms of discrimination in the workplace.

We thrive when we champion diversity and inclusion. We make better decisions, we’re stronger and happier, and it’s the right thing to do.

f1b36dbf10cc578f.title: Marketing Manager, Marketing Performance and Technology
f1b36dbf10cc578f.description:
The LEGO Group is looking for a Marketing Manager, Marketing Performance and Technology
Join the Marketing team to drive the global agenda on marketing performance and lead a data – driven decision making to maximize business and brand impact!

This is a permanent role could be based in our office in London or Billund.
Core ResponsibilitiesWork closely with the marketing organisation, data science team and our media agency in creating actionable insights to drive the marketing performance agendaStrengthen advanced analytics models by identifying and activating new data points across owned, earned, and paid media channelsManage marketing performance projects across internal and external stakeholders.Deliver presentations and downloads to stakeholders across markets, global marketing functions and top management with focus on how to drive insights to concrete actionsEducate the business in how to interpret and action advanced analytics insights to strengthen fact-based decision making across the full marketing value chain
Play your part in our team succeeding
The Global Marketing Performance and Technology (MPT) team is part of Brand, Marketing, Insights and Partnership (BMIP), a global marketing team working across the full marketing value chain.

Advanced analytics is a key part of the data-driven journey in the marketing organization. Being able to provide insights on the effect of marketing activities across paid, owned and earned as well as support global product and marketing development plays a pivotal role in enabling the organization to make the right decisions
Do you have what it takes?
You have a master’s degree in Marketing. You have 3-5 years marketing experience working with larger media agencies and/or social platforms. You also have consumer products or FMCG marketing experience. You bring over extensive marketing experience including executing campaigns across owned, earned, shared and paid channels. You have outstanding communication and presentation skills.

In addition, you have:
Experience leading projects involving cross functional teamsStrong analytical skills and ability to transform rather complex findings to simple insights, directions, and recommendationsExperience working with media analytics and BI or data scienceExperience in change management and in building and launching new systems and tools.
As an individual, you are proficient in English. You are well-organized and highly analytical with the ability to joggle multiple projects at a time.

Join the global LEGO® team
What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect:

Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programs run by local teams where you are based

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.

Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

These are exciting times for the LEGO Group as they look to build on their continued success. In their quest to reach the builders of tomorrow, they are looking to hire the best talent and have teamed up with some awesome partners in the market, like us! This might mean you could be contacted by multiple people about different opportunities. Don’t worry though,this just means you have a really interesting profile! Be sure to let us know if you’re already speaking with the LEGO Group directly so we can make sure you’re always talking to the right people.

This position is being managed by our talent search partner Cielo. By clicking on the apply button you’ll be taken to the job post on Cielo’s LinkedIn page where you should hit apply to submit your application. A member of the Cielo team will then review your profile and application.

adae378956fd7002.title: Social Media Manager (Influencers) - Luxury
adae378956fd7002.description:
Social Media Manager (Influencers)- Luxury
London
Our client, a fast-growing luxury brand, is looking for a strong and proactive Social Media Manager to join their team with a focus on Influencer Marketing specifically.
You will have strong experience with creating and implementing Influencer Marketing campaigns, reaching out to all levels of influencers from micro level to celebrities, arranging contracts and defining KPI's.
You will ideally come from a PR and Social Media background, be super proactive in creating influencer and celebrity relationships and have proven experience implementing successful Influencer campaigns.
If you match the above please apply.

08bf2d6042e28c64.title: Influencer and Media (PR) Manager
08bf2d6042e28c64.description:
Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for our mobile hits. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console department of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope and Die by the Blade.
With a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, we have a truly global team making games for a global audience.
Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit?
What’s the job?
Our Influencer and Media (PR) Manager will be creating content for various social media platforms and gaming communication channels, and getting our PC & Console titles in front of, and supported by the gaming media and influencers.
What you tell your friends you do
“I identify and support the Influencers that play Kwalee’s PC & console games and devise new initiatives to help the games grow.”
What you will really be doing
Developing and executing strategies to establish Kwalee’s PC and console titles among gaming media & influencers.
Leading & managing a team of skilled PR, Influencer and media communication experts.
Becoming a recognised figure in the media landscape for Kwalee’s PC & Console games.
Establishing Kwalee as a recognised curator of premium third-party PC & Console games amongst media, influencers and other tastemakers.
Establishing a working framework of systems and processes to plan & deliver effective Influencer and media campaigns and manage your team’s workload.
Leading outreach to influencers across various platforms and making it easier for them to play Kwalee games.
How you will be doing this
You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results.
You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best.
You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you will get it. We even have a robot!
Team
Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 200 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games.
Skills and requirements
Previous experience on PC & Console games including min 5 years in a PR or communications management role
Ability to conceptualise and execute effective media strategies to cover a game’s entire lifespan
Passion for games and knowledge of industry trends and key players
Interested in gaming influencer trends, the successful candidate will use this mindset to assist with influencer outreach for new titles
Experience in establishing meaningful KPIs and metrics to monitor performance of the Influencer & Media team’s work and ability to report to senior management in a concise and timely manner.
Interested in gaming PR and media trends, familiarity with industry standards such as the Barcelona Principles - the successful candidate will use this mindset to assist with media and influencer outreach for new titles
We offer
In addition to a competitive salary we also contribute to your pension, offer private medical cover and life assurance
Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday)
A dog friendly office - bring your favourite pooch! (There’s dog-free areas too)
Hybrid model available depending on the department and the role
Access to on site gym - no more skiving!
25 days of paid holidays plus bank holidays
Relocation support available
VISA Sponsorship available
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Entertainment area with consoles, pool table, tennis table and darts!
Monthly employee awards
Free snacks, fruit and drinks
Our philosophy
We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible.
Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference.
