f140091838ce2f44.title: Social Media Content Writer
f140091838ce2f44.description: Job Role – Social Media Content WriterFull Time PermanentSalary:  £23,000 Per AnnumLocation:  Office in ShoreditchOverview: This is a brand-new position for LLO Group, you have the freedom to create something amazing!We are searching for a highly collaborative, driven, and passionate social media Content Writer, for our social media platforms. In addition to the social media content this role will also include blog, PR, and website content writing as well as the co-ordination of influencers and their content.This is a truly exciting opportunity for a social media expert to manage and deliver the social media strategy for all LLO Group Brands. You will take day-to-day responsibility for all our digital platforms including our badhandwriting brand Instagram, Tik Tok and You tube channels.The LLO Groups goal is to make everyday LIFE LESS ORDINARY with exciting fashion, products, and design. Our first brand that we launched in December 2021 is badhandwriting, a fashion company targeting 14–26-year-olds that has a lot of love for the LGBTQ+ community, equality, the legalisation of Marijuana and body positivity.Working closely with our marketing campaign manager, our creative designer, and the whole studio team, you’ll devise social campaigns in line with our brand values that will deliver meaningful engagement with our community and customer base.As a creative and innovative thinker, you will represent our voice and be quick to react to everyday life and not be afraid to push the boundaries.Whilst your creativity will know no bounds, you will equally be able to analyse results for all platforms to identify areas that perform well and areas that need to evolve or do not perform. Using your analysis, you will react quickly to ensure you deliver on our key performance indicators.Objectives: My Monthly One to One - 100% CompletionAttendance - Greater than 95%Role KPI'sCreate engaging content, imagery and tone of voice that feels authentic and relatable to our customer baseCreate and deliver a targeted number of social media posts per week via Instagram using scheduled and real time contentDeliver a split of stories, reels, stills and videos in line with published KPIsCreate and deliver a targeted number of social media posts per week via TIK TOK via scheduled and real time contentCreate and maintain brand specific YouTube channel and deliver minimum content in line with KPI’sDrive, monitor and respond to engagement with our online community in line with brand personalityDeliver innovation by exploring new features of existing social platforms and / or expanding too newWork with the team to build a collection launch plan each season and oversee the production of content with the Creative Designer and MCMSupport the Marketing Campaign Manager in writing content for blogs and email campaignsCo-ordination and management of the LLO Influencer program contentDeliver content writing for LLO Press Releases in line with our PR programSupport the Production team with the creative content writing for our website and productsIdentify and implement relevant additional social media channels to the LLO Group brands.Benefits: - Life Assurance- Employee Assistance Programme- Annual Leave 23 days Plus Bank Holidays (increasing with length of service)Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £23,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayReference ID: GC07032022D

4f0995f0d9d1c0f5.title: Social Media Officer – Ashby
4f0995f0d9d1c0f5.description:
The Team & Focus of the Role

You will be joining a creative and innovative Business Development & Communications team. As Social Media Officer you’ll manage our social presence producing engaging content, raising external engagement and providing reports on what is working well. You will have a high level of knowledge of different social media channels and have a real passion for engaging our communities in our business activities through videos, graphics and other creative content. You’ll understand which social platforms are the right fit for our different audiences and look for new ways to engage our audiences.

You will be the voice of Fisher German through our social media and ensure our output is aligned to our ‘OneFG’ approach, social media strategy and stringent brand guidelines. You will work closely with the wider team to align key messaging across internal and external platforms and give external audiences a positive view of Fisher German, our work and our clients. The ability to communicate creatively and build relationships with multiple stakeholders across the business and with external partners is essential for the role.

This will be a full time position based on 37.5Hrs, Mon-Fri 08:45-17:15.

Duties will include:

Administer the firm’s central social media accounts
Work closely with the Marketing Manager and Communications Manager to ensure consistency of brand and voice and alignment on focus campaigns and topics
Work closely with stakeholders from across the business to generate creative content in line with our vision and values, using a range of methods including infographics and videos
Ensure continuity and timeliness between the firm’s PR activity and social media content, building close and trusted relationships with our chosen suppliers
Collaborate with our Talent Acquisition and Graduate teams to ensure vacancies are advertised appropriately and social media channels accurately reflect our employer brand approach
Build strong relationships with Division and Department representatives to ensure output accurately reflects our business activities
Be the in-house guru for social media guidance for the business and uphold quality standards across platforms. Provide training and support to colleagues on appropriate use of social media for business as required
Provide a first line of support for any complaints raised through social media and ensure these are appropriately handled and passed to the Compliance team
Build engagement across social media channels through quality, organic content as well as PPC campaigns as required
Report on social media engagement and activity monthly and make recommendations on where we can improve
Manage all published content and assets on social media, including images, videos, GIFs and written copy
Hold responsibility for the firm’s image library and iStock account
Research and recommend new approaches and trends in social media tools, applications, channels, design and strategy
Work with the wider Business Development & Communications team to provide copywriting and graphics support.

The successful candidate will have...

2+ years’ experience in a role where social media management is required. We will also consider applicants who have built experience and knowledge through personal social presence
A sound working knowledge of Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube, Vimeo and their reporting mechanisms, including experience of setting up and reporting on PPC campaigns
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail and ability to meet strict deadlines
Excellent grasp of grammar and punctuation, with a minimum A-level equivalent in English Language / English Literature or similar subject
Confident using the Adobe suite, including Photoshop, InDesign, Rush and/or Premiere Pro
Self-starter, with a willingness to get involved in a variety of projects
Excellent organisational, planning and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure
Creative and confident communicator and content generator who is willing to share their ideas and try new approaches
Strong desire and focus to deliver added value
Team player.

Why Fisher German?

We’ve been around for a while, but it doesn’t mean we are behind the times! Across our office network we offer a hybrid working approach to help our colleagues design their working day to suit their diaries. Some days you might be in the office enjoying a collaborative team day, and other days might see you focussing on project work at home. Wherever you choose to work, you’ll be part of a social and digitally connected workforce with the chance to get involved in a variety of activities, like sports events, pop-up bars, BBQs, CPD days, live leadership updates on Zoom, picnics in the park and lots more.

What’s not to love? We work hard but we also have lots of fun! If that sounds like something you would enjoy, then please get in touch.

We have a history going back as far as 1830 but have been Fisher German since 2000. We operate UK wide advising and managing a range of client portfolios with national visibility across all the 6-property market sectors; rural, commercial, development, residential, infrastructure services and sustainable energy

Bring Yourself to Work

It’s simple really, we are passionate about what we do, and we want you to be driven to succeed with us. For this to happen, you need to feel supported and included which is why we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer.
Share on Facebook
Share on Twitter
Share on LinkedIn
Share over Email

97ed911cb61a0d6c.title: Digital Media Specialist - Paid Social
97ed911cb61a0d6c.description:
Overview:

The Global Subscriber Acquisition (GSA) team acts as an internal global marketing team that handles the media strategy, buying, execution, and reporting of all media vehicles with the goal of driving multiplatform consumption of Discovery Inc’s networks and subscriber growth for our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) products. We’re growing our team of smart, hungry, and upbeat doers who crave the chance to build and support products with the global leader in real life entertainment.
The Paid Social Specialist will lead the implementation and development of the paid social channel, maximising customer growth at cost-effective levels. Reporting to the Paid Social Manager, the successful candidate will also integrate cross-functionally, regularly liaising with other teams within GSA and the wider business org.
Responsibilities:
Own the strategy and performance of paid social activity with full operational responsibility
Lead Paid Social planning and media-buying across all territories, ensuring both functions are optimised to achieve high levels of growth with an ROI-focus
Keep abreast of market trends and developments
Work closely with the planning teams to recommend effective growth strategies and budget
Effectively collaborate with other teams and internal stakeholders
Lead Social innovation within the team and the effective use of relevant tools, identifying new BETAs and data sources to drive our Paid Social offering forward
Clearly communicate performance and uncover growth levers
Effectively document our strategies and approach to drive common understanding and efficiency
Qualifications:
2+ years’ experience with a track record of delivering success in a similar role
Demonstrated experience in media strategy and execution within buying platforms (e.g., Facebook Business Manager), showing the ability to manage multiple campaigns at once
Experience with app campaigns and Mobile Marketing
Attribution (such as Kochava) preferred
Proven experience with Direct Response campaigns with experience with attribution, conversion tracking, and optimizing towards strict KPI goals.
Highly numerate, logical thinker, comfortable using excel to both run campaign analysis and provide recommendations, with experience using analytics to drive decision-making
Demonstrable experience driving growth through testing and analytics
Strong appreciation of the marketing funnel, and the relationship with specific tactics with clear POVs on tracking, attribution, ad fraud, cookie windows, etc.
Excited by working in a fast-paced environment with excellent troubleshooting and QA skills - strong attention to detail essential
Proven project management, self-organisation and prioritisation skills - Ability to multi-task with effective resolution management in a fast-paced, growing environment
Reasonable availability to respond to requests and attend the real-time needs of campaigns outside normal business hours.
Clear communicator who can translate strategy into action.
Additional languages a plus.
Must have the legal right to work in the country you are applying for.

1f06d5e71a3a8578.title: Social Media Manager at HRtechX
1f06d5e71a3a8578.description:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment, where you gain a tremendous amount of responsibility? Do you want to be part of an exceptional entrepreneurial team with young, motivated and extremely driven people? And are you curious or passionate about people? If so, you might be our next Social Media Manager.

About us

HRtechX is a world leading HRtech community, connecting industry executives, entrepreneurs and professionals. We are a start-up on a growth journey who help leaders evolve and create stronger businesses through people and technology. We aim to address the challenges and opportunities for HR and HR Tech.

We bring together the most influential executives, investors, and entrepreneurs to share their insights on how technology will shape the future of HR, as well as forge long lasting partnerships and client relationships.

HRtechX is part of United Media which focuses on building large scale industry media and conferences products in sectors such as insurance, HR, private equity, retail, etc. As of today, we have organically launched 8 media companies and acquired one.

What we offer you

As our Social Media Manager you'll have the unique opportunity to be part of building and scaling a company. By providing you with the ownership of our content marketing, we want to constantly push you out of your comfort zone. You'll be working out of our HQ in London and to ensure a never ending growth curve, we provide you with:
An opportunity for getting operational experience in a scale-up where both your work and the results are highly tangible and matters to the businessA chance to work closely together with the CEO on our Social Media MarketingUnlimited growth potential in our company - we strongly believe in and have a track record of promoting internally.

Your Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will vary; however, some of them will be to:
Manage the day-to-day handling of all social media channels with aggregate +255,000 cross-platform followersScale follower base on LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube, and adapt the content to suit different channelsResearch industry-related topics and generate ideas for content and curating it for social mediaCopywrite, design, edit and repurpose audio, visual and written contentExecute data-driven strategies to our social media presence

What we expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:
Have acquired a bachelor's or master's degree with outstanding results2+ Years of experienceHave an UK work permitPossess exceptional analytical and problem solving skillsAre an excellent communicator in writing with an exceptional attention to detailAre excellent at communicating both written and verbally

Startdate

As soon as possible

b018a05356750191.title: US Brand Manager
b018a05356750191.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY
Introducing a brand-new role with plenty of scope for impact in the fashion and gifting sector. As our USA Brand Manager you will own in-market execution and localization of marketing campaigns for Katie Loxton in the USA. You'll lead initiatives to grow the brand digitally through increasing brand awareness, recruiting new customers and driving sales.
Working closely with the Global marketing team based in the UK, you will lead on USA marketing activity, aligning with the Global brand vision to meet USA business objectives. You'll get to partner with teams across the business including eComms and Creative.
Aligning with the UK based team on marketing strategy and execution plans, you will be the voice of the brand in territory, ensuring that all in-market opportunities are maximized, and that all marketing comms are relevant and appropriate for the local audience.
We are looking for someone based in the UK with proven previous experience working within the US market.
BEHIND THE BRANDS
We’re a family-run, entrepreneurial company with an exciting pace of life and a bright and friendly team. We are passionate about creating stunning products with a personal touch and innovating our business behind the scenes. We value creativity, collaboration and integrity.
HOW YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE

Act as our brand guardian and champion for the USA
Develop and execute in-market brand marketing plans, partnering with digital and social teams to deliver on business objectives and drive brand growth for USA
Localization of marketing campaigns, aligning to the global campaign vision and working with the Global team to ensure in-market relevancy whilst maintaining the core brand identity in line with the overall brand vision
Oversee the USA arm of the Marketing Calendar, aligning with global campaigns and ensuring that all regional brand moments and opportunities are fulfilled
Collaborate with the Creative & Copy teams on USA marketing requirements, overseeing marketing design briefs ensuring marketing content is fit for purpose for the market, for each channel, and that all content aligns
Initiate and coordinate reciprocal marketing activity with complimentary brand partners to drive brand awareness and meet marketing goals, including social following targets, email database growth
Ensuring that all marketing activity is in line with the approved budgets set, and monitoring brand marketing spend
With support of the Social Media & Influencer Coordinator continue to develop and grow our paid and organic Brand Ambassador program to include USA based influencers, driving social following, engagement, brand awareness and commercial performance (with support from an external agency and SBMM)
Maintain in-depth understanding of the consumer, category, competition, and trends and transform into insights and opportunities to grow the brand
Innovate through identifying new marketing opportunities, ensuring that all marketing delivers commercial results and supports the global brand vision.

THE TALENT YOU'LL BRING

Proven success in the development and implementation of marketing campaigns for a fast-growing .com led business
Ability to think global, but act local
Digital first, with standout experience with influencer and social marketing
Ability to develop and execute marketing plans
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Highly organised with strong attention to detail
Creativity, with the ability to consistently align to the brand.
The ability to work practically as well as theoretically
Ability to thrive in a dynamic evolving environment
Experience working in the fashion industry desirable
Highly self-motivated, with a ‘can do’ attitude and a keen eye for detail

PERFECTLY PACKAGED

A competitive salary of £35,000 - £45,000 per year
A broad benefits package including our staff favourite – a very generous staff discount across both our brands. See all of our benefits on our careers portal
Our staff exclusive interactive magazine
Opportunities to make an impact as well as learn and develop further
An innovative and friendly workplace with a team we’re proud to be part of. Find out more about us and our culture on our careers portal

We strive to be the best in our field and we know that happens by hiring the best people, which means a diverse and talented team. We don’t hire based on age, background, or nationality – it’s what you bring to the team that counts.

4221161b585e0597.title: Social Media Manager
4221161b585e0597.description:
Salary
£36,000 to £38,000 per annum, plus £4,452 London Weighting if applicable
Package
Permanent. Full Time 35 hours per week. 28 days annual leave plus bank holidays, Employee Assistance Helpline, Life Assurance. Voluntary Benefits: Group Pension Plan, Cycle to Work Scheme, Charity Worker Discounts.
Contractual hours
Blank
Basis
Full time
Job category/type
+ Brand and Marketing
The Role


At the Royal British Legion, we believe in building on potential. As Social Media Manager your ability to manage and develop RBL’s organic social media presence could have a real impact on people’s lives.


At its heart, RBL is a people organisation. People who want to do the very best for others, while at the same time making the most of the opportunities and experiences we offer them.


We are the country’s largest Armed Forces charity, with 210,000 members, 50,000 volunteers and a network of partners and charities; helping us give support wherever and whenever it’s needed.

As Social Media Manager you will be responsible for ensuring social media content is both relevant and engaging and supports the delivery of our One Legion strategy. Working with colleagues across the organisation, you will influence and educate key stakeholders on the development of effective social media content.


If successful, the main duties of your role will be:


Support the Head of Social Media and Content in the development and implementation of a national and regional social media strategy and social media polices.
Oversee community management, ensuring standard responses are up to date and work with other teams to produce proactive and reactive lines as required
Provide guidance and coaching to staff at all levels on social media best practice, building a network of contacts across all departments and divisions of RBL.
Liaise and collaborate with senior stakeholders across the organisation to identify current and future needs, advising on the most effective approach and negotiating requests for support.
Manage the Social Media Officer, providing guidance and direction and ongoing developmental support.
Own and manage the social media content plan and ensure an approval process is in place for all external facing social media content.
Lead on monthly reporting of channel growth and engagement, competitor analysis and ongoing channel and audience research, keeping abreast of developments in the social media sector to ensure RBL is making effective use of best practice.
Work closely with digital team to manage paid social media, including small-scale budgets, raising all necessary purchase orders, ensuring financial efficiency and maximum return on investment.


You will have demonstrable experience in crisis comms and managing large online communities. You will be an organised and proactive individual with the ability to manage multiple deadlines and projects, who should be equally comfortable working independently and as part of larger, cross department working groups.


Please note that this role can be based at our London office, which is located at Haig House, 199 Borough High Street, London SE1 1AA, or can be homebased. London Weighting will be offered to candidates based at Haig House with an expectation to attend the London office regularly. Candidates taking up the role on a remote basis will not be eligible for London Weighting, however all work-related travel expenses will be paid.


About the Royal British Legion – Careers in Marketing and Remembrance

Across the country, in every city and on every street, the RBL is there to support our Armed Forces community.


Our Marketing and Remembrance teams ensure that the RBL’s key messages are delivered and understood by people across the nation. Not just by those we are here to support, but by everyone in this country who owe a debt of gratitude to all who have served. It's this mission, this scale, this challenge and the values we all live by, that makes the Legion such a fulfilling place to thrive.


Whether it’s through our Brand, press and television coverage, or integrated digital campaigns, as a member of our Marketing and Remembrance teams, you’d help ensure the unique contribution of the Armed Forces community is never forgotten. While inspiring people to engage with the Legion and make an impact for good.


This team is made up of people with a broad range of skills from an even broader range of sectors. If you were to join, together you’d implement the brand and marketing strategy, and deliver events like the Festival of Remembrance.


So, whatever your talents and expertise, if you want to give your days meaning. To put your passion into a role with real impact. To support people and be supported yourself. In an inclusive team that faces every challenge together. We think you’ll find a role here that works for you.


Diversity Statement


We believe that the compassion, understanding and service we show each, and every individual customer should be reflected in the way we all support, respect and include every individual who works with us.


It’s because of this that we have strived hard to create a One Legion culture that we can all feel part of and succeed in. It’s why we make sure that you have the opportunities you need to learn and develop. It’s why we’re invested in making RBL a truly inclusive place to work, where everyone can be themselves. It’s why you’re welcome, whoever you might be.


It’s why we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.


How to Apply


Please click ‘Apply Online’


Closing date for this role is: Tuesday 8th March 2022

b24e2459d92393ad.title: Media Manager
b24e2459d92393ad.description:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Multiple years professional experience in media planning/buying and the media landscape for one of the following EU countries: NL/PL/FR/DE/UK. Experience in more than one local would be beneficial but not essential.
Highly detail-oriented, have excellent organisational skills, and ability to multi-task
Self-motivation, flexibility and an impeccable attention to detail
Strong quantitative and analytical skills including working with budgets and numbers
Advanced proficiency in Excel and Word

The EU XCM (Cross-Category, Cross-Channel, Cross-Country Marketing) team is looking for a Media Manager, with extensive cross-channel planning experience and with particular knowledge of either retail, technology or FMCG categories. This role is a maternity cover (12-months contract).

The successful candidate will: Help develop the media strategy for cross-country activities across the EU supporting our strategic communications priorities. Own the detailed media planning of their campaigns, working with our agency partners. Partner with key stakeholders across the business.

We are looking for someone who is highly organised and comfortable working in a fast-moving, dynamic environment. Strong candidates must have the ability to work autonomously, have excellent written and verbal communications skills and the ability to influence others. This role works closely with our strategy planning and campaign management teams to translate business briefs into best-in-class media plans. This role is based at our Amazon corporate offices in London/UK or Munich/DE.

Responsibilities

Manage multi-channel (TV, Digital, Social, Radio, Print, OOH, Cinema) media plans, alongside the Senior Media Manager, across a range of varied business categories.
Monitor campaign performance and report back results to wider team and stakeholders.
Work with the Senior Media Manager to develop and present recommendations, evaluations, POVs and media analyses to relevant stakeholder(s).
Build trustworthy relationships with internal business teams, agency partners, and finance teams.
Ensure smooth running of the business through strong coordination with wider media team and global colleagues – aligning and sharing plans and accurate tracking of budgets.
Media agency experience or in-house agency experience
Intense bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment
Outstanding oral, written, and presentation skills
Knowledge of either retail, technology or FMCG categories

3b907e252389346e.title: Communications Manager - Research and Development
3b907e252389346e.description:
Are you interested in using your extensive communication skills to elevate world class research?

Oxford Health’s research and development division alongside our NIHR funded Biomedical Research Centre - one of only two dedicated to mental health and dementia - is already at the cutting edge when translating brain research into life-transforming benefits for patients.

Now we are looking for a dynamic multi-talented communications manager to join our team at a pivotal time.

At Oxford Health we pride ourselves on our commitment to research – it’s one of our four strategic objectives. We are also striving to be an NHS organisation that will become synonymous with world class translational mental health research.

Our new team member will be embedded in the Trust’s communications team, but will hold special responsibility for designing and delivering communications and engagement strategies for Research and Development and the NIHR Oxford Health BRC.

This includes leading on internal communications to raise the profile of research within the trust and planning and delivering external communications to ensure that patients, the public and funders are well informed about our research and achievements.

Sitting within a complex research environment in the heart of Oxford, you will work collaboratively with key partners and stakeholders locally, nationally and internationally.

Strong skills in media management are essential as is the ability to turn complex research into digestible news and information that resonates with a range of audiences.

You will be highly adaptable and work with agility, juggling competing demands. You will also possess a range of technical skills, from website content writing, social media, design and videography.

If this sounds like you and you want to work for an NHS organisation with ambition and globally acclaimed research professionals, we would be delighted to hear from you.

83f1200b51ba8e4b.title: Social Media Manager
83f1200b51ba8e4b.description:
Job Description:
My client, an award-winning fintech company, specialising in trading and forex is looking for a Social Media Manager. The role is reporting to the Head of Growth.
Key tasks & responsibilities:
You will be designing and implementing social media strategy to align with business goals.
You will create awareness of and develop the brand across the main social media channels.
Day to day management of all company social media accounts.
You will develop engaging, creative, innovative content for regularly scheduled posts, which enlighten audiences and promote brand-focused messages.
You will be setting specific objectives and reporting on ROI by analysing social media campaigns with tracking systems to gather data and determine efficacy and areas for social media campaign improvement.
You will collaborate with other teams, such as product, sales and customer service to ensure brand consistency.
You will communicate with followers, respond to queries in a timely manner and monitor customer reviews.
You will ensure all the social media is compliance approved and within the FCA regulation standards.

About You:
4 years + of experience in Social Media marketing, preferably in Financial Services.
A creative mindset to create engaging and attention-grabbing posts within a competitive market.
In depth knowledge of all leading social media sites, including their algorithms.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
Excellent copy writing skills.

Please contact me if you want to take advantage of this fantastic opportunity. claireblasi@aquent.com
Due to the high volume of responses, if you have not received an email in 48 hours please take it that you have unfortunately not been successful.

6c8ea6a667d8a194.title: Social Media Manager
6c8ea6a667d8a194.description:
Paysafe Limited (“Paysafe”) (PSFE: NYSE) (PSFE.WS) is a leading specialized payments platform. Its core purpose is to enable businesses and consumers to connect and transact seamlessly through industry-leading capabilities in payment processing, digital wallet, and online cash solutions. With over 20 years of online payment experience, an annualized transactional volume of US $92 billion in 2020, and approximately 3,400 employees located in 12+ global locations, Paysafe connects businesses and consumers across 70 payment types in over 40 currencies around the world. Delivered through an integrated platform, Paysafe solutions are geared toward mobile-initiated transactions, real-time analytics and the convergence between brick-and-mortar and online payments. Further information is available at www.paysafe.com
This is a unique opportunity to join Paysafe, a leading specialised payments platform, in the newly-created role of social media manager to manage and evaluate our social media channels and develop, plan and execute social media campaigns.
Reporting to the Director of Corporate Communications, and sitting within the global corporate communications function, this is a key role within a high performing, international team operating in the fast-paced and dynamic fintech industry.
This is an exciting opportunity for a passionate individual to make a significant impact on Paysafe’s brand through digital engagement. The successful candidate will collaborate with various internal stakeholders at every level of the business to support their respective strategies and ensure an aligned, relevant and consistent voice is delivered through Paysafe’s digital channels.
Responsibilities
Review Paysafe’s current social media presence and make recommendations for improvements.
Support the communications team to define, implement or, where necessary adapt the social media strategy by channel to reflect Paysafe’s corporate narrative, brand and values.
Amplify Paysafe’s employer brand strategy through creative campaigns which support our recruitment goals.
Manage and optimise Paysafe’s social media channels and pages across multiple platforms to increase Paysafe’s brand awareness and online reputation.
Own the social media publishing plan to support the needs of various internal stakeholders.
Promote content on our Paysafe Insights blog and support major company milestones and events across social media.
Measure the effectiveness of Paysafe’s social media activity on an ongoing basis and make recommendations to review and amend activity as required.
Monitor, listen and respond to user-generated content in line with the moderation policy for each social community; identify threats and risks in user generated content.
Provide knowledge and expertise to internal teams using social media and support the communications team to increase sharing among divisions and geographies with approaches and tools aligned to Paysafe policies and business priorities.
Source and develop visuals which can be leveraged across our social media channels, and liaise with design teams/agencies to brief in creative assets.
Requirements
A minimum of 3 years of social media management
Solid technical and professional expertise with online marketing tools and web-based technologies
Excellent communications, writing, editing and presentation skills
Positive approach towards people and tasks
Ability to influence team members for whom you don’t have direct authority
Ability to juggle priorities and thrive in an exceptionally fast-paced environment with a flexible approach; available out of hours when needed, especially in a reactive situation
Strong analytical skills
International experience or experience of working in related fields beneficial
Occasional international travel required
Payments knowledge useful
Ideally has an interest or past experience of furthering CSR programmes through social media work. Paysafe is committed to clearly communicating its DE&I agenda through proactive social media activity on its group channels, generating positive employee and customer advocacy in the process.
Experience of designing visual assests for social media and collaborating with creative teams, colleagues and agencies.
Equal Employment Opportunity

Paysafe is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to providing a work environment of mutual respect to everyone without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

8173286412cca63d.title: B2B Marketing Manager
8173286412cca63d.description:
Who we are
Evolution AI develops an artificial intelligence platform that reads and understands documents. We exploit recent advances in deep learning, computer vision and natural language processing. Our clients are the likes of Dun & Bradstreet, The Economist, Deutsche Bank and NatWest Bank. Together with the University of Southampton, Innovate UK and corporate partners, we founded and lead the biggest AI consortium in the UK, which enables us to incorporate the latest AI research into our products.
This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing team at the forefront of commercial artificial intelligence. You will be working in a small team of award-winning engineers, scientists and product leads.
‍
Who we are looking for
As we expand our offering to new customers across the financial services industry, we’re looking for a creative product marketer to source new sales opportunities. We’re looking for someone with a passion for artificial intelligence technology and the ability to work independently in creating and executing our marketing strategy.
Would suit experienced marketers as well as writers/journalists looking to move to marketing.
The compensation package for this role includes a very substantial share option and bonus package.


Responsibilties
Creating content that brings our technology to life and attracts new customers
Writing case studies and managing the production of video case studies (with external videography support) in collaboration with our clients
Developing our relationship with industry analysts (e.g. at Gartner or Forrester)
Keeping our website up to date (managed through Webflow)
Delivering a monthly newsletter with updates for our network (Drip or Mailchimp)
Managing our social media channels and CRM system (Pipedrive)
Executing an events plan (our own events and speaking opportunities)
Generating sales leads in the enterprise market
Requirements
The candidate must be able to provide previous publications/written content
5+ years of experience managing marketing campaigns or copy writing
Experience at an AI, deep learning or FinTech startup is a plus
Competent using marketing tools such as Webflow, Drip, Mixmax. Basic knowledge of Photoshop is desirable
You are very detail orientated with high standards for written communication
You have a creative brain and a passion for effective graphic design (you won’t have to own design yourself, we have external support)
Perks
Salary: £50,000 - £70,000
Generous option package.
Opportunity to attend conferences.
Remote working available.

1415c20b38a6e3c4.title: Assistant Brand Manager (Madrí Excepcional)
1415c20b38a6e3c4.description:
Date: Mar 7, 2022
Location:
London, GB
Company: MolsonCoors_UK
Why You Should Join Us
For over two centuries Molson Coors has been brewing beverages that unite people for all of life’s moments. We produce some of the most beloved and iconic beer brands ever made. While the company’s history is rooted in beer, we offer a modern portfolio that expands beyond the beer aisle.
Our growing beverage portfolio in the UK & Ireland includes Pravha, Staropramen, Cobra, Madrí Excepcional, Blue Moon, Rekorderlig, Aspall Cyder alongside popular favourites Coors Light, Carling - the UK’s number one selling lager, and the UK’s number one selling cask ale - Doom Bar.

We’re looking to recruit an Assistant Brand Manager – Madrí Excepcional.

Your Purpose
This is an exciting time to join the Madrí Excepcional brand team where you’ll have the chance to be involved in developing this new and exciting premium world lager brand. You’ll be working on a brand that is accelerating its growth and size within the market at an incredible pace, and you will play a key role in upholding its premium credentials and supporting its growth ambitions through brand activations, social media activity, and supporting landing its first ever advertising campaign across the UK & Ireland market.

Working with the Madrí Excepcional Senior Brand Manager & Brand Manager, you’ll support in the delivery of the annual brand plan across the full marketing mix to a consistent, high standard and take the lead in running your own projects. Together, you will run the entire Madrí Excepcional UK marketing operation responsible for delivering brilliant consumer and customer plans to drive brand performance. This includes working on our new advertising campaign, experiential brand events, creating new POS material, digital marketing and continually looking for new opportunities to drive brand performance.

This is a dynamic marketing role with the opportunity to be creative, take on high levels of responsibility and work on projects that are grounded in consumer insight and trends. You will take the lead on new packaging projects, developing social media content, supporting our experiential brand events and leading other key BTL activities whilst supporting the Brand Manager on other key projects.

About you:
You’re passionate about people and creating memorable brand experiences for our consumers, keeping the consumer at the heart of all decisions
Experience as Assistant Brand Manager or similar marketing role
Proven project management and analytical skills
Team player, able to form strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders and confidence to work in virtual teams
‘Can do’ attitude and high bias for action
You take accountability and initiative to drive Madrí Excepcional brand ambition, seeking out new growth opportunities
This role will offer you a lot of autonomy, you will have the space to manage your own workload and take your own initiative with decisions, so organisation and clarity is key
You can think creatively to keep up with an ambitious brand and can work your way through ambiguity
You’re not afraid to challenge the status quo and step up to new challenges
Data is king in brand management to ground your decisions in consumer insight or facts and optimise brand performance. You will be comfortable working with data and research and have experience with IRI/ Nielsen or willing to learn
Passionate about continually learning and developing with an ambitious mindset
Above all, we want you to be you. We’re a business which thrives off individuality and we’ll be looking for you to bring your authentic self to work.

About Us
We’re one of the UK’s Most Attractive Employers winning the Top Employer award for the last 9 years.
Flexible work programmes to ensure a work life balance is maintained such as our market leading Moments That Matter for significant moments in your life.
Commitment to the physical and mental wellbeing of all our people. We are proud to have been awarded Gold in Mind’s Workplace Wellbeing Awards.
We’re committed to raising industry standards and leaving a positive imprint on our employees, consumers, communities, and the environment which is reflected in Our Beer Print and our 2025 sustainability targets.

Molson Coors: Building Careers
Molson Coors Beverage Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we seek diversity. We want to continue to create an environment where our people are truly able to be themselves at work, regardless of their gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. We want people to be able to bring their own creativity and style to work, so that we get diversity in our thinking across our organisation, as we believe that we are a better business for it.
This makes our talent strategy simple – we want the best talent in all our roles, regardless of their background. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew and our people are our greatest asset.

c5c5a65ed6eb89c6.title: Head of Content
c5c5a65ed6eb89c6.description:
Head of Content – The Payments Association
Salary: £65k-£80k (depending on experience) + bonus
Required: For immediate start
Location: London Bridge, with flexible remote working available
About the company
The Payments Association is for payments firms, big & small. We are home to the most influential community in payments, where the connections, collaboration and learning shape an industry that works for all. We help our members navigate a complex regulatory environment and facilitate profitable business partnerships.
We deliver a world-leading series of events, an active research and policy agenda to bring about meaningful change and innovation, and a powerful digital media portfolio. Through our comprehensive programme of activities for members and with guidance from an independent Advisory Board of leading payments CEOs, we produce a programme of monthly digital and face-to-face events including our annual conference PAY360 and awards dinner, webinars, CEO round tables, podcasts and training activities. The Payments Association connects the market-makers - informing, influencing and celebrating change and development throughout the booming UK market for Payments.
About the Head of Content role
The Head of Content is a key addition to our senior management team, responsible for the development and implementation of our content strategy across independent editorial and branded content teams. You will be overseeing the event production team, driving content creation from our project and policy work and supporting our developing insights capabilities.
You will fast become a prominent voice in an exciting sector undergoing significant change; digitisation and ‘platformisation’ are driving significant innovations and change in payments frameworks and services. Business strategies, operating models and routes to market are being challenged across the payments value chain. As purchasing behaviours have shifted further during the pandemic (from offline to online, and from cash to noncash), we’ve seen existing trends accelerate and industry-wide transformation continue at pace.
You will inspire and develop our teams, leading by example, providing support in the day-to-day management of a number of departments that are growing quickly, providing strategic direction for the portfolio in addition to producing content of your own.
The Head of Content will help to establish The Payments Association as the most important voice and source of information and insights for those operating in the UK payments industry. Focussing upon the topic areas aligned with our six working groups (Inclusion, Regulator, Financial Crime, Cross Border Payments, Crypto/Digital Currencies and Open Banking), the content strategy will support growing our share of voice, encouraging media pick-up, stimulate debate, provide invaluable insight and promote the online profile of the Association. It will also involve adding value exclusively to our members to make the membership product more appealing to new members, whilst supporting retention of our 160+ current members.
This role supports how we harness the social capital of our existing membership base, the loyalty of our engaged stakeholder groups and our in-house content creation capabilities to drive greater coverage and expansion of The Payments Association’s own thought leadership & insight, and that of our members.
Key responsibilities
A successful Head of Content will be highly commercial, with the skills to leverage existing capabilities, resources and industry relationships. This will involve:
Strategy Develop and implement content (independent and branded/commercial) strategy and budget Set and achieve clear KPIs and targets to drive growth and habituated usage from our core audience personas Build and deliver content plans that keep focus aligned with the overarching strategy of the business Ensure branded content with partners and sponsors is most effectively incorporated in the editorial output and, where it is created by us, delivers equal or greater value to the audience Build a deep understanding of the audience needs to help support product development strategy, sales and marketing opportunities
Management Develop and lead a team of content creators including independent journalists, content marketing creators, subject matter experts, conference producers and industry thought leaders
 • Build a results-focussed culture in which your team consistently strive to solve the strategic business challenges of our audience and clients
 Be a coach, mentor and performance manager that supports the development of their team but is not afraid to make tough decisions quickly when needed Take a process-led approach to decision making at all times Committed to upholding the highest journalistic standards whether applied to independently written or commercially driven content Collaborate with senior management, sales, marketing, and operations teams as an enabler of growth
Content Creation and Industry Relationships Become a ‘face’ in the industry, being known for your insightful approach and market understanding Lead by example and become a thought leader, personally creating a regular series of high-level insight-driven content Quickly build valuable relationships with C-suite, innovators, key vendors and other thought leaders
 Be an ambassador for our brand, chairing discussions, industry events and building our editorial voice Regularly attend networking at events, meetings and audience/client site visits (Add international/national) Acquire top-level, high-profile speakers and contributors for interviews, features and opinion pieces Work closely with the events, member engagement and policy teams to gain access to industry leaders and politicians/regulators, and to produce cutting-edge thought-leading content that supports the working groups, expands audiences and meets our content strategy objectives
Financial and Reporting Accurately forecast and manage expenditure within agreed budget limits Create and present regular performance reports to the senior team and wider business
Research and Programme Development Keep primary research at the core of the process and work with the market – both buy and sell-side – to provide cutting-edge thought leadership, insights and trends
 Create profitable, sustainable market-led content programmes designed to connect members with key audiences and purchase influencers
 Identify opportunities and develop relationships to drive future digital growth and success
Copywriting Take primary responsibility for the content and style of The Payments Association’s content marketing strategy Manage the creation of opinion pieces and membership driven outputs Ensure as a team we write concise, persuasive copy which sells the benefits of our work and the value of engaging with The Payments Association
Deadline Management Safeguard the delivery of all content programmes to key deadlines, budget and a market-leading standard Meet all KPIs and targeted outcomes within required timeframe Plan for mitigation/contingency strategies where necessary
Topic generation and validation Work with the event production, policy and project teams to identify, validate and select themes and commercial topic ideas
Skills, Experience & Personal Attributes Strong organisational ability with deep B2B journalistic experience and a proven track record as a leader driving innovation and change.
 Experience managing content creators including; journalists, subject matter experts, video, audio and conference producers and industry thought leaders Proven experience developing independent editorial and commercial content strategies Proven experience integrating independent editorial and commercial content workflows and teams Experience and relationships within Fintech/FS audience sector, sectors served by payment or tech vendors, or a comparable sector undergoing similar trends or with similar dynamics Superb communication and problem-solving skills Ability to work well in a fast paced environment and eagerness to tackle daunting tasks, including recruiting, hiring and managing new, collaborative teams of content creators Proven success working with cross-functional teams and external partners across a range of formats. Experience building and managing budgets and forecasts to agreed targets Have a sophisticated understanding of the evolving digital landscape and how to best connect with b2b audiences through all channels including email, search, social and events (digital and in-person) Minimum 10+ years experience as a reporter/editor in B2B journalism Proven experience in forging industry relationships across reader and vendor groups Be a thought leader with a passion for sharing opinion and insights in written, video, audio and live event settings A process-led approach to decision making and performance management Experience in digital media and event workflows and technology Proven ability to work in and build collaborative environments with a solution-focused approach Be an avid consumer of all types of digital and traditional media Exceptional writing, attention to detail and proof-reading skills

34da026ff9d20ae3.title: Social Media Manager
34da026ff9d20ae3.description: We are looking for an experienced social media manager to focus on three key areas of the business; content writing, PR and social. You will be responsible for writing fascinating targeted articles, blogs, web copy and press releases for clients. You will then be responsible for dissemination of content through social media and working with the technical manager in using the content for off-page linking. Thirdly you will be responsible for social media management for our clients accounts and driving the development of their strategies forward.

df4e2c04bdf37e0a.title: Social Media Manager - Beauty
df4e2c04bdf37e0a.description:
Social Media Manager - Beauty
Remote
Our client a leading beauty brand is currently looking for a Social Media Manager paying up to £42,000.
You will manage all organic social media activity and manage one Social Media Executive to plan and implement social media strategies. You will create unique content and distribute the content across channels. You will also develop the influencer marketing strategy and work with the rest of the marketing team.
To be considered for this role you will have hands on social media experience and have experience developing influencer marketing and social media strategies.

ebb42138972a05fb.title: UK & Europe Social Media Manager
ebb42138972a05fb.description:
Description
Plum is powered by automation. It’s an app that acts like an autopilot for your money.
You sit at the controls, with smart spending analytics and budgeting tools to help you set your financial destination. Plum gets you there safely, meaning you don’t need to remember things like setting money aside, investing regularly and getting the best deal on household bills.
Plum makes your savings and investments work for you.
Here’s what we’re trying to tackle:
100m Europeans have less than 2 months in savings
Savings accounts that pay less than inflation
$120bn lost to the loyalty penalty every year in Europe
Our Mission
Here at Plum, we imagined a world where people effortlessly manage their money, without having to worry or even think about it.
A world where our customers' money has a brain that's configured to automatically reach their financial destination.
We've made it our mission to build that world…
In 4 years, we've grown from 2 co-founders sharing a rusty desk in Soho, to a hard-working team of 100+, with offices in London (HQ), Athens and Nicosia.
And now, with more than 1 million customers across the UK, France, Ireland and Spain, we could use a little help... and that might be where you come in!
The Team & the Role
We’re looking for a talented UK & Europe Social Media Managerr to join the team.
Working within our Marketing Team, this role is perfect if you’ve got 3-5 years experience managing social media accounts and creating content, with a track record of growing organic channels.You will work closely with the Head of Brand & Comms to build always-on and campaign content to ensure our social platforms resonate with our audience and grow our brand.
You will need to have a creative outlook, a good understanding of Plum, and overall financial knowledge. Perhaps most importantly, you’ll be as passionate as we are about making finance fairer for all!

69211a2b90788d90.title: Social Media Manager
69211a2b90788d90.description:
Key role within the Content Team.
Ownership of all Social Media strategy.
Opportunity to manage people.
My client needs a collaborative Social Media Manager, with strong strategic campaign planning skills, to take the lead on all social media output for the organisation. You will own the vision, growth, management and accountability for all national elements of our owned social media channels.

What you’ll be doing

Managing a team of experienced Social Media Marketing Executives, you’ll ensure that social media activity is seamlessly integrated and supportive of the broader brand, marketing and commercial objectives. You’ll work closely with the Content teams, Campaigns teams, and PR, to promote and support integrated brand campaigns.

You will develop the end-to-end social media strategy, execution, and growth of paid and organic social channels (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok and LinkedIn). This includes creating and managing content calendars, managing a team, and measurement and weekly performance reporting.

You’ll help maintain a clear, consistent, authoritative, expert and friendly voice, forming a key strand within our wider brand positioning.

Aside from your own team you’ll also advise and support the social media champions throughout our business, particularly our regional Social and Content Campaign Executives, assisting with their planning and publishing. You'll need to maintain a keen eye on the horizon, looking for the opportunities and challenges which emerge as social channels evolve and launch.

Finally, you’ll work closely with the PR team, proactively and reactively, dealing with reputational management and engagement management on social platforms, and leading confidently on reactive social communications.

What experience you’ll need to apply

Significant experience in social media strategy and on-platform content creation.
Experience in brand management, reputational management and engagement management on social platforms.
Experience in consumer content and video production for social platforms.
Experienced in managing people with confidence and positivity.
Creative flair – the ability to produce engaging content that aligns with key business objectives.
Outstanding communication skills and strong ability to develop and present creative ideas.
Insight, evaluation and reporting skills, with experience in social listening and analytics.
Must be able to work collaboratively and openly.
Clear and effective communication.
Innovative and entrepreneurial – keeping at pace with the evolving social media landscape.
What you’ll get in return for your experience.

The salary banding for this role is £45-49k.

What's next?

Please send your CV to Rina to hear more about this position.

684d599009d3b522.title: Creative Manager
684d599009d3b522.description:
Job title: Creative Manager
Responsible to: Creative Director
Department: Polydor
Location of work: 4 Pancras Square, Kings Cross
Music is Universal
It’s the passionate and dedicated team at Universal Music UK who help make us Britain’s leading music company. From A&R to finance, legal to digital, sales to marketing, Universal Music is the place to grow and develop your career within a truly commercial and innovative business that leads in everything it does.

Everyone is welcome to apply for our roles, and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment because of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, belief, age, marital status, background, pregnancy or caring responsibilities. We also recognise the importance of diversity of thought within our teams and are fully committed to embracing the talents of people with autism, dyslexia, ADHD and other forms of neurocognitive variation.

We will always seek to make appropriate adjustments to recruitment, workplaces, and work processes to be fully inclusive to people with different needs and working styles. If you need us to make any reasonable adjustments for you from application onwards, including alternatives to the online form or to disclose a neurocognitive condition, please email UniversalMusicCareers@umusic.com
The A Side: A Day in The Life
Few labels can boast as long, prestigious and varied a musical history as Polydor Records. From the 60s ‘beat boom’ onwards, through the eras of progressive rock, disco and punk, the label has been in the vanguard of every significant new musical development, while today the likes of Lady Gaga, Haim, Ellie Goulding, Billie Eilish, Sam Fender and Lana Del Rey maintain Polydor’s enviable cutting-edge reputation.
The B Side: Skills & Experience
Be Creative
Working closely with the Creative Director as well as managing the rest of the creative team and OOH freelancers
Working closely with artists to create long term cohesive visual strategies
Understanding the DNA/narrative behind each artist- be the conduit that ensures all short form content needs are met.
Planning and/or being across commissioning short form content around artist activities- diaries/live/promo etc
Be across artist social media campaigns within the label as well across competitor campaigns
Reacting to current campaigns as well as proactively working towards new campaigns
Always striving to push creative boundaries that set our artists and label apart from the rest of the pack
Collaborating with the Creative team on projects to maximise ideas and ensure the visual tone is consistent across a multitude of platforms
Working in lockstep with the marketing team to ensure creative deliverables are at the heart of wider marketing plans
Ensuring that your creative work is backed by strategic thinking and maximise any research or insight available
Be Operational

Commissioning a broad range of artist visuals from music videos, to live sessions, and other long form content as well as overseeing OOH creatives/freelancers
Demonstrating the ability to work across all genre’s, delivering work that’s bespoke to each artist personality, vision, and overall campaign
Commissioning a multitude of creatives incl but not exclusive to directors, freelance editors, videographers, producers, animators, stylists, hair and make-up creatives and content creators
Project managing music videos, from start to finish, meticulously over seeing every detail
The ability to keeping communication and workflow as organized and stress free as possible
Working closely with marketing and digital team in terms of campaign strategy and ensuring deadlines met
Communicating your ideas with conviction and guiding artists and managers through the creative process
Having a diverse network of impactful creatives that you’re excited to align with our artists
Having positive and strong working relationships within each side of the business, from label, production, artists to managers
Liaising with the wider label, creative team, artist managers and key contacts diligently and professionally at all times
Creating compelling briefs / presentations that get artists and creators excited about a project
Be Administrative

Being able to give and receive constructive feedback
Ability to work under pressure and make calm decisions
Ensuring projects are delivered to the agreed delivery date
Ensuring commissioned projects are paper worked correctly in conjunction with our business affairs and marketing teams
Delegating creative work to external parties (OOH freelancers etc.) coherently and managing the workflow from start to finish
Creating detailed budgets, call sheets and schedules with the support of the Creative Intern
Be Financial

Managing budgets and working closely with finance team ensuring targets are kept and forecast numbers are managed
Having a strong understanding of production costs/budgets and having the ability to negotiate and ensuring projects are fair and represent good value for the artist and label
Ensuring shoots are planned meticulously and operate to the given budget


Person Specification

Several experience within your creative field
Passionate about music, design, culture, and all things creative
Proven track record delivering highly impactful visuals in your relevant field
A reputation for being excellent in your field across all aspects
Positive attitude and collaborative approach to projects and working with colleagues
Experience working in a fast-paced, quick turnaround environment - music industry a bonus but not essential
Understanding of how budgets work, scope of work and realistic deliverables
Highly organized with the ability to keep calm under pressure
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Flexible and be able to prioritise own workload
Ability to manage your workload and handle hard deadlines
Tactful and diplomatic, especially when dealing with Artists and Management
Bonus Tracks: Your Benefits

Group Personal Pension Scheme (between 3% and 9%)
Private Medical Insurance
25 paid days of annual leave
Interest Free Season Ticket Loan available
Holiday Purchase scheme
Dental and Travel Insurance options
Cycle to Work Scheme
Salary Sacrifice Cars
Subsidised Gym Membership
Employee Discounts (Reward Gateway)
Just So You Know…
The company presents this job description as a guide to the major areas and duties for which the jobholder is accountable. However, the business operates in an environment that demands change and the jobholder's specific responsibilities and activities will vary and develop. Therefore, the job description should be seen as indicative and not as a permanent, definitive and exhaustive statement.

88586a882ccacebe.title: Social Media Manager
88586a882ccacebe.description:
Have we got a job for you?!

Build Your Career | Have Fun | Make a Difference


If you're the kind of person that loves to get stuff done, collaborate with colleagues all over the world and is interested in joining a fast growth global company that is trusted by the world's top digital brands and truly cares for its customers, join us at Payoneer!

Check out our values

We're looking for A highly motivated and creative Social Media Manager with exceptional communication skills and experience in bringing brand strategies and stories to life. You will develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy to increase our brand awareness, connect with customers and influencers, and ensure our online presence is aligned with our marketing strategy. You must be a quick learner who can quickly grasp the intricacies of a complex business and thrive in a fast-paced environment, while successfully managing multiple projects at once. Is this you?

What's the job?

Build, manage and execute a comprehensive social media strategy that increases our brand visibility and overall market engagement, and drives customer growth
Manage all existing and new brand-owned global social platforms ensuring up-to-date content, including but not limited to Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube and Payoneer's online forum in line with the business goals
Find new ways to build and deepen Payoneer's relationship with its community of followers, and engage with them in exciting ways
Track and analyze performance across all channels to connect the dots from data to insights to action
Establish a unique brand voice and consistent look and feel on our social media platforms working closely with the Community and Customer Care Social Media teams
Actively participate on non-owned industry forums and sites such as Quora and Reddit to help position Payoneer, seek thought leadership opportunities, look out for specific customer feedback and be the first point of contact to resolve issues
Partner closely with Product Marketing to create buzz regarding new product launches, features and updates
Align with the Communications team to amplify key messaging, especially around relevant corporate announcements or in the event of a crisis
Maintain expert knowledge of social media and forums best practices and trends

Have you done this kind of stuff?

Excellent copywriting skills in English; able to articulate ideas in a clear, exciting manner
BA in marketing or anything else that would make us say, "hmmm that's interesting"
An expert in all things social media, with minimum of 3 years in a relevant marketing role
Out-of-the-box thinker who loves creative solutions and playing with new formats to inspire an audience, while keeping an eye on the details that make great social content
A strong project manager who is data driven, has a high level of organization and ability to hit deadlines
A proactive thinker who knows how to work remotely with various internal teams and across time zones

Not a must but a great advantage:

Experience using platforms like Hootsuite/Sprout Social/Hubspot, Brandwatch, Salesforce and Jira
Experience in marketing to SMBs
Additional languages

A few words about us

Payoneer is a leading payment platform and one of the world's fastest growing fintech companies, ranking high on Inc. 5000, Deloitte Fast 500, and the CNBC Disruptor List. We empower entrepreneurs and businesses anywhere in the world – from Cairo to California, Buenos Aires to Bangalore and Tel Aviv to Tokyo – to go beyond and grow successful, sustainable businesses. With millions of customers in over 200 countries worldwide and trusted by clients like Amazon, Airbnb and Google, Payoneer truly connects anyone, anywhere, with opportunities to trade globally.

1e6901eb58ac8494.title: Social Media Manager (UK)
1e6901eb58ac8494.description:
The Social Element is not your typical social media agency. Our number one focus is to help brands build genuine human connections with their consumers. We partner with our clients to find business solutions through human interactions driven by data and insights. We use insights to form strategy, then execute across all areas of social, including social community management, listening, content, reporting, and crisis management.
We pride ourselves on having exceptional talent in our business. As the pioneers of social, we stay at the forefront by constantly creating, learning, and guiding.
Our relationships with our clients are true partnerships as we become an extension of their team: trusted, committed, leading.
We are currently looking for a UK based Social Media Manager to work on a major ecommerce client. This role requires you to be on top of the latest social media trends, so you can advise and recommend to our client the best methods to deliver maximum customer and partner engagement. You will collaborate with our Social and Community Engagement, Strategy and Insights departments, along with the client, implementing the best engagement approach and adapting it as new trends and issues emerge. You will create social engagement playbooks for campaigns, as well as develop tone of voice training and FAQs. You will write creative engagement responses and also work with the engagement team to ensure the highest quality for the responses.
This is a full time permanent role 37.5 hours per week and fully remote. You can be located anywhere in the UK.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Provide strategic guidance to your client on how to best utilise social media, advising on campaign engagement and day-to-day responses
Develop and maintain campaign activation engagement playbooks, brand and TOV guidelines, processes and FAQs
Create routine reports based on engagement activity
Support Project Managers to implement and execute engagement procedures
Keep in close contact with the client and internal stakeholders, keeping them informed on key topics, themes and issues happening on social media
Manage a team; recruit, onboard new starters, and develop, support and mentor existing team members
Attend a weekly inter-agency meeting representing social media as part of the digital campaign
Update and deliver team training on-brand objectives, style and TOV
Write creative responses to build genuine and human conversations
Manage content calendars, including writing social media posts and publishing content
Support other regions on community engagement approaches to share best practises and lessons learn
Keep on top of your clients’ business and community objectives
Ensure our team is constantly delivering the best social media approach and community engagement to the client and its audience, writing responses to a high standard in line with the client’s TOV and brand guidelines
Take ownership of your professional development and keep up-to-date with new developments in clients’ industries and best practice in social media community engagement
Highlight issues to protect the brand’s reputation on social media
WHAT YOU’LL BRING
Social media and community management experience either with a brand or digital agency
Previous experience in copywriting and editing social communications.
Business experience of a wide variety of social platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn, WhatsApp, TikTok and Snapchat and their audiences
Sound knowledge of social media best practises for community engagement
Exceptional creativity and storytelling ability with a passion for words
Experience of creating and/or delivering client facing and internal reports
Effective leadership and development of direct reports
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a native level of English.
Outstanding writing and proofreading skills with a strong accuracy and attention to detail.
Logical thinking with creative troubleshooting and problem-solving ability
Excellent organisational and time management skills
Effective relationship building skills
Project management skills
An extensive knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business problems
OUR BENEFITS
100% Remote work: we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance.
Flexible working hours
33 days of holiday (including bank holidays): Increasing with length of service up to a maximum of 36 days holiday
Birthday off
Annual Occasion Day off for an important event
1 Volunteer day off
Wellbeing Support
The Social Element values
Work according to the company values
Do it Well
Be One Team
Do the Right Thing
Keep Pioneering
Make Them Smile
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our recruitment process is fair, transparent and based on merit, skill and experience related to the role. We welcome applications from diverse and under-represented groups regardless of their background.
HOW TO APPLY
If all this sounds like you, simply upload your CV and a cover letter (or a link to your cover letter video if you prefer). *Be sure to include the following details in your cover letter/video, or we won’t be able to process your application:
Details of your professional experience in community management
Why you are interested in being part of our team at The Social Element

This position allows you to start your marketing career in a company that works globally and presents a huge opportunity for growth.Why us?Track-POD is a fast-growing SaaS company with strong revenue growth, offering one of the best Paperless&Contactless Delivery Management Software.
