b7af7ad2a0de4656.title: International Marketing Manager - Spinnin' Records - UK
b7af7ad2a0de4656.description:
GOAL OF YOUR ROLE

As an International Marketing Manager you are representing Spinnin’ Records on a global scale. Your main goal is to translate the musical vision of our artists towards a strategic and feasible plan, all in tight cooperation with SR HQ.
This will include identifying meaningful (streaming) marketing and promotional opportunities, securing artist and partner support across the board, amplifying existing relationships with key stakeholders and developing strong connections with new partners across the board.
In this role, you are the bridge between the Marketing, Promo and Streaming departments based in the Netherlands working to secure the best possible results on the various channels and platforms. An International Marketing Manager needs to be able to lead – from meetings to campaigns and everything in between.

SKILLS FOR SUCCESS

You are a specialist in planning and executing global marketing campaigns;
You are able to work closely with artists and their representatives to define strategies, objectives and oversee campaign execution;
You are used to translating strategies and goals to specific action points;
You are able to identify and drive innovative initiatives that contribute to our financial targets;
You have the ability to analyze results (data) and identify action points on a global scale;
You are able to nurture our global network and expand our existing network even further;
You are actively seeking opportunities across our roster.
JOB REQUIREMENTS

You have a minimum of 5-10 years of experience in the music industry;
You have 5+ years of experience in music marketing;
You have an advanced understanding of digital platforms and marketing technology for music releases;
You have excellent presentation, analytical and communication skills’;
You bring existing relationships with all key DSP’s, (radio)partners and channels;
You have a goal-getter attitude who thinks in opportunities instead of risks.
WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?

The chance to do what you are passionate about and join our global community

An open, collaborative culture
Training and development opportunities
Remote work
Great team activities and legendary parties such as Spinnin ’Sessions during ADE

THE PROCEDURE

1. Apply for the job

2. Telephonic introduction

3. First interview

4. Case or Assessment

5. Second interview

5. Proposal

6. Onboarding & start at Spinnin'
LOCATION

UK / Remote

INTERESTED?
We would like to receive your extensive motivation with cv.

COMPANY

Spinnin’ Records is one the world's best-known dance music labels, with artists such as KSHMR, Sam Feldt, Alok, Lucas & Steve, Kris Kross Amsterdam and many more in its roster. The label specializes in electronic music and manages the largest online dance community in the world with more than 12 million followers on social media. In addition, the label has its own YouTube channel with Spinnin' TV, counting more than 28.5 million subscribers and 18 billion views. We are a growing international company and offer the unique opportunity to be a part of it!
Acquisition as a result of this vacancy is not appreciated.

2c0db573d4ef61b9.title: Community & Social Media Manager
2c0db573d4ef61b9.description:
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.
Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?
As our Community & Social Media Manager for the UK region, you will be key in managing our official social media channels and communities (Twitter, Telegram and more to come!).

We’re looking for a crypto-obsessed individual who has a sense of humour, can create relatable crypto memes, and craft frequent posts to grow and engage our followers.

Someone who lives and breathes cryptocurrency; aka, a HARDCORE individual who is available to be our keyboard warrior.
Job Responsibilities:
Launch, manage and grow our UK Telegram & Social Media channels.
Build and engage with our local communities through one-on-one as well as one-to-many conversations.
Produce high quality, engaging, original content.
Moderate the regional Binance social media, platforms, and chat groups and interact with the community to increase positive engagement.
Be the eyes and ears on the ground; understand and share knowledge on local trends, communities and news.
Explore new community-friendly platforms to facilitate the expansion of the local user base and awareness.
Manage and expand the UK Angel program through recruitment and relationship building.
Assist in organizing both online and offline events and meet-ups.
Share market feedback and user suggestions with relevant functional teams.
Job Requirements:
University degree in Marketing or a related discipline.
Minimum 2 years of proven community management experience or a strong interest in social media and communities.
Familiarity with both online and offline marketing activities.
Experience in launching community initiatives (e.g. building an online forum, starting an ambassador program, creating an event series).
Familiarity with online platforms such as Twitter, Telegram and Discord.
A strategic thinker with the motivation and drive to own and execute initiatives.
Must be able to both work independently and collaborate with remote global marketing team members.
High levels of professionalism and emotional intelligence.
Strong understanding of cryptocurrency/blockchain-related terminologies and trends, and a strong interest in crypto culture are a plus.
Must be a fluent English speaker with an in-depth understanding of the UK market, preferably having spent 5+ years in the UK.
Conditions:
・ Competitive salary
・ Flexible working conditions
・ Flat organisation
・ Great Locations with a highly talented and international colleagues
・ Be a part of the exciting future of the crypto-currency revolution and work on the world's no.1 crypto-currency exchange!
About Binance
Binance Exchange is the leading crypto exchange by trading volume and users, with customers in over 180 countries and regions. Capable of processing more than 1.4 million orders per second, Binance is one of the fastest trading platforms in the world. The platform focuses on security, robustness, and execution speed—attracting enthusiasts and professional traders alike.

4527e424780b940c.title: Social Media Executive
4527e424780b940c.description:
This post is full time and permanent, working 35 hours per week.
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Social Media Executive to join our Marketing team. The role sits within our Global Recruitment, Admissions, Marketing and Communications directorate, but you will also be working closely with multiple internal stakeholders and teams across the University, including professional services and academic staff.
You will create and publish organic and paid-for social media content for deployment across the University of Westminster’s social media channels, developing the University’s reputation, building brand awareness and underpinning student recruitment. From videos to static content, you will be an excellent content creator and be confident working with students, staff and external bodies to produce innovative and engaging, high quality content. Supporting the Social Media Manager, you will ensure social media content is created to complement other strategic, campaign and tactical activities to reach current and future prospects, supporters, stakeholders and donors.
You will possess strong interpersonal skills and have the ability work under pressure, on time and to the highest standards. The role will suit an enthusiastic, tech-savvy and organised individual who understands and appreciates the needs and role of social media within a university environment by being both proactive and reactive – with the ability to prioritise accordingly.
To apply for this vacancy please click above. Further information can be found in the job description and person specification, which can be accessed through link below.
At the University of Westminster, diversity, inclusion and equality of opportunity are at the core of how we engage with students, colleagues, applicants, visitors and all our stakeholders.
We are fully committed to enabling a supportive and safe learning and working environment which is equitable, diverse and inclusive, is based on mutual respect and trust, and in which harassment and discrimination are neither tolerated nor acceptable.
Closing date: midnight on 27 March 2022
Interviews are likely to be held on: To be Confirmed
Administrative contact (for queries only): Recruitment@westminster.ac.uk

874f239a18d18ce1.title: Social Media Coordinator
874f239a18d18ce1.description:
Why us?
£20-23k salary on a full time, permanent contract

 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

️ 33 Days Paid Leave

 Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

 High end laptop or PC and top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse

 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need
Summary
Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!

We are looking for a Social Media Coordinator with the skills and enthusiasm to help run our clients' social media profiles and campaigns.

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!
About us
Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.
Responsibilities
What can you expect?

Reviewing and scheduling content across a variety of social networks
Optimising content for social media with effective thumbnails and copy
Monitoring social media accounts and gathering performance data
Analysing social performance and generating reports and recommendations
Researching clients' shows/movies via pre-release footage, internal documents, audience culture and competitor analysis
Brainstorming on social content and digital activation ideas
Managing and organising images, videos and GIFs to be produced by our in-house team
Assisting with the setup and documentation of internal processes for new projects
Helping our clients use our product HailTo via day-to-day management, material creation, usage checks, assisting with support, user analysis and new release testing
Qualifications
What's important to us:

2:1 Bachelor’s degree or higher
Good school grades
Ability to prioritise workload and complete tasks to deadlines
Unparalleled attention to detail
Strong organisational skills
High work-ethic and self-motivation
Excellent written and communication skills
Good numeracy skills and ability to analyse data quantitatively and qualitatively

As long as you possess smarts, attention to detail and enthusiasm, please apply.
Your working environment
Agility & Openness for Ideas We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!
Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do. The Social Media team is 30+ people strong and made up of account managers, project managers, social media specialists, social media coordinators, social media analysts, and more. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology and Industry Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-Notch Equipment We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. We have flexible working hours so you can start your day anytime between 8am and 11am.

You’ll have a daily standup with the team of the project you are working on. To best serve our US clients, we are looking for people who can work at least two late shifts (1:30pm-10pm) per week and at least one weekend day every four weeks. So, some days you’ll need to be flexible to work later if there’s a key delivery to a US client, but any time can be taken back.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.
Salary
£20-23k per year, commensurate with experience.
Employment type
Permanent / Full time. Either in our Edinburgh office or remote within the UK.
Benefits
Immediate Benefits

33 days’ holiday
High end laptop of your choice or PC equivalent, it’s up to you!
Top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
Paid training to further your skills
Annual Flu inoculation
Team outings and monthly meets

After 3 Months

Up to £700 to spend on a chair, desk or any other necessary workspace equipment to kit out your home office.
£625 budget every two years to choose your own mobile phone + monthly mobile contract paid for
Enrolment in workplace pension scheme with matched employer contributions
Money towards glasses with Specsavers

After 1 Year

Performance Related Pay Scheme giving an annual bonus of up to 100% of monthly salary whenever Storm Ideas is in profit
Access to the Cycle to Work scheme
Recruitment process
First, we will invite you to an interview (60 minutes via Zoom). During the meeting, Caspar, our Head of Social Ops, and Bella, Social Ops Manager, get to know you and try to understand if you’d be a good fit for the role, and at the same time answer all your questions. After the initial interview, you may be sent a short reporting task to complete (if you're open to it).

You may then be asked to have a final interview, where you will meet Duncan, our Social Media Director (30 minutes, Zoom).

And that’s it!

de5d74c50410e44f.title: Senior Social Media Manager
de5d74c50410e44f.description:
Senior Social Media Manager

Want to spearhead social content and campaigns in a hyper-growth tech company that's revolutionising the consumer digital experience in hospitality? The Global Marketing Team at Flipdish is on the hunt for a Senior Social Media Manager who is chomping at the bit to get creative and deliver award-winning work that will propel the brand to even greater heights. We recently became one of those elusive unicorns (valued at more than $1 billion) and it's now full steam ahead on our mission to be the leading food tech brand in the world.

It's a big job. We're not gonna lie.

You will develop and manage a global B2B social media strategy that aligns with key business and marketing objectives. Reporting to the Head of Brand Marketing, you'll work closely with various stakeholders including Content, Creative, Communications, Product Marketing, Acquisition, Events and Partnerships to identify opportunities for organic and paid growth in social on multiple platforms.

Flipdish digital ordering is driving exponential growth for thousands of hospitality businesses around the world. Millions of consumers use our technology to order food online for collection or delivery, and in-store with kiosks and QR codes. Today, food delivery is a hyper-growth, multi-billion dollar industry. This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the fastest-growing technology brands in the food industry.

We are looking for someone who can create compelling 'social-first' content that reaches and engages our target audiences, delivering measurable business outcomes. You're a strategic thinker but also someone who's happy to get your hands dirty and create the content yourself when required.

You will:

Manage the global social media editorial calendar, campaign and content development, publishing, and reporting.
Own social-first and integrated social programs (organic and paid) end-to-end, including:
drafting inspiring briefs, setting objectives and key results, creative ideation process, go-to-market program planning, implementation, reporting and optimisation.
Build and lead a social measurement plan to ensure that the social content strategy is rooted in performance, continuously evaluated, and demonstrates ROI.
Understand the social presence of the Flipdish brand and constantly suggest creative ways to better position it via social media, taking a fresh, relevant approach that resonates with and attracts new audiences.
Create playbooks across social channels to ensure the brand has a consistent identity.
Create content when time and skills allow, outsource work to content creators as required.
Work with account leads at key social platforms to identify new activation opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop impactful social campaigns and day to day content.
Manage social media tools and platforms to gather insight about conversations and trends relevant to the company, industry and influential communities.


What we're looking for:

An experienced, creative and innovative social media manager, confident in operating on a global level creating engaging content and driving audience engagement.
Proven results building a social following across a variety of channels and using social to drive brand awareness and sales.
A portfolio of work that showcases all the components of leading high impact social media campaigns including strategy, conceptualisation, execution and reporting success metrics.
Extensive knowledge of the social landscape, online behaviours and how to communicate across the various platforms in the cultural zeitgeist.
Hands on experience in social measurement and listening, along with effective use of these tools to drive ongoing strategy and tactics (organic and paid).
Ability to analyse metrics and use them to improve, adapt programs for better business outcomes.
Strong image and video editing skills. Photography skills are a plus.
High energy, proactive personality and ability to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
Benefits

Too many to list on this job post! We are a growing startup that understands that only amazing incentives will attract the best talent. This obviously includes ESOP because we want all of our best employees to have skin in the game. In addition to a long list of incentives, we provide unparalleled opportunities for growth and development. If you are smart, ambitious and hard-working, we will do whatever it takes to convince you to join the Flipdish rocketship!

We are primarily located in Ireland, but we are a remote team and we will consider highly-qualified applicants from other nearby locations.

No business embodies diversity like the food business. And at Flipdish, we're all about empowering those diverse, local, independent businesses - all over the planet. For us, diversity isn't a checkbox. It's embedded in how we work. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills - all working together in an open, honest and transparent culture. Because our strength comes from embracing our differences: differences that reflect the diverse customers we serve.

Please note that for this role we only accept applications from candidates directly. No recruitment agency assistance is needed.

About Flipdish

Flipdish is a hyper growth technology company (3rd in the 2020 Deloitte Fast 50) who puts hospitality brands of all sizes in control of their business growth with a digital ordering and marketing system that builds brands, grows profits and turns customers into regulars.

With a branded website, app or self-service kiosk, powered by Flipdish's world-class technology, hospitality brands can directly accept digital orders without having to list on aggregator platforms, at a lower cost and with more control over the customer experience.

Started in 2015 by technology entrepreneurs James and Conor McCarthy, Flipdish is headquartered in Dublin with a team of 280 digital food retailing enthusiasts, 7000 active clients across 20 countries with teams in Ireland, UK, Spain, France, Germany and the US.

Flipdish Mission Statement: "To provide food businesses with the best-in-class tools and support they need to win."

048b3ed113db6612.title: Press & Social Media Manager
048b3ed113db6612.description: Job Title:  Press & Social Media ManagerLocation:  WalsallSalary:  £41,881 - £46,845 per annumJob Type: Full-time, PermanentClosing Date: Sunday 6th March 2022Tens of millions of pounds have been secured to transform Walsall and we need a Press & Social Media Manager to showcase our people, our place and our Council. We have big ambitions to build on our proud industrial heritage and build a borough fit for the future.We need a story teller who will work closely with the local, regional and national media and to create compelling social media content.The successful candidate will manage, inspire and develop our proactive, content-focussed approach to communications.Key Responsibilities: Managing the media function of Communications Marketing & Brand to deliver both proactive and reactive communication activities.Leading media relations and social media activity to enhance engagement with staff, residents and stakeholders.The development and delivery of media and social media campaignsThe robust evaluation of media, social media and web contentWorking with the Director of Communications Marketing & Brand to manage the Council's reputation and to effectively manage issues and communication crises.Promoting creative thinking, thought leadership and influence to enable the whole Council to be more creative and innovative in the way that it works.Establishing a fit for purpose, in-house video production unitProviding expert communications counsel to Cabinet members and to the Council's senior managers.About you: We're looking for an experienced media and communications manager with excellent writing skills. 8ef8e843f40008b7.title: Digital Campaigns Manager
8ef8e843f40008b7.description:
Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Traffic Cop 3D and Makeover Studio 3D. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope and Die by the Blade.
With a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, we have a truly global team making games for a global audience. And it’s paying off: Kwalee games have been downloaded in every country on earth! If you think you’re a good fit for one of our remote vacancies, we want to hear from you wherever you are based.
Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit?
What’s the job?
Our ideal Digital Campaigns Manager will have plenty of experience in managing paid and organic digital activity in the games industry. They will have a sophisticated technical knowledge of paid search, social media, display and programmatic activity, with experience of driving high quality web traffic that increases conversions and business results. Overall, they will confidently plan, execute and report on creative and impactful campaigns from start to finish.
What you tell your friends you do
“I run the campaigns that persuade developers to publish their games through the Kwalee Mobile Publishing Team”
What you will really be doing
Develop the marketing campaigns that build brand awareness and engagement with Kwalee’s Mobile Publishing offering and events, including our Publishing Portal
Run PPC campaigns, including social media, search, programmatic and display, to generate and convert leads
Enhance the user journey of our game developer communities across our website and digital platforms
Use our CRM to increase the effectiveness and intelligence of our marketing activity
Use sophisticated attribution methods to demonstrate a clear link between marketing activity and developer lead generation
Monitor and improve our search engine optimisation and performance to ensure it is seen by the right audience in the right place
Identify new ad publishing and delivery tactics, technologies and trends - running experiments to refine our advertising effectiveness.
Use analytics to identify and measure key KPIs and metrics to continuously improve performance and report back to the management team
Collaborate with others in the Mobile Publishing Marketing team to ensure that campaigns are integrated across the full marketing mix
How you will be doing this
You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results.
You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best.
You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you will get it. We even have a robot!
Team
Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 200 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games.
Skills and Requirements
Previous experience of managing digital campaigns for an established company
Advanced knowledge of ad self-service platforms such as Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads etc
Comfortable working with cross-functional teams to develop campaigns
Experienced in managing a budget and maximising return on investment
At ease with using Google Analytics, as well as numbers and metrics to evaluate the success of our campaigns
Able to explain complex data and results in a clear and accessible way
Experience of campaign delivery in the games industry would be advantageous
Able to work with other functional teams in the Mobile Publishing Department, as well as with other teams within Kwalee.
We offer
We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
In addition to a competitive salary we also contribute to your pension, offer private medical cover and life assurance
Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday)
A dog friendly office - bring your favourite pooch! (There’s dog-free areas too)
Hybrid model available depending on the department and the role
Access to on site gym - no more skiving!
25 days of paid holidays plus bank holidays
Relocation support available
VISA Sponsorship available
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Entertainment area with consoles, pool table, tennis table and darts!
Monthly employee awards
Free snacks, fruit and drinks
Our philosophy
We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible.
Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference.

a6ccd2b62d826fb2.title: Paid Search Manager
a6ccd2b62d826fb2.description:
A highly innovative hair and skincare brand is looking for an experienced and motivated new Paid Search Manager specialising in Google Ads to join their team. This role will mainly be remote, with occasional days in the London office.

The Role

As Paid Search Manager, you’ll be responsible for the performance and hands-on management of paid search for multiple brands globally, including analysis, strategy development and implementation.

You will build paid search and shopping campaigns, managing day-to-day spend and regularly analysing performance and offering insights. Other responsibilities include:

Managing global search and other paid media accounts including maintaining shopping feed
Ensuring the brand search marketing activity contributes to the overall brand acquisition and retention strategies globally
Proactively optimising performance by testing, conducting research and working with internal and external contacts to maximise results
How you’ll dazzle us

We are on the hunt for someone creative and enthusiastic with at least three years of PPC or paid media marketing experience, either in-house or at an agency. The perfect candidate is someone with a broad knowledge of affiliate marketing, display advertising and paid social media, as well as a strong understanding of industry trends.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about long-term brand building and performance optimisation through search engine marketing. You will be a fantastic communicator with exciting ideas and a pro-active, can do approach to work. And of course, a passion for all things skincare, haircare and beauty won’t hurt!

What happens next

If this sounds like your dream role, apply today via the form below!

48d7712c7c90cf23.title: Brand Manager - Haircare
48d7712c7c90cf23.description: We have a fantastic opportunity for a Brand Manager to join our Beauty Haircare team here at PZ Cussons, on a Permanent Full-Time basis.About UsPZ Cussons is a global, fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) company, with office locations in the UK, US, Australia, Africa and Asia. Throughout our 135 year history, we have successfully adapted and evolved to the constantly changing consumer, market, and economic environments. Our diverse portfolio of brands can be found across four major categories: Personal Care (including Beauty,) Food & Nutrition, Home Care and Electricals.We have a real passion for our employees, our consumers and our brands and we strive on creating moments of pleasure for everybody, every day. You will recognise some of our renowned, market-leading household names (think Carex, Imperial leather and Original Source…) and now here is the opportunity to join the organisation responsible for them.If you are looking for an opportunity to fully utilise your creativity and social media skills through campaignsin an industry-leading organisation, or are wanting to apply your existing experience with hair brands to help deliver on our growth ambitions with an exciting brand , this role could be the one for you!The RoleWe are looking for a driven and enthusiastic individual with established experience in social media and is able to work autonomously, who has a strong interest in working within Hair Care Brands. You will report directly into the Senior Brand Managerand work closely with multiple teams such as Product Development, Insights, Marketing and Commercial. They will be accountable for delivering end-to-end retailer activation campaigns and managing the retailer activations plans for all accounts internally.Duties/AccountabilitiesYour main duties will involve:Global Brand Plans: Strategy & Execution:  Support the Brand Manager in executing a winning, distinct brand proposition based on consumer, customer and market insights. Identify gaps and opportunities to generate compelling insights to help develop the in-year plan, communication & innovation plans.Support Brand Planning & Campaign Development:  Using the in-year brand strategy, deliver all brand campaigns for UK/EMEA which inspire Commercial teams and retailers alike. Bring concise, accurate and effective campaigns to life with above industry average performance, delivering the brand’s commercial and growth targets across all markets.UK/EMEA Execution: Working with the relevant agencies, PR, Social, Media Buying, and Creative to deliver and implement first class activations and channel excellence across all consumer touch points in the UK/EMEA markets. Delivering the brand calendar and lead the integration of activation and trading with commercial/distributor counterparts, to deliver on strategic priorities, with a focus on driving brand performance and long-term brand health.Trade Marketing:  day to day management of trade marketing & communications at POS and online ensuring fully on brand and integrated with any consumer marketing and work closely with the agencies to ensure creative, accurate and timely communications.Brand Health & Identity: working as the internal brand guardian ensure all our owned activations, partnership activations & retailer activations deliver on the principles of the brand; brand visual identity, brand tone of voice, distinctive assets & primary messages. to deliver brand consistency across the organisation.Leadership:  Create action and inspire and motivate others to make brand plans happen, at pace with the consumer and brand salience at the centre of everything you do.Relationship Management: Be one of the lead marketing contacts for UK/EMEA retailers and distributors to secure and drive brand growth opportunities. Maintain day-to-day relationships with key 3rd party partners and agencies e.g. Media, PR, VM, Creative, Photography/Production/Talent, Digital/Social/ Influencers, Partner Brands and Designers for close and mutually beneficial working relationships.Key Attributes/Skills: · 3+ years marketing experience· University Degree qualified, or equivalent, ideally· Strong Communicator/Influencer – experienced in influencing immediate stake holders internally and externally at same level and above with aptitude in storytelling, presentation writing and delivery· Passionate about the beauty / self-care industry / beauty products· Passionate about marketing and campaigns· Agency management experience· Experience in leveraging digital & social vehicles· Demonstrable campaign and project management experience· Experienced in brand analytics – tracking and reporting on brand and commercial performance· Highly organised and capable of juggling many tasks at once· Good initiative, a real self-starter· Analytical· A solutions-driven and pragmatic individual· Creative thinker· Excellent Communicator· Flexible, adaptable and able to follow directionApply Now!We have bold brands, and this is your opportunity to become one of our bold leaders. If you would like to be considered as PZ Cussons’ newest Brand Manager, click “Apply” now or risk missing out on this incredible opportunity – Be bold._______________________________________________________________________________Due to the amount of applications we receive we may not always be able to respond to each individual candidate. Therefore, if you have not heard back from us within 30 days, unfortunately, your application, has not been successful. We do however wish you every success with your future endeavors and the best of luck with your job hunt!Job Types: Full-time, PermanentAdditional pay:Bonus schemeBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsCompany pensionCycle to work schemeEmployee discountFlexible scheduleGym membershipPrivate medical insuranceReferral programmeSick payWellness programmesWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Brand Management: 1 year (preferred)Marketing: 1 year (preferred)

9dc2c89888a0822f.title: Social Media/ Digital Designer FTC
9dc2c89888a0822f.description:
Are you looking for your next fixed term opportunity within Social Media Design? Would you enjoy the pace and energy of a retail environment which is collaborative, fun and inclusive where people feel part of a winning team? Do you enjoy the benefits of working together in person as a team blended with the flexibility of remote working?
If the answer to the above is ‘yes’ then Wickes is the place for you!
Wickes are a digitally led, service enabled organisation with a project in every home.
We’re looking for a Social Media Designer for a period of 6 months to work with our Studio Manager and assist in the day to day delivery of all Social Media creative for Wickes.
Key Accountabilities:
Lead the creative development of impactful, category leading, on brand content for social platforms that drives clicks, swipe ups and traffic to the website
Work with the Marketing Manager - Social Media to understand the results delivered through the creative, what works, what doesn’t and what we should do next time as a result of that
Excellent understanding of social media and digital assets across all devices and platforms and have knowledge of dynamic creative tools
Become a gatekeeper for social media creative, challenging the status quo and striving to drive improvement of social.
Work with Studio Coordinator and brief owners to ensure briefs and feedback are delivered on time and drives the Wickes brand forward
Support in the delivery of other briefs including artworking Point of Sale for campaigns, brochures and website work to maintain workflow across the studio team
What are we looking for:
A degree or equivalent in design
3+ years experience of social media creative development for a retail brand
Good experience and understanding in moving image, photography, graphics and other techniques to drive engagement
Must be able to use; Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe Premiere, After Effects, Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator
Knowledge and experience of videography
Able to storyboard ideas to convey response to brief and flow the storyboards in social assets
Keen creative eye, able to recognise how to drive engagement and look at ways to push the brand forward in social
Understand the results delivered through the creative, what works, what doesn’t and what we should do next time as a result of that.
Understand digital design across different formats – from mobile to app to desktop to app outputs - and deliver the best creative for each format
Keen attention to detail, continually striving to deliver ‘right first time’ creative
Organised, able to manage time and project delivery
Able to get to the root of feedback to quickly understand what needs to subsequently be done
Work alongside team members to ensure creative campaigns can work from a social/digital aspect
What can we offer you?
You’ll be supported with fantastic learning and development and have the opportunity to grow and develop your career with us
We’ll also equip you with a benefits package that includes
Save-as-you-earn scheme
Contributory pension scheme
Colleague discount
Discount platform including savings and cash back at numerous retailers, savings on gym membership, cycle to work scheme
Our widely recognised wellbeing strategy is something we’re proud of at Wickes. As part of this, we offer a range of health and wellbeing benefits and support, including an Employee Assistance Programme, financial education & loans, and access to parental, menopause and fertility support.
We have recently re-opened our Support Centre in Watford, where our Design team are based, along with our other support functions. We recognise the value of bringing our teams together to collaborate, support each other and build on our amazing culture. We are also encouraging our teams to work flexibly, with a blend of remote / office working.
About Us:
Wickes is a multi-channel retailer operating in the home improvement market. With 40 years in industry, Wickes now generates revenue in excess of £1.3Bn across 230 stores delivered by 8,000+ colleagues.
But it is the Wickes’ culture that is considered its best kept secret; it’s a collaborative, down to earth, fun and inclusive environment where people feel part of a winning team. All our colleagues come from different backgrounds, but what we all have in common is a determination to succeed and a passion for being the best we can be. If that sounds like you, we’ll make you feel right at home.
Please note: All offers of employment are subject to DBS / background checks.
"Please contact us if you require any adjustments within the application process, wickesrecruit@wickes.co.uk If you require any reasonable adjustments at the interview stage you will have an opportunity to inform us when we invite you to interview.”

829f5d5025a70f46.title: Digital Media Manager
829f5d5025a70f46.description:
Purpose of the job:
About The Company
We create big, new ideas and deliver smart, on-point campaigns for some of the biggest brands in the world. To do this, we bring strategy, campaign development and production together in one place.
And when we say ‘communications that actually work,’ we mean it. Because that’s the only way your brand can make the impact it deserves to make.
Purple is part of the HH Global family, working in over 65 countries with a team over 4000 strong – and we just keep growing. As a creative marketing communications and advertising agency, we work with brands across the health, B2B and B2C sectors.
Whether you’re in the UK, Germany, Italy, Mexico, Brazil, or somewhere else entirely, you’ll find a warm, friendly working atmosphere colours everything from our client interactions to our creative output. It’s the reason for our enduring client relationships and our regular service and communication awards.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide expertise and best practise insight into planning and optimising effective digital and social media campaigns.Continually build knowledge of new digital ad formats, Ad serving technology and digital media ecosystem - be the digital media subject matter expert for the agency.
Support wider media, strategy, creative and client services teams in delivering, executing, analysing, reporting and optimising digital media, content led and social media campaigns.Planning, developing and deploying digital & social media campaigns
Researching media / audiences.Negotiating placement, packages and pricingDefining KPIs, optimising and reporting on campaign performance
Presenting media plans, modelling forecast results and defining key performance indicators
Confirming media specifications and ensuring assets are supplied to media owners/publisher accurately and on a timely basisFinancial admin: raising purchase orders to suppliers, setting up accounts and processing invoices.Ensuring all time spent on client and internal media activities are recorded and charged to clients as appropriate
Maintain and grow digital media spend under Purple management and the number of clients who buy this service from PurpleReport on agency media commercial performance, at sales and margin level
Support maintenance of agency Google Partner status and identify other relevant certificationsDevelop and maintain currency of knowledge of latest trends in digital and social media and its use in specialised / specifically regulated markets

Knowledge, Skills & Experience:

.

Ability to prepare and present media plans and present results and reports effectively to both internal and external client stakeholders
Ability to forecast campaign performance accurately, pro-actively optimise campaigns to deliver against both client and Purple commercial objectives.
Ability to meet agreed deadlines and timescales.
Adherence to supplier / scheduling / agency SOP processes and best practise digital media methods
Confident presenter both to internal and external audiences
Google Analytics and AdWords certified (ideally BluePrint)
Able to independently undertake keyword and digital media research in order to make appropriate client digital and social media recommendations.
Ability to deploy and report on digital media campaigns using LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, AdWords and other social and programmatic platforms.
Collaborate with clients and client services to develop appropriate media / content solution for each client campaign
What else is in it for you?
As a member of the HH Global family, you’ll enjoy a comprehensive programme of rewards and benefits, including personalised career development.
It’s our people, and our passion, that have made us the first-choice partner for some of the world’s most influential brands – and we recognise that in as many ways as possible.
We’re committed to giving back, whether it’s through charity work, community projects or supporting the environment. We have our very own Giving Back team who manage and coordinate our initiatives globally.
If you’re looking for an exciting new opportunity within a dynamic, ambitious, growing agency, this could be the role for you!

2adc876da7606059.title: DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER
2adc876da7606059.description:
MARKETING
DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER
London, United Kingdom

SPEED & SPIRIT is what we look for in our candidates, defined by some simple values that inspire us to BE DRIVEN in our performance, BE VIBRANT in our sporting legacy, BE TOGETHER in our team spirit, and BE YOU to let our individual talent and experience shine. Applying for a job at PUMA is easy and all genders are welcome. Simply click APPLY ONLINE and follow the steps to upload your application.
YOUR MISSION
Reporting to the Head of Marketing, working on the digital transformation of PUMA UKI
Within the Marketing and Communication department, you are responsible for the strategy and then the implementation & monitoring of digital trade marketing plans across the worlds of our wholesale partners (Sports Performance/Sportstyle), pure players and aligning with the UK PUMA eCom team
Your role coordinates the Marketing team, Merch & Sales and our own Retail/eCom to develop and accelerate an aligned approach
Responsibility to upskill and grow the digital marketing competence within the PUMA UK Marketing team
Audit our digital marketing landscape and propose a multi-step plan to deliver digital acceleration in PUMA UKI
In conjunction with Commercial Marketing managers and Sales managers, design & implement best in class digital marketing strategies for strategic accounts & DTC brand comms.
Work with the campaign managers & paid media agencies for each campaign to support the digital strategy, paid media campaigns, performance marketing, KPIs and reporting
Deliver and track digital content; UTM set up, URLS, image & copy performance
Monitoring, analysis of KPIS and adaptation of plans and strategies
Support the team with your digital expertise by inputting into full funnel marketing planning when relevant
Be the team’s eyes and ears into the social media landscape, providing insights into e.g. trends and platforms
Be the point of contact for PUMA Europe digital insights into the UKI Marketing Communications and support the Marketing, Sales and International teams with needs relating to UKI KPIs, results, tracking etc.
Work with Business Operations to include relevant monthly/quarterly/campaign activity reports
Manage the digital marketing agency relationships
YOUR TALENT
Experience running full funnel marketing campaigns, optimising for brand awareness, through to consideration, through to conversions.
Experience advising on the best platforms to optimise campaigns to each of the above goals
Planning and buying paid social/display media & working hands on with Google Ads, Facebook Business Manager, Google Analytics, Microsoft Advertising, MS Office etc.
Running AB tests across multiple digital channels with a knack for turning raw data into actionable insights
Experience driving the strategy of organic socials channels
Passion for sport and lifestyle and proven marketing track record in consumer or lifestyle brand, or in agency
Knowledge of emerging technologies in new media, with creative/strategic thinking to put into action
Demonstrated ability to lead & manage projects on challenging timelines
Budget management and organisation skills
Ability to work cross-functionally in a matrix organisation
Creative & entrepreneurial spirit and energy, proven ability to work independently and multi-task
Must be detail oriented, resourceful, self-motivated, self-confident and proactive
London, UK based with frequent travel within UKI and Europe
Tertiary education or equivalent; strong written & verbal communication skills
PUMA provides equal opportunities for all job applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or disability. Equality for all is one of the core principles at PUMA and we do not tolerate any form of harassment or discrimination.
PUMA supports over 14,000 employees across 120+ countries. The PUMA Group owns the brand PUMA, Cobra Golf and stichd, and is headquartered in Herzogenaurach, Germany.

05472c69cd4fc6f1.title: Social Media Manager
05472c69cd4fc6f1.description:
Company Description
Launched in 1998, this pioneering British-born brand has specialised in creating amazing experiences and unforgettable memories - from hotels, city breaks and holidays to theatre, entertainment and spa days. Experts in brightening up online travel, lastminute.com is among the worldwide leaders in the field, helping hundreds of thousands of customers every year find, and do, "whatever makes them pink".
lastminute.com is part of lm group, publicly traded multinational Group, among the worldwide leaders in the online travel industry. Every month, the Group reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 60 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to provide our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel related products and services.

Job Description
We’re looking for an ambitious, highly motivated Social Media Specialist to join our growing Engagement Team.
As a member of an experienced and dynamic team, you will be responsible for guiding and executing the social media strategy and building social media campaigns within demand side platforms and across partner’s platforms such as Facebook and Instagram, ensuring campaigns are on track and improving the performance.
As a Social Media Expert, you will develop and execute social media activities in accordance with marketing objectives and business stakeholders and you will play a key role in the development of the overall social media strategy and organic performance.
Key Responsibilities
Working with the Content Strategy team in order to align objectives, audience targeting, brand image, messaging and editorial line.
Ensure that organic strategy campaigns meet company’s expectations in terms of Engagement, Reach, traffic and customer acquisition. ROI, budget spend
Monitor performance against KPI
Being responsible of Organic strategy, coordination and posting
Ensure channels performance are on track and to budget
Scouting new tool for campaign management and performance tracking
Execute, monitor and optimize social media campaigns based on campaign’s goals
Provide reports,analysis and creativity actionable insights to stakeholders keeping an eye on performance and Voice of Customer impact. Identify creativity trends and inputs for digital platforms and coordinate internal stakeholders (brand, content, design, video)
Manage and coordinate influencer and external social media agency.

Qualifications
Essential
Knowledge and interests in Social media platforms such as Facebook & Instagram
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to maintain a high level of productivity under pressure
Passionate for digital marketing and data expert
Ability to work in a team and cross department
Native English/French
Desirable
Ideally coming from a multinational company
Knowledge in cross-channel media planning which includes digital and offline strategy, implementation, tracking and insights and hands-on experience in running organic and paid advertising campaigns on various platforms
Additional Information
Abilities and Qualities
Autonomy and proactiveness, taking initiative and ownership
Capable to identify opportunities and/or problems
A self-motivated, high-energy approach being able to plan and execute new ideas, from start to finish with professionalism
Marketing / Business courses. Degree, A Level – Diploma or equivalent.
Passion for all things Social

cc05f39a4e79be96.title: Junior Marketing Manager
cc05f39a4e79be96.description:
Position Summary
The role of the European Marketing team is to make the Samsung

brand and products desirable. Our remit stretches from brand,

marketing, PR to Samsung.com, CRM, social media and retail.

Samsung Europe comprises of 17 subsidiaries across Europe that

represent billions in sales! To continue to drive growth in a hyper

competitive industry across mobile, consumer electronics and home

appliances categories, we must identify new and innovative

opportunities and implement strategic programmes to compete

against other brands and maximise our business sales performance.


We are the leading Consumer Electronics brand in the region in terms

of recognition and most preferred by consumers. In the pursuit of

global excellence, we are continuously looking for dynamic new

leaders for the digital age of the 21st Century.


Imagine a career working for a company who is passionate about its

people. It is our people that make Samsung the leader in diverse

marketplaces and the market innovator that drives technology. At

Samsung Electronics, our products, our people and our approach to

business are held to only the highest standards so that we can

effectively contribute to a better world!
Role and Responsibilities
The aim of this role is to build and implement the vision and deliver product and brand campaigns for Samsung Europe. You will encourage very hardworking individuals, cross functions and agencies. You will champion comprehensive marketing plans and coordinating/managing/implementing all related marketing activities.
It requires an agile and passionate Junior Marketing Manager with an excellent team spirit and understanding of culture, competitors and what makes our audiences tick.
What will be your key deliverables?
Support to both Team Lead and Snr. Marketing Manager on campaign strategy and delivery
Drive, cohesive, compelling IMC (Integrated Marketing Creative) content experiences.
Work in close partnership with EU marketing teams at all level of Marketing activities.
Work closely with all team members across Marketing Operations and Finance to ensure smooth running of the relevant category marketing budget, raising campaign lines, PPs and POs via the correct Samsung processes.
Identify and share outstanding marketing practices across Samsung Europe that will support our centralised approach and lead on efficiencies across the business
Help establish tracking and reporting processes within our team and how this information is circulated
Identify stretch goals and improvements in day to day team operations and also campaign activity
Skills and Qualifications
To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:
Passionate, motivated and interested in learning and delivering best in class campaigns
A brilliant team player with a positive approach to their work day
Appreciation and exposure to agency management, PR, Social, B2B, Media, ATL and BTL streams of work
Competitor understanding
Culturally attuned to Gen Z and Millennials
Creative judgement and ability to write clear briefs that get the best outputs from agencies.
Influencing skills to convince others, to see their point of view and articulate how improving the path to purchase can deliver against business objectives
Resilience: this role requires the ability to balance work at pace and be flexible
Collaborative: Build a network, understand different points of view, overcome objections, deliver a vision, a plan and then make it happen by working with and through others.
Attend and present plans at key meetings both to internal and external collaborators
What does success look like?
Driving for Results – you should chart a course of action in a complex organisational environment operating across diverse categories and markets. The approach should emphasise consumer and market needs, be insight-led, quantified and easy to understand;
Navigating Organisations – After agreeing direction, you will support the navigate through the organisation, recognising how to build EU consensus. Should stay fully aware of markets own pressures and motivations;
Planning and implementation - you will be able to build and manage a strategic plan that impacts the consumer journey in an impactful and meaningful way;
Inspiring Others – you will build rapport and support by rationalising and evangelising across the European and HQ organisation, right up to executive level;
Creative Intelligence – You will introduce a way of working that acknowledges those aspects of Samsung culture we can’t change vs. those we want to. The operating model proposed by this role holder should be simple, effective and motivating for time-stretched people.

b5d6cbcce20f559a.title: Social Media Manager
b5d6cbcce20f559a.description:
Social Media Manager
Location: London & Remote
Salary: £30,000-£40,000
The Company:
Our client is a leading brand activation marketing agency with a fabulous line-up of clients. They devise and deliver campaigns for the world’s most ambitious brands across sectors including FMCG, retail, health and beauty and luxury goods.
The Role:
Here is your chance to manage the newly formed social media and content team, to lead, and set the social direction of brands like Coca Cola, Superdrug, Boots, Nestle, Tesco, Mondelez to name just a few.
This opportunity will enable you to bring your own expertise and knowledge to work every day. Working with Strategists, Creatives and Client Development you will enable brands to deliver brilliant content and digital experiences that helps build their brands.
You will get the chance to lead and inspire your team and wider agency.
Role Responsibilities:
Planning and executing paid and organic social media campaigns.
Presenting and discussing social media and influencer campaign strategies with clients.
Managing their live event feeds on social media channels, optimising engagement and participation rates.
Achieving ROI/KPI expectations.
Tracking and reporting on success of all campaigns, identifying, and sharing learnings.
Increasing awareness across the business on social media practices.
Managing and developing your team.
Coordinating deliveries of external and internal content creators.
Having financial responsibility for the social media elements of projects; costing, managing and monitoring suppliers to ensure appropriate margins are met.
Supporting the Marketing team with internal social media channels.
Essential Skills & Requirements:
About 2 years’ experience working in a social media company or similar.
Ability to come up with quirky out of box of ideas
In-depth knowledge of social content strategies.
Examples of successful social media campaigns you’ve devised.
Experience of managing or coaching colleagues.
Understanding of Photoshop, Canva or other editing software to amend visuals.
Benefits:

An environment and culture that enables your creativity and personal curiosity
Flexible working: ideally you will be London based
23 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Life assurance

Employee Assist Programme
Season ticket loan

5dfb667c3c3fa703.title: Content Manager
5dfb667c3c3fa703.description:
The Social Element is not your typical social media agency. Our number one focus is to help brands build genuine human connections with their consumers. We partner with our clients to find business solutions through human interactions driven by data and insights. We use insights to form strategy, then execute across all areas of social, including content, customer service, listening, reporting, and crisis management. We pride ourselves on having exceptional talent in our business. As the pioneers of social, we stay at the forefront by constantly creating, learning, and guiding.
Our relationships with our clients are true partnerships as we become an extension of their team: trusted, committed, leading.
As a UK based Content Manager, you will shape, create and execute the organic social content calendar, by working with the internal client sources. Spotting trends and proactive content opportunities to get the client noticed in social culture, the ideal candidate will be confident taking the lead for the client’s organic social strategy, working with the client to hit to its KPIs and delivering the brand’s visual identity in social, and partnering with the engagement team and strategists to identify key conversation topics and themes and turn them into brand content.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Lead content creation and curation for the client’s social media, including managing an editorial calendar, writing excellent creative content working with the various stakeholders to feed in content into the calendar and guiding the development of visuals and other assets
Guide and advise the client on content best practices to ensure content production utilises the best appropriate format, channel and CTA
Create and execute project campaign timelines and schedules and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements of campaigns, evergreen content and client’s goals
Strategise and execute programmes to grow and engage audiences and followers
Work with internal stakeholders to update and change content strategy and themes
Produce regular performance and measurement reports with recommendations on improvements and analysis
Keep on top of emerging industry practises when solving business problems
Stay current with and assess industry and social media trends, tools, platforms, innovations and best practises
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:
Previous experience managing and creating a content calendar
Experience working at a social media agency or being responsible for content creation at a brand
Strong knowledge about content requirements for each major social platform and a working knowledge of the social platform audiences
Deep knowledge of social media platforms and content creation
Graphic design skills including basic design skills in Photoshop/Illustrator
Ability to influence key stakeholders and support change
Confidence in pitching ideas to clients and internal stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal communications
Thorough attention to detail, organisational and time management skills
Knowledge of the automobile industry is desirable
WHAT YOU’LL GET:
Remote working; we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance
33 days of holiday (including the bank holidays). This will increase with length of service. Once employed for 3 years, you will receive an additional day’s annual leave up to a maximum of 36 days holiday
Day off on your Birthday
1 Occasion day (for those special occasions such as getting married, moving house, needing a “Peternity day” to settle a new pet into your home, or dropping your child off for their first day at school)
1 Volunteer day
Access to our Employee Assistance Programme including counselling
Auto-enrolment into our pension scheme
Access to retail discounts
OUR VALUES:
Do it Well
Be One Team
Do the Right Thing
Keep Pioneering
Make Them Smile

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our recruitment process is fair, transparent and based on merit, skill and experience related to the role. We welcome applications from diverse and under-represented groups regardless of their background.
HOW TO APPLY:
If all this sounds like you, simply upload your CV/resume and a cover letter (or a link to your cover letter video if you prefer). *Make sure to include the following details in your cover letter/video, or we won’t be able to process your application:
Details of your personal/professional experience in content management
Details of your professional and/or personal experience with social media channels.
Why you are interested in being part of our team at The Social Element
