ef1243a3b6c47967.title: Brand Manager, Global Travel Retail
ef1243a3b6c47967.description:
YOUR OPPORTUNITY
This is an amazing opportunity to be part of the Global Travel Retail (GTR) marketing team as a Brand Manager for specific one-two key brands across all GTR channels. Your main role will be to help create a legacy for the brands and to contribute to key decisions that will significantly impact our brand presence and category positioning in GTR. You will be based in London with flexible working and expected to travel across our markets.
ABOUT YOU
You will be ‘FEARLESS’ with an entrepreneurial mindset, constantly looking for opportunities to be creative & identify growth opportunities.
You will have a ‘FOUNDERS’ mindset who will execute innovative brand campaigns that will enable the category to reach greater heights.
You will champion our ‘FAMILY’ culture pillar with the ability to understand different cultures and work collaboratively across the matrix.

Responsibilities
RESPONSIBILITIES - WITH OUR CONSUMER AT THE HEART YOUR KEY FOCUS WILL BE
Lead the development and execution of Annual Brand Plans coordinated with cross functional teams to deliver maximum impact plans that deliver share growth and financial targets
Lead the development of the innovation plan for your brands in line with financial and brand building targets
Develops compelling Activation Toolkits that translate Global Consumer Brand strategies into high quality executional activations in GTR (specifically enabling high quality merchandising and omni-channel activations)
Adapts Global Brand strategies into compelling GTR Channel Strategies
Helps drive the Revenue Growth Management agenda in GTR by completing robust analysis and supporting the process of setting pricing and promotional guidelines for your brands.
Partners with the Regional Commercial Managers to assist in planning and delivering their marketing activities with key customers
Leads omni-channel activations for key customers in key locations

Skills and Experience
THE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED TO CREATE YOUR LEGACY
Around 3-5 years in brand marketing (Strategic Category Management, Consumer Marketing, Shopper Marketing, Sales and Channel Strategy, Revenue Growth Management & Brand/Product Innovation)
Additional experience in Commercial and/or Customer Marketing experience and/or digital business is an advantage
Experience in multiple specialty areas: digital, innovation, promotions, events, media, etc.
Experience in managing stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of yearly brand plans and projects
Actively builds and leads interactions between functions to ensure plans are implemented and goals are met
Skilled at communicating with all levels and functions (written, verbal and presentations)
Strong numerical, insight and analytical skills
PERSONAL QUALITIES – SHARE OUR FOUNDER’S PASSION AND ENTREPRENEURIAL FLAIR
Belonging: You have a strong capacity to create a culture of ‘Belonging’, where people feel appreciated for who they are, what they do, and who they can become
Self-Awareness: You have high levels of self-awareness, are reflective and know yourself well, understanding both your own strengths and weaknesses and your impact on others
People Agility: You bring a deep ability to understand and relate to people and navigate through tough situations to harness and multiply collective performance. You create strong positive first impressions and build those into great relationships
Results Agility: You demonstrate consistent delivery of results in first-time situations by inspiring teams, exhibiting a presence that builds confidence in yourself and others. You operate at pace and are able to multi-skill effectively and are at ease leading projects. You will be highly performance driven, commercially and financially astute
Mental Agility: You can think critically to penetrate complex problems and expand the possibilities by making fresh connections. You think strategically whilst being execution focused and bring creativity to the challenges you’re presented with. You will have an attitude of constant learning and improving. Curious, creative, obsessed about the consumer and have a strong sense of popular culture to identify passion points the brand and consumer share. Inquisitiveness/ curiosity around new media, digital, technology and social trends and possessing an attitude to experiment or innovate in these areas
Change Agility: You have a deep natural curiosity, desire to experiment and ability to effectively deal with the heat of change. You have a growth and learning mindset that you instill in yourself: ready to test, stumble, learn and apply from experience. Comfortable with change and ambiguity

Our culture
We share the passion and entrepreneurial flair of our founder and are guided by our three culture pillars - Fearless, Family and Founders, they inspire our Primos to be the best they can be and drive us forward in all we do. But what does this mean? Being Fearless; means adopting an agile mindset, being comfortable trying new things and taking risks. We are empowered to question, challenge and innovate. Family; We treat each other, and our communities, like Family. Always.
 Founders; The spirit of entrepreneurship is at the heart of everything we do. We see the business as if it’s our own. We do the right thing for the business and we all take accountability for our work.
When you join Bacardi, you become part of our family and gain more than just a job.
Disclaimer: Bacardi is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. Diversity is core to our business: by embedding diversity into all aspects of our culture, we maximize the opportunity to achieve sustainable business success and growth. The duties and responsibilities described in the role profile might not be a comprehensive list.

df54740ae3292f5d.title: Paid Social Media Manager
df54740ae3292f5d.description:
We are looking for a talented individual to join brand management at P&G as a Social Media Manager! We are looking for someone who can lead our social media campaigns with the mindset of a business owner, bringing our brands' vision and strategy to life for our consumers. Together, we'll continue to create leading brand experiences and make a difference for nearly 5 billion consumers every single day. Pretty cool, right? We invite you to apply and join us now!
In this role you will:

Design Paid Social campaign strategies to effectively reach the identified target audience.
Own the end-to-end execution of social media campaign buys.
Drive the setup, launch, trafficking and optimization of campaigns in the main biddable media platforms and ensure that they are in line with P&G brand safety and ad fraud guidance and compliant to consumer privacy regulations.
Recommend an effective mix of strategies and tactics inside the platforms to deliver KPIs and specific media targets (brand awareness, engagement or conversions goals).
Manage day-to-day campaign performance optimizations in partnership with the Brand and Analytics & Insights team, pacing, and reporting of campaigns, forecasting media spends and KPIs goals.
Analyze campaign performance (including reports around pacing, optimization, insights on new testing opportunities) and continually look for ways to drive efficiency.
Present innovative ideas about campaign's strategies and effective ways to reach the identified target audience, accelerating business performances, and stay ahead of the competition by analyzing, keeping pace and in touch with industry trends.
Work closely with the Analytics & Insights Manager and the Brand team to enable a consumer-centric data strategy. Understand basic data structure, business fit and flows across involved systems.
What We Offer You:
Businesstopicsattheheartoftoday'snews- Evolving channels, competition, and customers' reality makes working in a consumer good's business dynamic every single day.

Recognized state of the art marketing skills- We will constantly help you improve your marketing knowledge and management abilities.

ResponsibilitiesasofDay1- You will have total ownership of your projects from the beginning, and will work on very concrete projects.

Continuousmentorship- We work with passionate people and like to give both formal training as well as day-to-day coaching.

Dynamicandrespectfulworkenvironment- Our employees are at the core of everything we do. We value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance. Although the role will be based inWeybridge, Surrey (circa 30 mins to Waterloo), Flexible work arrangements will be available, with the opportunity to work couple of days a week from home.

Benefits-You will receive a competitive salary as well as other great benefits including pension & share schemes.

New state-of-the-art gym -A space to prioritize your wellbeing, the gym has been designed with the latest Technogym equipment. There is also an instructor led studiowith a variety ofclassesand personal training available on request.

Qualifications

Work Experience and skills needed:
Social media campaigns' management (set up, optimization & reporting) across a variety of Social Media Channels, including Display, Video and Audio in a Digital Agency / Trading Desk / Publisher / eCommerce / Start up /Client Side.

Working on awareness and performance (e.g. deliver growth campaigns with targets optimizing towards acquisitions and registrations) activations within Paid Social.

Managing and working with multiple stakeholders and campaigns.

Degree qualified.

Attention to detail, entrepreneurial and growth mindset, analytical, innovative.

Preferable: Experience working with Consumer Packaged Goods' companies is highly appreciated.
Software, Equipment and Tools
Mandatory: Microsoft Office Package (in particular, excellent Excel skills).

Mastery of Social Media Buying Platforms such as, TikTok, Snapchat, Facebook Business Manager, etc.

Preferable Audit Tools' management (MOAT, Nielsen DAR) is a plus!
About P&G

P&G serves consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Braun®, Fairy®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Lenor®, Herbal Essence®, Olay®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Vicks®. The P&G community includes operations in approximately 70 countries and more than 100 thousand employees worldwide. And with great reach comes great responsibility - not just for our people and our products, but for the society we live in, and the communities we share.
JUST SO YOU KNOW AT PROCTER & GAMBLE #WESEEEQUAL

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. P&G ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process.
Please contact us to request an accommodation by clicking 'application help' at the top right-hand corner of the career website.
)

9f6682726ac07449.title: Social Media Manager
9f6682726ac07449.description:
About the role

Our people-centred culture combined with our tech and data expertise makes us one of the UK's leading companies. It is a great place to grow your career as a Social Media Manager in our Social Media and Content team whose purpose is to build awareness with car buying consumers across the UK.

As a Social Media Manager, you'll oversee the organic growth of the Auto Trader brand across our existing and any future social media channels. You'll generate compelling and engaging social media content and campaigns and manage a fast paced and reactive schedule of regular updates. The role will also involve working alongside the wider consumer marketing team to continually develop our social media output and push our capability boundaries in new directions to earn us new audiences and surface Auto Trader in new arenas.

You'll also be passionate about championing social media within the business by presenting regular updates on our performance and approach to key stakeholders. The role will be based in our London Kings Cross office however you will also work closely with colleagues in our Manchester location so travel to Manchester will be required on average once or twice a month.

What we're looking for
Experience in a social media role within an agency or in-house marketing team with exposure to social media engagement strategies, tactics, execution and best practices.
Experience working on a diverse range of social media platforms and curiosity to discover new ones and evaluate if they are right for Auto Trader.
Someone who is team-orientated and a great communicator and collaborative and enjoys working with and learning from multiple teams across the business
Excellent organisational skills, with a proven ability to successfully manage multiple projects across multiple channels at the same time.
Experience of building reports to support the team and business and provide data-driven insights and actions off the back of them.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Although not essential, we'd be also keen to hear from those who also have;

Existing relationships with the key social media platforms.
Worked for brands who have won and/or been nominated for social media awards.
Worked with both influencers and content creators to earn new audiences.
Created and managed user generated content campaigns.
Benefits and more

We're offering a competitive salary dependent on experience, and a flexible benefits package to support your health and well-being. You'll have 28 days holiday per year, and that's in addition to bank holidays and half day closures on Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve. Our Aviva pension scheme offers between 5% to 7% employer contributions depending on the percentage you choose to contribute, and we provide Bupa healthcare cover for all of our employees.

Our employee assistance programme, enhanced parental leave and share-save options and are just some of the other benefits on offer should you decide to join us.

Career development is something that we're passionate about at Auto Trader, and we all develop and learn things differently. Whether you attend an external conference, utilise a LinkedIn Learning license or choose one of our in-house masterclasses, there's something for everyone.

Our hybrid working model gives you a range of options, including combining office with home working and flexible start and finish times. Find out more about Connected Working here, or speak to a member of our resourcing team.

237c25fe516c5246.title: Private Client Manager
237c25fe516c5246.description:
Private Client Manager
Based remotely
THE COMPANY
Established in 1980 and with royalty and celebrities amongst our clients, Carrier’s discreet, attentive

and bespoke service is held in the highest regard. Carrier curates exceptional luxury travel

experiences designed to fulfil the desires, dreams and goals of our clients; experiences so bespoke

you won’t find them anywhere else. The client’s every need, every preference and every whim is

catered for, no request is too small and no challenge too big.
THE OPPORTUNITY
This role will best suit candidates with luxury tour operator experience .
With access to an existing personal network of HNW individuals, the successful candidate will be

responsible for fulfilling the travel arrangements of their clients.
Working remotely, you will have the freedom to develop new client relationships through

networking, joint partnerships and promotional events. You will be supported with industry leading

marketing collateral and the full strength of the Carrier brand.
You will have a passion for luxury travel and we will build on your destination knowledge by showing

you the world. Your little black book of contacts will grow as we support you in building industry

relationships at the highest level.
For your clients you will create exceptional luxury travel experiences. With access to a global

product range, via both our in-house tour operator and third party suppliers, your clients will travel

to experience the best of world.
This is a luxury travel opportunity like no other.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide a 24/7 concierge travel service to a small HNW client base
Create exceptional luxury travel experiences tailored to client’s individual needs
Develop deep client relationships to understand their needs and goals
Proactively manage regular communication with your clients
Develop your client database through networking, collaborations, events, social media and
referrals
Enhance your knowledge of luxury travel by attending supplier launches & events and
travelling on overseas familiarisation trips
REQUIREMENTS
Considerable experience gained at a luxury tour operator
A track record of creating and developing exceptional clients relationships
A deep understanding of the luxury landscape and customer; an innate ability to deliver
exceptional service
Personal confidence with a record of building credibility and trusted relationships within a
network
A genuine passion for travel with extensive first-hand experience of worldwide luxury travel
The ability to thrive working independently and remotely; a record of demonstrating
resilience & flexibility
Commercially astute and motivated to achieve a healthy margin
Desirable: knowledge of our tour operator reservations systems Dolphin & Galileo
PACKAGE
Excellent base salary
Uncapped performance related earnings
Minimum two luxury overseas familiarisation trips per year
23 days annual leave (increasing to 27 with length of service)
Company laptop and mobile phone
Further company benefits include discounted personal travel, company pension scheme,
flexible working hours, cycle to work scheme and unpaid leave entitlement
APPLICATIONS
Please send CVs to daniella.hudson@carrier.co.uk for consideration

34b20d850195479f.description:
Maidenhead, Berkshire
Creative Team
Full time
Social Media Executive / Manager

Competitive Salary - Fantastic Benefits - Growing Group of Businesses

An exciting, entrepreneurial group of businesses/ brands within health and beauty who are expanding at a phenomenal rate are looking for a Social Media Executive to join the growing multi-disciplinary in-house creative team in our Maidenhead office. You’ll be joining a creative marketing team who are responsible for running multiple brand social channels and all community growth.
The successful candidate must have good working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Video editing, social media planning across Instagram, Facebook, TikTok and Youtube.

Start Date: ASAP

Industry: Nutrition & Beauty FMCG

Hours: Full Time. Monday-Friday 9-5.30pm

Location: Maidenhead (with remote working until the Government guidelines ease)

Job Description: We are looking for an organised and focused individual to join our Creative Social team. We need someone to help assist with the strategy, planning & execution of all social media content marketing. With a team of designers working alongside you, will have full access to multiple brands and insights across our portfolio of products to help drive increased organic growth and engagement on our social channels. From stories to carousels, sponsored to organic, if you feel you can help us shape our social media and fine tune our community building - this is the role for you. We are looking to expand our video content marketing across Tik Tok / You Tube / Instagram so any video production knowledge will be well received.

We are a leading nutrition brand, one that cares deeply for our customers and the world around us. The Nutravita team is passionate about health & wellbeing which is why we want to help our customers live healthier, rewarding life.

Key Competencies/Technical Skills
3 years experience in a social media role or similar related degree
Good working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Especially Photoshop)
Strong attention to detail
Creative flair
Able to be proactive and reactive
Can work hands on, as part of a team & hit the ground running in a fast-paced, exciting business.
Fluent in English

Nice to have:
Work Experience
Video production / editing
HTML Knowledge
Experience with creating emails

Profile
Interest in the Beauty and Nutrition industry.
Easy commute to Maidenhead

a9f5a76e7f8e553a.title: Marketing Manager
a9f5a76e7f8e553a.description:
About the role:

Role models are looking for an experienced Marketing Manager. You will be an integral part of a small but ambitious team looking after the whole marketing function. You will work to optimise marketing and partnership strategies, manage the brand, as well as prepare forecasts for the future success.
Key Responsibilities

Build and grow a funnel of leads and sales opportunities to help with scaling our acquisitions and growth efforts sustainably
Partner with our agency partners across Digital Advertising, Digital eCRM, PR and Influencer Marketing
Work collaboratively with our Sales team to develop exciting partnership strategies to drive sales globally
Work closely with our Director of Character Education to develop rich and engaging content
Manage performance metrics and budget tracking while ensuring findings are shared cross functionally with the proper partner
Manage our Digital Marketing Intern in term of social media management and digital advertising production
Manage and create appropriate content for a variety of channels, including website, social media, email marketing, event sponsorship
Work on strategic and tactical marketing plans, based on the existing business, targets and market research, to generate increased sales levels.
Requirements:

You have proven experience as a Marketing Manager working across the whole marketing function
You enjoy working collaboratively with different team members as well as rolling your sleeves up and working independently
You have excellent communication skills
You enjoy creating new things but also have skills to analyse and monitor trends in the market
You are proficient with CRM / ECRM tools

Good to have:

Interest in social media development strategies and online content marketing
Familiarity with digital ad campaigns
Previous start-up experience

About Role Models:

Role Models is an impact driven education provider. We focus on life skills that promote social & emotional wellbeing and dynamic thinking, helping young people to thrive in life; both at home and their future workplace.

We complement traditional academic education by delivering online & offline courses for 3-15 year olds that develop young peoples’ skills in leadership, confidence, resilience, creative problem solving, collaboration and growth mindset. These skills really impact the everyday lives of the young people we work with.

Benefits:

Bonuses – of up to 20% of annual salary

Hybrid or remote working model
Holiday – 23 days’ holiday a year (excluding bank holidays), which increases by a day each year you work with us up to 28 days. Plus one day off for your birthday and one ‘me day’ if you’d like a last minute day off.
Training in Life Skills – The whole team attend regular training on life skills to help them both in the workplace and in their personal life
£500 p.a. learning & development allowance

bc3d15b13cbb956d.title: Social Media Community Manager
bc3d15b13cbb956d.description:
Overview:
Home based - with travel to events and Microsoft (Reading) on occasion
£40-45K plus quarterly bonus, car or car allowance & great benefits package
Our McCurrach Microsoft Team have a unique opportunity. Could you be our new Social Media Community Manager?
This role is perfect for you if you understand Social Selling and have experience of managing and influencing an online community. You may come from a Social Media Manager background. Alternatively, maybe you come from a Content or Training role but most importantly you will be socially savvy with a strong understanding of online key platforms within a corporate and preferably brand/selling environment.
Day to day you will manage, inspire and coach your team of Microsoft Evangelists (Digital Trainers). Your 4 direct reports will create content including images, live streaming, podcasts and blogs - and a huge part of your role will be to advise on where to post to gain the furthest reach. You will know what does and doesnt work and be our expert on how to increase brand presence and visibility through social platforms and online communities.
Why join us?
Salary in the region of £40-45k + quarterly client bonus circa £1k a quarter (OTE £50k)
Company car with fuel card OR car allowance (£480pm)
Full kit provided / home working set up
Flexible smart working allowing you to flex around other commitments when required
25 days paid holidays (pro rata) + public holidays
Annual leave purchase scheme - up to 5 extra days per year! *
Life Assurance - 3xsalary
Private Healthcare (Bupa)
Company pension scheme - we contribute 4%, you 5%
Enhanced sick pay
Family-friendly working policies (such as enhanced maternity & paternity pay) *
Access to our fantastic Employee 'Perks' portal (discounts from a wide range of retailers, gym memberships, leisure activities plus much more!)
Opportunity to volunteer for our taskforces (Diversity & Inclusion; Community; Sustainability; Mental Health & Wellbeing)
Personal development through our 'Byte' e-learning platform
Access to Employee Assistance Programme - 24/7 support on Physical, Mental & Financial well-being
Supportive company culture & values
Career progression opportunities across the Avidity Group
More about you...
We wont expect you to create content - what you will bring to the role is the expertise and confidence in really knowing your stuff when it comes to social online communities, social selling etc.
You will have an understanding of how training is delivered and if you have trained in a previous role then even better!
Previous team management experience is definitely advantageous
You will have great stakeholder management experience as you will work closely with Microsoft (spending time at the Reading HO when required)
Digital and Social Media savvy with proven experience within a corporate environment
Bring your whole self to work - we are a diverse and inclusive employer and encourage you to be 'you'

We dedicate business solutions to premium brands to achieve incredible results online. Regardless of size, our network is important and we lavish time and expertise on all, ensuring the business is showcased and growing.Mason Circle is a London based hospitality and retail digital marketing agency with over 2000+ London venues.We are looking for a Social Media Manager Apprentice; someone with energy and willingness to learn who can portray this through visuals with the latest trends in content production.Mason Circle has partnered with Londons biggest brands and looking to onboard and expand the content team with the special someone to direct and shoot show stopping imagery and videography.The Social Media Manager Apprentice is a highly motivated individual with a passion for designing and implementing the Company’s content strategy, creating relevant content, blogging, community participation and leadershipThis is a full time role with both administration; includes content strategy, develop brand awareness, generate inbound traffic and cultivate leads and sales & field work; you will support our large client base with social media & digital outreach activity across various client types (B2C & B2B) and industry sectors.The role includes:Source and manage the social assets and copy for several accountsCommunity management including responding to user queries and escalating when necessaryReporting on the statistics of social channels and campaignsYour role is key in supporting other members of the social media, marketing and content teams and you will have the ability to multi-task across various projects and platforms is essential.You will have entry level business experience and will be familiar with standard social media management tools. e68e815f57a3bd50.title: Social Media Marketing Manager - EIA
e68e815f57a3bd50.description:
Overview:

Frost & Sullivan is seeking a European Social & Digital Media Marketing Manager for its European operations to play a key role in the creation and distribution of impactful content across multiple channels to enhance the promotion of Frost & Sullivan's products, services and thought leadership.
This position will partner with sales, analysts, customer research and the global integrated marketing team to help drive the development and execution of multi-channel demand generation campaigns, ensuring a fully integrated, consistent, and cohesive brand experience across platforms, industry sectors and target audiences.
While focussed on the delivery of the go-to-market priorities aligned with the regional European territory’s objective, the successful candidate will form part of a broader global team leading the communications initiatives that pull together the Frost & Sullivan vision across multiple products and value propositions.

Frost & Sullivan research reveals that 80% of companies fail in their first 18 months of life and that 9 out of 10 new product launches significantly miss their sales targets. Numerous challenges can derail a company’s strategy, from poor opportunity identification to unsuccessful implementation. Frost & Sullivan is poised to help our clients realize their vision. Our global team of analysts and growth consultants is available to offer extensive best practice-based expertise and tools to help our clients evaluate, prioritize, and pursue their growth opportunities. If you are interested in joining a global team with the capability to not only help organizations prosper, but help you realize your potential, Frost & Sullivan is the right choice for your career development. Learn more about Frost & Sullivan: http://tinyurl.com/Frost-Sullivan-overview
Responsibilities:
Develop and implement creative, innovative and integrated digital marketing campaigns.
Identify trending topics to curate compelling content across channels.
Defining and owning a strong social media strategy to retain and increase engagement across platforms.
Establish and nurture relationships with key stakeholders in the social space to drive share of voice.
Help steer the creation of digital assets and rich media, including social media banners and video content.
Track performance and translate analytics into actionable business insights to grow our brand.
Ensure all localised activities are aligned to business priorities and the global marketing strategy, sharing best practices and implementing the relevant campaigns/tactics for an integrated approach.
Qualifications:
Minimum five to seven years of experience in a relevant discipline with a professional services company.
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or proven success working in a similar role.
Experience in creating, executing and measuring digital marketing plan.
Demonstrated excellence in communication and editorial skills, being particularly adept at B2B/corporate content creation in a digital media environment.
Possess expertise in identifying target audiences and tailoring content.
Excellent organisational and project management skills to effectively plan, monitor and prioritise workload.
Proven ability to operate with agility, impeccable attention to detail and with an analytical mindset.
Knowledge of video editing and video content creation would be an added advantage.
Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken; German/French a plus.
Benefits:
Enhance your skills, discover growth opportunities, and be part of a team that, for more than 60 years, has been developing high impact growth strategies for emerging business and for the global 1000.
You will be part of a winning, global team that fosters team work and an Olympic spirit while enhancing your communication and people skills.
Encouragement to develop your intellectual curiosity and will be provided the ability to collaborate across all levels of the company across the globe.
Have a definitive career trajectory with numerous growth opportunities and career paths available to you.
Be part of a "best in class" global team that strives for excellence in work and social engagements.

b3d1b8f53b05d80a.title: Social Media Manager - Brazilian Portuguese speaking (12 month FTC)
b3d1b8f53b05d80a.description:
The role: Social Media Manager – International (Brazilian Portuguese speaking)

We are looking for a Social Media Manager to join our International Brand Marketing team in London.

Are you our next star player?

Reporting to the Senior Social & Content Manager, the Social Media Manager will have end-to-end responsibility for delivering against Betfair’s social media strategy in international target markets.

This is a key role in the International Brand team, offering cross regional scope but with a core focus on Brazil. Your campaigns will catalyse the growth of our business in a rapidly growing market, diversifying beyond traditional media to enable Betfair’s ownership of the betting conversation in new and emerging customer touchpoints.

Adopting a publisher mindset, you will surface social media content that engages our players, delivers cut-through, and gets shared on the platforms that matter to our players. Sourcing content from our in-house studio and external collaborators alike, you’ll be working with world class assets like our Copa Libertadores sponsorship and Brazilian football legend Rivaldo to bring our brand to life.

The role requires a true critical expert who is obsessed with emerging trends in social media and has the operational aptitude to enable them at pace. Moreover, you’ll champion a fully localised approach in every customer interaction, developing content that is natively designed to cut through in our regional markets.

Why we need you

Your role responsibilities will include:

Defining monthly content plans for our social media channels, aligning execution with the sporting calendar, customer behavioural trends and wider ATL and Digital campaign media
Collaborating with teams across Campaigns, Sponsorship, PR and Digital teams to build joined-up campaigns with complete cross-channel alignment
Owning the test and learn roadmap to generate data-driven insight from every social touchpoint, feeding learnings back into our content plan to continuously optimise campaign performance
Working with Online Media colleagues to build out our network of Influencers, applying best practice ways of working to deliver campaigns that resonate with our content creators’ audiences
Managing monthly budgets, with paid media investment optimised based on performance insight
Monitoring social media trends in the wider industry and beyond, ensuring Betfair is at the forefront of any emerging platforms, and in a position to leverage them where it supports our strategic priorities
Accountability for Quality Assurance, ensuring all campaigns are subject to robust QA processes
Building out our social channels as a vehicle to grow Betfair’s customer base, continually optimising our response led messaging and measuring performance with the right tracking solutions
Operationalising the real time publishing capabilities required to own the conversation around major sporting events, enabling the right mix between scheduled, reactive, and planned reactive content
Working flexibility to cover key sporting events that might take place at evenings/ weekends, or outside standard working hours to account for time zone differences
Who we’re looking for

Your experience:

4+ years’ experience managing social media channels for B2C brands
Deep technical understanding of social media platforms – you know the metrics that matter, the tactics that work, and the best practice techniques to implement them for each channel
Commercial acumen and a will to deliver projects that impact marketing metrics
Experience in a fast-moving ecommerce environment
Excel & PowerPoint skills
Fluency in English and Brazilian Portuguese is essential. Spanish language skills are a distinct advantage.
Your behaviours:

Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and managing multiple simultaneous projects
Customer obsessed: Quickly gains an understanding of what drives Sports bettors, executing customer-centric campaigns that deliver against their motivations
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time
Stakeholder management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple stakeholders across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find new solutions. Takes on the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy
What’s in it for you?

Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus.

Your package will include:

Health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
A personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
Looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of £1,000 for your new addition whilst working for us
Discounted gym membership
In-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career.
About the Group

Betfair International is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange. Flutter brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@flutterint.com

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

Want a seat at the table? Apply now!

Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. A real problem-solver who possesses excellent communication skills, eager to make a real difference and get things done. From campaign strategy, set up and development, campaign management, optimization tracking and reporting, this role has it all. 25d4dc58e6153a17.title: Social Media Executive
25d4dc58e6153a17.description:
Genflow helps creators become entrepreneurs through its audience monetisation platform. We started in 2016 and since have become one of the leading companies in the creator economy working with the likes of Logan Paul to the latest tiktok creator.
We do this in a way that has never been done before by giving them a 360 experience through leveraging our platform, infrastructure, team and experience all in one place.
We do everything in house and we have helped some of the biggest creators launch their own brands whether that’s DTC brands (cosmetics, fashion or fitness etc) or their own digital brands (mobile apps, courses, membership clubs, gated content) or traditional brand deals.
With over 100 clients around the world, a team of 90+, international warehouses and offices we are now entering a real growth phase as a company (raised $11m Jan 2021) and looking to add the best people in the world to join us.
Our vision is to help anyone become a creator.
See our team in our vlog > Weekflow
See what we do on > Instagram
Learn about the business > https://genflow.com/
Our Founders Podcast and Origin Story of Genflow > https://lifeofanentrepreneur.com
About the role of Social Media Executive
If you love creators, social media and everything online then this is the role for you. This is an opportunity to join an award winning creator brand building platform and work in the team that runs the social media accounts for some of the most exciting creator brands on planet. You will have responsibility for the social strategy and content of some accounts that have seriously big followings - what you do will be seen by millions of followers, and matters. Quality of execution is everything because what you will be responsible for is so high profile.

You will be someone who is entrepreneurial with a strong appetite for growth, who can connect social and digital agendas in a credible, relevant and inspiring way both between Genflow and the creator as well as the creator brand.
This role is all about growing the brand audiences, enhancing engagement with the brand, and ultimately driving conversion. It requires a real instinct for cutting edge social content and a genuine understanding of the audiences. If you are someone who is passionate about working with some of the world’s most influential and innovative content creators on their brands and is hungry to work at the pinnacle of the creator economy, then this is the role for you. Jobs in social media marketing don’t get any more exciting than this.
Responsibilities
This is an exciting opportunity within the growing Marketing team and your key objectives will be to:

Set social strategy, plans and agendas for multiple brand accounts
Drive month on month follower growth on all client accounts

Create exciting and purposeful content that inspires and engages that will be considered industry leading and that others will look up to

Measure the impact of your work from ranking changes through to impact on organic traffic, organic revenue , social follower uplift and assisted conversions

Dive promotional strategies for on site content
Keep on top of trends and developments and use them to drive your social accounts forward.

Requirements

Extensive experience:
Managing social media accounts and driving growth

Reporting KPIs and social media analytics

In content creation

Using GA, IG analytics, Iconosquare, FB reporting, and other KPI/Data tools

Using Adobe Suite or something similar

With social analytics and media terminology

Working on some of the coolest brands out there right now

Excellent time management and organisational skills

Excellent written skills with an acute attention to detail

High energy and positive team player

Able to work in a fast-paced environment

Have experience of utilising social listening tools to gain consumer insights, target influencers and influence the social strategy.

Juggle a number of projects at once whilst sticking to deadlines
Proactive, can do, find a way attitude
The ability to think strategically and creatively

Good networking skills to form relationships with influencers and other key players

Good communication skills to liaise with multiple departments to create the desired outcome

Experience at trendy, fashion based or lifestyle B2C brand.

About you:

Previous experience working in a similar role as an social media manager for brands within an agency environment and have worked across multiple accounts at the same time

You have a strong understanding of agency / client relationships and how to manage them well

You have an entrepreneurial mindset, and ooze determination, perseverance and an instinctive eye for what will work and what won’t

You are comfortable working quickly across multiple brands and projects at the same time, and get a genuine thrill from working at pace with a team of highly talented and driven people

You understand ecommerce and social media and how the key platforms and successful social media marketing strategies achieve growth
You understand and appreciate the power of the audience first approach to brand building, and the enormous potential that the creator economy represents

You have a deep understanding of Gen-Z, how they interact with content and how to connect with them
You are on trend and up to date with your understanding of the creator economy industry and audience - you understand the digital and content trends amongst Gen-Z and Millennial audiences, and have an intuitive understanding of what type of user experience, marketing and activation achieve success

What it’s like working here
We are an incredibly talented team, assembled with experts from across various industries and specialisms. Genflow has achieved a lot of commercial success in a short space of time, culminating in our most recent round of investment in early 2021. We are intense, focussed and most importantly we are winners. If you want to be part of a business and culture that will push you to achieve career defining skills and goals whilst truly defining consumer behaviour, then come join us.
Small Teams & Real Ownership
Work in small, multi-disciplinary teams. You won't be constantly moved around teams and your team will usually focus on a specific set of creators, allowing you real ownership of your work. We're proud of the close and friendly culture in our team and do our best to support this with team drinks, meals, and more.
The Best Tech, London Offices & Remote Options
We work with the latest and best technology available. Our team is constantly exploring new ways to improve the way we work through software and you'll get the latest Mac hardware when you start. We have offices in Central London which you're welcome to use and are open to primarily/fully remote options too.
Private Healthcare, Coaching & Birthday Leave
All employees have access to regular professional coaching sessions, which can be used for professional development or personal support. c890dcc8072a0ab3.title: Social Media & Digital Publishing Specialist - Blizzard Entertainment Titles
c890dcc8072a0ab3.description:
Team Name:
Job Title:
Social Media & Digital Publishing Specialist - Blizzard Entertainment Titles
Requisition ID:
R011895
Job Description:
Job Title: Social Media & Digital Publishing Specialist
Reporting To: Social Media & Digital Publishing Manager
Department: Marketing Communications
Location: King Office (London), Wardour St, Soho, UK
Your Platform
Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across franchise product management, corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain.
Based in Soho, the cultural heart of London’s West End with a vast array of classic record shop and leading film companies, media offices and great restaurants. Regent’s Park is close enough for a lunchtime run, as are the delights of Piccadilly Circus and the shopping mecca of Oxford Street. It is conveniently walking distance from a number of London tube stations and mainline train stations.
To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB.
Your Mission
As a Social Media & Digital Publishing Specialist you will help to ensure that our content and channels are world class, by supporting across day-to-day social media and digital marketing activities for Activision Blizzard titles. Working closely with global and regional marketing teams, you will thrive in a fast-paced and energetic team environment, be a natural team-player and a functional specialist in all things Social and Digital Marketing. You love gaming, you know your social memes from your TikTok trends, and you’re raring to create experiences that delight players and level up our business. You bring a passion for Blizzard games to work each day (you’ve enjoyed playing at least one of World of Warcraft, Diablo, Hearthstone or Overwatch), and you bring this passion to life on our channels through a ‘player first’ mindset.
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Support with transcreation, creative origination and subsequent publishing of content across Social and Digital platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and websites including Battlenet for EMEA
Identify tactical content opportunities to support key franchises in EMEA and ensure we are delivering key marketing messages to our players
Deliver reporting around campaign/content performance, working with our external social media agency and utilising a number of in-house and external tool sets
Work closely with global franchise Digital Marketing leads to pitch, develop and execute truly Global digital franchise campaigns
Partner with cross-functional teams (centrally and locally) to develop and execute local content opportunities
Develop an effective partnership with the internal Community teams to drive a consistent feedback loop to inform content strategy
Player Profile
Minimum Requirements:
A Degree level Education (preferred) relevant to the experience required for the role
+2 years experience of Social Media and/or Digital Content Publishing experience preferably within the gaming sector
Experience working with digital content planning tools (e.g Opal), social publishing tools (e.g Sprinklr, Spredfast) and digital reporting/social listening tools (e.g Netbase, Crimson Hexagon) preferred
Strong business acumen and proven strategic, analytical and creative abilities
Clear self-motivation with a history of exceeding high performance standards
Ability to build productive relationships by using your excellent written and verbal English skills along with strong stakeholder management skills
Additional EU language (preferred, but not essential)
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information appropriately
Demonstrable experience in self-prioritisation of work and appropriately responding to urgent matters
A willingness to travel should it be required in role
You will be a confident, proactive and approachable personality that oozes team spirit with the added extra of being a go-getter, ambitious and tenacious in nature who can work autonomously when required, all with a great sense of humor
Finally a passion for gaming and entertainment is an absolute must, robust knowledge of Blizzard games is advantageous
Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

fd09028135ad7dec.title: Senior Digital Experience Manager
fd09028135ad7dec.description:
The job of a Save the Children's UK Senior Digital Experience Manager is exciting and fulfilling.

Do you have significant experience developing digital content for various social, email, and websites channels?
Do you have experience of storytelling within a digital context?
Do you have strong knowledge and experience in SEO techniques and best practices?
Are you motivated by our vision of creating a world where every child doesn't just survive but thrives and can go on to change the world?

If the answers to these questions are yes, we would love to hear from you!

About Us

Save the Children UK believes every child deserves a future. In the UK and worldwide, we work every day to give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protect them from harm.

The organization is committed to investing more into digital and technology as we seek to increase our voice and relevance in an increasingly complex world. The post holder will have the opportunity to develop their skills in a fast-paced, ambitious environment.

Job Purpose

As the Senior Digital Experience Manager, you will play a leadership role in setting and driving cutting-edge standards for digital content, copywriting assets, and experiences across all channels, including website, email, social, and paid ads.

You will Lead on digital content creation within a multi-disciplinary marketing squad; you will ensure the overall digital experience is inspiring, engaging, accurate, and inspires action with our supporters while ensuring alignment across all supporter touchpoints.

Person Profile

To be successful, you will have solid experience working in a digital marketing/experience capacity, whether across social, email, or website. Ability to work to deadlines, have an MVP mindset, be data-driven, creative, and technically adept while ensuring accurate and up-to-date content. In addition, you will:

Lead on developing and creating inspiring, engaging, and accurate content and assets for a marketing squad across all channels and experiences.
Lead on the UX across Save the Children digital products & channels, including our owned social media, websites, microsites, and, when appropriate, coalition websites.
Lead on the maintenance and overall health of one or more digital channels to ensure editorial consistency.
Champion Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) ensures our website content follows best practices and considers our Search Engine results pages (SERPs) position.
Champion the user at all times, using supporter insight and data analysis to scope and shape user experience enhancements and enable new functionality, including working with 3rd parties such as external UX consultants and agencies.
Lead on a new digital product and channel approach from content and experience perspective, ensuring innovative and effective digital solutions for the organization and its supporters. This ensures that outside thinking leads to continuous improvement internally.

Abilities

Extensive experience developing digital content for various channels, including social, email, and websites.
Extensive experience managing one of the following in a large B2C organization: website, owned social, email content, marketing copywriting.
Significant experience developing digital experiences using best practice user experience design principles.
Knowledge of new digital trends and emerging consumer technology and the ability to apply this in developing ideas and informing decision making
Experience working with digital analytics packages (such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics).

Aptitude

A demonstrable commitment to the principles of diversity and inclusion and their practical application and integration in the work environment
A commitment to Save the Children UK's aims and core values of accountability, ambition, collaboration, creativity, and integrity

Remote Working:
The majority of SCUK employees are currently working remotely within the UK in line with UK Government guidance. Commencing July 2021 we will transition to flexible and hybrid ways of working (i.e. a mixture of remote/home and office-based working) as social distancing restrictions ease.

We are happy to discuss flexible working options at interview.


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Save the Children UK is committed to diversity and equality of opportunity in all aspects of our work both external and internal. We strive to be an inclusive employer and particularly encourage applications from under-represented groups such as returning parents or carers who are re-entering work after a career break, people who are LGBT+, from Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic backgrounds, with a disability, impairment, learning difference or long-term condition, with caring responsibilities, from different nations and regions, and from less advantaged socioeconomic backgrounds.

To see our full statement please visit this link: https://jobs.savethechildren.org.uk/our-policies/diversity/


Jobs are positioned within the salary structure on the basis of evaluation. New employees would normally be appointed at the bottom of the grade, however the appointed salary may also take into account the relevant experience a candidate brings to a role. Save the Children is committed to paying staff in a fair and equitable way and will benchmark all salary offers in line with the pay of existing staff.


Save the Children UK has a comprehensive benefits package. To see our full offer please visit this link: https://jobs.savethechildren.org.uk/what-we-offer/


Interview expenses: Candidates should note that unfortunately it is not our policy to reimburse expenses accrued when attending interviews at Save the Children UK unless you are requested to attend an interview in an alternative location to where the role is based.

Pre-employment Checks: Any Employment with Save the Children UK will be subject to the following checks prior to your start date:


a satisfactory police record check to include a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check and/or an International Criminal Record Check (If applicable)
receipt of satisfactory references
proof of eligibility to work in the national location for this role
Division:Fundraising & Marketing
Department:Marketing Delivery
Team:Digital Experience
Location (Role):Farringdon, London/Home-based
Contract Type:Permanent Contract
Full / Part Time:Full time (flexible working options available)
Salary Range:43000-46000

286c0025a7f15358.title: Senior Marketing Manager - ATL & Social
286c0025a7f15358.description:
Who we are?
We want to help small businesses win. That’s why we’re here.
We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, support local communities and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help realize their goals.
So, we created the leading small business loan platform. Investors have lent £11.4 billion in 100,000 small business owners. In a single year, this lending supported 135,000 jobs and contributed £10 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!
Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.
We are looking for a Senior Marketing Manager to grow and manage our ATL, Social and Display channels. This role will involve both setting up the strategy and managing the execution of campaigns for multiple products.
This role will be a key pillar of the performance marketing team, working closely with the other channels and brand team to deliver against business objectives. You will have experience managing large budgets and developing campaigns across most if not all of these channels (TV, Radio, BVOD, Social, Display) and be comfortable planning both brand and performance activity.
You will also be the expert for your channels, advising the business on best practice, current and future trends.
What you will be doing:
 Developing strategic approach and vision for ATL, Social and Display channels across
multiple products. Managing day-to-day delivery of campaigns including set-up, reporting, optimisation, budget
and agency management Maintaining a strong testing schedule including creative and media, ensuring that we’re
always learning and evolving. Managing agencies to continuously optimise our ATL campaigns, including testing new
audiences, media buys and technologies. Working closely with the Digital team to ensure we have suitable onward journeys that tailor
to both high and low intent users. Working closely with the brand team to develop best in class campaigns to support your
channel performance.
It would be great if you have:
 At least 5 years experience planning and managing either TV media or Paid Social
campaigns, experience managing both ATL and Digital channels is preferred although not
essential. You manage annual budgets of at least £5m. Analytical and numerate - you will have the ability to interpret data to inform decision making and be comfortable making trade-off decisions to optimise campaigns. A confident communicator, able to manage stakeholder relationships at all levels of the
business. A flexible, self-starter person who is able to make things happen.
Why should you join us?
We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by all of our Circlers.
We think of ourselves as the career launchpad. A place to develop yourself, fast. Real work. Real experience. Real opportunities to collect skills. Think big remits and huge ownership to make great things happen.
Yes, it’s target-driven and high-octane – but we like to play hard too. That’s what makes us, us. Our vibrant culture is built around potential and creating a place where you can really be you. We keep it agile and open. All voices heard. Because we believe great ideas come from everywhere.
If you show skill and are willing, we’ll back you all the way. This is the place for you to build something incredible.
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.
At Funding Circle, we celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe that diversity makes us better. We particularly encourage applications from applicants from underrepresented backgrounds. We welcome applicants who may want to work flexibly.
Want to Build The Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.

e97473f335000dc6.title: Corporate Communications Manager (6m FTC)
e97473f335000dc6.description:
Job & LOB Summary

Disney is looking to expand its Corporate Comms function in the UK with the addition of an experienced Corporate Comms Manager to help support on key initiatives including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I), Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), local investment and the build up to its 100th anniversary celebrations (October 2023).

The Corporate Communications Manager will work closely with the Corporate Comms team (including Senior Manager and VP) to help deliver a proactive media relations campaign focused on showcasing Disney’s EMEA corporate strategy and key successes as well as protecting the brand in the UK and EMEA.

The Manager will be a key member of the team and will work across media relations, speaking engagements, crisis and issues management, asset creation, as well as serving as the Communications partner to the CSR, DE&I and Brand & Franchise Market teams. The Manager will also work closely with the Corporate Comms team to support issues related to Global Public Policy, Tax, Legal/Antipiracy, Finance and HR.

Responsibilities :

The Opportunity & Responsibilities:
Campaign management: This individual will help to manage and lead designated PR campaigns for key initiatives including DE&I, CSR, Brand, Disney’s 100th anniversary celebrations and Franchise Marketing as well as campaigns for the wider corporate function. This includes management of agencies, leading on messaging and plan creation, developing assets and implementation.
Writing: The candidate must be an extremely strong writer and will be expected to draft corporate and consumer press releases, messaging and talking points, corporate website stories, crisis and issues messaging and plans, speeches, strategy plans, and presentations for executives across the business. The candidate will need to show strong proof of experience in this area.
Media Relations: This role should have extensive media relations experience including relationships with relevant business and trade media. This role is primarily focused on delivering press coverage for key corporate initiatives around DE&I, CSR projects and promoting major brand and franchise campaigns working with the Brand & Franchise Marketing team, as well as consumer outreach around our Disney 100th anniversary campaigns. This person will also support the Corporate Comms team on larger reputational initiatives and risk management, where needed.
Crisis Comms: This position requires experience in managing crisis communications and issues, including writing crisis plans, reactive messaging and media management. The candidate will support the Senior Manager and VP on these issues.
Speaker Opportunities: The individual will also support Disney’s ‘Speaker’s Bureau’ across the business. Working with the Senior Manager, in addition to creating an ongoing calendar of speaker opportunities for the UK and EMEA leadership team, they will work with the segment communications teams to evaluate speaking opportunities for executives across the business, develop key messaging, draft speeches as well as deliver exceptional audiovisual supporting materials. The individual must be able to manage all of the detailed scheduling and Audio/Visual planning needs. They will be the primary liaison with the third parties organizing the events.
Corporate Support: The Manager will help develop and write-up key messages and talking points that can be used internally and externally as the communications partner to the corporate functions – these include:
Ownership of TWDC EMEA / UK Fact Sheets, Boilerplates and other shared communications assets such as executive biographies and corporate photography.
Oversight and management of the content on the EMEA Corporate Website and the corporate elements of the UK Press Site (working with the Coordinator and Intern).
Managing our centralized assets platform that includes various corporate resources and information for all comms teams to use across the region.
Helping to manage our quarterly comms summits and best-practice sessions for the wider EMEA comms teams.
Events: They will help plan, organize and deliver Corporate events ranging from Corporate Media Screenings & Breakfasts to collaborating with the publicity teams on other line of business events. They will assist in planning and managing EMEA’s participation in the bi-annual D23 Expo.
Management: The candidate will line-manage the Corporate Comms Coordinator, managing their workload, priorities and tasks. They will also help mentor and manage the Corporate Comms Intern and their development throughout their placement
Other: Work in partnership with the segment and EMEA market comms teams for greater corporate campaign impact. Counsel the segment and EMEA market comms teams on corporate issues where appropriate. Be a conduit with the US Corp Comms teams and EMEA. Help manage the annual Corporate Communications budget.

Basic Qualifications :

The Experience We Require From You:
Bachelor's degree or higher
Demonstrated excellence in writing and editing
At least eight years proven corporate comms experience within a large enterprise or agency, ideally with additional experience in delivering consumer comms campaigns
Experience of managing crisis comms issues essential
Experience in line-management
Must be able to interact with employees at all levels, including senior executives
Ability to set clear goals and manage multiple assignments
An understanding of deadlines and project management is essential
Proven ability to self-direct and drive projects from start to finish
Strong experience creating and delivering (or managing the creation/delivery of) high quality video assets and presentations
Must be able to operate across different markets and LOBs
Must be diplomatic, professional and able to handle confidential information
Able to act as an ambassador for the department with key internal stakeholders

Additional Information :

The Perks:
25 days annual leave
Private medical insurance & dental care
Free Park Entry: You will have the opportunity to enter any of our parks with your family and friends for free
Disney Discounts: you are entitled to discounts on designated Disney products, resort F&B and ticketing
Hybrid working is available
Excellent parental and guardian leave
Employee Resource Groups – WOMEN @ Disney, Disney DIVERSITY, Disney PRIDE, our new disability & neurodiversity focused group - ENABLED, and our Mental Health & Wellbeing Group, TRUST.

The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

b95c8507b1b1a229.title: Social Media Manager
b95c8507b1b1a229.description: WHO ARE WE?At ECLIPSE ENTERTAINMENT we’re famous for our pride, passion & personality.WE SUPPLY!We supply shisha at a lot of London venues and night clubs.We supply home delivered hot tubs, bday decorations and other surprises.We supply venues for clients in need.In need of a good strategy, engagement for our business to reach more clients, so we decided to hire an EXPERIENCED social media manager to help us do that.Some of the daily tasks would be:Developing social media strategies with the aim of increasing brand awareness and customer engagementAnalysing the long-term needs of the company’s social media strategy and offering quarterly reports to the management and executive teams, outlining any necessary changes to the overall digital marketing planCreating captivating content for an organisation’s social media sites, which may include writing blogs, articles, posts and multimedia contentStaying up-to-date with the latest social media trends and digital technologiesDeveloping monthly reports on emerging social media trends that will be submitted to the management and executive teamsDeveloping and overseeing competitions and campaigns to draw attention to a brandMonitoring and responding to customer feedback, comments and social media postsThe job includes 10 hours per week and it is paid 100 pounds a week.Conditions: At least 1 year of experience in the field with reported positive results and recommendation.Job Types: Part-time, FreelancePart-time hours: 10 per weekSalary: £24,520.00-£50,554.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsFlexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)Experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 year (preferred)social media: 1 year (preferred)Reference ID: 12345Expected start date: 04/04/2022

A perfect candidate for the Social Media Manager role is:

540787a18e26c727.title: Marketing Manager
540787a18e26c727.description:
Marketing Manager
Reporting to the Director of Sales & Marketing, you will be responsible for delivering and executing the Communications, Digital and Marketing strategy set by the Director of Sales & Marketing and Commercial Director, for all departments within the hotel (accommodation, golf, spa, sales, food & beverage)
What is in it for you:
Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide
Ability to make a difference in the local community through Ce Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21
Shuttle to and from St. Andrews
Meals on duty
50% off F&B
Discounted B&B stays
Discounted Spa treatments
Access to gym and pool area

What you will be doing:
Communications:
Communicate with outside advertising agencies on ongoing campaigns
Work with the Public Relations agencies and artists to oversee copywriting, design, layout and the production of promotional materials
Field media questions and pitch stories to the media, prepare media kits and organise press/media trips
Ability to write press releases and prepare articles for corporate newsletters
Liaising with Accor Hotels Luxe Marketing & PR Directors to align opportunities within the Fairmont strategy
Liaising with sales managers to align sales efforts with press/marketing efforts
Engage in activity with Brand and Hotel Partners and explore opportunities for new brand collaborations in order to build partnership network

Marketing:
Manage a team of two: Marketing Executive and Digital & Design Coordinator
Manage all activity within the marketing department, ensuring all service standards are followed
Execute marketing plans and programs in conjunction with the Sales department to ensure profit growth
Oversee all marketing initiatives for the hotel
Plan and oversee the hotels advertising and promotion activities, including print, digital and direct mail
Develop and coordinate annual digital marketing plan
Develop promotional materials, which include marketing print and collateral
Brand guardianship/preserve brand standards
Developing and maintaining hotel information collateral and sales team collateral for promotion to specific markets
Implement and maintain collateral strategy for wider hotel that meets with brand identity. This will include liaising with and managing various creative/branding agencies on specific design briefs and marketing projects
Seeking out and driving offline advertising opportunities/plans and campaigns with effort to tie-in press and promotional opportunities
Directing on-site photography and video shoots: press shoots, film location shoots and internal marketing shoots

Digital & Social Media:
Daily upkeep and performance of websites including brand.com
Responsible for all digital marketing including, newsletters and tactical campaigns
Social media management with Marketing Executive in devising social media campaigns and engaging with bloggers/influencers and guests pre/post-stay
Database acquisition, quality and email campaigns

General:
Balance operational. administrative and Colleague needs
Follow the annual budget and administer that budget in a fiscally responsible manner
Ensure the Marketing team are conducting regular competitive surveys surrounding benchmark and competitor marketing - both on and offline
Be an ambassador for Fairmont St. Andrews, and on behalf of the marketing communications team within the overall department and wider hotel team (share information/achievements/news)
Participating in daily team meetings and monthly departmental meetings
Act in accordance with fire, health and safety regulations and follow the correct procedures when the situation arises
Carry out additional tasks as instructed and by reasonable request from the leadership team
Adhere to all Fairmont St. Andrews policies and procedures as outlined by the hotel

Your experience and skills include:
2-3 years previous leadership experience within a marketing or communications role required (not bound to hospitality)
Outstanding communications skills, both written and verbal in English
A confident and dynamic speaker, able to communicate and interact effectively with all levels of an organisation
Enthusiastic and positive personality with the ability to build trusting relationships with others
Proven organisational skills, works well on their own. Able to set and meet deadlines with quality results
Applicable job related skills as per Accountable Duties
Excellent customer service skills, superior interpersonal skills, results-orientated and highly self motivated
Able to multi-task and work under pressure
Working knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, InDesign and Outlook
Knowledge of Adobe Suits (InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator) beneficial but not essential

Your team and working environment:
Working in a fast paces team environment
Shifts will be during the day and may include some weekend work
Must be legally eligible to work in the UK. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining UK work authorization

Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?
We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.
By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/
