1213db83a4a99253.title: Senior Digital Marketing Manager - Social Media & Display
1213db83a4a99253.description:
Senior Digital Marketing Manager - Social Media & Display
 - 220000YU)
 Here in the Display and Social Media team, we work with stakeholders from all areas of the Sainsbury’s business to create effective and engaging communications for our customers. We plan, buy and manage all social and display activity across Sainsbury’s, Argos, Tu, Habitat & Nectar.
Sitting within Digital Marketing, we have a strong focus on driving sales and building our brands, through continuous optimisation and innovation. We are constantly evolving our approach to deliver best in class digital media that delivers results. After all, you don’t get from a small shop in 1869 to one of the UK’s most loved retailers without a passion for innovation and a relentless pursuit for making it better.
And that’s where you come in. As our Head of Social Media and Display you’ll be working within one of the UK’s biggest and best in house digital marketing divisions where you will spearhead a team that is responsible planning and activating all digital programmatic media across display and social media platforms in support of our customer and commercial goals.

As our Head of Social and Display you’ll be accountable for a planning, buying and managing all brand and performance led programmes and campaigns, supported by a £30m budget, a team of 16 and our agency of record. A key element of the role will be to evolve the Sainsbury’s creative capabilities in partnership with our brand communications team to drive greater levels of personalisation, automation and impact across display, social and VOD. You’ll also define a measurement framework for all display and social media activity that identifies the most important KPIs for measuring media effectiveness (e.g. quality viewability) and campaign impact (e.g. brand lift, sales lift etc.). In addition, with the support of our technology and data teams you’ll take a leading role in utilising our first party data to create dynamic and personalised communications that are targeted with precision and drive cut through.

If you like the sound of what we offer then please tell us more about you! We’re looking for Digital Marketeers with experience developing strategic Display and social media plans that have driven commercial and customer impact through the use of cutting edge technology, audience management and planning. You’ll need to be able to demonstrate a depth of practical experience in planning and buying digital media programmatically, with awareness of the Ad-ops functions and processes. Our ideal candidate is uncompromisingly data-driven, highly detailed oriented, a creative problem solver, and is a self-starter who is excited to work in a high velocity and innovative industry. You must understand the technical workings of display and programmatic media, and be able to stand toe-to-toe with agencies to make choices such as technology deployment!

If that sounds like you then we would love to hear from you! Here at Sainsbury’s we’re a proud equal opportunities employer that values diversity at every level of our business. Inclusion and Diversity are fundamental to our culture and values, fostering an innovative, collaborative and fast paced work environment that means we can build a better future for our colleagues and our customers. Everyone is welcome at Sainsbury’s.

c3afa69a89806c00.title: Communications Manager
c3afa69a89806c00.description:
The Medical Research Council Toxicology Unit is an internationally renowned institute focused on understanding molecular mechanisms underlying toxicity of medications and pollutants. The Unit's cutting-edge research spans multiple disciplines including RNA Biology, Cell Biology, Microbiology, Bioinformatics, and Immunology.
We are looking to appoint a Communications Manager to join our vibrant team of researchers and research support staff. You will actively develop the Unit's communication and knowledge exchange strategies by defining a voice for the Unit that articulates the Unit's values. Working closely with scientists, you will help promote the visibility and outreach of our research through formal press releases, and communication with the broader audience via social media and other channels.
You will provide high level editorial direction, contributing material for content across external and internal communication channels, and lead on the implementation of the Unit's Public Engagement strategy.
You will have - A degree in a health related, biological, or other relevant area, ideally with an additional media/communications qualification - Experience in internal and external communication aimed at a diverse range of audiences - A proven track record of developing communication strategies across digital channels - Experience with outreach events/activities - Exceptional communication skills (oral and written) - Knowledge of an academic/research environment - Excellent IT skills with the ability to use web content management systems - Strong interpersonal skills - Good organisation skills and creativity for outreach activities
Click the 'Apply' button below to register an account with our recruitment system (if you have not already) and apply online.
If shortlisted for interview, you will be asked to submit a brief digital portfolio of projects which demonstrate your range of competencies.

bdcd9b1f0f7af3d6.description:
To support the attendance, room nights and revenue goals for Disneyland Paris (DLP) for the UK and Ireland.


The Social Media Content Executive, DLP, will be responsible for the management of the DLP UK community chat “Dream Team” to support guests’ questions and increase bookings through the consumer direct (CD) website, and will work with the central DLP social media team to develop and implement social assets to support the UK and Ireland business.

Responsibilities :

Work closely with the Social Media Manager and in-house media and brand teams to deliver social campaigns that support above-the-line campaigns
Responsible for assisting with ongoing development of creative and assets to support the UK social strategy to drive engagement and bookings
Optimise the EMEA Social Editorial Line to better fit with UK community (Facebook)
Write copy and produce engaging content and adverts for all social media channels, including paid social advertising campaign assets
Work closely with the Central team to develop local assets (photos, videos) for DLP social media
Where relevant to UK campaigns and initiatives, work with external creative agencies to develop social assets including managing asset briefings, feedback and deadlines
Stay up-to-date with digital technology and social media trends
Generate reports to monitor social media activity, including ad-hoc social listening reports and make reccomendations on improvements based on findings
Assist the Social Media Manager in building the local DLP social media strategy for the year ahead during the annual operating planning (AOP) process
Manage Influencer activations including; sourcing relevant Influencers, writing briefs, developing content ideas, coordinating filming in Resort with the in-house broadcast team; organise and host trips in DLP
Support Manager, Direct Marketing, with planning and implementation of DLP advertising strategy in partnership with music streaming services
Work closely with The Walt Disney Company social teams to source contra marketing opportunities to place DLP on other Disney company social channels
Work with the wider Disney Destinations team to share social assets and best practices with them when needed
Support the Social Media manager to ensure all social media content adheres to Company guidelines and is approved where relevant prior to publication
Responsible for operating within compliant business practice, standards of business conduct, and within approved departmental guidelines

Basic Qualifications :

Degree-level education in a related field or equivalent work experience; marketing qualification, advantageous
Proven experience of building effective relationships and managing stakeholders within a large, multi-national, matrix organisation
Marketing experience at equivalent level within a major multi-national marketing environment
Understanding of social media management and digital marketing
Proven experience in managing social media platforms and identifying and tracking relevant community KPIs
Demonstrable strategic and tactical skills related to implementation of marketing and sales plans and recommending resources necessary for success
A confident copy-writer who is able to craft compelling social copy for each Disney Destinations brand
Proven work experience as a community manager or similar role
Disney/Disneyland Parks and Resorts product knowledge, beneficial

328d77da0f76b68d.description:
Administration includes content strategy, develop brand awareness, generate inbound traffic and cultivate leads and sales.

The Social Media Manager/Strategist is a highly motivated individual with experience and a passion for designing and implementing the Company’s content strategy, creating relevant content, blogging, community participation and leadership.

This position is full time salaried with benefits, including attendance at Social Media, blogging and industry-specific conferences.

We are seeking a curious & motivated executive to join our award winning social media team.

You will support our large client base with social media & digital outreach activity across various client types (B2C & B2B) and industry sectors.

Your key responsibility will be community management and the evolution of social media campaigns on channels including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

The role includes:
Source and manage the social assets and copy for several accounts
Community management including responding to user queries and escalating when necessary
Reporting on the statistics of social channels and campaigns
Your role is key in supporting other members of the social media, marketing and content teams and you will have the ability to multi-task across various projects and platforms is essential.
You will need to be an experienced social media marketing professional. Someone who can devise solid paid and organic social media campaigns to increase brand awareness for clients across LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and other major social platforms, it's a role with a lot of responsibility and scope for growth, ideal for someone looking for career progression to senior level
Key responsibilities:
Assist with the on-boarding of new clients by planning, creating and implementing social media strategies
Proactively manage & maintain social media channels with large audiences and create engaging and relevant content in collaboration with the creative and copy teams
Manage social media budgets and produce monthly reports on ROI and campaign performance
Plan, execute, optimise paid and organic social media campaigns across multiple markets
Provide digital PR Support
Act as a vocal advocate for Social Media across all clients and within the agency
You will have entry level business experience and will be familiar with standard social media management tools. We offer great development and training, hands on experience and competitive salary & benefits.

b12cf04174eef2f8.title: Social Media Manager (Remote)
b12cf04174eef2f8.description:
The social media manager will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and implementing social media campaigns and community growth strategies within timelines set out by the C-level management and head of marketing. You will also monitor and present project updates and reports to the senior team and the wider marketing team. Your work will be to support the growth and execution of the marketing strategy. You will be expected to also work to support ongoing operational marketing for the launch of new products and ensure maximum visibility throughout all our social media channels including Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Linkedin, Instagram and Telegram.

You will be expected to regularly review the efficiency of campaigns and discover new ways to optimise their growth. You will also be expected to understand the latest trends within the market.

Currently looking for:
Social Media Manager (Remote)

Job description

Develop and implement social strategies that drive community engagement and increase Bitfinex brand awareness and user acquisition.
Conceptualize, categorize, visualize, edit and execute every piece of social content that goes out.
Create and manage social distribution plans and schedules that align with wider marketing and business efforts.
Define and track key performance indicators and use these to report on your strategies and campaigns to the rest of the team and management.
Put our community first, always. Make a positive impact in the hearts of our direct supporters and the larger community. Develop our social customer care strategy in partnership with our support team.
Create synergies with the PR team to initiate joint projects which feature a high integration of social.
Network with industry professionals and influencers through social media outreach and leverage these relationships to benefit our PR and marketing efforts.
Work with our product team to surface valuable customer feedback which can inform new product developments.
Collaborate with Marketing and Product development teams to create social ‘buzz’ regarding new product launches.
3-5 years of work experience in social media management and/or strategy in technology, finance or media.
Demonstrated self-starter, with the ability to work in a team environment with minimal oversight.
Strong English communication skills, both written and verbal (only applications in English will be accepted).
Experience prioritizing tasks, managing deadlines, adapting with changing priorities, and balancing short-term needs with long-term strategic initiatives.
Proven ability to work in multidisciplinary teams with copywriters, designers, customer support, product managers, etc.
Ability to deal with negative sentiment diplomatically, and convert detractors to supporters.
Ability to use data to communicate and report how social goals, strategy and results, and how these relate to wider business aims.
Ability to work with visuals, simple gifs, PS assets, videos, etc.

9d1dce093aa1cd67.description:
Are you interested in leading on the analytical engagement and orchestrating innovative integrated media marketing programs (across OESP - owned, earned, shared and paid) for the LEGO brand across our global landscape?
If you are curious, have a bias for actionable insights and have experience in integrated media insights across channels, you can help deliver the best LEGO experience and growth!
Core ResponsibilitiesLead analytical engagement across the full Marketing Value Chain for OESP implementation and strategic developmentBuild positive relationships with business partners to understand priorities, define the roadmap, working with them to improve our shoppers’ experienceTranslate strategic media questions into projects, identifying requirements and relevant business partnersLead continuous digital marketing insights & analytics efforts and custom deep dives to seek opportunities for LEGO.comIdentify existing and new methodologies to measure and analyse digital marketing opportunities. Lead digital marketing analytics 3rd party toolkit and drive our test and learn agenda.
Play your part in our team succeeding
As a part of the LEGO Retail organisation, the Global Ecommerce team drives the development of LEGO.com and digital shopper channels across regions, including new market entry, and plays a pivotal role in commercial strategy.

Within Global Ecommerce, the Digital Insights team are responsible for uncovering insights pivotal to our growth.
Do you have what it takesExperience working in a media insights and analytics environment (mix of agency and client-side would be ideal)Detailed knowledge of the key digital performance marketing channels and experience in optimising campaigns using standard tools (Google Analytics, Adobe, Google Ads, Facebook Business Manager, Adserver, DSPs) and running performance marketing channels (SEM, paid social, programmatic, e-mail)Strong understanding and experience of the OESP media modelExperience leading multiple projects and business partners in a fast-paced, results-focused business environmentAbility to look at data from a business perspective, and drive business actions based on insightsAn understanding of measurement and critical metrics across the consumer journey. Ability to analyse customer journeys through paid/owned/earned channels. Knowledge of multi-click attribution
Join the global LEGO® team
What’s in it for you. Here are some of what to expect:

Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.

Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.

6accb59ad87724f6.title: Production Manager, Global Creative Studio
6accb59ad87724f6.description:
You are a dynamic and experienced Creative Production Manager with a drive to make sense of nonsense, a flair for problem-solving, and an innate ability to coordinate multiple moving pieces in a fun, fast-paced environment. Communication is your strong suit, you thrive well under pressure, and can delegate where needed. You are organized and deadline oriented, but flexible and quick when faced with change. In this role you will manage the workflows and processes within the creative studio for a multitude of projects, from brief through execution, approval process, and delivery of creative assets to cross functional partners. The Global Creative Studio is in a stage of growth and we're looking to build up a stellar team to support marketing initiatives across the board.

In the first 12 months you will:
Be a part of an exciting and growing creative team routing, tracking, and delivering creative assets for all consumer facing Pollen events as well as internal initiatives and campaigns.
Be the through-line between our global creative studio team and pod.
Foster relationships and maintain good communication within the pod structure and our cross functional partners.
Proactively communicate to stakeholders on progress, process, and best practices for efficient and effective creative production.
Develop and manage creative production process in the studio for each campaign, including graphic design and animation assets for social media, CRM, email and website content, to constantly increase efficiency.
Manage the process of intake of new briefs and creative requests.
Create long- and short-term plans, including setting work back schedules, targets for milestones and adhering to deadlines.
Make effective decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress with the project, and adjusting schedules and targets as the project needs change.
Ensure the creative team (Creative Leads, Graphic Designers, Motion Graphics) have all the information they need to deliver assets on brief.
Facilitate creative reviews with key stakeholders to consolidate feedback.
Resource projects across the Global Creative Studio.
Track and communicate status around timelines, deliverables, and contingency plans .
Manage the onboarding and resourcing of external vendors.
Manage and track budgets .
Motivate, support, and provide guidance to the creative and production team to meet productivity goals.
Champion project management tools like Asana.
Develop and foster close relationships with various teams to ensure all needs are met on a consistent basis.
About our culture
We are results focused so you can choose your own hours & take as much vacation as you need to drive results and perform at your best. Watch our CEO talk about our innovative culture.
Read our CEO's open letter about our focus on Belonging, and about the mission of our women's programme Illuminate.
Everyone is an equity owner in the company.
Watch our tech team talk about our culture and how it enables them to do their best work.

Find out more about our culture and life at Pollen on Instagram.

About Pollen

Pollen builds, curates, and delivers the best travel experiences using technology, a network of global partners, and a data-driven customer-led mindset – pairing world class entertainment with the world's most exciting destinations.

Pollen brings you all the best experiences on pollen.co. We have two offerings: Pollen Presents and Pollen+. Pollen Presents curates experiences around your tastes and preferences you can't find anywhere else. These experiences bring together music, sports, wellness and beyond to enable you and your friends to connect around one-of-a-kind itineraries in exciting destinations. Pollen+ always gets you more at music festivals and events when you book through us. Pollen+ partners with the biggest promoter brands and music festivals, including We Are FSTVL, Austin City Limits, Bonnaroo, C3, Electric Zoo, Live Nation and more.

Pollen was founded in 2014 by brothers Callum & Liam Negus-Fancey. Pollen is backed by prominent investors including Kindred, Northzone, Sienna Capital, Backed and Draper Spirit. Pollen has raised over $100 million in VC funding.

GDPR Statement

When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Streetteam Software Limited t/a Pollen ("Controller"), which is located at 3 Loughborough Street, Vauxhall, London, SE11 5RB and can be contacted by emailing talent@pollen.co. Controller's privacy officer is Stephanie Ng-Fragner, who can be contacted at stephanie.ng-fragner@pollen.co. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller's recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.

Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller's behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under either the standard contractual clauses or the Privacy Shield. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at legal@pollen.co.

Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. In the event that you are unsuccessful during the recruitment process, your personal data will still be retained by Controller for up to a year for the purposes of assessing your application for future vacancies. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have the right to data portability. Please notify us if you would like your personal data erased. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority, including the Information Commissioner's Office, the UK regulator for data protection issues (www.ico.org.uk).

375e61506cc37936.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
About us

Here at Pretty Little Thing, we strive to fly the flag for love, equality, and acceptance, working to use our platform to spread nothing but good vibes. Regardless of race, gender, sexuality, style or budget – there’s something for everyone! We want our customers to feel confident in the way they dress and to embrace the way they look. #EveryBODYinPLT is our community that is all about body positivity, equality and supporting each other.

What you'll do
Lead our Paid Media team – a team of Paid Media specialists who manage our Paid Social and Display advertising across 9 different territories
Own the Paid Media strategy, ensuring that we continue to evolve our proposition and remain at the forefront of Paid Social and Display advertising
Work with the Head of Digital Marketing and wider senior stakeholders to ensure that the Paid Media strategy is reflective of the latest business objectives
Own relationships with media owners and tech partners
Own the tech stack with the Paid Media team, making recommendations on which partners we use in order to maximise our proposition and results
Drive best practice across the team
Drive innovation, encouraging test and learn opportunities across all of our activity
Work closely with the wider Digital Marketing team to ensure that strategies and plans are fully aligned across all marketing channels
Build strong relationships with other internal teams such as Business Intelligence, IT, Marketing, Trading and Design
Critically assess weekly Paid Social and Display performance, pulling key actionable learnings for reactive optimization in line with channel objectives
Present strategies, results and opportunities to senior management
Total responsibility for spend management and performance reporting of the Paid Media Team
Use competitor analysis and 3rd party data to benchmark our performance and influence our future strategy
Build and develop a high performing team
What you've got
At least 4 years experience in Paid Social, with additional knowledge of Display being preferable
Demonstrable experience of managing and developing others
A strategic mind, capable of long-term planning and spotting opportunities
A ‘can do’ attitude
The ability to build strong, effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
A keen understanding of wider marketing channels and how they fit into the full consumer journey
Experience in Facebook, Snapchat and Tiktok business managers
Strong analytical skills with an ability to draw insights from large data sets
A good technical understanding
Excellent knowledge of excel; comfortable in producing complex reports, formulas and pivot tables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Behaviours you need to show
You are driven, proactive and passionate
You show strong problem solving skills and are able to source help when needed
You have the ability to work to deadlines in a fast-paced environment
You are a dedicated team player and are able to work with people of varying seniority

Due to the evolving nature of our organisation, this job description is not exhaustive. While this job description will be reviewed and updated periodically, the job holder may from time to time be required to carry out tasks which are not detailed in this document.

PLT Perks

We know that as a company we are only as good as the people that we employ. We know our employees work tirelessly to make PLT the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

Free parking
25 days holiday
Free on-site gym with daily classes (due to current restrictions, live PT sessions)
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Company shares schemes - including a ' Save As You Earn' scheme
40% staff discount (including PLT, Boohoo, Boohoo MAN, Nasty Gal, Coast, Warehouse, Misspap)
Monthly social events (including pay day drinks, Employee Appreciation Day etc.)
Salary sacrifice pension scheme with 5% employer contribution
Flexible working hours
Cycle to work scheme
Childcare support through the Government
Health cash plan
Personal development opportunities to learn and grow at work

Smart Working Policy

PLT offers increased flexibility with working from the office and home in the form of our smart working policy. In brief each department has a set amount of days allocated to office time and working from home to ensure you get the best of both worlds.

Equal opportunities

Here at PLT we not only embrace diversity we celebrate it! We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and we’re continuing to build an inclusive environment for our employees. We know we are better together, and we will continue to build a team that represents a variety of skills, perspectives, and backgrounds.

Reasonable Adjustments

PLT want to give everybody the chance to perform their best whether that is during an interview or whilst at work. Should you require any reasonable adjustments please let the talent team know.

5071e74c18e6d107.description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY
As a company, we are only as good as the people that we employ and as a brand of our Boohoo Family employees work hard to make the business a huge success and in turn we offer them amazing benefits:


25 days holiday + 8 days Bank Holiday
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Company shares schemes - including a 'Save As You Earn' scheme

ABOUT THE ROLE
The primary focus for this role is to manage the execution of various marketing initiatives to grow our social media following and digital presence.

Reporting directly to the Brand and Social Media Manager, the Senior Social Media Executive will work with our social media team to drive forward boohooMAN’s social media presence, producing visual social media content and engaging with our audience.

Our ideal candidate is a social media obsessive with a strong understanding of social media and core marketing concepts, and who can develop creative ways to generate buzz on social. They will understand the nuances between the key social platforms with an ability to adjust content and tone-of-voice accordingly.

The role is carried out in support of the overall marketing strategy and goals. This involves closely liaising with the communications and brand teams to ensure content is social-first and in keeping with our brand identity along with KPIs for driving traffic to the website and increase sales.

What you will be doing:

Content

Support the Social Media Manager in creating, planning and delivering social media plans across all social media channels, including but not limited to Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat and YouTube.
Act as the social content lead. This includes managing two social media executives, two social media assistants and a marketing intern with social content production, as well as planning, shooting and editing social media first, iPhone shot content on campaign shoots.
Maintain our social media channels with fresh new content by organizing and co-ordinating all necessary assets and delegating to other members of the team where necessary.
Assist in execution of new initiatives to help grow the social fan base across all of our channels, including building relationships with external brands for prize giveaways.
Remain proactive across all new emerging technologies, channels, tools and trends.
Participate in the development of social media strategies and key programming throughout the year.
Assist in general social media and digital responsibilities including special projects with influencers to gather content and strengthen the relationship

Reporting

Update and distribute weekly reporting on our social media platforms and our competitors
Regular reporting across all our promotions including regular tracking throughout whilst we host competitions simultaneously.
Conduct regular competitor research to ensure boohooMAN’s social media strategy remains ahead of the competitive set.
ABOUT THE CANDIDATE
Experience at a social platform, PR/content/media agency or brand
Strong understanding of the nuances of different social platforms and the ways audiences consume content on them
Good image and short form video editing skills, including how to shoot and edit on TikTok
Experience in creating social media proposals across BAU and campaigns.
Good analytical understanding to organise and interpret data. Proficient in Microsoft Office and basic knowledge of Google Analytics
Flexible and adaptable to change
Strong relationship builder with wider teams
Ability to work under pressure and at a fast pace
Excellent attention to detail
Demonstrates a creative flair
Works to tight deadlines with a can-do attitude
Willingness to go beyond the call of duty to get the job done
Strong communicator both internally and externally

3e77e30395926d2f.title: Social Media Specialist
3e77e30395926d2f.description:
Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.


As our new Social Media Expert, you will join our high-achieving and international Digital Media Team (11 people and growing across the globe). You will take responsibility over building and launching social media campaign across all product lines of Agilent wide portfolio of solutions working closely with internal stakeholders. You will work on assignments and develop market/product business plans and strategic marketing programs, while enjoying all the support and encouragement you need to build a far-reaching career.


Your main responsibilities will be:
Work within the internal digital media team to build and execute paid social media campaigns, with focus on paid LinkedIn and Facebook. Continuously monitoring and optimizing campaign portfolios across all social channels.Develop short-term and long-term strategies, campaign setup, deployment, monitoring and optimization.Provide monthly reporting, as well as expertise and guidance to internal teams on their campaign performance.
Act as a consultant to internal stakeholders, becoming a trusted adviser by sharing latest industry trend and, media recommendations, continuously educating internal stakeholders.
Work with Media Client Partners on brainstorming campaign strategy and design to provide high-level media plans.Provide insights from past campaign performance and learnings to internal team.
Identifying trends and analyzing results that help steer innovation — making recommendations to further drive awareness, growth, and engagement


This role can be based anywhere in the UK, or potentially another country in Europe where Agilent is based. You will have the opportunity to work fully remotely or on a hybrid model by working from one of our offices.

We are looking for a motivated individual with the following background:

Significant marketing experience with running paid social media campaign, in the B2B spaceIdeally a University DegreeExperience with LinkedIn Campaign Manager – knowledge of Facebook Campaign Manager is a plusFirst experience in the Life Science sphere or in a Social Media Agency is idealUnderstanding of Quickbase, Asana, Sprout and/or MS Office (and especially Excel) is a plus.


On a personal level, you are both autonomous & a team player. You like working in a fast-paced environment and to solve problems. You have great communications skills to interact with many internal and external partners at a high level.


Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

6daed71eca99ec6a.title: Social Media Intern
6daed71eca99ec6a.description:
Job title: Social Media Intern
Responsible to: Brand Manager
Department: Rebel Labs
Location of work: 4 Pancras Square, Kings Cross
Music is Universal
It’s the passionate and dedicated team at Universal Music UK who help make us Britain’s leading music company. From A&R to finance, legal to digital, sales to marketing, Universal Music is the place to grow and develop your career within a truly commercial and innovative business that leads in everything it does.
Everyone is welcome to apply for our roles, and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment because of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, belief, age, marital status, background, pregnancy or caring responsibilities. We also recognise the importance of diversity of thought within our teams and are fully committed to embracing the talents of people with autism, dyslexia, ADHD and other forms of neurocognitive variation.
We will always seek to make appropriate adjustments to recruitment, workplaces, and work processes to be fully inclusive to people with different needs and working styles. If you need us to make any reasonable adjustments for you from application onwards, including alternatives to the online form or to disclose a neurocognitive condition, please email UniversalMusicCareers@umusic.com
The A Side: A Day in The Life
Universal Music Group is looking for a Social Media Intern to join their social media department, Rebel Labs to support their Snapchat Discover programming team and diversify our portfolio of successful Snapchat shows.
You’ll be obsessed with music and have your finger on the pulse when it comes to the latest relatable internet youth culture, the biggest global trends and viral videos across Snapchat, TikTok and Reels.
The B Side: Skills & Experience
Scheduling and publishing posts on TikTok, Snapchat & YouTube
Community management; communicating with our followers in our brands’ tones of voice
Research and pre-production assistance ahead of our shoots with artists
Capturing on-set behind-the-scenes video content on mobile for our socials
Contribute to brainstorms and creative development of new ideas for shows, formats and ad-hoc content
Open-minded, versatile, and willing as possible to help us achieve all of the weird and wonderful things that we create
Person Specification

Necessary
A deep understanding of social media (especially TikTok)
Great short form writing skills for social media
An interest in music marketing
A big love of music (pop, rap, R&B and indie)
Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Desired

Basic video editing
Basic photography skills
Adobe Premiere Pro
Adobe Photoshop
Facebook Ads Manager
Bonus Tracks: Your Benefits

Group Personal Pension Scheme (between 3% and 9%)
Private Medical Insurance
25 paid days of annual leave
Interest Free Season Ticket Loan available
Holiday Purchase scheme
Dental and Travel Insurance options
Cycle to Work Scheme
Salary Sacrifice Cars
Subsidised Gym Membership
Employee Discounts (Reward Gateway)
Just So You Know…
The company presents this job description as a guide to the major areas and duties for which the jobholder is accountable. However, the business operates in an environment that demands change and the jobholder's specific responsibilities and activities will vary and develop. Therefore, the job description should be seen as indicative and not as a permanent, definitive and exhaustive statement.

7f7affa5da1fc327.title: Social Media Officer
7f7affa5da1fc327.description:
We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Social Media Officer to join our Digital Engagement team. You'll be supporting the Digital Engagement Manager with the day to day management of Cats Protection’s national social media profiles whilst delivering the brand values and meeting the social media strategy. You will join us working 35 hours per week and in return you will receive a competitive salary of up to £30,738.01 per annum plus excellent benefits.

Cats Protection is the UK’s leading feline welfare charity with a nationwide network of adoption and homing centres, volunteer-run branches and charity shops. During 2020, despite all of the challenges, we helped 126,000 cats and kittens. That's the equivalent of around 345 cats a day!

Cats Protection’s Digital Engagement team, based in the Marketing and Income Generation Directorate and looks after social media, email marketing and video production for our popular social media channels. Small but busy, the Digital Engagement team produces informative cat care videos and emails as well as the charity’s e-newsletter, and works hard at building an engaged community of cat lovers online so that we can talk all things “cat” with supporters and promote better feline welfare across the UK. No two days are the same – with a busy content calendar, one day could involve jumping on a trend, the next we could be launching a major national campaign. You’ll have the opportunity to work closely with lots of teams across Cats Protection so it’s the place to be if you’re a people person!
Responsibilities of our Social Media Officer:

As our Social Media Officer you'll plan, create and publish content for our national Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and TikTok accounts. You’ll work closely with the Regional Social Media Officers within the team who support branches, centres and shops. You'll explore new technologies and social media channels as they arise whilst staying in line of trends and news. You'll support the Digital Engagement Manager to provide social media training for employees and volunteers as well as uploading and optimising our YouTube videos.
What we’re looking for in our Social Media Officer:
Significant experience of using social media in a professional capacity
Experience of working to brand guidelines and policy constraints
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Creative and with a desire to learn/stay abreast of constant changes in social media
Understanding of social media principles

What we can offer you:
salary of up to £30,738.01 per annum plus excellent benefits
generous annual leave entitlement
contribution pension scheme
life assurance scheme
range of health benefits
Employee Assistance Programme
and more

Join us as our Social Media Officer and know you are helping to make a real difference to cats and kittens across the UK!
Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications or CVs that are emailed to us directly. Please note any applications received after the closing date may not be responded to.
Closing date: 15th March 2022
Virtual interview date: 24th March 2022

74be1de61899a831.title: Social Media Content Executive,WDW & DCL -12 months FTC
74be1de61899a831.description:
The Social Media Content Executive, WDW & DCL will support the Social Media Manager in developing and executing social media campaigns for Walt Disney World (WDW) and Disney Cruise Line (DCL). Responsibilities include; developing and executing the social editorial content plan and campaigns; engaging with and leveraging the loyal communities and fan bases; and rolling out and managing Influencer activations; organising and hosting WDW and DCL trips.

This is a fixed term contract.

Responsibilities :

Develop and deliver an engaging year-round social editorial calendar for Walt Disney World and Disney Cruise Line utilising US-led creatives where relevant and develop localised content that supports the UK Strategy
Write copy and produce engaging content and adverts for all social media channels, including paid social ad campaign assets
Work with external creative agencies to develop social assets including managing asset briefings, feedback and deadlines
Work closely with the Social Media Manager and our in-house media and brand teams to deliver social campaigns that support above-the-line campaigns
Work with the Social Media Platform Executive to manage UK social media platforms, including scheduling organic posts and monitoring Guests’ comments
Assist the Social Media Manager in building the overall social media strategy for the year ahead during the annual operating planning (AOP) process
Manage Influencer activations including; sourcing relevant Influencers, writing briefs, developing content ideas, coordinating filming in resort with the in-house broadcast team; organise and host trips in WDW and on-board DCL
Work closely with The Walt Disney Company social teams to source contra marketing opportunities to place WDW and DCL on other Disney company social channels
Work with the Social Media Manager to develop and execute a Fan Group Program for UK-based Disney Destination fan pages on Facebook
Stay up-to-date with digital technology trends
Work with the wider Disney Destinations team to share social assets and best practices with them when needed
Responsible for tracking, updating and working within allocated budgets where appropriate
Develop and deliver an engaging year-round social editorial calendar for WDW and DCL utilising US-led creatives where relevant and develop localised content that supports the UK Strategy
Build strong relationships with the North America WDW and DCL social teams to coordinate best-practices, leverage opportunities that will enhance the UK social media strategy
Responsible for operating within compliant business practice, standards of business conduct, and within approved departmental guidelines
Support the Social Media manager to ensure all social media content adheres to Company guidelines and is approved where relevant prior to publication

Basic Qualifications :

Degree-level education in a related field or equivalent work experience
Proven experience of building effective relationships and managing stakeholders within a large, multi-national, matrix organisation
Marketing experience at equivalent level within a major multi-national marketing environment
Proven experience in social media and digital marketing
Experience in managing social platforms and identifying and tracking relevant community KPIs
Demonstrable strategic and tactical skills related to implementation of marketing and sales plans and recommending resources necessary for success
A confident copy-writer who is able to craft compelling social copy for each Disney Destinations brand
Proven experience working with social tools/platforms such as Sprinklr, Khoros (Spreadfast), Facebook Business Manager, as well as Google Analytics
Disney/Disneyland Parks and Resorts product knowledge, beneficial

7283ec3ef3ceda8e.title: SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER
7283ec3ef3ceda8e.description:
The role: Social Media Manager – International (Brazilian Portuguese speaking)

We are looking for a Social Media Manager to join our International Brand Marketing team in London.

Are you our next star player?

Reporting to the Senior Social & Content Manager, the Social Media Manager will have end-to-end responsibility for delivering against Betfair’s social media strategy in international target markets.

This is a key role in the International Brand team, offering cross regional scope but with a core focus on Brazil. Your campaigns will catalyse the growth of our business in a rapidly growing market, diversifying beyond traditional media to enable Betfair’s ownership of the betting conversation in new and emerging customer touchpoints.

Adopting a publisher mindset, you will surface social media content that engages our players, delivers cut-through, and gets shared on the platforms that matter to our players. Sourcing content from our in-house studio and external collaborators alike, you’ll be working with world class assets like our Copa Libertadores sponsorship and Brazilian football legend Rivaldo to bring our brand to life.

The role requires a true critical expert who is obsessed with emerging trends in social media and has the operational aptitude to enable them at pace. Moreover, you’ll champion a fully localised approach in every customer interaction, developing content that is natively designed to cut through in our regional markets.

Why we need you

Your role responsibilities will include:

Defining monthly content plans for our social media channels, aligning execution with the sporting calendar, customer behavioural trends and wider ATL and Digital campaign media
Collaborating with teams across Campaigns, Sponsorship, PR and Digital teams to build joined-up campaigns with complete cross-channel alignment
Owning the test and learn roadmap to generate data-driven insight from every social touchpoint, feeding learnings back into our content plan to continuously optimise campaign performance
Working with Online Media colleagues to build out our network of Influencers, applying best practice ways of working to deliver campaigns that resonate with our content creators’ audiences
Managing monthly budgets, with paid media investment optimised based on performance insight
Monitoring social media trends in the wider industry and beyond, ensuring Betfair is at the forefront of any emerging platforms, and in a position to leverage them where it supports our strategic priorities
Accountability for Quality Assurance, ensuring all campaigns are subject to robust QA processes
Building out our social channels as a vehicle to grow Betfair’s customer base, continually optimising our response led messaging and measuring performance with the right tracking solutions
Operationalising the real time publishing capabilities required to own the conversation around major sporting events, enabling the right mix between scheduled, reactive, and planned reactive content
Working flexibility to cover key sporting events that might take place at evenings/ weekends, or outside standard working hours to account for time zone differences

Who we’re looking for

Your experience:

4+ years’ experience managing social media channels for B2C brands
Deep technical understanding of social media platforms – you know the metrics that matter, the tactics that work, and the best practice techniques to implement them for each channel
Commercial acumen and a will to deliver projects that impact marketing metrics
Experience in a fast-moving ecommerce environment
Excel & PowerPoint skills
Fluency in English and Brazilian Portuguese is essential. Spanish language skills are a distinct advantage.

Your behaviours:

Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and managing multiple simultaneous projects
Customer obsessed: Quickly gains an understanding of what drives Sports bettors, executing customer-centric campaigns that deliver against their motivations
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time
Stakeholder management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple stakeholders across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find new solutions. Takes on the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy

What’s in it for you?

Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus.

Your package will include:

Health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
A personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
Looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of £1,000 for your new addition whilst working for us
Discounted gym membership
In-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career.

About the Group

Betfair International is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange. Flutter brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@flutterint.com

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

Want a seat at the table?

fb2b9ba40b6db3b0.title: Social Media Manager
fb2b9ba40b6db3b0.description:
At M&G our vision is: to become the best loved and most successful savings and investment business and we’re looking for people who are excited about joining us on our journey. We’re digitally transforming and investing heavily in technology and innovation to develop new and improved customer propositions that really raise the bar for our customers. To help us achieve our vision we’re looking for exceptional people who live our values and behaviours and who can inspire others; embrace change; deliver results and keep it simple.
We know that an inclusive environment makes us more accessible and ensures we attract, engage, promote and retain exceptional people. We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of age, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity/nationality, disability, or military service and welcome those who have taken career breaks. We will consider flexible working arrangements or home working arrangements for any of our roles.

What you can expect from us:

We are committed to creating an environment where you can be exceptional at all you do. To help us deliver this, we promise to:
Challenge Your Limits by creating a stimulating working environment and providing opportunities for you to be involved in meaningful and challenging work
Support Your Aspirations with a commitment to learning and development that helps you achieve and build your experience with people who want you to succeed
Value Your Input whereby leaders and managers will involve you in key decisions, listen to your thoughts and recognise the important contribution you make
Balance Your Life through a work life partnership that focuses on making this an inclusive, diverse and friendly place to work and offers the flexibility and support that enables everyone to be at their best
How do we support our employees:
All M&G plc employees will be supported in the workplace through our M&G Employee Assistance Programme (EAP). If you need counselling, confidential financial or legal advice. The service is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and offers access to qualified professionals who can provide specialist information, advice and support on many issues. It offers a broad range of services, including help with family issues, maintaining work/life balance and mental health support.
The Role: Social Media Manager (Hybrid working)
The social media team at M&G manage a global estate of accounts across LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube, and as part of our continued growth we are looking for a Social Media Manager to work closely with the Senior Global Social Media Manager to develop and deliver our M&G social media strategy.


As our social media footprint evolves globally, we are looking for an individual who can champion brand presence for our M&G brands in the financial services space, connect with potential clients and customers, boost awareness of our brands, and help deliver traffic to our suite of websites. We want to put our clients and customers at the heart of what we do socially, while collaborating and communicating these developments to key stakeholders internally – helping them understand why and how social media is relevant to them.
This role will require the individual to be a social media expert, offering innovative and technical counsel to stakeholders, while project managing content, outreach, advocacy and reporting requirements.
Key Work Level Accountabilities:
Experienced Colleague:
Accountable for providing a quality service or product to customers and stakeholders, using skills/experience built through significant practical experience or training
For team leaders, accountable for ensuring the team the role supports is delivering a quality service or product
Works within established frameworks and procedures, with the freedom to interpret them to solve a range of problems
Delivers outputs that are clearly defined, using discretion over how to achieve them
Makes suggestions for improvements to the work of the team, based on previous experience and knowledge of similar situations
Key Responsibilities for this role:
To collaborate with colleagues in the Brand and Social Media Centre of Excellence to create and deliver a successful M&G social media strategy, which supports business growth priorities
Responsible for developing engaging and relevant content to support business strategies through social media opportunities
Responsible for day-to-day management, coordination and activation of social media content across M&G brands, including proactively developing ideas and content to amplify and support business growth priorities
Work closely with our regulatory and compliance teams to ensure content achieves excellence in customer/client engagement whilst remaining fully compliant
Work closely and develop effective relationships with business stakeholders to define social media project requirements
Responsible for managing and coordinating our paid outreach social strategy, and monitor and manage external agency relationships
Responsible for developing our employee social media advocacy programme across the M&G business
Responsible for managing social media risk, governance and reporting including reviewing, analysing and presenting social performance across our global estate
To work collaboratively with colleagues and support social media community management
Ability to positively promote the work of the team
Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience:
At least five years of experience operating in a social media/digital marketing environment within financial services and/or asset management
Significant experience working with and reporting into senior executives and business leaders
A proven ability and a solid understanding of social media functionality, formats and best practices across LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook, with technical understanding of how the industry is evolving
Experience of implementing, developing and delivering financial services/asset management content campaigns (both financial and non-financial promotions) via social media management platforms for professional investor and/or financial advisers audiences
Significant and proven technical capability and experience in using social media advertising platforms for paid social campaigns, primarily LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter
The ability to dissect social media analytics via Adobe Analytics and report back insight-led insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Detailed understanding of risk in relation to brand management, social media and compliance
Experience in online community management
Desirable
Experience within financial services is essential and it would also help to have a background in:
Our target customers
Life and pensions products, markets and competitors
Asset management, markets and competitors
Financial services regulatory frameworks
Work Level: Experienced Colleague
Recruiter Name: Chloe Murphy
We live by four behaviours at M&G and we ask all our employees to:
Inspire Others - Support and encourage each other, creating an environment where everyone can contribute and succeed
Embrace Change - Be open to change, willing to be challenged and able to adapt quickly and imaginatively to new ideas
Deliver Results - Focus on outcomes, set high standards and deliver with energy and determination
Keep it Simple - Cut through complexity and bureaucracy, be clear and decisive and never overcomplicate things

02abd42447e91f43.title: NFT Campaign Manager
02abd42447e91f43.description: We’re seeking a Campaign Manager to lead the implementation of marketing activities for our NFT launchpad and marketplace. To be successful in the role, you will need good project management skills and marketing experience, and a solid understanding of the NFT space.Our NFT platform is the newest product in our successful defi ecosystem, lining up to deliver some head-turning projects in 2022. You'll be joining a global team, fully permanently remote, during its scaling stage at a very important time of growth.
