4fbcb715390d2d35.title: Social Media Specialist 3 Month FTC (Hybrid Role)
4fbcb715390d2d35.description:
Alongside the Social Media Manager the individual will be responsible for the development & execution of the social strategy for the Fashion & Home categories across primary and secondary social platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest). This role is critical to driving social media KPIs across several QVC social media platforms to drive engagement, reach, and brand awareness. This role will work closely with various internal stakeholders to create campaigns, ideate, plan and brief compelling, consistent, and meaningful content for all social media platforms.

This role reports solid line to Social Media & Community Manager.

3107fdf6b1b8764c.title: International Communications Manager
3107fdf6b1b8764c.description:
Job title: International Communications Manager
Responsible to: Senior Director, Global Priorities – Communications & Artist Strategy
Department: Global Classics & Jazz
Location of work: 4 Pancras Square, Kings Cross

Music is Universal
It’s the passionate and dedicated team at Universal Music who help make us the world’s leading music company. From A&R to finance, legal to digital, sales to marketing, Universal Music is the place to grow and develop your career within a truly commercial and innovative business that leads in everything it does.
Everyone is welcome to apply for our roles, and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment because of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, belief, age, marital status, background, pregnancy or caring responsibilities. We also recognise the importance of diversity of thought within our teams and are fully committed to embracing the talents of people with autism, dyslexia, ADHD and other forms of neurocognitive variation.
We will always seek to make appropriate adjustments to recruitment, workplaces, and work processes to be fully inclusive to people with different needs and working styles. If you need us to make any reasonable adjustments for you from application onwards, including alternatives to the online form or to disclose a neurocognitive condition, please email UniversalMusicCareers@umusic.com
The A Side: A Day in The Life
Global Classics and Jazz (GCJ) is a division within Universal Music Group (UMG) focusing specifically on classical and jazz music throughout the company. Working with the company’s market leading and iconic labels, including Deutsche Grammophon, Decca, Blue Note, ECM, Verve/Decca US and Mercury KX, it is the largest and most successful classical and jazz recorded music business in the world. Global Classics and Jazz is committed to growing the international profile for UMG’s genre-leading artists and labels.
The B Side: Skills & Experience
Be Organised

Help co-ordinate regular communication calls
Monitor media uptake and social media output
Create international press reports including internal newsletters
Write and edit press releases and draft internal communications
Be Collaborative
Assist with GCJ conferences and events
Support creation and editing of presentations for GCJ team
Support international media campaigns for UMG artists, labels and releases
Support the wider GCJ marketing team with international promotion and interviews
Carry out research and handle media related enquiries internally and externally
Be Commercial
Identify and generate news stories and help create storytelling tools
Work across recorded music, audio-visual content and GCJ related partners
Maintain media contacts and constantly expand personal network of journalists, across TV, radio, print and online
Person Specification
Necessary
A broad understanding of today’s PR and communications environment
Knowledge of classical and/or jazz music
Confident communicator across all levels of seniority internally and externally
Excellent writing skills and story-telling ability
Strong traditional PR skills and media relations expertise in the music, digital or entertainment industries
Broad range of active international media contacts
Attention to detail and highly developed organisation skills, deadline driven
Ability to multi-task, think quickly and exercise sound judgement
Confidential and trustworthy, must be a team player and open to guidance
Self-motivated
Experience with events, media and content launches
Design and content creation skills
News obsessed – both music and wider media business
Ambition and tenacity
Desirable

Languages
Familiarity with translations or ability to translate
An understanding of music in 2022 and how the industry, media and fans interact
Digital and social media strategy experience
Experience in crisis management
Experience with internal corporate communications
An understanding of digital innovation and evolving technologies
Bonus Tracks: Your Benefits

Group Personal Pension Scheme (between 3% and 9%)
Private Medical Insurance
25 paid days of annual leave
Interest Free Season Ticket Loan
Holiday Purchase scheme
Dental and Travel Insurance options
Cycle to Work Scheme
Salary Sacrifice Cars
Subsidised Gym Membership
Employee Discounts (Reward Gateway)
Just So You Know…
The company presents this job description as a guide to the major areas and duties for which the jobholder is accountable. However, the business operates in an environment that demands change and the jobholder's specific responsibilities and activities will vary and develop. Therefore, the job description should be seen as indicative and not as a permanent, definitive and exhaustive statement.

a6ede45d6e5f7878.title: Social Media Manager
a6ede45d6e5f7878.description:
Job Type: Full time
Salary: £17,000 - £21,000 (Depending on experience)
Location: Bristol (BS1)
Role
As Social Media Manager you will be responsible for the delivery of social media content across multiple social media platforms for a number of large-scale trade events throughout the year. You will join a fast-paced, collaborative and dynamic team of marketers. Supporting the sales teams through the creation and management of popular social content.
You will work closely with the Head of Marketing and Marketing Director as well as collaborating with the Marketing Managers for each show to ensure delivery of high quality and engaging social media content and strategy. You will be encouraged to bring ideas to the table and contribute heavily to the campaigns and develop the knowledge and understanding to your team members around you.
The role will require you to be able to function effectively within a fast, sales orientated environment, providing an excellent opportunity for you to put your stamp on a rapidly growing organisation within the trade exhibition industry.
Required Skills:
Proven track record of delivering social campaigns across multiple platforms
Experience in delivery of paid social advertising campaigns
Excellent organisational skills
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent understanding of LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram & Facebook
Experience using social media automation tools
Able to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
A proactive approach to content delivery
Excellent time management skills
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Microsoft Office
Ability to prioritise and juggle multiple projects at the same time
Demonstrate commercial acumen
Ability to learn and understand new industries quickly and efficiently
Main Responsibilities:
Manage and develop social media strategy
Build back catalogue of social proof
Creation and delivery of social content
Management of paid social advertising
Our Company:
We have been organising leading B2B trade exhibitions for over twenty years, and are responsible for a portfolio of over 50 shows across the world, from a variety of niche industry events like Family Attraction Expo to major global events like The B2B Marketing Expo and White Label World Expo
Prysm has a reputation for producing well run, well attended events that receive significant investment to ensure they constantly evolve and improve. The success of our events is built on an ethos of delivering outstanding educational content that attracts highly targeted audiences and offers an engaging visitor experience.
Apply Now:
Please send a cover letter and CV to Andra Burlacu andra.burlacu@fortem-international.com.
We will be looking to interview successful candidates immediately.

330f194c382c7ee8.title: Paid Social Media Manager - Contract
330f194c382c7ee8.description:
Paid Social Media Manager - Contract
London
Our client, a luxury agency in London is looking for a Paid Social Manager to work on a remote and part-time basis, across facebook and instagram
You will be working on a number of key luxury clients, with an ability to work on new clients. The ideal person will be responsible for strategy setting, implementation and optimisation.
You will ideally have experience within relevant sectors such as luxury, fashion, beauty and lifestyle.
If you match the above please apply.

91687ffba9e17535.title: Social Media & Digital Campaign Manager
91687ffba9e17535.description:
This is an exciting opportunity work at the cutting edge of digital campaigning and social media. You will be responsible for enhancing the social media presence of elected Conservatives and candidates with a focus on developing their organic distribution channels. You will also engage with a wide range of stakeholders including MPs, Councillors and CCHQ professionals nationally and locally. There is scope to bring your own creative flair to the role, whilst working within a disciplined campaign strategy and message.

Positions are available nationwide.

Your responsibilities

Co-ordinating digital campaigns across Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, web and other platforms
Building and growing local organic social media distribution channels as a central part of our local campaigning
Videography – filming and editing social media ready clipsGraphics - creating bespoke graphics for social media to portray key information and messagingDeveloping local social media content creationResearching and recommending content ideas for social mediaAbility to implement digital targeting and advertising to support local campaigns and candidatesDeveloping new strategies for increasing reach and engagement with local communitiesProducing reports to showcase performance on social media and making related recommendationsSupport the training and development of digital and social media skills amongst local campaigns and candidates

Your professional experience:

Proficient in administering social media channels
You know what works on social media and can show itA good understanding of digital advertising and how best to create online advertising campaignsUnderstanding of, and ability to, disseminate appropriate messagingCapacity to produce photos, films and graphics which work well on social media platformsBe proficient at editing in industry-standard software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe PhotoshopAbility to manage a content libraryCan do attitude and willingness to work flexible hoursTeam playerDriving licence and access to your own vehicleYou can work under pressure and be able to turn round tasks with short deadlines

Desirable: - Prior political experience with the Conservative Party

466a7c77f50d95dd.title: Digital & Social Media Marketing Manager
466a7c77f50d95dd.description:
We are recruiting for a highly experienced and innovative Digital and Social Media Manager to be based at our Force Headquarters in Camden, London. This is a permanent contract paying £34,274.06 - £36,461.77 (depending on experience) plus £2,700.10 London Allowance per annum.
If you’re looking for a role that brings together your digital channel expertise and your sense of social responsibility, then this is it.
A new in-house team with an agency feel will offer a specialist multi channelled approach to the British Transport Police’s (BTP’s) proactive communications. The team will be responsible for overseeing BTP’s campaign and marketing communications, which not only save lives it also tackles some of society’s biggest issues. From preventing suicide to countering terrorism and reducing violent or sexual assaults – we can promise no two days will be the same.
BTP is the national police Force for the rail network throughout Great Britain, including London Underground, across which we ensure the safety and security of nearly 3 billion passenger journeys and over 100 million tons of freight every year. The world in which we work is fast-paced, operationally and commercially demanding, and constantly changing. As our Digital and Social Media Manager you will lead, direct and coordinate the digital communications strategy behind our day to day and campaign communications, and manage our all our digital channels.


As Digital and Social Media Manager you will be required to:
Provide expert advice to BTP on the strategic management of high profile force wide digital communications to raise its profile and enhance and protect its reputation
Work with a team of communications specialists to deliver integrated proactive communications, as well as support the media relations team in the case of reactive incidents
Be our communications lead for a new website project, enabling us to better connect with our communities
Continually improving the use of social media channels and website content across the force.
Provide expert advice and direction on the management and use of BTP’s external online and digital presence
The successful Digital and Social Media Manager will be required to evidence the following skills:
Educated to degree level in Digital Marketing, Business Marketing, Media, Communications or similar professional qualification or relevant equivalent experience
Proven experience of planning, delivering and evaluating internal and external digital communications strategies
Excellent level of social media and web literacy at a corporate level
Further information about this vacancy can be found in the attached job description.
If you are interested in applying to this Digital and Social Media Manager role then please do not delay as interviews will be held as soon as appropriate candidates are highlighted. In return for your experience, we can offer you:
Salary £34,274.06 - £36,461.77 (depending on experience) plus £2,700.10 London Allowance per annum
28 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Pension scheme
Other benefits include a bespoke BTP rewards platform and various salary sacrifice schemes such as cycle-to-work and season ticket loan as well as many high street and online retail discounts
How to apply
Click on the apply button below, complete a brief application form and upload a CV and a short cover letter outlining your skills and experience in relation to the role in one document.
We want our organisation to be as diverse as the community it serves and welcome applicants from all sections of the community. In order to apply, you must have the permanent right to live and work in the UK and have been resident in the UK for the previous 3 YEARS/5 YEARS (dependant on the level of vetting required of the role). You will be asked these and other questions to determine your eligibility to work for British Transport Police when you start your application and you must answer honestly.
BTP has undertaken a review of Police Staff pensions and as a result of this the Police Staff pension will be changing. The current police staff pension is a Defined Benefit scheme which is administered by the Railways Pension scheme. The new pension scheme which is launching is a Defined Contribution scheme which is administered by Royal London. The new pension scheme is awaiting formal approval and an introductory date is not finalised. The earliest this will be is May 2022. If you have any queries, please contact recruitmentteam@btp.police.uk
Candidates internal to BTP must confirm that they are not subject to formal action plans for sickness/complaints/discipline or poor performance, that all mandatory training courses have been attended and are in ticket/up to date, that a ‘developing’ rating, or above, was achieved on the last reporting year PDR and they have completed their tenure period (6 months) for current substantive posting.

22ba8b0bd7be23db.title: PR and Communications Manager
22ba8b0bd7be23db.description:
POSITION: Permanent, Full Time (37.5 hours per week)
LOCATION: Remote (with flexibility to travel within the UK)
SALARY: Competitive
OUR COMPANY
Founded in 2013, Healios is a leading specialist digital healthcare company working to empower patients and families affected by mental health, autism and ADHD conditions to support long-term outcomes and wellbeing. Our mission is to bring exceptional healthcare to anyone, anytime, anywhere.
Healios is pioneering the world’s first digitalisation of NHS Mental Health Trust outpatient services, covering multiple complex specialist assessment and psychological intervention services. By digitising entire clinical pathways, we enable children, adults and their family members to receive and seamlessly transition between clinical services from the comfort of their home.
You can find out more about us by clicking here!
OUR TEAM
Through our NHS partnerships and private care services our commercial teams set out to empower every young person to build the capabilities for long-term mental health to successfully navigate life’s challenges and experience a better quality of life.
Through our NHS partnerships and private care offer we are improving outcomes for children, young people and their families across the UK. We are a fresh, dynamic and fast growing team with a passion for delivering exceptional experiences for our partners and those that use our services.
THE OPPORTUNITY
As we continue to scale our organisation we have an exciting opportunity to expand the skills and competence of our commercial team with the recruitment of an experienced PR & Communications Manager. This role will sit within our marketing team and work alongside our Marketing Manager and Content Manager, while also collaborating with multiple stakeholders across the wider Healios organisation.
You will create and execute the strategy to inspire all our audiences (internal and external) with highly impactful and targeted communications in support of our core strategic priorities. If you are passionate about developing creative communication campaigns and want to be part of building something from the ground up, then we’d love to hear from you.
To be successful in this role, below is what we would need from you:

Experience developing and executing a fully developed, measurable PR and communications strategy for internal and external stakeholders
Promoting Healios’ pioneering story and thought leadership through multiple channels and stakeholders, including traditional and new media channels
Develop a media distribution list and build relationships with key stakeholders to raise awareness of Healios
Manage media inquires and interview requests
Development of promotional materials e.g. press releases, case-studies and testimonials to support brand awareness and positioning
Support in the delivery of the broader marketing and content strategies for owned channels, e.g. the Healios website and social media channels
Have a professional home working environment
A Wifi connection. Minimum of 2 mbps up and download speed
Have a real passion for supporting people to improve their lives
A desire to become part of a collaborative environment and share knowledge and learning for the benefit of all
A curious mind-set that underpins your continuous drive to challenge the status quo for achieving better outcomes
Flexibility to support our mission of bringing healthcare to anyone, anytime, anywhere

WHAT WE WILL PROVIDE FOR YOU
33 days holiday (including bank holidays and closure days)
Contributory Pension Scheme
Fully personalised flexible benefits package
Enhanced family friendly policies
Flexible, home based role
Company laptop, monitor and keyboard, plus an allowance to purchase additional equipment
A collaborative culture where curiosity, creativity, experimentation and innovation are fostered
A highly motivated and energetic team bringing a wide range of talents, experience and knowledge to solve complex challenges
Autonomy to shape and design world leading clinical pathways that harness the power of combining technology with evidence-based interventions and a human touch
Opportunities to grow and further develop your professional interests
A culture that challenges the status quo in pursuit of providing exceptional healthcare and an unrivalled experience for the clients and families we support
PRE- EMPLOYMENT CHECKS
As part of our pre-employment checks, all employees of Healios will be asked to have a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check. Dependent on your role within the business, this will either be an Enhanced or Basic. A Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) check may also be required. You will be asked to provide two professional references as a minimum.

fd1d78ede2808b77.title: Marketing Manager - Glasgow
fd1d78ede2808b77.description:
Overview:

The Marketing Manager will bring marketing strategies, campaigns, content, and programming to life for our venue. This individual knows how to strategically target core audiences and demographics by activating campaigns, building local affiliations, and delivering outreach efforts that proactively drive awareness, understanding and have a direct impact on new and repeat Guest visits.
Communication skills and a vibrant personality are just as important as a knowledge of marketing. The Marketing Manager will be an “influencer” when it comes to internal team engagement and communication. This is critical to ensure our Guest facing Associates have clear understanding of campaigns and programs.
Effective application of marketing efforts must be complimented by an astute knowledge of analytics, measurement, and control to evaluate performance and business impact. The role integrates with the Home Office based marketing team for support across all marketing related application.
Key Responsibilities:
Intimate knowledge of the local market. Where our core audiences live, work, and socialise. Competitor experiences and promotional activity. Networking and affiliation groups. Sporting and Cultural Events.
Work with the venue leaders to educate and engage Associates on marketing and revenue driving initiatives, utilizing in-person, Workplace and message boards
Execute in-venue campaigns, programming, and corporate partnerships in accordance with national/local plans, as directed by the Home Office Marketing team
Create and manage key partnerships with local businesses, organizations, and charities to build community relations
Assist in managing local earned media and influencer relationships, operating as a spokesperson for the venue as needed
Social Media – Manage and execute established strategies across Facebook, Instagram and TikTok, with a focus on capturing and producing channel specific content
Manage online reputation by tracking and responding to consumer feedback across social and review platforms.
Ensure all printed and digital in venue collateral and promotional items meet brand standards
Work with the venue leaders to develop local programs and events, including but not limited to local promotions, field trips, sports viewing events, and music
Plan and carry out local outreach programs as to promote the venue and experience
Track results of marketing activities (KPI’s, budgets/financial returns, ROI, planning, sizing)
Manage donation requests from local sports teams, charities, or schools
Live Topgolf’s Core Values: Fun, One Team, Excellence, Edgy Spirit and Caring
In-venue contact for marketing and event related activity, which may include after business hours, evening, and weekends. Hours and workdays may adjust where appropriate
What we're looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications or Public Relations
1-2 years’ experience in a Marketing role utilizing the following: Social media branding, Managing ROI and KPI metrics, marketing initiatives, managing local outreach marketing programs, developing, and managing local partnerships, managing relationships with charity and non-profit partners
Tangible dedication to providing a best-in-class hospitality experience to both internal and external guests
Ability to self-evaluate and consistently identify areas where knowledge or performance improvement can be identified and actioned
Friendly, positive, outgoing personality who relates well and gets along with people
Energy and enthusiasm
A high level of self-awareness, receptivity to change and integrity
In return we offer:
Competitive salary
33 days leave (inclusive of bank holidays)
Flexible working hours
Continuous professional development in a fast-growing company
Food and Beverage discounts
Discounted use of Topgolf, extending to friends and family

0629530d5a1a3b04.title: Senior Social Media Manager - 12 month FTC
0629530d5a1a3b04.description:
Something Extraordinary Every Day™
As our Senior Social Media Manager you will play a pivotal role in our digital strategy across all 9 European Villages within The Bicester Village Shopping Collection.
This visible and exciting Social Media role will provide strategic alignment across all our Villages and assist in the development of all international and brand campaigns, while being responsible for our social channel structure and channel optimisation. Combining analytics, testing and expertise to provide guidance and best practice to all of the villages, you’ll need extensive experience in social media strategy and operations on an international scale.
This Senior Social Media Manager role is offered on a Fixed Term Contract basis for a period of 12 months covering parental leave. We’re flexible as to where you are based, as long as you are happy to travel our offices in Bicester Village as well as our 8 other Villages within Europe.

There’s no one quite like us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection are the worlds’ leading luxury shopping destinations, and we are committed to creating magical and memorable experiences for our guests. Taking the name of the founding Village, The Bicester Village Shopping Collection distinguishes the 11 Villages in Europe and China as one collection of destinations for our guests, our brand partners, our travel and tourism partners, our corporate and financial media, and our internal teams.

What makes you special
Every colleague is an entrepreneur at heart and this drives our organisational culture, which values invention, innovation and risk taking. To be successful with us as our Senior Social Media Manager, you’ll have:
Extensive experience as a Social Media Manager/Strategist, with international responsibility
Expert knowledge of social media platforms and different types of media
Experience of creating, implementing and developing Social Media strategies that have led to revenue growth and engagement of a diverse customer profile
A strong retail background with franchise experience, ideally with international reach
Fluency in English (verbal and written) essential; any other European language skills useful
Experience of developing a clear brief and working collaboratively across multiple stakeholders and departments to ensure a successful result
Demonstrable experience of content management and development of innovation around new content
Ideally, an understanding of luxury fashion/retail/lifestyle

Why we’re exceptional
The key to our success is the quality and commitment of our people. To work in one of the teams at any of the Villages is to play an active role in redefining both the art and the science of retail. This creates a dynamic approach that underpins our ability to anticipate future trends in a fast changing world. In return for your Authenticity, Critical Thinking, Innovation, Passion and Vision, you’ll receive a generous salary and we’ll also reward you by:

Looking after you: You’re entitled to 25 days of annual leave (plus UK Bank Holidays) and your birthday off, plus extra leave if you are getting married or moving. We provide above industry average life assurance cover, income protection, pension, personal travel insurance, dental and eyecare, private healthcare, access to a virtual GP app, Employee Assistance Programme, cycle to work scheme and flu vaccinations
Treating you: discounts throughout our villages, discounts with other retailers (known as My Choices) and a very generous employee referral bonus
Championing you: you’ll be working within a creative and collaborative environment like no other, with the opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills while advancing your career.

Come and live your story with us
The Bicester Village Shopping Collection is made up of 1,200 colleagues of 50 nationalities. We are diverse in background, age, experience and leadership style. We believe that an inclusive workforce makes magic happen, and with this in mind we welcome everyone - regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability or ethnicity - to be a part of our family.

8e84ff66a0e74397.title: Social Media Manager
8e84ff66a0e74397.description:
Social Media Manager
As our Social Media Manager you will be responsible for increasing Sennheiser Brand awareness and drive conversion sales of Sennheiser Business Communication products by deploying content and maintaining a premium brand presence through social media outlets. You will be responsible for also creating and maintaining an editorial calendar to ensure content and assets are being released on time, report on them and optimize based on results
You can be based anywhere in EMEA and work closely with Business Communication Marketing Communications and Information Technology

What do we offer?
a great multinational and multicultural work environment
diverse tasks and independent work
a modern and varied work environment in a family owned German company
personal and professional development opportunities
the option of flexible/ mobile work for a good work-life balance
In your new role, your task and responsibilities will be to:
deploy content and maintain a premium brand presence on Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, IGTV, Snapchat, Tumblr, Reddit and others.
collaborate with the Business Communication Marketing Team to provide content for marketing initiatives, events, exhibitions, etc.
deploy social media retargeting & advertising campaigns that are focused on achieving target KPIs
provide monthly KPI reports to management.
create an editorial calendar to ensure content and assets are being released on time, report on them and optimize based on results
support brand loyalty and encourage generation of user generated content via active community participation and conversation; manage online discussions by listening and responding to users (where appropriate) in a timely and authentic manner. Escalate issues as needed and provide feedback on community happenings.
monitor and track discussion topics regarding Business Communication products for management team; prepare weekly reports to update staff on predetermined metrics. Proactively monitor brand and relevant themes/news stories within the blogosphere and provide suggestions for timely content, assets and conversation within brand communities.
work daily with internal teams and stakeholders to ensure consistent execution of Business Communication marketing messages
update Business Communication editorial calendar and ensure all assets/materials are timely and up to date.
use online listening tools, supplemental research and daily community learnings to provide insights for improving programs and enhancing program successes.
research and identify bloggers/key influencers and associated community for blogger/influencer campaigns.
research and identify social media best practices and relevant brand examples within the space for proposals and online audits.
pro-actively researches new trends in social media marketing and share findings with internal teams.
encourage Contacts to be active in promoting Sennheiser in their own platforms
work cross functionally with social media managers in other divisions and outsourced freelancers to schedule posts accordingly.
represent Business Communication marketing interests at interdepartmental meetings, trade shows and events
Other duties may be assigned based on changing business environment and priorities.

We are looking for you if you:
have university degree in marketing, journalism or related discipline
have 2-3 years social media marketing experience on relevant platforms – Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat, other
are familiar with Sprout social platform
are fluent in English language, have excellent written and verbal communication, and excellent interpersonal and presentation skills,
have Digital Marketing experience and content curation, creation and editing skills.
have Adobe Photoshop editing skills
have verifiable examples of social media wins
have verifiable examples of integrated digital media campaign wins
have ability to multi-task effectively,
have creative and flexible approach to problem solving,
have proven record of working in a team

4df352765be56744.title: PR and Social Media Executive
4df352765be56744.description:
Reporting into the PR & Social Media Manager, you will play a crucial role in delivering our communications strategy across the Mountain Warehouse portfolio (including Animal and some exciting new brand launches for 2022). You will be working on the development of new press offices, as well as growing and deepening media relations for our long-established and thriving businesses. You will be an integral part of our rapidly expanding team, working not only on the UK market, but in growth areas such as Canada, US, Europe, Australia and beyond.

What you’ll be doing

Working closely with the PR Manager to execute PR and social media campaigns successfully
Pitching stories and new products to media
Writing key PR materials including: press releases, blog content, media alerts and event documents
Building relationships with key journalists, bloggers, and influencers
Managing several busy press offices, and handling reactive enquiries
Managing the brand’s charity inbox
Attending meetings with key internal stakeholders such as Buying teams and other marketing channels
Staying on top of key trends, viral news, and PR opportunities and sharing with senior team members
Arranging product orders for VIP gifting, stylists, and journalist requests
Tracking orders and coverage, and helping with reporting where necessary
Developing social media schedules and planning creative content ideas
Working closely with the graphics teams to create artwork briefs
Working closely with celebrity agents and brand ambassadors, helping secure paid and gifted influencer opportunities
Brainstorming and developing creative PR story ideas

We’d love to meet someone …

Who likes to read magazines and papers, perhaps watches YouTube, and will know the latest viral trends
Who is incredibly organised and might be the go-to event planner in their friendship/family group
With two years’ previous experience in a PR role. Agency experience desirable
With a passion for PR, and a little black book of journalists
Who has experience in creative/content writing and pitching stories to media
With a love for social media and an eye for imaginative content – scrolling addicts welcome!
Who has grammatical proficiency and excellent communication skills
An enthusiastic and proactive attitude

What’s in it for you?

Competitive salary and benefits package
Holiday allowance
50% staff discount & 25% for family and friends
Pension scheme

In 1997, we launched Mountain Warehouse to make the outdoors accessible to everyone by offering value for money product and exemplary customer service.
The outdoor industry had become very jargon heavy and we wanted to create a brand that would cater to our mothers and our neighbour’s kids as well as seasoned professionals who understood the technology.
Our expansion since then has seen the brand grow and the product evolve, but the small family business that makes MW special has remained. Great product is at the heart of everything we do.
As we expand internationally we employ a team of dedicated diverse people to offer our valued customers the best possible experience when visiting our stores, shopping online and putting our range through its paces.
Welcome to our journey.

58d1077c571d017d.title: Social Media Manager
58d1077c571d017d.description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic, self-starter to build our brands and grow the Pride of Britain family through engaging social media content and campaigns. Working within the National Events team, who are responsible for producing large-scale events and campaigns. Our events include; The Pride of Britain Awards, which is televised on ITV each year, The People’s Pet Awards and Pride of Sport. We are a small, dynamic team who work hard to honour our incredible unsung heroes by sharing their stories and achievements.
The role will be managing the social media campaigns for each of our event brands, with Pride of Britain being our flagship. It is an exciting role, for someone with creative ideas and excellent organisational skills and a passion for social media.
So, who are we?
We are Reach plc, you might not have heard of us but we have probably met without you even realising it. We are home to the UK and Ireland’s most iconic digital platforms, magazines and newspapers. From the Mirror, Daily Express and OK!, to our regional titles such as the Liverpool Echo, BirminghamLive and the Manchester Evening News (plus lots more), our brands and the stories we cover are as varied as our people. We help all kinds of people share experiences through our stories because we believe this is what makes us human. Oh, and we should probably also mention that with a monthly readership of 47 million people, Reach is the largest commercial publisher in the UK. At Reach, not only will you feel better understood, you will also feel you understand other people better too.

Key Responsibilities
Come up with creative new ways to drive traffic to social channels and websites, growing our audiences
Implementing and overseeing social media strategy to align with event campaigns
Generating, editing and sharing engaging content on all social media channels
Forward plan social media content and coverage
Cover our live events across all social platforms
Interview winners and celebrities on the red carpet
Monitor the competitive landscape to identify trends - and communicate findings
Report and evaluate the success of individual posts and overall engagement to continually improve our social offering and attract new audience
Manage responses via social media channels and email
Manage approvals and timelines for content created for our sponsor partners, working with internal and external teams
The Ideal Candidate
Will have a passion for social media and our brands
Will have a good knowledge of Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tik Tok, Pinterest and other social media platforms. Full training will be given to right candidate
Will have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Will be confident in dealing with all people, in particular our winners who may need a sensitive approach
Will have great attention to detail
Will have a good understanding of the English language and will be able to independently publish accurate social media posts
Will have a good knowledge of Office programs
Must be a supportive team player
The role involves occasional evening and weekend work
Package Description
What can we offer you?
We are offering a competitive salary and benefits including;
Help saving for your retirement - join our pension scheme and we’ll match contributions up to 6%
25 days’ holiday per year when you join. After three, five and ten years’ service with Reach, you’ll accrue one additional day of annual leave. We also have a Holiday Purchase Scheme
Giving back day- an additional day’s leave each year to support a cause close to your heart
Enhanced family leave- including maternity, paternity and adoption - and you’ll be eligible after just six months’ employment
Private Healthcare Cash Plan - free health cash plan so you can claim back cash for a range of medical expenses
As one of the UK’s top 50 Inclusive Employers everyone’s invited to join our events, programmes and networks to celebrate diversity and build an environment where all our people can thrive
Wellbeing support - including a 24/7 assistance programme for you and your nearest and dearest, a free subscription to mindfulness app Headspace and access to free mental health coaching through Sanctus
Awesome career opportunities - you’ll have support from your line manager and a range of learning & development programmes
We are a FTSE 250 Company, and also a member of the 30% Club, a global campaign aimed at increasing gender diversity at board and senior management levels.
Reach plc believes diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why we are committed to being an inclusive employer and encourage applications from all suitable applicants irrespective of background, circumstances, age, disability, gender identity, ethnicity, religion or belief and sexual orientation.

5e030789c47a97e4.title: Marketing Manager
5e030789c47a97e4.description:
You will be one of a team of marketing experts working on our factual television channel brands in the UK, which include National Geographic and National Geographic Wild. You will be focused on developing and implementing UK marketing strategies and ‘best in class’ campaigns that drive awareness, affinity, and tune-in to our key monetised platforms.

You will be responsible for delivering insights-driven paid and owned media campaigns across the media mix, working closely with key stakeholders internally and externally including insights, programming, creative & production, digital & social, and owned media teams, as well as our media agency. You will also lead the relationships with our affiliate contacts at Sky, NOW, Virgin Media, and TalkTalk, and other partners including media owners.

The role will require strong leadership, strategic and creative capabilities, and excellent communication and relationship building skills to achieve our core business objectives.

You will report directly to the Senior Marketing Manager and work closely with the Marketing Director, EMEA Marketing Manager and Digital & Social Marketing Manager. You will also line manage two direct reports, the Marketing Supervisor and Marketing Intern.

Responsibilities :

Support the Marketing Director and Senior Marketing Manager in developing the annual UK marketing strategy for our factual channel brands, including defining campaign priority levels based on their ability to drive ratings, deliver audiences, and build the National Geographic brand.
Project manage all top priority UK brand and content marketing campaigns from briefing through to implementation, optimisation and post-campaign analysis.
Collaborate with our media agency to create insights-driven and audience-first paid media campaigns across the media mix, including TV & BVOD, key digital and social platform partners and media partnerships.
Curate engaging creative and media briefs and run regular briefing sessions with creative & production teams and our media agency.
Develop relationships with key media owners including Sky, Facebook, YouTube and programmatic digital partners, among others.
Lead the relationship with our UK affiliate platform contacts at Sky, NOW, Virgin Media and TalkTalk.
Pitch National Geographic and National Geographic Wild content priorities for inclusion in affiliate marketing and merchandising campaigns and identify opportunities to align our content with their priorities.
Work with prize agencies to develop co-branded customer reward incentives including competitions, prize packages and money-can’t-buy experiences.
Represent National Geographic in monthly affiliate catch-ups and present in quarterly pitch meetings.
Work with the insights team to decipher performance and audience insights and trends, ensuring that key learnings are reflected in media briefs and plans and communicated to relevant stakeholders.
Provide full post-campaign analyses and identify go-forward recommendations for future campaigns.
Collaborate with the brand & franchise team to support the definition and alignment of strategic marketing plans and broader National Geographic brand initiatives such as Earth Day.

Basic Qualifications :

Proven experience at a Marketing Manager level or ready to promote to this level
Strategic marketing experience including media planning across the media mix, and briefing, deploying, optimising and reporting on paid media campaigns
An understanding of key digital and social platforms
Experience managing media agencies and creative & production teams
Budget management
Stakeholder management and relationship building
A team player – positive and proactive
A passion for marketing, media and entertainment

008cc469e2c32c25.title: Social Media Manager
008cc469e2c32c25.description:
Salary: Up to £50k depending on experience plus bonus + benefits
Job Type: Permanent
Job Contact: 0131 245 1000
Closing Date: Wednesday 16th March 2022
At Phoenix Group we’re passionate about helping people achieve a more secure and sustainable future. With circa 14 million policies, we make a difference to the lives of millions of people as the UK’s largest long-term savings and retirement business. Join us now and you’ll grow with us as we build on our success.
We support hybrid and flexible ways of working and would welcome discussion on how we can enable you to thrive in your role. There may be a requirement to meet, engage and collaborate with team members or stakeholders at our offices for business purposes at particular times which would be discussed with you.
We’re committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creative and inclusive and flexible culture – one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our customers and clients.

Standard Life is part of the Phoenix Group Open Division and has ambitious plans to grow in the next few years. Serving 4 million Pension and Retirement customers across Workplace, Retail and Adviser channels. Digital will be a fundamental element to support these ambitions and we are looking to build a team of highly skilled professionals to help us achieve these ambitions and increase customer awareness, build engagement and support commercial success. This is an amazing time and fantastic opportunity to join a business that is transforming for the future and focusing on supporting its customers’ needs.
The role is responsible for the Standard Life social media presence across all customer channels using Linkedin, Twitter and Facebook as primary channels. The Social Media Manager owns both the creation and implementation of the social media strategy, primarily growing our online community via delivery of frequent engagement.
Key Responsibilities


Maximise Standard Life brand exposure to customers via LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.
Support with the development and implementation of the Corporate Social Media Strategy.
Work closely with internal stakeholders and agencies to optimise ongoing paid campaigns aimed at growing our online following and increase engagement/reach across our networks.
Engage with key stakeholders to gain buy-in and support delivery of the strategy
Create, oversee and co-ordinate the creation of new social media content and tone of voice, providing consistent messaging across our networks.
Identify opportunities to create content to gain coverage and extensive reach for Standard Life and wider Group initiatives.
Work closely with the marketing team and internal stakeholders to ensure consistency of message and tone, along with the amplification of key brand attributes.
Work with internal and external stakeholders to agree appropriate activity to support strategy, brand and the Group’s overall purpose.
Design relevant KPI tracking and oversee the delivery of MI reporting.
Promote good customer outcomes and brand positioning.
Support the Senior Digital Marketing Manager with the creation of an up-to-date Social Media Strategy, ensuring alignment with wider activity.

What We’re Looking For
 Essential
Experience within a similar role required
Ability to analyse data to continuously improve brand awareness and consideration.
Identify opportunities to create content to gain coverage and extensive reach for Standard Life and Group initiatives.
The brand positioning must always support and deliver good customer outcomes.
Accountability for managing budgets and multiple agency relationships, reporting back on results and recommendations.
Understanding of regulation and guidance notes surrounding digital content and social media feeds.

Desirable

UK Chartered institute of marketing qualification
Experience of working in the life and pensions / financial services industry

What We Offer


Bring your ‘whole self’, skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we’ll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We’ll ensure you’re rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.


Join us and you join a unique organisation. It’s not just the 14 million policyholders we serve, or the £300 billion of assets we look after. Or that we’re a FTSE 100 company that has been listed as one of the UK's Top Employers for nine years running. It’s our talented, inclusive and diverse workforce that makes us a success. Find out about more about our people’s stories, our values and our commitment to diversity

Key Competencies


Customers at the Heart
Communication skills
Delivering Results
Planning and Organising
Working across Boundaries
Impact and influence
Interviews and Onboarding


As we begin to open up our office doors and move into our hybrid way of working our interviews can be held either remotely or in one of our office locations. You will be told in advance how and where this will take place. All of our Onboarding is managed remotely with the exception in obtaining your right to work documents. If you are successful in the role we will require you to visit your new office ahead of joining with us. This will be managed and organised by the hiring manager or nominated person.

We have in place a strong virtual support network to ensure new colleagues are supported and developed as they navigate their first few months with us


About Us


Phoenix Group is a member of the FTSE 100 index and is the UK’s largest long-term savings and retirement business. We specialise in the acquisition and management of Heritage life insurance and pension funds. We’ve businesses in the UK, Germany and Ireland and hold a broad range of both Heritage and Open products split across three key business segments: UK Heritage, UK Open and Europe. Our open business manufactures and underwrites new products and policies to support people saving for their future in areas such as workplace pensions and SIPPs, primary under the Standard Life brand. And we market corporate pension trustee services and manufacture products to be sold under other brands. Did you know Phoenix Life manufactures SunLife’s market leading Guaranteed Over 50’s plan? Find out more about Phoenix Group here.

We value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone.

37e01fb26b9183aa.title: Global social media & content manager
37e01fb26b9183aa.description:
Job Title:
Global social media & content manager
Job Description:
Role Overview
The world is changing fast and so is dentsu – not only to match the external pace, but also to be a force for growth and good for the brands we partner with, the people we interact with, and planet we live on.
We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about.
So, whether you are joining dentsu for the first time, or part of the group but looking to move to a different part of the business, we welcome you to apply and will work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.
Background
The global digital and brand team are looking for a tech savvy and audience oriented social media and content manager to help us support the group strategy by growing the dentsu brand visibility and positive sentiment online by delivering purposeful, engaging, and impactful digital experiences for our audiences across our channels.
Role Purpose
The person will take ultimate responsibility for the social media accounts, dentsu.com website, and content created for them by working with a variety of different stakeholders from around the globe.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Take-over and lead the social media and website content strategy for the global dentsu brand.
Proactively support, advise, and coach internal stakeholders on content and campaign creation to get the most out of dentsu’s digital channels, ensuring brand consistency and best-in-class execution of their efforts.
Facilitate the editorial process and curation/sourcing of content from a matrix structure of different functions, service lines, and regions.
Measurement and reporting of all digital marketing campaigns and assesses performance against goals (in many instances, you will be advising the stakeholders on the best digital KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) to measure and targets to set).
Events planning and activation – promotion and coverage of offline and online events (Cannes Lions, DMEXCO, Adweek, Adobe MAX etc)
Managing relationships with marketing technology and service providers and global media partners.
Key Requirements:
Previous experience in a social media management/digital marketing/campaign management/corporate communications role.
Previous experience in planning and producing engaging branded social media and web content and campaigns.
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders with differing degrees of digital competency and supporting them in achieving their communication objectives.
Experience in working with social and web MarTech platforms such as CMSs (Content Management System), Social Media Management platforms, and analytics and reporting tools.
Excellent written English communication and presentation skills.
`Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Strong marketing foundational knowledge.
About dentsu international
Part of dentsu, dentsu international headquartered in London operates in over 145 markets worldwide with more than 48,000 dedicated specialists. We help clients to win, keep and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses. With best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. www.dentsu.com
Working with us
Joining dentsu international, you’ll join a team of 48,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, memorable experiences and opportunities to shape your future.
Inclusion and Diversity
We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about. So, whether you’re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.
We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.
Location:
London
Brand:
Global Functions
Time Type:
Full time
Contract Type:
Permanent

a30666108074c206.title: Content Manager
a30666108074c206.description: Who we are: We are Vet-AI, and we are delivering the pet care of the future. Our flagship app, Joii Pet Care was created to make pet care affordable and accessible for all pet owners. Through Joii, pet mums and dads can video call a vet 24/7, use an intelligent pet symptom checker (think NHS 111 but for pets), or seek preventative care through nurse clinics. And yes - it can all be done from the comfort of home - drastically reducing the need for in-person vet trips.Our mission: To make pet care affordable and accessible for everyone.To improve the lives and wellbeing of everyone working within the veterinary industry.Quite simply, we want vet care to be available to everyone, and to ensure the people who are delivering it with us are as happy as they can be. We’re called Joii, after all.Role Summary: Do you want to step into a content role with purpose? Vet-AI, the company behind Joii Pet Care, is looking for a talented Content Manager to own all things content in our growing creative team. This is a full-time role based remotely (we are and have always been remote-first).You’ll combine your expertise in copy with your talent for content to deliver a bold, creative and powerful engagement strategy to our growing base of 150,000+ pet owners.You should be curious and renowned for pushing content boundaries. You’ll bring your experience of owning and delivering end-to-end creative content campaigns to Joii, and help us define ourselves in this industry. Excellent copywriting is a must have skill for this role, as is attention to detail (show us you’re paying attention now and include your favourite type of animal in your cover letter).You should have a portfolio that you’re proud of that demonstrates both creative thinking and the delivery of effective and innovative content campaigns. You’ll have excellent communication and presentation skills, and the ability to project manage and deliver against deadlines.Culture is super important to us, so you will need to maintain close relationships with the wider marketing and tech teams, and be an all-round team player.What you’ll do: Own the Joii Pet Care content strategy, across in-app messaging, push notifications, email, social, web, video and everything in between.Deliver engaging content that will help bring wider marketing campaigns to life, from copy through to visuals (we have an in-house designer that can support you here);Generate ideas that redefine how we use copy to engage with pet parents, pushing the boundaries to surprise and delight every single user;Conduct brainstorming sessions with the internal teams, maintaining strategic and creative thinking to develop innovative and actionable content plans to align with OKRs;Collaborate cross-functionally on the development and execution of campaigns, marketing plans, and business initiatives;A/B test, monitor and analyse the outcomes of content campaigns to deliver ongoing optimisation;Own our new tone of voice and help Joii be the bold household pet name it is striving to be;Take initiative and not be afraid to roll up your sleeves and be part of a fast-paced, scaling startup.On any day you could be working on a different project. You could be creating witty copy for the Joii symptom checker, shooting a video of vets for an email campaign, curating a push notification just for Border Collies, delivering a social media giveaway…wherever there is content that needs to shine, you’ll roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.The success of this role will be measured in line with the overarching business OKRs on customer engagement.Who you are: You’re an experienced copywriter, with a track record in delivering copy for B2C campaigns, and a portfolio that speaks for itself;You have experience in a comparable content/copy role, working with innovative brands that aren’t afraid to make a change;You have previous experience of leading and delivering on content, from content strategy through to execution;You’ll need to have a great work ethic and be a creative, expressive and supportive member of the Vet-AI team;You’re naturally creative, and feel excited to act as a source of creative inspiration for the team, department and the business as a whole;You have a knack for design and feel confident delivering creative visuals to enhance your campaigns;You are commercially focussed with an understanding of the role copy plays in achieving business goals.While this role does not have any direct reports, there will be room to step up as the marketing team grows.What you’ll get: We’re a startup transitioning to a scale-up, so if you like a slow pace we’re not the company for you. However, if you do like a supportive team, a fun culture, and the feeling of creating incredible work - you’ll fit right in! Some of the perks you’ll get with us are:33 days of paid holiday including the usual UK public holidays;Remote working - work from a location that you thrive from, with flexible hours. We will trust you to get the job done and don’t believe in outdated working conditions.A PerkBox membership with discounts on gym memberships, food, counselling and more.A work laptop to get the job done, plus some extras to help deck out your home working space;Social gatherings with the team - we work hard but value the fun side of life too!Regular Lunch & Learn sessions (last month our Chief Data Scientist taught us all basic physics!)Access to our newly launching career development scheme, where you’ll get £500 to put towards initiatives for your career (whether it’s training courses or tickets to conferences is totally up to you).Trust to do your job. We want to encourage everyone in the team to do their best. We also don’t believe in egos, and will never take credit for your work. Instead, we believe in mutual respect, collaboration, and empowerment.Want to apply?Send over a cover letter and resume showing us what makes you the perfect fit for Joii (and us the perfect fit for you). Please include examples of past creative campaigns that you’ve delivered in your career so far that you are proud of. We want to get to know you!Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can't wait to hear from you.Diversity and InclusionWe’re building an inclusive and diverse team. We truly believe that surrounding ourselves with different opinions means that we’ll challenge our own assumptions instead of thinking we know the correct answer. We welcome applications from everyone and will foster an encouraging and caring workplace. If you aren’t sure if you qualify, send us your CV anyway. We’ll take the time to look over your application and give you feedback.Reference ID: Content ManagerJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £35,000.00-£45,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company pensionEmployee discountStore discountsWellness programmesWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayNo weekendsApplication question(s):What is your salary expectations for this role?Work remotely:Yes

c6b38870e01b0fd5.description:

£250-280 PER DAY
IRELAND/UK/REMOTE
Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? Then this role as a contract Social Media Community Manager in an industry-leading company could be for you!

As a community manager, you'll be working for two to six with a leading business to help manage their social media accounts and drive performance.

As a community manager, you can expect to be deeply involved in all things social media, diving into the project and taking a hands-on role.

eb3a979d7f17f32e.title: Social Media Marketeer
eb3a979d7f17f32e.description:
Join a high-growth and rapidly scaling business
Great Company Culture, Bonus Paid and Share Options Available*
Performance Marketing Role - PPC (Google Ads, Google Tag Manager) & Paid Social
Forward thinking business, connecting students with incredible opportunities
Liverpool St London HQ - Hybrid/ Flexible Working
Salary: £45,000-£55,000.00 depending on experience (+ 5% bonus paid annually)
B2C Performance Marketing Manger

The Company: Our client helps 250+ companies such as KPMG and Goldman Sachs, to attract and assist the next generations employment opportunities, giving access to an exclusive and diverse pool of candidates.
The Role: The performance Marketing Manager will report to the Marketing Director and be responsible for scaling the UK B2C Marketing function. Key success factors are:
Improve conversion rate optimisation
Decrease cost per acquisition
Optimising user journey
Scale commercial revenue of direct-to-consumer business in the UK

The company have an existing marketing team based in London, but that team's focus is on growing the amount of students that sign up to their platform. This role will however work closely with Product/Tech/Dev teams to support website changes and product direction based on consumer activity.
This role is a senior position within the organisation but needs someone to be both strategic in their approach as well as having the ability and desire to get their hands dirty in the day-to-day tactics. This role will not use agencies for performance marketing support and will require the successful candidate to use all paid channels themselves.
This role therefore requires an expert knowledge of performance marketing channels including the google suite (Google AdWords, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics). You will know how to increase conversion rate through great ads and you will enjoy testing content on landing pages.
The successful candidate will be a commercially savvy marketer with creative flair, but who first and foremost has a data-driven, analytical style of marketing. The company are fast-growing, innovative and entrepreneurial. They are looking for a motivated, talented and successful digital marketer to join their business.
Responsibilities for the position of Performance Marketer:
Owning the UK marketing strategy for the direct-to-consumer business
Auditing the existing marketing activity
Creating a marketing strategy to increase the volume of traffic to site, improve stickiness and conversion rate of traffic
Analysing campaigns and spend and decrease cost per acquisition
Running A/B Testis of landing pages and website content to improve results
Taking ownership of the UK Google Ads strategy and supporting field marketing teams
Driving traffic to the website by executing the digital marketing strategy (SEO, PPC, Paid Media, Display, social media and email automation)
Analysing the website traffic and improving UX and customer journey onsite - google analytics
To be considered for the role of Performance Marketer you must have:
B2C/D2C digital marketing experience
Have worked in a stand-alone or small marketing function and helped scale businesses through innovative performance marketing tactics
A desire to lead and grow a marketing function
UK market experience
A desire to succeed and build something from scratch and the ability to go 'above and beyond' to achieve your goals
Benefits:
The opportunity to join a high-growth and rapidly scaling business (recently secured £3.5 million in funding).
A flat & transparent structure with a values-driven & collaborative culture.
Unlimited holiday & flexible/remote working.
Open plan Liverpool Street office, with snacks, beer tap & team drinks on Fridays.
Share options after 1 years' service.
Regular team socials and the annual full team off-site.
Location: The position of Performance Marketer will be based in Central London with flexible working options.

b45427106ac79157.description:
Permanent
40 Hours
Salary
Excellent
Country
U.K
What you will be doing...
Reporting to the Social Media Manager, the Social Media Executive (Recruitment) is an exciting role in the fast growing, high profile social media team. The Social Media Executive (Recruitment) will be responsible for Jet2Careers’ social media and online accounts, providing dedicated and effective support of the company’s recruitment campaigns, promoting our customer helping ethos and telling the Jet2.com and Jet2holidays story to become an employer of choice.

Key responsibilities:
Monitor the recruitment team’s social media accounts and key online job board profiles ensuring all information is kept fresh, up-to-date, accurate and tailored appropriately for the audience.
Work closely with the recruitment team to proactively develop creative content plans showcasing company values and personality and driving demand for current vacancies.
Proactively develop creative assets (video / photography) ensuring they are aligned with our brand guidelines.
Schedule all content and adverts, making sure it is accurate and within agreed timescales and any costs are agreed in advance.
Respond to all comments and public / private messages ensuring a 100% response rate SLA and escalating issues where necessary.
Monitor key recruitment / employment forums (i.e. Glassdoor) and develop a plan for promoting us as an employer of choice.
Support on the delivery of key recruitment campaigns.
Attend key recruitment / HR events and roadshows.
Work closely with the brand social team to amplify relevant activity across recruitment channels.
With direction from the recruitment team work with relevant departments across the business to help support on their recruitment drives.
Work closely with the PPC and digital teams to develop strategic advertising plans.
Ensure all social media campaigns are appropriately tagged to allow for accurate reporting on campaign success.
Investigate opportunities for growth across other social media channels.
Responsible for monitoring engagement, sentiment, volume of / responses to comments, social advertising spend and produce monthly performance reports.
Analyse results to develop future content.
Any other duties as required.
Ideally with proven social media and communications experience, you should have a strong work ethic and commercial flair plus a proactive, creative outlook. You should also have sound technical knowledge and the ability to work to tight project deadlines within a fast-paced team.

Key skills / experience
Experience and successful track record of creative content and campaign planning.
Strong social media and communication skills.
Proficient in the use of all social media channels including LinkedIn and forums.
Self-starter with confidence to work on own initiative and liaise with key stakeholders in the business.
Recruitment experience ideal but not essential.
Spanish speaker desirable but not essential.
In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting, forward-thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 10 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!
