3e89cbba87efe225.title: Social Media Manager
3e89cbba87efe225.description:
Social Media Manager

My client, a large, market leading and nationally recognised financial services business is looking for a Social Media Manager to join their Digital Team and they embark on another exciting period of transformation.

The Social Media Manager will be responsible for social media presence across all customer channels using Linkedin, Twitter and Facebook as primary channels. You will also own both the creation and implementation of the social media strategy, primarily growing our online community via delivery of frequent engagement.

This is a full time, permanent role paying a salary of £45,000 - £55,000 plus a marketing leading benefits package including; a generous bonus scheme, 30 days holiday, private healthcare and a 10% non-contributory pension to name a few.

My client will offer a hybrid approach to work long term, with lots of scope to work remotely although you need to be within a commutable distance of either their Edinburgh or Central London offices.

Key Responsibilities:
Maximise brand exposure to customers via LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.
Support with the development and implementation of the Corporate Social Media Strategy.
Work closely with internal stakeholders and agencies to optimise ongoing paid campaigns aimed at growing our online following and increase engagement/reach across networks.
Engage with key stakeholders to gain buy-in and support delivery of the strategy
Create, oversee and co-ordinate the creation of new social media content and tone of voice, providing consistent messaging across our networks.
Identify opportunities to create content to gain coverage and extensive reach
Work closely with the marketing team and internal stakeholders to ensure consistency of message and tone, along with the amplification of key brand attributes.
Work with internal and external stakeholders to agree appropriate activity to support strategy, brand and overall purpose.
Design relevant KPI tracking and oversee the delivery of MI reporting.
Promote good customer outcomes and brand positioning.
Support the Senior Digital Marketing Manager with the creation of an up-to-date Social Media Strategy, ensuring alignment with wider activity.

Experience Required:
Experience within a similar Social Media Manager or Executive role
Ability to analyse data to continuously improve brand awareness and consideration.
Ability to identify opportunities to create content to gain coverage and extensive reach
Can ensure that brand positioning must always support and deliver good customer outcomes.
Understanding of regulation and guidance notes surrounding digital content and social media feeds.
Please apply ASAP to be considered or email matthew.stone@modis.co.uk for more information.

Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. For all positions based in Switzerland, Modis Europe Ltd works with its licensed Swiss partner Accurity GmbH to ensure that candidate applications are handled in accordance with Swiss law.

Both Modis International Ltd and Modis Europe Ltd are Equal Opportunities Employers.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Modis International Ltd and/ or Modis Europe Ltd. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement which explains how we will use your information is available on the Modis website.

8fcc939c75ec6661.title: E-Commerce Manager
8fcc939c75ec6661.description: Purpose: Responsible for driving online sales with full ownership of the online customer journey and content management systems across multiple sales channels, including management of 6 Naissance websites, 6 eBay accounts, as well as other sales channels. You will employ best industry standards to deliver own strategy to meet business objectives.What we’re looking for: - Responsible for the tactical, daily execution and performance of the E-Commerce channels including 6 Naissance websites (Shopify), 6 eBay accounts & other channels.- Works closely with cross functional teams to drive traffic and deliver superior consumer shopping experience, optimising online stores including branding, design, navigation, assortment, site content, traffic generation and demand generation.- Formulates strategy for improvement and drives and implements UX and UI design change in our online stores, including developing new features and tools as well as enhancing functionality to increase conversion.- Identifies market and customer range gaps, customer challenges and provides creative and innovative solutions to convert to sales.- Assists in developing efficient and effective digital marketing strategy for search engine optimisation (SEO), and paid marketing (PPC) a laser focus on delivering measurable and positive ROI per marketplace.- Understands and continuously monitors brand and product performance, maximising the return on any brand and marketing investments in order to achieve targets.- Achieves budgeted sales and profit targets by developing plans based upon channel performance, sales analytics and competitive trends.- Identifies areas of strength/opportunity based upon business and web analytics.- Monitors and analyses competitor’s behaviour within the marketplace.- Responsible for web security and maintenance.- Provides sales and product forecasts in order to optimise stock cover and maximise sales opportunities.- Keeps up to date with industry updates, including new commercial opportunities.- Contributes to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed.Who we’re looking for: - Demonstrated success delivering an efficient customer journey strategy to increase conversion.- 3-5 years’ experience within the ecommerce landscape managing various channels, including Shopify and eBay.- Analytical horsepower focused on creating, analysing and activating key insights.- Good understanding of Google Analytics, Google Ads, social media & web platforms.- Outstanding understanding of the shopper and the customer journey.- Curious mindset into how shopper’s needs and behaviours are evolving and the ability to apply insight to drive change.- Self-starter and proactive, enthusiastic, and self-motivated with a passion for achievement and the drive to make things happen.- An effective communicator who can build trusting relationships internally/externally and influence multiple stakeholders.- Able to demonstrate financial and commercial acumen.- Ability to contribute within a team environment.- Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functionally.- Understanding of P&L advantageous.- Can Do attitude.Reference ID: JD030Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From £40,000.00 per yearBenefits:Additional leaveEmployee discountFlexible scheduleLife insurancePrivate medical insuranceReferral programmeSick payStore discountsWellness programmesWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)Experience:E-commerce: 3 years (preferred)Work remotely:Yes

b551bfd8ecb4583a.title: Social Media Manager
b551bfd8ecb4583a.description:
We are recruiting for Social Media Manager to join the Marketing Team within Aviva.
Perhaps you remember our interrogation adverts or as sponsors of our home team, The Canaries (or Norwich City to the rest of us) or maybe you’re lucky enough to have a pension or insurance policy with us. We’ve been around for 325 years so we’re like that comfy chair in the country’s living room.
And it’s because of that we’re focussing on giving the people what they want in terms of brand campaigns that grab you by the ears and digital experiences smoother than Kenny G. So in 2021, Customer and Marketing was launched, bringing together customer insights, data, creative, digital and marketing teams to help our general insurance, savings and retirement, and health businesses transform how we do.
There’s huge amount of investment, Aviva aims to partner with each of our customers as we work towards a brighter future – illustrated by being the first major finance company to commit to net zero by 2040, 10 years ahead of the global target – for both us as a business and whomever we invest in.
We’re the sandwich board outside the store. We make customers and potential customers notice, connect and want to know more about what we do and where/how to find out more. Good social media helps us connect with our customers and prospects, to build relationships and trust by delivering relevant content to the right people at the right time, increase brand awareness and loyalty, build communities of advocates and boost discovery, leads, sales and relationships.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Daily channel management of the Aviva UK social media channels.
Quality control of all social media content.
Know our audience, our customers and build plans that deliver social content that they need and want.
Constantly evolve our presence on social by testing new features and ideas and scoping new channels.
Work collaboratively with SEO and content teams on agile campaigns to engage users and drive traffic to.co.uk Work with other teams across Aviva such as Marketing, Media Relations, Brand, Corporate Responsibility and Sponsorship, to plan social content that helps deliver their initiatives.
Push creative boundaries for social media to capture attention and deliver content of value to customers, whilst maintaining brand consistency and style (visual and tone of voice)
Work with influencers to reach new audiences, build positive sentiment, trust, and loyalty for the brand, with the aim of increasing purchase intent.
Monitor our metrics, create and develop benchmarks, and use this data to prove, improve and inform future campaigns.
Analyse and report performance data to the wider team and business.
Monitor competitor landscape and share insight with the team.
Supporting and helping to develop the social media consultants to learn and improve.
Manage day to day agency relationships, ensuring effective delivery and flag issues/additional requirements to social media lead.
Works closely with the social media response teams to manage risk and maintain visibility of content and processes.
Keeping up to date with social media platform capabilities, trends and changes, industry/non industry best practice in social media, and applies this to our plans.
Shouting about our success – pulling together the numbers to show how we’re smashing our targets and how campaigns delivered against their objective.
Skills & Experience required:
A senior social media manager with proven experience in developing social media strategies and delivering multi-platform campaign plans.
Forensic knowledge of social media metrics and KPI’s. Results and insight driven for commercial outcomes.
An instinctive know-how for what makes an engaging social media campaign and how to deliver.
An understanding of the role social media activity plays in the customer experience of the brand.
Understands working relationships between Social/SEO and performance content and is able to translate this into plans that deliver impact and results.
Know your stakeholders. Ability to work with and influence a broad range of colleagues at all levels of the business.
Is an ambassador for social media in Aviva and generates pride in the team.
What will you get for this role?
Competitive salary depending on skills, experience, and qualifications
Generous defined contribution pension scheme
Annual performance related bonus and pay review
Holiday allowance of 29 days plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days
Up to 40% discount for some Aviva products through “My Aviva Extras” plus discounts for Friends and Family. (Some exclusions apply)
Excellent range of flexible benefits to include a matching share save scheme
Working at Aviva
At Aviva, we’re people with a purpose. To be with you today, for a better tomorrow.
We bring this to life by ensuring managing risk is at the heart of the way we all work. We love people who do the right thing for our customers, and our colleagues. We want people who speak up, who take ownership, and who make good decisions.
The way we do this is important too, we’re all about our people – that’s you – so we can be pretty flexible. If you want to work from home some of the time or change your hours so you can pick up your kids or care for someone in your family, we’re very open to that. In fact, we don’t advertise roles as either part or full time, because we know each person has different needs, just as each business area has different needs. So, it’s up to you to discuss working hours during your interview.
We care deeply about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We want our employees to bring their whole self to work and that starts with you.
We interview every disabled applicant* that meets the minimum criteria for the job . Once you’ve applied, please send us a separate email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll make sure we interview you.
We’d love it if you could submit your application online . If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Alice Neal a call on 07393469953 or send an email to alice.neal@aviva.com .
*As defined in The Equality Act 2010 *. By ‘ minimum criteria’ we mean you should provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required and have the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential to perform the role.

78871169d279c7ae.title: SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER
78871169d279c7ae.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Help us transform a bell-weather of the UK high street into one of the most progressive & creative online businesses in any industry, anywhere. If, like us, you have the vision and bold ideas to help us realise this ambition, then we’d love for you to join our Marketing Team here at Debenhams.com. As the Social Media Manager for one of the UK’s most beloved and respected brands, we need your eye for detail, passion and inspiration to help us to stand-out from the crowd.

Job Requirements

Define the strategy and ongoing optimisation of Debenhams social media across all channels (Official and Beauty) in line with the wider marketing strategy to maximise follower acquisition and customer engagement
Underpinned strategy with clear and ambitious KPIs that measured performance and provide insight to inform activity
Develop the activity calendar for social media and share with senior stakeholders
Champion social media and ensure effective use within the wider marketing and communications strategy
Ideate and coordinate creation of social media content in line with campaigns priorities
Oversee visual content creation for social media channels including but not limited to dynamic video (reels, infeed and IGTV content) written and graphic content
Produce original content such as ‘behind the scenes’ assets and other social first deliverables
Work closely with the campaign team to create briefs for the in-house creative team in relations to the generation of social-led assets from existing imagery
Liaise with brands and suppliers to source relevant assets for use on social channels
Create reactive social content in relations to key events, social media trends, relevant celebrities and influencers that will resonate with our audience
Work with the PR and influencer team to create a programme of relevant and on-brand influencer content, this will include static and as well as LIVE and competition content
Actively champion new ideas and initiatives and engage with relevant stakeholders across the organisation to deliver these in an impactful manner
Maintain knowledge of new and emerging technologies and approaches to social media and review plans and strategy as a result of the changes and trends in the social sphere
Measure the performance and impact of social media activity, create weekly and monthly reports and communicate results to the wider business
Work closely with creative editorial team to manage TOV across social channels in line with the overarching brand approach
Protect the brand image by monitoring conversations across social media channels and implementing appropriate responses and proactive initiatives
Identify relevant commercial opportunities to monetise social media channels
Instil and grow a strong collaborative approach to social media marketing with relevant stakeholders - particularly trading, E-Commerce and creative teams
Support Debenhams’ partnership marketing function, helping to deliver media and campaign opportunities to third party brands and in so doing securing additional revenue
Manage and develop a team of 2 Social Media executives, ensure that the team work together effectively and have clear objectives
Some (but limited) weekend work is required
ABOUT THE CANDIDATE
Skills & Experience

Minimum of six years’ experience in social media with a track record of follower acquisition, and engagement improvement
Social media experience within fashion, luxury, beauty or lifestyle brands required
Deep understanding of social media landscape, various platforms and trends within social
Ability to work at both a strategic and operational level
Strong editing skills including reels and video app editing knowledge
Good copywriting skills
Experience in managing and coaching team members
Creative thinker who is passionate about developing new and engage social ideas
Collaborative attitude with the ability to develop strong working relationships with key business departments and 3rd party brands
Exceptional organisational and time-management abilities
Good IT skills including Microsoft Office package
Strong business acumen and goal-oriented approach

The exciting part:

We know that as a company we are only as good as the people that we employ. We know our employees work tirelessly to make boohoo the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

25 days holiday
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Company shares schemes - including a ' Save As You Earn' scheme
40% staff discount
Monthly social events (including pay day drinks, Employee Appreciation Day etc.)
Pension scheme
Flexible working hours
Cycle to work scheme
Health cash plan
The opportunity to work in a company that encourages engagement and growth!
