fd03f3e592dce9ca.title: Field Marketing Manager - Midwest
fd03f3e592dce9ca.description:
Red Bull are currently recruiting for a Field Marketing Manager to be responsible for growing sales and consumption of Red Bull through field marketing in the Midwest region.
You will spend your days working in locations and communities across your region, growing brand visibility, product availability, brand experiences and product consumption in key moments when people need energy. You and your team will increase product consideration through initiatives that grow trial, availability and visibility using Red Bull’s four key pillars of the field marketing mix (Consumer Collecting, Sports, Culture and Communications). This isn’t your average 9-5 office job as you will be out in the field ensuring Red Bull is relevant and present in the right places on any day of the week and at a time when people need energy.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Areas that play to your strengths
All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:
Expand all
Strategic Direction
Infuse global and national Red Bull priorities, strategies and the Red Bull philosophy in the field, focusing on building a local face of our global brand.
Understand the consumer in various fields across the region which forms the basis of local idea generation and execution.
Define ideas that build brand image and increase understanding of product functionality on a local level (working closely with National Marketing Teams).
Use trial and awareness, sales and regional intelligence to make strategic decisions, sharing market insights (consumer insights, competitors, etc.) with your team and the national team.
Work in conjunction with the regional sales team to build mental availability hand in hand with physical availability within image driving outlets, On Premise, Off Premise and new business environments. Ensuring the product is readily available in every field marketing activity.
Deliver the annual approved business plan for the region.
Implementation of Regional Marketing Plan
Create and support local key events, scenes and marketing opportunities in line with Red Bull brand values that are relevant to the local consumer and media landscape, with a focus on participation.
Ensure that every consumer experience with the brand is a positive one thanks to love for the detail and premium execution at events and all other field marketing activities.
Always have the “consumer” and “brand” eye in every single initiative and ensure we talk to the consumer in the most effective and efficient way with a strong focus on digital & social media, while ensuring that all the communication is in the correct brand tone of voice.
Ownership of high priority 3rd party events within the region. Adding value by determining the appropriate level of Red Bull brand support & visibility with the objective of increasing brand attribution and product usage in relevant scenes.
Own relationships with the key influencers of the region (local authorities, local sport and cultural opinion leaders relevant to our target, entrepreneurial and start-up communities, media outlets (TV, radio, print, digital and social media).
Marketing Innovation
Understand the latest generational trends by being close to our consumers and talking to our networks across multiple scenes.
Involve your team in idea generation for the field and capitalise on their personal/university lifestyle to identify technological, digital, and socially driven consumer trends early.
Create new and innovative ideas that bring the brand to life and captialise on new business opportunities. Tapping into local networks, scenes and opinion-leaders. Executing these ideas with the right balance between the 4 pillars of the field marketing mix, based on the knowledge and ownership of your region and the global and national priorities.
Ensure digital and social media sit at the heart of every field marketing activity.
Identify and selectively support cross-marketing opportunities (with sales, marketing & Red Bull Media House).
Organisational Capabilities and Enabling Structure
Act as a role model to your team and display the Red Bull values with a consistent tone of voice that is motivating and inspiring.
Source, hire, train and manage a diverse team of Field Marketing Specialist that perfectly fit the field scenes and brand.
Coach Field Marketing Specialist in sourcing, hiring and training their Student Marketeers.
Set regional objectives and clear goals with your Field Marketing Specialist to ensure accountability to their key deliverables and conduct on-going performance evaluations.
Provide on-going coaching and support to ensure Field Marketing Specialist achieve their deliverables.
Regularly assess and identify development needs of the Field Marketing Specialist working closely with the Head of Field to help make it happen.
Identify and nurture key talent giving them opportunities to live up to their potential.
Train the regional team (including sales) on necessary brand strategies and relevant execution guidelines.
Driving Efficiencies
Implement and uphold a logistical system for warehousing and infrastructure to ensure the right tools and management are in place to support the local needs, succeeding in premium appearance.
Creation and management of branded tools e.g., Event Vehicles, Event Equipment etc.
Develop and manage the regional budget with the support of the Head of Field and national specialists.
Constantly identify cost saving opportunities and other efficiencies for the company in the region.
Regularly review the environmental impact of the teams marketing activity working with the wider field marketing team to develop a year round plan and new initiatives to keep it to a minimum, ensuring we leave the playgrounds we operate in better than we found them.
Manage field expenses and general administration.
Build smart and mutually beneficial partnerships by working with other brands, organizations and networks that bring added value such as expertise, networks, goods, budget or facilities.

EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise
that matter most for this role:
Previous marketing experience preferably in brand/sports/culture and or field marketing.
Previous experience of line management with expertise in hiring, training, administration and motivating teams.
Ideally, experience in working with commercial teams – general sales or trade marketing.
Proven background in negotiation and management of budgets and strong leadership skills.
Driving license - essential
We value experience over formal qualifications
Fluent in written and spoken English
Travel 50%

323b5b5aa66b9726.title: Content Manager
323b5b5aa66b9726.description:
The University of London is one of the largest and most diverse higher education institutions in the world. It brings benefits to society through its research in the humanities, and connects enquiring minds across the world through public engagement – transcending geographic, social and cultural barriers.
The University of London educates more than 50,000 distance learners annually in 190 countries and has over 500,000 alumni across the globe. It pioneered the concept of ‘education for all’ when it was founded in 1836, and has continued to innovate ever since.
At its heart is collaboration: the University is a Federation of 17 elite London-based Member Institutions. From this exceptional foundation of knowledge, the University delivers globally-respected academic programmes through flexible and distance learning, changing the lives and prospects of hundreds of thousands of people.
The Strategic Communications and Marketing department have recently been brought together in order to support the delivery of the ambitious new corporate strategy. It has a specific purpose around raising awareness and building the reputation of both the central University, and the Federation more widely. This new role and the creation of this dedicated Content team plays a critical role in telling our story.
Content Manager role
The new postholder will be responsible for developing the brand tone of voice, writing/ editing engaging content for a variety of campaigns and collateral production (including print, web, video, and social media). Alongside their team of two Senior Content Officers, they will work closely with leading academics, marketing, communication and design teams to create concepts and develop messaging. This will include creating content that connects with our audiences, drives action and helps to promote our online degree programmes. There will be a variety of projects to tell our stories, developing corporate marketing, and communications materials that contribute to the University of London’s brand awareness activities.

For a full Person Specification please refer to the Job Description below.
Further Information
To be considered for this role, click the ‘Apply for job’ button below to submit your application and CV. Applications close midnight 25 March 2022.
First round interviews will be held on w/c 4 April 2022.
The University reserves the right to close the vacancy earlier than the published end date should it receive sufficient applications to warrant earlier shortlisting.
Preferential consideration will be given to the University redeployment pool.
The University of London is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive working environment where we can all be ourselves and succeed. We particularly encourage applications from members of Black, Asian, and Minority Ethnic communities as this group is currently under-represented in senior levels within the University. All appointments will be are made on merit, based on the criteria identified in the job description.
Pursuing excellence in education and equal opportunities.

27827a1c080f5dc0.title: Social Media Manager
27827a1c080f5dc0.description:
We are working with a leading developer looking to add to their ever-growing Sales and Marketing team with an experienced Social Media Manager. Reporting into the Head of Marketing, on offer is a basic salary of up to £45,000 DOE plus package.

You will be responsible for driving the social media strategy and increasing the online presence, enhancing enhance brand awareness, as well as producing campaigns and customer communications.

You will be based between head office in Sawbridgeworth, Hertfordshire, and spilt the rest of your time working from home and visiting sites across the South East.

Responsibilities include:

Driving the social media strategy
Growing the social media following
Driving engagement and building brand recognition
Working with the sales team to utilise socials to drive sales leads
Content creation and working with all areas of the business to identify content opportunities
Handling customer queries through social media and passing onto the relevant department for action
Represent the brand with the right tone and personality
Continuous review of the website and working with agencies to ensure UX and CRO are performing
Work with the Head of Marketing to plan and deliver lead generative marketing campaigns through social media, email and other appropriate digital channels
Agree and work towards digital and social media KPIs
Deliver regular reporting on performance of key KPIs
Track competitor and market activity
Stay on top of the latest digital and social trends

Requirements

Experience driving social media strategy, ideally in the property sector
Strong knowledge social platforms
Experienced in producing social media copy
Content creation and idea generation
UX and CRO experience
Knowledge of Google Analytics
Ability to work to deadlines
Organised
Proactive and self motivated
Experience in dealing with customer communications and directly communicating with customers on social media platforms
Valid UK Driving license

Reporting into the Head of Marketing, on offer is a basic salary of up to £45,000 DOE plus package.

497fcd2a72fe0a4c.title: Social Media Professional (12-Month FTC)
497fcd2a72fe0a4c.description:
Canon is looking for a passionate B2B Social Media Specialist (12-month maternity cover) who will be part of Corporate Communications, supporting our overall comms strategy. As a key member of the social media team, you’ll be part of a team responsible for developing and implementing the strategy for Canon’s presence on social media aimed at engaging new and existing audiences by demonstrating Canon’s imaging expertise and relevance.
What we give
With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.
Work closely with B2B business unit (BU) stakeholders, product management (PM) teams and the principle coordinating digital agency partners to develop social media plans that directly support business objectives around priority product launches and technology announcements.
Provide social media expertise in the planning and creation of campaigns; support the development, planning, execution and measurement of EMEA organic and paid social media strategies for B2B.
Assist with the development of social media editorial content calendars and to collaborate across the wider communications team to ensure content is repurposed through other Canon channels (external, events, blog, etc).
Manage the Canon EMEA corporate brand profile across the broad range of social platforms and centrally owned digital platforms like YouTube and our employee advocacy tools.
Provide Social and Digital media consultancy, counsel and mentoring to key business stakeholders, including educating the Business Unit and Product Manager community on effective process, practice, performance and employee advocacy.
Provide communications support to local markets communications teams and social media managers, including providing centrally created strategies, governance & assets; support the local deployment of central social media activities.
Strong understanding of organic and paid social media performance and social listening to provide data-based insights and reports to stakeholders.
Ability to identify and manage crisis communications in collaboration with (Corporate) PR department at headquarter level.
What we ask
Experience of content marketing; understanding of digital user journeys/target audiences; deploying content to create multiple touchpoints.
Understanding of how paid, owned and earned media co-exist & reinforce each other.
Ideally pan-EMEA Social Media experience including experience working with and managing all major social media platforms (LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Pinterest).
Experience with developing and deploying Editorial calendars and toolkits as well as working with Social Media Management tools (i.e. Social Studio, Sprout Social or similar, Employee advocacy tools).
Strong stakeholder management.
Capable of managing multiple projects at once, prioritising and staying calm under pressure.
Self-motivated, collaborative & pragmatic; Can-do attitude.
You will need
Create insight
Take ownership & accountability
Communicate effectively
Plan & organise effectively
Act as a team player
Further Information
In addition to a salary of between £37,187.50 - £43,750.00 you'll be eligible for a performance-based bonus of 10%. We have recently implemented a new range of flexible benefits including a strong contributory pension plan, private healthcare, life cover, an Employee Assistance Programme plus employee discounts on Canon products.
Canon also champions hybrid working and a flexible working policy, with a minimum of 25 days holiday per year. Lastly, you'll find that Canon encourages continuous Learning and Development with a wide range of resources and support available on demand.
Canon is enriching lives and businesses in incredible new ways. You can play a part in shaping the future of a company that’s visionary, innovative and bold. As the world's best imaging company, we're living and working together for the common good.

f55b6874ffed02fb.title: Social Media Executive - South, West England & Wales Cluster
f55b6874ffed02fb.description:
Posting Date Mar 01, 2022
Job Number 22030557
Job Category Sales & Marketing
Location Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel, College Green, Bristol, Bristol, United Kingdom VIEW ON MAP
Brand Marriott Hotels Resorts
Schedule Full-Time
Relocation? N
Position Type Non-Management
Located Remotely? N

Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you?

 
Position:
Social Media Executive
Date:
December 2021
Business Unit:
Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
/
Department:
Marketing
/
Reports to:
Cluster Marketing Manager

This job description sets out the current duties of the job role that may vary from time to time without changing the general character of the job role or the level of responsibility entailed.
JOB SUMMARY
The Social Media Executive is for someone that wants to join the #1 leader in hospitality and become a critical member of the team. You will help design and implement Marriott International’s marketing strategy, including content creation and promotion across numerous social media channels. This is a great opportunity for a creative individual to join an international organisation where you can utilise and develop your Digital Marketing Skills.
Reporting to our Cluster Marketing Manager over the South, West England and Wales Cluster, you will be responsible for implementing our Social Media strategy in order to increase our online presence. You will be responsible for the maintenance and scheduling of our social media communications as well as researching, designing and creating new ideas to connect with our audience through Social Media. The role requires the ability to manage a multitude of social channels. The overarching aim of this role is to grow a number of Marriott hotels profile, increase engagement with relevant audiences and generate leads.
Marriott International provides plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and develop as an individual. During your time with us you will have the chance to learn how to work with several teams and stake holders, write compelling social media posts, utilise several tools to leverage social media and use social media to grow an International Companies online profile.
SCOPE / BUSINESS CONTEXT
A position based mainly working from home.
Experience:
Previous experience working within a similar environment preferred but not essential. Ability to be a self starter and able to work autonomously.
Skills and Knowledge
Strong communication skills (verbal, listening, writing)
Sounds knowledge of social media platforms
Outstanding proofreading and editing skills
Ability to write catchy content
Excellent ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize them
Innovative
Pro-active and reliable
Strong Team Player
Able to work on own initiative
Highly motivated
Education or Certification
Good level of English essential
SPECIFIC DUTIES
The following are specific responsibilities and contributions critical to the successful performance of the position:
Developing engaging social media content.
Managing social media platforms of the organization.
Scheduling social media posts.
Engaging followers with regular company updates.
Creating brand awareness to gain audience attention.
Responding to the comments on social media.
Monitoring social media metrics and ROI.
Analyzing social media trends.
Preparing social media engagement and activities reports.
OTHER
Performs other related tasks as assigned by management.
Complies with Marriott International Hotels Limited Regional Office policies and procedures.
Working hours as required to do your job
Seeks and makes the most of learning opportunities to improve performance of self and/or others.

21c4657c75804b48.title: Social Media Manager
21c4657c75804b48.description:
Are you passionate about technology, networking and learning? Insoft Services is looking for a creative, organised and thoughtful social media manager to join our fast-passed marketing team. As a social media manager you'll oversee all company's channels and facilitate communication internally.
Roles and Responsibilities
Developing relevant content topics in accordance with the editorial calendar and the companies activities.
Create and curate marketing content (visual, written and video) on the various social channels.
Develops and expands community and influencer outreach efforts.
Designs, creates and manages social ad campaigns that ensure brand consistency.
Cultivates opportunities and leads.
Analyses key metrics and tweaks strategy as needed.
Builds and curates social media presence for company executives and thought-leaders.
Administrates the creation of engaging, relevant, original, high-quality content
Demonstrates ability to map out a comprehensive social media marketing plan with a regular publishing schedule.
Qualifications and Experience
The idea candidate for this role has at least 1 year of experience in a marketing or advertising field.
Experience in content creation and using social media in B2B and technology fields.
Displays in-depth knowledge and understanding of social media platforms and how each platform can be used to communicate with different tone (and still keeping the same brand voice).
Excellent writing and language skills.
Creative and analytical skills.
Proficient in design tools, such as: Photoshop, Canvas, Illustrator (basic After Effects is a plus)
Proficient in analytic tools, including: Google, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter, scheduling tools, like Hootsuite and Trello.

Insoft Services provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.

b2460636e75460b4.title: SOCIAL MEDIA EXECUTIVE
b2460636e75460b4.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Help us transform a bell-weather of the UK high street into one of the most progressive and creative online businesses in any industry, anywhere. If, like us, you have the vision and bold ideas to help us realise this ambition, then we’d love for you to join our marketing team here at Debenhams.com.

As the Beauty Social Media Executive for one of the UK’s most beloved and respected brands, we need your eye for detail, passion and inspiration to help us to stand-out from the crowd. This role will include briefing our creative team to create posts, supporting the creation of original content, scheduling across multiple social channels and monitoring performance. As the beauty specialist you will also help shape the social media strategy for the area. You will need to be aware of the commercial objectives of the business and will play a pivotal role in the wider brand marketing team.


The role requires close working with the campaign planning team, creative teams and wider communications team to deliver creative, social-first, seamless activations that drive growth and support the commercial focus’ of the business.


What you will be doing:

Work with the Social Media Manager to develop the social media calendar and wider social content strategy reflecting the commercial needs of the business and relevant cultural influences
Generating briefs for the creative team to produce assets to support campaign activity
Coordinate, plan and publish content across all social media channels (including Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Youtube) on a daily basis in line with Marketing & Trade calendars whilst remaining agile to product and promotional changes
Assist with generating creative ideas for social first-content including campaign assets and real-time videos
Copy write caption and other relevant content
Create relevant re-active assets in response to cultural events, in particular Instagram Stories and IGTV
Manage the day-to-day communication with the Debenhams Beauty community
Work as part of marketing team to develop new social initiatives in relation to wide marketing initiatives such as partnerships, competitions, giveaways, influencer content
Continuously monitor UGC from influencers, micro-influencers and fan community, selecting key posts for approval and inclusion of social plan
Creating social first content by capturing BTS footage from campaign shoots and events
Produce post campaign analysis on a weekly, monthly and seasonal basis including suggesting future recommendations to test
Monitor competitor activity and social trends on a weekly basis to ensure the brand remains relevant and up to date
Liaise with the customer services team to ensure that their communications with customers are on brand and relevant to each social channel.
Daily community management, assisting with the monitoring and answering of all customer related questions.
Build great relationships across the business and with 3rd party brands, key relationships will be with buying, merchandising, digital, and marketing to ensure relevance of messaging.
Have a flexible attitude to support the scheduling needs of the business at weekends as required (typically this will be 1/2 hours every 3rd weekend).


ABOUT THE CANDIDATE
What we are looking for:

Social Media experience, ideally in beauty, fashion or lifestyle sectors
Deep understanding of all key social channels including IG, FB, Pinterest and Twitter. Focus on IG and FB is essential.
Demonstrate a passion for the beauty social landscape alongside an interest of the beauty industry.
Good copy writing skills and excellent communication skills.
Proficiency with social software such as Facebook Business Manager and Dash Hudson
Good analytical skills, able to organise and interpret data.
Proficient in Microsoft Office, Google Docs and basic knowledge of Google Analytics
Videography and video editing, experience using tools such as Premier Pro and editing tools within Instagram (Reels, IGTV and infeed video editing)
Understanding on paid functionalities across social platforms viewed as a plus

Requirements

Confident self-starter
Flexible attitude, happy to work around the needs of the business
A creative mind, thinking innovatively when it comes to social media and content campaigns
Organised and process-driven approach to work
Thrives in a fast paced and agile environment
Strong communicator both internally and externally
Excellent time management and organisational skills
Self-motivated and enthusiastic, happy to get involved in a variety of activities
Team player, working with teams across the business


As a company, we are only as good as the people that we employ and as a brand of our Boohoo Family employees work hard to make the business a huge success and in turn we offer them amazing benefits:

25 days holiday + 8 days Bank Holiday
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Company shares schemes - including a 'Save As You Earn' scheme
40% staff discount (including Boohoo, BoohooMAN, Pretty Little Thing, Nasty Gal, Misspap, Karen Millen, Coast, Oasis, Warehouse, Dorothy Perkins, Burton, Wallis & Debenhams)
Monthly social events (including pay day drinks, Employee Appreciation Day etc.)
Company Pension Scheme
Subsided Café on Site
Flexible working hours
Cycle to work scheme
Health cash plan
Personal development opportunities to learn and grow at work

1d61f07122e3154d.title: Social Media Manager
1d61f07122e3154d.description:
Social Media Manager (Job Number: 22000095)
Communications Office
Grade 7: - £34,304 - £40,927 per annum
Open-Ended/Permanent - Full Time
Contracted Hours per Week: 35
Closing Date: 18-Mar-2022, 6:59:00 PM

When appointing to this role the University must ensure that it meets any applicable immigration requirements, including salary thresholds that are applicable to some visas.
Durham University
As one of the UK’s leading universities, Durham is an incredible place to define your career while enjoying a high quality work/life balance.
The University sits in a beautiful historic city where it shares ownership of a UNESCO World Heritage Site with Durham Cathedral. A collegiate University, Durham recruits outstanding students from across the world and offers an unmatched wider student experience.
We believe that inspiring our people to do outstanding things at Durham enables Durham people to do outstanding things in the world.
We find it easy to be proud of the extraordinary people we have at Durham. We offer the inspiration, they achieve the outstanding. We invite you to join them.
As a University we foster a collegiate community of extraordinary people aligned to the University’s values. Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI) are a key part of the University’s Strategy and a central part of everything we do. At Durham, we actively work towards providing an environment where our staff and students can study, work and live in a community that is supportive and inclusive, and in doing so, recruit the world’s best candidates from all backgrounds and identities. It’s important to us that all of our colleagues are aligned to both our values and commitment to EDI.
Durham University’s Athena Swan institutional award recognises and celebrates good practise in recruiting and supporting the development of women. We have also signed up to the Race Equality Charter, a national framework for improving the representation, progression and success of minority ethnic staff and students within higher education.
Diversity brings strength and we welcome and encourage applications from members of groups who are under-represented in our workforce including people with disabilities, women and black, Asian and minority ethnic communities.
Durham University uses a job families approach for Professional Services roles. The job families underpin our career pathways and clearly demonstrate how all of our roles contribute to our strategy and provide a framework for how you can develop your career at Durham.
The department and role purpose
Durham University has an ambitious ten-year strategy (2017-2027) to achieve its objectives of becoming world-leading in research, teaching and the wider student experience. Successful implementation of the strategy is in part dependent on our approach to promoting the University in respect of:
Prospective applicants to our programmes of study;
Potential partners in teaching and research;
Current and potential collaborators in business and industry;
Current and future alumni;
Potential employers of our graduates;
National and international policymakers and influencers.
The overarching ambition is to achieve a step-change in awareness and reputation of Durham University globally.

Working alongside the Web and Digital Senior Manager and Head of Marketing, the Social Media Manager will be responsible for using insight and data to develop a social media strategy that supports our objectives of targeted recruitment and enhancing reputation. The purpose of this role is to plan, manage, monitor, report on, analyse and optimise our corporate social media channels, whilst increasing brand awareness and developing positive social interactions. The successful candidate will also have to be both proactive and responsive in terms of content creation and engagement with our social media audiences, as well as developing communities of good practice across social media accounts outside of the marketing team remit.
The role will sit within the Marketing and Communications Office (Web & Digital team) and report directly to the Senior Marketing Manager (Web & Digital). The responsibility of the Marketing and Communications Office is to develop and deliver, amongst others:

a) marketing our programmes to and assisting with the recruitment of home and international students;
b) promotion of the University to and managing engagement with multiple stakeholders and influencers locally, nationally and internationally;
c) promotion of the University’s brand and proactive management of its global reputation.
The successful candidate will work within the Marketing and Communications Office in collaboration with:
Other colleagues in the Marketing and Communications function.
Other colleagues within Faculties/Institutes/Professional Services and Colleges.
Other colleagues working in overseas offices

Core responsibilities
Recognised professional social media practitioner and management and/or service specialist with responsibility for the management of team members.
Provide input to the design and development of service processes, techniques and deliverables for one or more service areas or projects; including developing KPIs and key objectives.
Manage social media operational service activities to ensure excellence in the stakeholder experience.
Contribute to the analysis of stakeholder feedback to help define needs and requirements, inputting to the design and planning of social media services.
Internal and external relationship development and partnership working, networking and participation to engage and influence future services and the University reputation.
Provide feedback on team and individual performance and identify development needs, conducting regular staff ADR and performance reviews.
Handle the vast majority of welfare issues within a team, referring more complex welfare issues to appropriate support services/senior management.
Delivery of ongoing coaching, mentoring and training to team members in relation to social media management.
Maintain an awareness of current policy for University business goals such as widening participation and access.
Contribute to business meetings, working groups and sub-committees at departmental and operational service levels.
Responsible for managing small budgets for consumables and some capital items, keeping records and processing invoices.
Devolve responsibilities to team members to ensure continuity of service provision and encourage skills development.

Role responsibilities
Provide management for corporate social media channels and/or processes ensuring high quality and timely service to all stakeholders, including prospective, existing and past students and staff.
Work with the wider Marketing and Communications team to manage the development and delivery of impactful digital content through relevant social media campaigns.
Manage and monitor performance and workload outcomes and/or staff, planning cover to ensure smooth social media service provision through peaks and troughs.
Analyse social media engagement and provide reports to Service Heads, making recommendations for improvement as appropriate.
Provide social media usage and management advice to stakeholders in relation to University, School and/or Department policy, procedures and regulations.
Ensure the review and improvement of systems and procedures in line with University, School, Department or unit frameworks.
Distribute social media-related information and provide advice to stakeholders regarding compliance and regulations.
Ensure social media regulations and procedures are updated to take account of internal and external changes.
Coordinate and oversee committee working and dealing with complaints.
Awareness of the external environment and sector best practice to support high-quality services.
Contribute to a community of practiceand share tips and best practice for maximising social media engagement – educate other staff on the use of social media and promote best practice.
Any other reasonable duties.

Specific role requirements
The role is based in Durham but travel in the UK and, where appropriate, overseas, will be required to deliver projects, take part in training and build and maintain networks.
Throughout the academic year 2021/22 we will be trialling hybrid working principles, allowing for some time to be spent working from home and some time working from campus. These arrangements are to be discussed and agreed with your line manager. Where ad-hoc on-campus meetings are required, you will typically be given 48 hours notice.
Will be required to provide support for the University’s Major Incident Response Plan and major reputational incidents during and out of office hours, including participating in a 24/7 on-call rota arrangement.
Some out of hours/evening and weekend work will be required to deliver projects and build and maintain networks.

Working arrangements
At Durham, we recognise that our staff and students are our greatest asset and we want to support the health and wellbeing of all. Hybrid working supports this ethos and provides many benefits to our colleagues, including empowering people, where their role allows, to work in a manner which is more suitable for them, whilst encouraging our commitment to environmental sustainability.
Depending on the needs of the business and the job role, Durham University is piloting hybrid working for all Professional Services colleagues in the academic year 2021/2022, which may include the opportunity to work both on and off-campus and to flex working hours. If appointed to the post, your line manager will discuss the specific arrangements with you. Any hybrid arrangements are non-contractual and may change within the pilot and when the pilot ends.
Reward and Benefits
To support the delivery of the University's People Strategy to attract, retain and reward the very best, we offer a fantastic range of rewards and benefits to our staff, including:
30 days annual leave, plus customary days and bank holidays (pro-rata for part-time) and the option to purchase additional leave;
Automatic enrolment into a pension scheme;
Corporate and local discounts;
Wellbeing resources and discounted health benefits;
Health discounts on sports and activities at Maiden Castle Health and Activity Centre;
Reward and Recognition Schemes;
Personal and career development;
And SO much more, with further information available here!

How to apply
We prefer to receive applications online.
Please note that in submitting your application Durham University will be processing your data. We would ask you to consider the relevant University Privacy Statement https://www.durham.ac.uk/about-us/governance/information-governance/data-protection/privacy-notices/ which provides information on the collation, storing and use of data.
Information if you have a disability
The University welcomes applications from disabled people. We are committed to ensuring fair treatment throughout the recruitment process. We will make adjustments to support the interview process wherever it is reasonable to do so and, where successful, adjustments will be made to support people within their role.
If you are unable to complete your application via our recruitment system, please get in touch with us at e.recruitment@durham.ac.uk.
What you are required to submit
A CV;
A covering letter which details your experience, strengths and potential in the requirements set out in the essential and desirable criteria;
Completion of the application questions with examples of how you satisfy the person specification. Please ensure you give detailed examples of how you meet these criteria.

Please ensure that you submit all documentation listed above or your application cannot proceed to the next stage.

Contact details
For further information regarding this post, please contact; Steve Davison, Senior Marketing Manager (Web & Digital): steve.davison@durham.ac.uk
We will notify you of the status of your application at various points throughout the selection process, via automated emails from our e-recruitment system. Please check your spam/junk folder periodically to ensure you receive all emails.

Person specification - skills, knowledge, qualifications and experience required
Essential Criteria
Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to develop excellent working relationships both internally and externally.
Strong interpersonal skills including motivational, negotiating, influencing, presentation and attention to detail.
Proven IT skills, including use of Microsoft Office.
Educated to degree level (or equivalent experience).
Continuing professional development required to maintain professional recognition.
Professional social media practitioner with knowledge and expertise used to contribute to the management, delivery, and development of services, events and activities within the organisation.
Experienced in developing, managing and delivering a comprehensive social media strategy, including developing KPIs and key objectives.
Experienced in planning, undertaking and reporting on social media monitoring activities
Experienced in planning and reporting on audience research and horizon scanning activities
Develop, launch and manage actionable social media plans and campaigns
Experience in interpreting and analysing social media engagement data and reporting to a variety of stakeholders.
Experience in developing, monitoring and managing content for social media channels in a professional capacity.
Experience in using social media management software to monitor and manage channels (such as Hootsuite, Social Bakers, Sprout Social, Falcon)
Excellent knowledge of current social and digital media trends and standards.
Proficient understanding of common social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok etc.) and their application for marketing purposes.
Experience in using both quantitative and qualitative research as a basis for strategic advice and decision making.
Experience in implementing policy and procedures and involvement with future changes for a service area.
Knowledge and experience in ensuring compliance with regulatory and organisational policy and guidelines.
Experience in providing social media-related advice and guidance to a range of customers and colleagues, including more senior colleagues.
Experience of being able to network effectively and develop strong and productive working relationships, to influence perceptions of the University.
Experience in managing and developing a team or teams and/or line management qualification.

Desirable Criteria
Working knowledge and experience of using Chinese social media and digital channels
Working knowledge and experience of social media to global audiences within a higher-education sector
Holds a professional marketing and/or communications qualification
Awareness and understanding of the activities, objectives and strategic direction of the University, both current and future.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance (CMA, GDPR, WCAG).
DBS Requirement: Not Applicable.

46bb558ba8eeb197.title: Senior Social Media Manager
46bb558ba8eeb197.description:
Senior Social Media Manager

My client, a large, market leading and nationally recognised financial services business is looking for a Senior Social Media Manager to join their Digital Team and they embark on another exciting period of transformation.

The Senior Social Media Manager will be responsible for leading social media presence across all customer channels using LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook as primary channels. You will be responsible for the development and delivery of the social media strategy, developing and advancing the client's online community via delivery of frequent engagement. The Senior Social Media Manager will also be responsible for ensuring that the executive team social profiles are optimised, giving advice on how they can broaden their engagement within their contacts. The role will see you managing a small team of two Social Media Marketing Managers either direct and or virtually.

This is a full time, permanent role paying a salary of £55,000 - £65,000 plus a marketing leading benefits package including; a generous bonus scheme, 30 days holiday, private healthcare and a 10% non-contributory pension to name a few.

My client will offer a hybrid approach to work long term, with lots of scope to work remotely although you need to be within a commutable distance of their Central London office.

Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for planning and executing the social media strategy and effectiveness
Responsible for designing, implementation and reporting against goals in relation to the performance of social media strategy across all social channels
Delivery of continuous improvement and ensure compliance with best practice for social media campaigns ensuring they are using the right technology and system to fully engage with our audience
Embed cross functional relationships to gain buy-in and support for social media plans including developing senior stakeholder advocacy for initiatives
Ensuring that campaigns and technology are at the required standard, including comparison to competitors, assessment of effectiveness and recommendations for improvements
Responsible for ensuring alignment to tone of voice, brand, regulatory guidelines and social media guidelines for all activity
Working in partnership with areas such as PR, channel leads, business leads, systems experts, technical owners, risk, procurement and 3rd party providers to provide a joined up and collaborative delivery of the social media strategy, BAU and project work
Ensuring ongoing paid campaigns aimed at growing our online following and increase engagement/reach across our networks are optimised
Promote good customer outcomes and brand positioning

Key Skills and Experience and required:
Experience within a similar Senior Social Media Manager role
Ability to analyse data to continuously improve brand awareness and consideration
Experience of managing social media budgets and multiple agency relationships
Understanding of regulation and guidance notes surrounding digital content and social media feeds
Able to articulate a commercial business case and benefit of improvement
Proven Digital leader ideally with team management experience
Please apply ASAP to be considered or email matthew.stone@modis.co.uk for more information.

Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. For all positions based in Switzerland, Modis Europe Ltd works with its licensed Swiss partner Accurity GmbH to ensure that candidate applications are handled in accordance with Swiss law.

Both Modis International Ltd and Modis Europe Ltd are Equal Opportunities Employers.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Modis International Ltd and/ or Modis Europe Ltd. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement which explains how we will use your information is available on the Modis website.

4fc47af8eeb2f337.title: Organic Social Media Manager
4fc47af8eeb2f337.description: ClearScore is searching for an Organic Social Media Manager. You will play a key role within our Marketing team and take charge in defining ClearScore’s vision, strategy, and tactics in social media. You will be collaborating closely across various teams to plan and develop best in class organic social campaigns. You will be a key part in our growth and define how we acquire via and engage with our social communities.What you’ll do: Own delivery and execution from defining the problems to be solved, possible solutions, weighing up the pros and cons of each, developing and getting buy-in to your roadmap, defining OKRS, and then campaign planning, execution and measurementUse data driven insight to create, develop and deliver impactful and engaging organic social media campaignWork with our teams in Paid Social, Customer Operations, Content and Product to create integrated campaigns aligned with our brandGrow our social media engagement and following on all social channels, including Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.Brief in-house or external creative designers to develop creative assets and experiments, which can be measured to inform future campaign planning and optimisationsIntroduce solutions and establish infrastructure which will enable us to efficiently scale across all marketsStay up to date on the latest trends in the digital and social media landscape that are relevant to ClearScore and put forward how to be reactive and implement these trendsYou're a fit for the role if you present most of the following: Experience managing large organic social accounts in a B2C / D2C environmentExperience of how to leverage different social platforms and community channels to drive growth, engagement, and business goalsYou will thrive in an environment with a high level of autonomy and responsibilityObsession with delivering excellenceWhy ClearScore?ClearScore is currently the biggest marketplace for credit products in the UK and in South Africa with over 15 million users. We are the first company to facilitate access to credit products using Open Banking data, making credit accessible to users with no credit files or low credit scores. In the UK alone, we have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.We were the first business to offer free credit reports. We did so because we are user-centric at our core and believe in leveraging on technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time, so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.Benefits25 paid holidays and a “duvet day” on your birthdayPrivate health and dental coverGP office visitsLife assurance schemeUp to 6% matched pensionBrown bags with guest speakersAccess to PerkboxDog-friendly officeDaily breakfast and free snacksFree sports and social clubsGenerous training allowanceFast progressionLeadership-led trainingRegular wellbeing eventsIn-house psychotherapistFinancial coach to help you plan and achieve your goalsPhysical and mental health support through BUPANo clock-watching cultureGenerous maternity and paternity plansCulture and inclusion representativesInclusion PolicyWe are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.Job Type: Full-time

8f2c149208cdfd81.title: Social Media & Influencer Manager (Gym Wear Brand)
8f2c149208cdfd81.description: We are an established eCommerce business with a 20 year trading history, employing around 40 members of staff and one of the leading retailers in our industry. As part of the diversification and expansion of our business, we are creating a new brand targeting the gym and active wear market. Our business will offer custom printed gym & yoga clothing, based on a similar US business who turned over $5m in their first year.We are looking for a motivated and knowledgeable person to manage our social media & influencer strategy. Initially, we will offer this on a part-time basis, but with the intention of developing it into a full-time role as the business develops.You would be responsible for:Managing our social media channels with regular, engaging content.Obtaining customer feedback on what designs they want to see (we have the capability to create virtually any design on a print on demand basis)Forming relationships with strategic influencers to promote our products in order to grow our brand.Creating strategic partnerships with relevant accounts through giveaways and affiliate relationships.Creating photo & video content suitable for use in paid ad campaigns.This is a role we hope to develop together with you and provide you opportunities to develop through our business, working on our multiple brands & managing staff under you as the business grows and develops.Job Types: Part-time, PermanentPart-time hours: 10-20 per weekSalary: £10.00-£11.00 per hourCOVID-19 considerations:The job can be performed remotely from anywhere in the UK.Application question(s):What social media experience do you have that makes you a suitable candidate for this role?What experience or knowledge of leggings, yoga or gym wear do you have that help give you the edge over other potential candidates?Do you have any creatives skills, in terms of generating ideas for new designs?

d096fe47468a2eeb.title: Social Media Marketing Manager
d096fe47468a2eeb.description:
Posting Date Feb 16, 2022
Job Number 22021200
Job Category Sales & Marketing
Location Europe Office - London, Barnard's Inn 86 Fetter Lane, London, London, United Kingdom VIEW ON MAP
Brand Corporate
Schedule Full-Time
Relocation? N
Position Type Management
Located Remotely? N

Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you?


ROLE SUMMARY
This position will support the EMEA Content Marketing department in the management and execution of social media strategies and the pull-through of tactics relating primarily to the Continent Socia Media Marketing initiatives and supporting leadership efforts with the goal of increasing the brand awareness and engagement of the Marriott Bonvoy portfolio of brands on social media channels.
Skills and experience we will look for in the ideal candidate to join our team:
Degree from an accredited university in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or related major.
5+ years of relevant professional experience in marketing and/or social media.
International work experience preferred.
Demonstrated project leadership and management skills, including a demonstrated ability to lead multi-functional project teams to deliver concrete actions and results.
Proven track record of successfully working in a multi-discipline environment.
Excellent software skills (MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other relevant office automation tools).
Excellent communication, copywriting and time management skills.
Advanced knowledge and understanding of Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube. Good knowledge of TikTok, Snapchat and LinkedIn.
Knowledge and understanding of Influencer Marketing preferred.
Prior marketing project management experience, preferably with a large, multinational organization.
Proven working experience in social media within an agency preferred.
Working knowledge of Sprinklr is a plus.
Working knowledge of several languages is a plus.
Why it’s a great idea to work for Marriott International:
We offer ‘hybrid working’ to enable you to live fully and balance home and work
22+ holidays plus public holidays as additional to be sure you have fun and make memories
This role is bonus eligible – our success is your success
Access to numerous, world class profession and personal learning and development programmes to enable success in your current role but also for your future growth within the Company
You will have international team members to share great ideas with and you will potentially travel in this role
You, your friends and family will be able to enjoy global hotel, food and drinks discounts and benefits, and explore our world
Regular team and office gatherings, both in person and remotely to build our sense of purpose
Strong, experienced leaders who will encourage you to grow and mentor you to succeed
Choice of pension plan to suit your current and future needs
Private Medical Healthcare and parental leave benefits to support your wellbeing and health
Various discounted retail and entertainment programmes for you to enjoy
Our office provides a modern working environment which includes ergonomic desks and ventilation systems

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

e394c90d2b62b989.title: Social Media Manager
e394c90d2b62b989.description: Do you enjoy using and promoting on a diverse range of social media platforms? Do you have a proven track record in promoting either a personal or professional brand? Are you a creative individual with lots of original content ideas? If yes, we may have the next adventure for you here at HamBris.We are currently on the lookout for a Social Media Manager to help promote and own our social presence. You’ll be given the opportunity to hone your creativity and social skills while being encouraged to test, innovate and improve our strategies. You should be interested in growing a community and be an outgoing and social individual.· Work closely together with our PR communications, Content and Community Management teams to innovate and improve our social media strategies.· Plan content and schedule posts for our social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok and YouTube.· Plan, manage and report on our KPIs including engagement, click through rate and followers.· Engage with our customers through our platforms and always represent our brand in a positive and friendly manner.· Understand our brand, vision and values and communicate these through visuals and storytelling.· Support in creating truly engaging and innovative content that is effective in growing followers and engagement while being consistent with our company positioning.· Consult with our external agencies to align on growth targets.· Be the first point of contact for most of our customers and help engage with them positively.· 2+ years experience in Social Media Management. It would be beneficial if you also come from a content creation background.· Knowledge with using different analytics tools including Google Analytics, Adwords, Hootsuite and Falcon.· Great content writing skills, it would be a bonus if you also have experience in creating small graphics and visuals.· Basic understanding of web design.· Outstanding communication skills both online and offline.· Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and tasks.· Experience with community management strategies.· English and German language skills are a must, any other language skills would be a bonus.Job Types: Part-time, FreelanceSalary: £10.00-£21.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekend availabilityEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)Experience:Social Media Marketing: 2 years (preferred)Language:German (required)Work remotely:Yes

5ebf0f3bcbc0a3d8.title: Social Media Manager, Alexa Social (UK), Echo Marketing, EMEA
5ebf0f3bcbc0a3d8.description:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing/ communications/ journalism related field or equivalent professional experience
Fluency in written and verbal English
Relevant years of professional experience in social media and community management for a lifestyle brand
Experience with Social Media, Analytics and Strategy
A passion for making data-driven decisions and driving strategic recommendations with data
Experience working cross functionally (channel strategists, PR, creative agencies/internal partners, product teams)
Ability to communicate, both verbal and written, with a wide variety of audiences both internal and external to the company
Must possess a sense of urgency and an appreciation for working in a fast-paced, deadline oriented environment
The ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
Up-to-date on the latest social media trends, up-and-coming social platforms, algorithm changes and excellent knowledge navigating social channels.

Job summary
Amazon’s Alexa is seeking a skilled Social Community Manager to support our online community and own the voice of Alexa across social channels in the UK. This candidate should have lifestyle brand experience and a passion for brand building and storytelling, with the ability to identify and highlight great stories across platforms. This candidate should be passionate about all things social and have prior experience building out brands across social platforms.

Key job responsibilities

Manage and build out the social content calendar, including writing copy and scheduling to channels for execution.
Help develop and maintain social media guidelines across owned and earned channels, including but not limited to Instagram and Facebook; creating consistent and cohesive messaging across platforms.
Write creative, engaging content that reflects the Alexa brand and resonates with our customers
Create opportunities to communicate with audiences in a compelling, engaging and helpful way that is mapped to audience building KPIs.
Dive deep into social media performance metrics and deliver data-driven recommendations for new content and creative strategies
Work cross-functionally with stakeholders to identify appropriate social moments to engage with and highlight on platforms.
Escalate top comments and potential customer issues to social media and social care teams, as appropriate
Identify opportunities to engage with influencers, major brands and influential accounts and think holistically to identify all potential outcomes.
Manage performance reporting and drive improvements and innovation from data.

A day in the life
As the Social Community Manager, you will engage with customers and build a strong online community of Alexa brand advocates. This role will be responsible for showcasing the Alexa brand and creating delightful social experiences for our customers. You will manage the content calendar and help support social marketing strategists. You have a passion for building audiences on social platform and are up to speed with latest social trends. You hold yourself to a high creative bar and are a stellar writer.

About the team
The Alexa Social Community Manager will join a team of driven, passionate and creative professionals who have their finger on the pulse of social trends and how to best drive brand awareness and brand love through our various channels, all while being customer obsessed.


MBA or Master’s degree in marketing or communications
Experience working with external marketing agencies
Experience with lifestyle brands and/or established brand with proven expertise in mastering brand voice and developing an online community and presence
Strong analytic and quantitative skills - ability to use data to develop and measure marketing programs
Strong written communication skills.
Expertise in social content initiatives that will encourage community engagement and brand building.
Understands influencer marketing and has communicated with influencers.
Multi-tasker who is well organized, agile, and detail oriented.
Demonstrates a positive, can-do, go-the-extra-mile attitude.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

92ff831865e3ee34.title: Social Media Manager at United Media
92ff831865e3ee34.description:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment, where you gain a tremendous amount of responsibility? Do you want to be part of an exceptional entrepreneurial team with young, motivated and extremely driven people? And are you curious or passionate about people? If so, you might be our next Social Media Manager.

About us

United Media focuses on building large scale industry media and conferences products in sectors such as insurance, HR, private equity, retail, etc. As of today, we have organically launched 8 media companies and acquired one. (Insurtech Insights, Presidents Summit, Private Equity Insights, HRtechX, CFO insights, Retail Insights and SetSales)

What we offer you

As our Social Media Manager you'll have the unique opportunity to be part of building and scaling a company. By providing you with the ownership of our content marketing, we want to constantly push you out of your comfort zone. You'll be working out of our HQ in London and to ensure a never ending growth curve, we provide you with:
An opportunity for getting operational experience in a scale-up where both your work and the results are highly tangible and matters to the businessA chance to work closely together with the CEO on our Social Media MarketingUnlimited growth potential in our company - we strongly believe in and have a track record of promoting internally.

Your Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will vary; however, some of them will be to:
Manage the day-to-day handling of all social media channels with aggregate +255,000 cross-platform followersScale follower base on LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube, and adapt the content to suit different channelsResearch industry-related topics and generate ideas for content and curating it for social mediaCopywrite, design, edit and repurpose audio, visual and written contentExecute data-driven strategies to our social media presence

What we expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:
Have acquired a bachelor's or master's degree with outstanding results2+ Years of experienceHave an UK work permitPossess exceptional analytical and problem solving skillsAre an excellent communicator in writing with an exceptional attention to detailAre excellent at communicating both written and verbally

Startdate

As soon as possible

c4f401d269d3b200.title: Digital Marketing Apprenticeship, 2022 October Start
c4f401d269d3b200.description:
Please complete your application before 18th March, 2022 for an October 2022 start.
How to apply:
Step 1: Answer the Apprenticeship Short Questions:

Why are you interested in this apprenticeship at Google?
What are you most excited about in the Digital Marketing space? Why?
How have you learned about the Digital Marketing space?
At Google, we believe that a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. Tell us about your background and experiences (e.g. volunteer work/club participation/extracurricular activities) and how they make you unique.
Step 2: Click on the “Apply Now” button on this page to provide the following required materials:
In the “Resume Section” attach a resume, motivational letter and answers to the short questions.
In the “Education Section” attach a current unofficial or official transcript if applicable.
Minimum qualifications:

Five GCSEs at grades A*-C or 9 - 4 including English and Mathematics, Functional Skills Level 2 in English and Mathematics, or a relevant Level 2 Apprenticeship, or equivalent qualifications or experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

Preferred qualifications:

Ability to work independently and within a team framework.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities.
Effective communication and organizational skills, proactive, positive attitude, and excellent customer service capabilities.
Willingness to navigate ambiguous tasks, find suitable solutions, and seek help/advice where appropriate.
Enthusiasm and passion for new technologies, demonstrated through personal projects and interest in learning new skills.
Authorization to work in the United Kingdom.
About the job
As an Apprentice at Google, you'll build the skills you need to become a Digital Marketer. You’ll join the Sales or Marketing teams at Google and will be assigned a manager and a guide for the duration of your 15 month apprenticeship. You’ll start in October with an initial onboarding period, then you’ll attend a bootcamp with our partner Multiverse. After completing your initial training, you’ll join a Google team for 80% of your time and complete your apprenticeship the other 20% of the time.
You’ll work cross-functionally to define, design, and implement campaigns across platforms. You’ll support product marketing strategy, understanding the users, turning them into a loyal consumer base, shaping the voice of the Google brand, or support digital marketing campaigns for the biggest brand and performance marketers. You’ll get exposure to various Google products. You’ll receive specialized training on basic marketing principles, search marketing, performance marketing, building brands and more. You'll have the opportunity to develop further skills through experience in research and web analytics.
The idea for Gmail began with 1 Googler. Today it has more than 1 billion users and counting.

At Google, one Googler can make a huge impact, and it’s no different with our interns-they are key players in our daily innovation. As an intern, you’ll have the opportunity to work on projects core to Google’s business, whether it be Sales, Enterprise, Finance, People Operations (HR), Legal, Trust and Safety, or Marketing. Our intern recruitment team will determine where you fit best based on your CV and the preferences you indicate on the application form.
Responsibilities
Analyze and evaluate organizations’ digital strategies and actions for some of the world’s biggest brands.
Support execution of go-to-market strategies and coordination for new product launches and programs (e.g., positioning, naming, external communications, competitive analysis, and feature prioritization).
Support insight gathering to better serve our users (e.g., via focus groups, working with a research agency to develop and test hypotheses, etc.).
Manage social media campaigns and develop ideas to better engage our users.
Undertake training and follow mentoring as specified.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

3ee223f0f84f390b.title: Social Media Executive - Menswear
3ee223f0f84f390b.description:
Social Media is an incredibly powerful communications platform, and ASOS has presences on multiple social platforms with more than 20millon followers combined. We are responsible for managing and creating content for ASOS’s branded social presences (such as TikTok, Instagram, Facebook and YouTube). We are a nimble team with core members based in London, and other members of the team in New York.
The Brand Content Team – Social, Editorial and Talent - which you will be a part of, is responsible for managing and creating content for ASOS’s branded social presences, Insiders social accounts, the ASOS website plus our suite of CRM channels.
The role :
As our Social Media Executive (Menswear), you’ll be responsible for leading the creation of world class social content on our suite of social channels. Working with the Senior Brand Content Manager (Fashion), you’ll manage the content output for our Menswear category, including both own-brand and branded. In the role, your key aim will be to develop and help execute exciting content franchises and one-off posts for all channels.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
You will be responsible for all menswear fashion content across our brand channels including the day-to-day running of the asos_man Instagram.
Feed into and execute our per-platform social strategies, as set by your Senior Brand Content Manager.
Working with the wider team, develop and execute ideas for exciting still image and video shoots across a range of business areas.
Work with the wider content team to manage the content calendar. Liaise with other departments within ASOS to share this, as required.
Collaborate with the Marketing, Creative, Talent and Fashion teams to capture, create and commission social content for the ASOS channels.
Work with the Editorial team to self-sub, and to maintain and manage to global tone of voice across all content.
Work with the Social Insights team on social reporting, ensuring you are rigorously tracking the performance of all content and enabling this data to be fed into future channel strategies.
Work with the Talent team to identify relevant creators and influencers to work with.
Work with the Social Insights team and the Senior Brand Content Manager to implement findings from the monthly and quarterly reports.
Developing and maintain excellent relationships within the business i.e. Retail Teams
Work with partner brands on developing and executing shoots for a range of business areas.
Self-shoot and edit content where necessary to maintain the smooth running of the team.
Ensure competitor research and customer insight are at the heart of all our output.
Ability to create content for both organic, boosted and paid formats, with a clear understanding of the different nuances between the three.
Be proactive with new and emerging platforms and formats on social and encourage first use where appropriate.
The person:
An enthusiastic team player with a genuine obsession for social media.
Minimum 2 years’ experience creating brilliant social content for brands.
Harbouring a real interest in social media platform changes and news, committed to exploring how ASOS might maintain a first-move advantage on each channel.
Impeccable organisation skills and the ability to keep projects moving and ensure deadlines are met.
Ability to act as an ambassador for the ASOS brand on shoots with talent and partner brands.
Strong numerical know-how for reporting and analysing stats.
Copywriting experience and flexibility to adapt across contrasting tones of voice.
An interest in fashion, trends and pop culture our 20-something audience love.
A visual native; keen and critical understanding of creative imagery.
A passion for ASOS and the brands we sell.
