8bc18e6470444811.title: Social Media Manager
8bc18e6470444811.description:
As our Social Media Manager, you'll be responsible for managing all social media platforms planning and creating engaging content that stands out from the crowd. You will also be responsible for reporting on growth and engagement KPIs across social media, as well as managing comms with the PPC Protect Slack community.
A bit about the job...

Develop creative and engaging social media campaigns with clear KPIs.
Manage the day-to-day handling of all social media channels such as LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tiktok, Reddit, Pinterest, and YouTube - creating and adapting engaging content to suit different channels.
Oversee, plan and deliver content across different platforms using social media scheduling tools like SEMrush and Hootsuite/Sproutsocial.
Support demand generation campaigns with engaging social media posts.
Engage and build relationships with key influencers in the Digital Marketing/PPC community.
Form key relationships with influencers across social media platforms.
Manage and facilitate social media communities by responding to social media posts and developing discussions.
Monitor, track, analyze, and report on performance on social media platforms and measure lower-funnel impact using Google Analytics.
Research and evaluate the latest trends and techniques to find new and better ways of measuring social media activity.
Liaise with internal departments to plan and share interesting and newsworthy updates with our community.
Ensure the company is active in social media (personal profiles, actively sharing and contributing, etc.)

A bit about you...

You are a creative social media wizard with excellent knowledge of most social media channels, including; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and TikTok, and what type of content performs best for each channel.
You are proficient in using social media management tools such as Hootsuite, SEMrush, or Sprout social.
You have good general knowledge of the digital marketing space and PPC advertising.
Strong understanding of social media marketing strategy and how to effortlessly utilize these concepts throughout various forms of outreach
Experience using content creation tools such as Canva/Adobe.
A proactive and highly organized approach to handling tasks

The nice to haves...

Photography and video editing skills
Certification in Google Analytics

So what do we offer?

Salary Package starting at £30,000
Hybrid working: 2 days in the office and then whatever works for you - we think the five days a week in the office mindset is well and truly dead.
Flexi-Working hours: Choose your working schedule as long as you're here for core team hours.
£1,500 home office budget: Stop using stacked cardboard boxes or the kitchen table as a desk. We'll pay to furnish your office space for you.
Thirty-two days holiday: You'll work hard at PPC Protect, but you'll be rewarded with plenty of time to recharge.
£1,000/year for personal development: Training courses, professional certifications, new language skills... If anything progresses your development, we'll pay for it.
£500/year wellbeing allowance: Meditation services, mental health support, gym subscriptions, physiotherapy - we'll cover it up to £500/year
Climate Positive Workforce: Through our Reforestation program and partnership with Ecologi, we ensure that we offset the CO2 emissions of every employee who works for PPC Protect every month
Private Medical Insurance: Accessible through our wellbeing budget program.

Us in a nutshell...
Founded in 2016, PPC Protect is working to disrupt the ad fraud and ad verification space as one of the UK's most exciting technology scale-ups. Our platform offers advertisers the first real-time protection against fraudulent advertising activity, offering the first truly effective solution to the industry's $50bn per year problem. We are supported & backed by the same VCs and accelerators as hyper-growth companies like Just-Eat, Revolut, Starling Bank, OnBuy, Skyscanner!
No recruitment agencies or contractors at this time, please. Any speculative CVs will be treated as gifts!
PPC Protect provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

e515441a89fb4eb9.title: Social Media Marketing Manager
e515441a89fb4eb9.description:
Canada Life UK looks after the retirement, investment and protection needs of individuals, families and companies. We help to build better futures for our customers, our intermediaries and our employees by operating as a modern, agile and welcoming organisation.

Part of our parent company Great-West Lifeco, Canada Life UK has operated in the United Kingdom since 1903. We have hundreds of respected and supported employees committed to doing the right thing for our customers and colleagues.

Canada Life UK is transforming to create a more customer-focused business by providing our customers with expertise on financial and tax planning, offering home finance and annuities propositions, and providing collective fund solutions to third party customers.


Job Summary
Accountable for developing and delivering the paid and earned social media strategy for Canada Life UK to support stretching growth plans. We are looking for a Social Media Manager who can enhance our brand and build strong online engagement with the advisor network and our customers, using social media platforms. The Social Media Manager will be responsible for working with our campaign teams to develop and delivering social media content that is designed to engage users and create interactive relationships The successful candidate will also be required to collect and review social media data to develop more effective campaigns.


Social media is a growing contact channel from a service perspective and the Social Media Manager will need to work closely with operational colleagues across the business to ensure timely responses to customers enquires and digital best practice is followed.


The role holder will be passionate about the customer and have experience of working with social media in both B2B and B2C markets. They will work collaboratively across the marketing team to share innovations, drive test activity and drive efficiencies as well as delivering a highly effective social media plan. They will also understand we operate in a highly regulated market, the job holder will be responsible for ensuring our social media activity is always delivered in a compliant manner.
What You'll Do

Develop the company’s social media strategy, be clear how each channel is used and deliver engagement within those chosen channels.Work closely with the marketing teams to develop social media campaigns that help to achieve brand and customer engagement (B2B and B2C).Identify and where appropriate engage with relevant influences to drive broader brand engagement.Develop and distribute regular reports on campaign performance, channel performance and competitor activity.Understand and share emerging social media trends.Develop a social listening program which will drive new and engaging content themes.Educate colleague in social media best practice.Monitor for and respond to brand mentions across all social channels.Work with the servicing teams to manage customer contact via social channelsOversee the sign-off of social media post to ensure regulatory requirements are being met.


Who You Are

Strategic thinking – understand how to integrate social media into the marketing mix, how it will integrate with other digital and with traditional media activity.Data driven – social media has a cost and a commercial value; the role holder needs to be able to understand the business objectives and align ROI to those objectives.Creative – the job holder will work in a highly regulated environment and needs to be able to make our social media engaging with the confines of that regulation.Process focused – we operate in a highly regulated environment and need to ensure we follow regulatory process when engaging through digital channels.Communities – we engage with many different audiences; the job holder needs to be able to relate to each of these and drive engagement across consumer and business relationships.Challenging – how can you make us stand-out in a crowded and functional market.


What you’ll like about working here

As a Canada Life UK colleague, you’ll receive a competitive salary and comprehensive reward package including income protection, private medical insurance and life assurance, along with a generous pension and bonus scheme. You’ll also receive the support you need with your personal and professional development.

Diversity and inclusion

Canada Life is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Our role as an employer of choice is to provide the right environment for talented people to do their best work, by respecting, understanding and valuing individual differences

43ba3823cf47a3f5.title: UK Digital Marketing & Content Writer (Part-Time)
43ba3823cf47a3f5.description:
Our Company:

At Cerebral, we're on a mission to improve access to long-term, high-quality mental health care for all. We believe that everyone everywhere deserves to get the care they need. And how are we doing this? By making care convenient and accessible and tackling the stigma that surrounds mental illness.

Since launching in January 2020, we have gone from a team of 5 to over 3,000 team members across the United States and in the United Kingdom. Our team will not stop building, growing, and iterating until everyone, everywhere can access high-quality mental health care without the high cost, long wait times, and stigma. Simone Biles, world champion gymnast, and mental health advocate joined Cerebral as our Chief Impact Officer to help further our mission.

We are the fastest mental health company ever to achieve unicorn status, having raised over $462 million and achieving a valuation of $4.8 billion in under two years from a top-quality investor group led by SoftBank Venture Fund 2.

We're also incredibly proud to be an NHS supplier, delivering rapid access to mental healthcare that is free at the point of use.

It is just the beginning for Cerebral, and we need your help as we transform access to high-quality mental health care globally.

About the Role:

Cerebral is seeking an creative and ambitious digital marketing professional on a part-time basis. You will control significant advertising budget with the potential to scale this rapidly in the UK's private healthcare market. Additionally, you will work NHS and other partners to manage marketing, PR, and organic social media activities, reporting to the Cerebral UK General Manager.

This is a part time role where we are looking for a professional with at least 1-2 years experience, looking to branch out into a portfolio career.

Responsibilities:

Own the D2C customer acquisition process, including advertising, spend, strategy and data/reporting
Production, design and copywriting of marketing assets, working with third parties (e.g. agencies) as required
Work with partners e.g. the NHS on organic social media strategy and multi-channel marketing campaigns

Who you are:

At least 1-2 years Digital Marketing/Social Media/Content Writing background.
Experience launching and scaling acquisition on both paid search and paid social campaigns on Google, Bing, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, etc. while maintaining CPA targets
Experience working at an agency, start-up, or established company on new consumer-facing product launches
Have an entrepreneurial spirit - willing work in the weeds finding ways to quickly test new messaging, new audiences, and new value propositions for product/market fit
You're a wordsmith – you can write copy that people feel in their gut
You're analytical – you're not afraid of numbers, you understand attribution, and you can recognize patterns and apply your findings to the real world
You're empathetic – for both your coworkers and those you advertise to

Who we are (our company values):

Results and data-driven - we strive to reach our goals by making data-led decisions and focusing on measurable results
Take ownership - we hold ourselves accountable to our goals and deliver on our commitments, which fosters trust within our team
High velocity - we seek to roll out new initiatives, products, and conditions quickly so that we can see real data-driven results and iterate accordingly
Empathy - we expect team members to demonstrate the same level of compassion for one another as we show for our clients
Drive mission-driven experimentation - we iteratively experiment with new ideas, products, and services to help serve our clients and advance our mission
Provide deep, hands-on leadership - our leaders believe that no task is beneath them, and stay connected to the details of their business and operations

What we offer:

Salary:

£200-£300 a day depending on experience (we're also open to discussing bonus structures linked to business targets such as CAC)
Flexible work patterns with the option to attend our London office, work remotely, or both
Part time role targeting 2 or 3 days a week

Impact & brand recognition:

Shape the future of the #1 largest and fastest growing online mental health care company in the world
Build a platform that is improving the lives and well-being of hundreds of thousands of people (and counting)
Join a community of high achievers who have a passion for promoting mental health

Path to develop & grow:

Bi-annual performance reviews & opportunities for promotions - as Cerebral grows, so should you. We build your goals together and forge a career path that is right for you
Culture & connectivity:

Social events (e.g., monthly happy hours) enable us to build a sense of community and connect on a more personal level

Optional in-person company retreats provide an opportunity to augment team-building and celebrate our successes together
Please contact Amy Coltman at amy.coltman@cerebral.com if you have any questions.
Cerebral is committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. dbb4fb192b5ea6c8.title: Media Manager
dbb4fb192b5ea6c8.description:
Media Manager

Thetford, Norfolk
Full time, permanent
£28,204 to £31,388 depending on experience, + 11% employer pension contribution

The Media Manager is responsible for the management and delivery of BTO’s scientific and engagement messages to print and broadcast media. They do this through a combination of reactive (responding to approaches from journalists, broadcasters and producers) and proactive approaches (pitching stories to long-lead print and broadcast media).

This key role sits within the Communications Team, based at Thetford in Norfolk (though with home-working possible for part of the week). The post-holder reports to the Head of Communications (Mike Toms) and works closely with the Science Communicators Manager (Viola Ross-Smith), Social Media Officer (Tom Stewart), and Website Editor (Miriam Lord). In addition, the Media Manager works with science and engagement staff to source and develop stories for use in media opportunities.

The role requires an excellent understanding of science and UK ornithology, together with a comprehensive knowledge of Britain’ birds and proven experience in working with the media. Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills, including the ability to turn complex material of jargon into plain English, are vital, as is the resilient and professional manner necessary to support staff and work with partner organisations (including the BBC, RSPB and JNCC).

The nature of the role requires some working outside of core hours, and travel (for example, meeting a film crew at a study site at dawn to record an interview). It also requires the post-holder to develop effective relationships with journalists, broadcasters and producers, and to be available to answer their calls.

The ability to interact with a wide range of stakeholders, partnership organisations and give presentations to audiences including scientists, policy-makers, volunteers and the media is required. The successful candidate will be well-organised, competent in computing, good at problem- solving, and would be expected to contribute to BTO’s wider work as required.
Closing date for receipt of applications is 1pm on Tuesday 22nd March and It is anticipated that interviews will be held in Thetford on Tuesday 29th March.
For further information and to apply visit our website: www.bto.org/vacancies.

If you have any questions, please email recruitment@bto.org.

If you have a disability or long-term illness that otherwise prevents you from meeting any of the essential criteria, please contact us to discuss whether a reasonable adjustment could be made. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.


We recognise that candidates from Black, Asian and Minority-Ethnic (BAME) backgrounds are under-represented in our organisation, and that there are often additional barriers present for people from these groups when applying for roles in the charity sector and beyond. It is our policy to help under-represented groups get into the conservation and environmental sector, and if you meet the essential criteria for a role and are from a BAME background, you'll be guaranteed a first stage interview.

afcc10bf828c78ba.title: Media relations Intern (12-month placement)
afcc10bf828c78ba.description:
1. Description of the department :
The Corporate Communication Department of AXA IM brings together roughly forty employees across six departments:
 Media relations
 Internal communication
 Corporate messaging
 Brand and advertising
 Web and Social Media
The role of the media relations team is to:
 increase the visibility and reputation of AXA IM in the media (print and web)
 support the company's strategy and its implementation, to reinforce the understanding of AXA IM's role and ambition to an external audience
 position the company as a thought leader in its sector of activity on various topics (e.g. responsible investment, active long-term manager)
 protect the brand and the reputation of the company, especially in times of crisis and handling of sensitive issues
The central media relations team is composed of 6 people divided between London and Paris: 3 people in London and 3 people in Paris.
2. The main responsibilities of the role:
To support the media relations team and its strategy in the UK and globally, to coordinate the work between the different members of this team, as well as the tasks below:
Press documents:
 Draft and distribute press communications (press releases, media comments…)
 Draft media briefing notes ahead of press events/interviews
 Update media documents, including distribution lists and spokesperson biographies
 Interviews: manage incoming requests from journalists and coordinate internal responses
 Assisting in helping prepare the company's spokespeople for interviews with journalists e.g.’ compiling briefing notes and organising media training
 Monitor follow-up enquiries e.g. quote checks
Support to the team
 Work in close collaboration with London and Paris-based teams
 Contribute to ideas, content and solutions to help develop AXA IM’s visibility in the press worldwide
 Liaise with the UK marketing department to publicize the company’s services and events in a coordinated manner
 Have regular interaction with AXA IM’s UK PR agency - all media activity is done in partnership with a retained media relations agency

Events
 Organise different types of press events (virtual or physical ones) with company spokespersons such as conferences, round tables etc. (creation of invitations with the Design team, logistics, review of presentation materials, spokesperson brief).
Media coverage, monitoring and reporting, administrative
 Monitor and analyse media coverage
 Circulate articles to spokespeople following their publication and to the team
 Update reporting tools for media coverage, in collaboration with the media relations agency and the reporting provider
 Ensure the coordination and follow-up of the awards received by AXA IM
 Manage and track invoices
Digital
 Liaise with the digital team to promote media communications
 Participate actively in weekly team meetings
 Update the web pages of media relations (global and UK) with all new publications (comments, press releases ...)
 Proactively find new ways showcasing the team’s work internally

QUALIFICATIONS
3. Profile
Education
Communications, marketing or financial studies preferred but not essential.
Knowledge and Skills
 Excellent writing skills
 Excellent interpersonal skillsResilent learner
 Basic excel skills
 Strong work ethic
Competencies
 Proactive multi-tasker
 Highly organised with the ability to meet strict deadlines
 Ability to work autonomously, detail-oriented
 Basic knowledge of the financial/asset management industry
 Problem-solving

ABOUT AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things. In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.
AXA Investment Managers (AXA IM) is a responsible asset manager, actively investing for the long-term to help its clients, its people and the world to prosper. Our high conviction approach enables us to uncover what we believe to be the best global investment opportunities across alternative and traditional asset classes, managing approximately €866 billion in assets as at the end of June 2021. AXA IM is a leading investor in green, social and sustainable markets, managing €568 billion of ESG-integrated, sustainable and impact assets as at the end of June 2021. We are committed to reaching net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 across all our assets, and integrating ESG principles into our business, from stock selection to our corporate actions and culture. Our goal is to provide clients with a true value responsible investment solution, while driving meaningful change for society and the environment. At end of June 2021, AXA IM employs over 2,488 employees around the world, operates out of 26 offices across 20 countries and is part of the AXA Group, a worldwide leader in insurance and asset management.

WHAT WE OFFER
We are proud to foster a high-performance culture, which means that we seek to recruit and retain people who are not only technically-skilled but also globally-minded, innovative and able to leverage their unique perspectives and life experiences to support our success as a company. AXA IM is committed to building an inclusive culture, valuing diversity and supporting the career progression of all employees.

bd0fda3b93015bfd.title: Global Social Media Manager
bd0fda3b93015bfd.description:
Who we are:

At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience.

We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology.

What we're looking for:

We are looking for a Global Social Media Manager to come and join our vibrant Global Growth & Marketing team and assist across team functions including brand collateral management, new business, PR, thought leadership and internal communications.

This opportunity is great if you:
Want to demonstrate your exceptional knowledge and understanding of the social media landscape of a global stage
Want to be at the heart of shaping Wunderman Thompson as the most inspiring agency, globally!
Want to be part of a fast paced environment within a vibrant team
Are someone who excuses energy, drive, good vibes and can demonstrate a passion for being our network ambassador
What you'll be doing:
Define and execute Wunderman Thompsons's social media strategy, championing brand values, messaging, culture and behaviours supporting our overarching marketing and growth objectives
Establish a regular content cadence and manage the creation, scheduling and day-to-day implementation of content across all of our global channel strategies to meet social KPI's
Build world class, highly innovative social campaigns to support global brand initiatives and events, driving reach and engagement
Manage the social handles for the global CEO
Conduct audits, reporting and analysis on the performance and engagement levels of Wunderman Thompson social media channels and campaigns and make recommendations for continuous improvement
Work closely and collaboratively across brand, creative, paid social, PR and marketing teams championing social-first ideas
Foster relationships with social leads across the Wunderman Thompson network, giving guidance on social media best practices and providing support with local campaigns where necessary
Build relationships with social platforms to identify new opportunities and trends to find new and exciting ways to engage audiences ahead of competitors
Work closely with wider marketing team to assist in the management of website and intranet content, brand collateral, events and marketing initiatives
We would love to see Global Social Media Managers with:
Experience of developing and delivering social media strategies and campaigns
Expert knowledge of all social media platforms
Experience growing and managing global social channels
Experience of using social media management platforms like Sprout
A strategic and analytical thinker that can interpret numbers and data into actionable insights and learnings
A creative thinker who can come up with original, highly shareable social ideas
An innate understanding of what Social First content is
An understanding of the paid social media landscape
Enthusiastic and energetic, demonstrating a strong work ethic and willingness to learn
Highly organised, managing multiple campaigns/projects at once
A natural communicator, someone confident in presenting social campaigns and activities to different parts of the business and managing key stakeholders
Ability to interpret, prioritise and deliver actions with a meticulous attention to detail and flawless execution
An ability to work under pressure, with the ability to be reactive and flexible in a fast-paced environment
Strong copywriting and presentation skills with a keen eye for aesthetics

We want you to be comfortable and proud every day of the week and have created an open and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. We don't want you to just fit into our culture, we want your uniqueness and diversity of background to add to it and make this an agency where we all have a real sense of belonging and purpose. We are a community.

At Wunderman Thompson, we are committed to actively building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcomed, valued and heard, and is treated with dignity and respect. As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve.

Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency. For more information, please visit our website and follow Wunderman Thompson on our social channels via Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.

We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.

31cd8bb7cb1402af.title: Manager, Paid Media (International)
31cd8bb7cb1402af.description:
Headspace and Ginger have recently merged to become Headspace Health! While roles are still being recruited separately on our respective websites, new hires from this point forward will be joining Headspace Health. For more information, please speak with your recruiter!
About the Manager, Paid Media (International) at Headspace Health:
Our ideal candidate has the ability to work from the top to bottom of the funnel. Whether it be a brand marketing campaign that requires an ambitious paid media plan or hitting aggressive performance marketing KPIs, you’ve been there and done that. You can speak buying tactics with media buyers and also speak with any VP to translate paid media tactics to marketing goals.
Location: This role is open to remote employees in London.


How your skills and passion will come to life at Headspace Health:
Drive the holistic media strategy for our key international marketing across the funnel (performance marketing + brand paid media).
Oversee platform strategy across all channels (digital, search, social, audio, OOH, VOD/TV, and digital partnerships)
Ensure that paid media strategy aligns to Headspace’s growth goals at a regional and country level
Own regions test & learn agenda for current channel optimization (A/B Testing, Multi-Cell) and build ways to test new channels/countries with a test & learn focus
Ability to forecast media budgets + plans in correlation with business KPIs for both brand + performance marketing
Manage an in-market international acquisition lead along with regional agency partners for both brand + performance marketing
Keep up constant communication with the international marketing team along with other key stakeholders
Ability to work cross functionally with marketing
What you’ve accomplished:
7+ years in paid media and performance marketing with a proven track record of hitting KPIs
Previous paid media planning for UK + DE
KPI development and paid measurement experience (Brand Lift, Conversion Lift, MMMs)
Experience taking creative learnings and translating it into action items for future creative
Ability to present and communicate to executives
English Language required, additional language welcome
How we feel about Diversity & Inclusion:
Headspace Health is committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.
Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Headspace Health. Please inform our Talent team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.
How to get started:
If you’re excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Headspace Health, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications.

Production of content throughout the full planning lifecycle from ideation to shoot.

Experienced in creative and media agency management
