STRATEGIC ACCOUNT MARKETING MANAGER (MATERNITY COVER)
London, United Kingdom

SPEED & SPIRIT is what we look for in our candidates, defined by some simple values that inspire us to BE DRIVEN in our performance, BE VIBRANT in our sporting legacy, BE TOGETHER in our team spirit, and BE YOU to let our individual talent and experience shine. Applying for a job at PUMA is easy and all genders are welcome. Simply click APPLY ONLINE and follow the steps to upload your application.
YOUR MISSION
Responsible for delivering pioneering marketing activity for one of our most significant strategic wholesale accounts managed from the UKI. Working cross-functionally with multiple depts in the business (such as Sales, Merch, Finance), you will have excellent relationship management skills and this role will see ownership of strategies and plans for one of our most important Sports and Sport-style partners in the UKI, aligning disciplines including but not limited to; account management, retail marketing, PR, Digital marketing, Social Media, Influencer management and activation.
YOUR MISSION:
Manage account and internal relationships to build strong teams, clear vision and impactful delivery
Define, refine and execute consumer focused marketing strategies to support growth for a strategic wholesale account group and PUMA UKI business – across sports performance and sport-style business units.
Lead and plan seasonal account marketing to drive retailer success; collaboration with Sales & Merchandising teams to produce activity for the Go-To-Market process, including sell-in and sell-through.
Develop and deliver best-in-class full funnel campaigns for strategic retailer partner. Campaigns will deliver in multiple marketing channels; commercial, digital, social media, partnerships and activation.
Strategic Account Group: work with PUMA Sales Head to evolve strategy, projects and plans, aimed to elevate the brand and drive awareness, engagement and conversion with target consumers.
Manage, develop and empower an intern in their responsibilities.
Integrate with the wider marketing team of Sports Performance, Sportstyle & Golf to maximise opportunities for your Accounts and Brand Comms Manager ensuring Trade needs are considered and delivered.
Setting measurements, evaluation and analysis of all marketing activity, identifying key learnings and best practice for future planning.
Collaborate across the Strategic Account team, Marketing team, leading meetings and team communications as needed
Support the production of marketing documents including GTM presentations, reports as well as input to regional requests.
Keep abreast of new social media sites, web technologies, and digital marketing trends
Continually maintain an awareness of consumer trends and insights and provide unique and creative solutions using this knowledge, to reach new audiences
Keep PUMA Direct To Consumer channels and opportunities front of mind to ensure smooth collaboration and seamless integration from the consumers’ perspective
Budget management
YOUR TALENT
Consumer obsessed, creative and culturally considered
Excellent relationship management skills and proven track record of account management
Excellent planning and organisation, a multi-tasker with an ability to prioritise
Pro-active, ability to show initiative / ideas
Commercially minded
Proven experience and a proven track record delivering fully integrated marketing campaigns
In-depth knowledge of the sportswear/ streetwear/ fashion retail landscapes, trends and influences
Able to work independently, but also collaboratively on projects with multiple stakeholders
Personable and a strong networker; excellent at building and maintaining relationships
Excellent communication skills; articulate, efficient and concise. Strong verbal and written communication
Well-developed problem-solving skills, able to use initiative in ambiguous and pressured situations
Knowledge and experience of social media and digital channels
Comprehensive understanding of how to drive brand desirability with target consumers
Project & budget management including navigating multiple stakeholders
Entrepreneurial spirit and energy, and a way of using creativity to make the most of any situation
Detail oriented, resourceful, self-motivated and proactive
Willingness to travel as—required within the UKI and Europe
PUMA provides equal opportunities for all job applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or disability. Equality for all is one of the core principles at PUMA and we do not tolerate any form of harassment or discrimination.
PUMA supports over 14,000 employees across 120+ countries. The PUMA Group owns the brand PUMA, Cobra Golf and stichd, and is headquartered in Herzogenaurach, Germany.

7fea5dfd29361d55.title: Social Media Manager
7fea5dfd29361d55.description:
PwC is looking for a creative and innovative Social Media Manager to join our Digital Marketing Team. The team creates compelling digital experiences for our clients across channels, leads the firm in the development of digital marketing strategies and strives for investment in the right tools and technology to support our ambitions.
The Digital Marketing team collaborates with the business and other teams in the Sales and Marketing function such as brand, design, content development and campaigns to shape the right digital approaches. It also works closely with a small group of digital agencies - for social media in particular, this includes working directly with the platforms and with Salesforce.
Reporting into the Senior Digital Marketing Manager for Channel Management, the individual will be responsible for:
Developing organic social media platforms strategies for Marketing, including best practice and processes.
Driving innovation on the social media platforms e.g. new formats, testing etc.
Advising marketing teams and the business on social media excellence and how to best achieve campaign/business objectives.
Strategy through to execution on all our organic social media campaigns.
Influencer and employee advocacy strategy development.
Creating and leading on social media training capability for the digital marketing team and the business.
Exploring new tools to publish social media content.
Working closely with the Corporate Affairs team to co-create social media strategies and adhere to wider firm content, risk and brand guidelines.
Leading a group of ‘Social Media Super Users’ from across the Digital Marketing and Campaigns Teams to ensure all content going out on social media is best-in-class.
Working closely with the Design, Content, Digital and Campaigns teams on our go-to-market social plans, and connecting with the Recruitment and Global teams on their social strategies.
Building strong relationships with the platforms themselves including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and YouTube, and ensuring our organic plans are well integrated with our paid social activities.
Using software and tools e.g. Salesforce Social Studio to conduct social listening, trends and performance optimisations and recommendations.
Keeping abreast of social media trends to drive innovation and developing ‘test and learn’ approaches to new pilots.
Helping to govern what goes out over our social media channels in conjunction with Corporate Affairs, to protect the reputation of the firm and enhance the client experience.
Reporting on social media performance of our digital campaigns and establishing benchmarks.
Sales and Marketing is a centralised support function and covers all aspects of professional services marketing, sales support and business development. The prime area of focus for the function is to support the development and implementation of the firm’s market strategy and in particular to ensure;
We innovate every day
We are inclusive by default
We deliver commercial impact with purpose
We tell stories that inspire.
There is the potential to line manage team members in this role.
Key capabilities the individual would need include:
A passion for and prior experience in social media
Proficient with social media management and analytics tools e.g. Social Studio or similar
Deep knowledge of Linkedin, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube including analytics
Understanding of community management would be advantageous.
Proven record of success in growing followers and engagement on social media platforms
Experience with briefing and reviewing creative assets for social media
A curiosity to learn new things and challenge ways of working
Experience in creating and delivering social media strategies to drive optimum performance
Experience of measuring and analysing social media performance
A mind-set which demonstrates a comfort with testing, learning and optimising
Clear communication skills to aid working with other teams and agencies to deliver
Experience of working in complex, matrix organisations would be helpful, along with evidence of managing varied stakeholder groups
Influencing skills to challenge the status quo.
Our people need to demonstrate a defined set of core skills and behaviours. We refer to these as our global core competencies. They're integral to who we are as a firm and form the basis of our people appraisal process. We will also assess you against them within our recruitment process to benchmark your own skills and behaviours. We recommend you visit the below web page to find out more about our global core competencies and to consider how your own experiences will align against them. This will help you through the recruitment process with us.
http://www.pwc.com/uk/en/careers/experienced/applying-to-pwc.jhtml
Not the role for you?
Did you know PwC offer flexible contract arrangements as well as contingent work (ie temporary or day rate contracting)?

The skills we look for in future employees
All our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.
Learn more here: www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/apply
The Deal
We want all of our people to feel empowered to be the best that they can be, which is why we have ‘The Deal’.

Find out more about our firmwide Employee Value Proposition: https://www.pwc.co.uk/careers/about-us/the-new-deal.html

Diversity
Valuing Difference. Driving Inclusion.

We work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool because creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business, enabling us to solve important problems and deliver value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be themselves, are valued for their strengths and are empowered to be the best they can be. As an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we also support different ways of working offering flexible working arrangements. Learn more here about our work to support an inclusive culture.

www.pwc.com/uk/diversity

b4e0f151986b7976.title: Social Media Governance and Insights Manager
b4e0f151986b7976.description:
At M&G our vision is: to become the best loved and most successful savings and investment business and we’re looking for people who are excited about joining us on our journey. We’re digitally transforming and investing heavily in technology and innovation to develop new and improved customer propositions that really raise the bar for our customers. To help us achieve our vision we’re looking for exceptional people who live our values and behaviours and who can inspire others; embrace change; deliver results and keep it simple.
We know that an inclusive environment makes us more accessible and ensures we attract, engage, promote and retain exceptional people. We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of age, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity/nationality, disability, or military service and welcome those who have taken career breaks. We will consider flexible working arrangements or home working arrangements for any of our roles.

What you can expect from us:

We are committed to creating an environment where you can be exceptional at all you do. To help us deliver this, we promise to:
Challenge Your Limits by creating a stimulating working environment and providing opportunities for you to be involved in meaningful and challenging work
Support Your Aspirations with a commitment to learning and development that helps you achieve and build your experience with people who want you to succeed
Value Your Input whereby leaders and managers will involve you in key decisions, listen to your thoughts and recognise the important contribution you make
Balance Your Life through a work life partnership that focuses on making this an inclusive, diverse and friendly place to work and offers the flexibility and support that enables everyone to be at their best
How do we support our employees:
All M&G plc employees will be supported in the workplace through our M&G Employee Assistance Programme (EAP). If you need counselling, confidential financial or legal advice. The service is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and offers access to qualified professionals who can provide specialist information, advice and support on many issues. It offers a broad range of services, including help with family issues, maintaining work/life balance and mental health support.
Social Media Governance & Insights Manager
The Role:
The social media team at M&G manage a global estate of accounts across LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube, and as part of our continued growth we are looking for a Social Media Governance & Insights Manager to work closely with the Senior Global Social Media Manager to develop and deliver our global M&G social media strategy.
As our social media footprint evolves globally, we are looking for an individual who can be the operational social media governance and insights lead across our market brands, ensuring we adhere to M&G plc’s Social Media Risk Policy globally while also developing and evolving our use of social media analytics across our business.
We are seeking an individual who has a deep understanding of social media in financial services, who understands the importance of risk management and governance processes in social media, and is passionate about social media data and its ability to support business development.
Experienced Colleague
Key Work Level Accountabilities
Accountable for being a social media governance and insights champion, providing technical and social media risk management expertise across our global M&G business, with a specific focus on the development of market brands, including M&G Investments, M&G Wealth and Prudential.
Accountable for managing and evolving our always-on social media risk and controls framework, including identifying any gaps, assessing opportunities for development and implementing an effective governance operating model
Accountable for implementing an innovative reporting model to analyse the performance of Brand and Marketing social media content, offering data-led insights, which support business priorities
Accountable for managing and delivering social media training and support for business stakeholders across our suite of social media tools – including social media platforms, management, advocacy, security and listening tools.
Key Responsibilities For This Role
Governance:
Dedicated operational point of contact for global social media governance queries, specifically related to M&G’s social media risk policy
Responsible for development, management and monthly attestation of business vertical-specific social media policy control maps, ensuring that M&G’s global social media activity is compliant and adheres to global policies and processes.
Responsible for creation and ongoing management of global governance hub, including social media registers, supplier/tool databases and policy process maps
Responsible for governance and protection across M&G’s social media accounts, including access management and 2FA configuration
Requirement to become social media management tool super user, and oversee business stakeholders access management and training requirements
Lead point of contact for social media brand monitoring, protection and compliance management across global M&G social media estate
Manage governance reporting across global social media estate including development of social media risk dashboards
Analytics:
Responsible for the creation of variety of social media insight-led reports and dashboards for key stakeholders – including senior leadership teams and campaign managers – highlighting key data points, trends and opportunities to improve performance and drive positive change
Responsible for the creation of proactive and reactive reporting and real-time listening dashboards in order to provide social data to internal and external stakeholders
Responsible for the creation of social media brand monitoring, protection and security reports
Essential:
Key Knowledge, Skills & Experience:
At least 3 years of experience operating in a digital marketing environment within financial services, complimented by significant expertise in social media analytics and/or governance/risk management
A proven ability and a solid understanding of social media functionality across LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook, with technical understanding of how the digital marketing industry is evolving
Significant and proven technical capability and experience in using social media analytics platforms for paid social campaigns, primarily LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter
A proven ability to interpret data from numerous social media sources and present it back in bite sized and insight-led reports
The ability to dissect social media analytics via Adobe Analytics and report back insight-led insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Experience working with and reporting into senior executives and business leaders
Desirable
Experience within our industry is essential and it would also help to have a background in:
Our target customers
Life and pensions products, markets and competitors
Asset management, markets and competitors
Financial services regulatory frameworks
M&G products, systems and distribution methods
Work Level: Experienced Colleague
Recruiter Name: Chloe Murphy
Closing Date: 10th March 2022
We live by four behaviours at M&G and we ask all our employees to:
Inspire Others - Support and encourage each other, creating an environment where everyone can contribute and succeed
Embrace Change - Be open to change, willing to be challenged and able to adapt quickly and imaginatively to new ideas
Deliver Results - Focus on outcomes, set high standards and deliver with energy and determination
Keep it Simple - Cut through complexity and bureaucracy, be clear and decisive and never overcomplicate things

8635feea341966a1.title: Social Media Marketing Manager - EMEA
8635feea341966a1.description:
You Have:

Expertise in always on social media marketing and campaign execution
Experience of social media networks, and how best to use them (Including: Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Snapchat and more)
Passion for content creation and compelling copywriting skills
You've got a pulse on local and regional cultural trends
International marketing exposure within multi-functional organisations with varied regional audiences
Experienced in navigating around data and insights, including the use of Google Sheets, Social Tech and Social Listening tools
Understand how to report on effectiveness of social media content
A passion for live streaming, gaming and new media channels

Job summary

About Us:
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog.

About the Role:
As the Social Content Manager for EMEA, you will plan, brief, schedule and create on trend social media content that achieves outstanding reach, engagement and shares, relevant to our audiences across UK, France, Germany, Spain and Italy. You will oversee the daily planning, coordination and community management with our social media creative agency. You will have a passion for growing communities on social media, through a combination of owned, earned and paid social media.
You will have an excellent understanding of best practices in storytelling, creative and formats across essential platforms of Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat, TikTok and others. You will also be experienced in using owned, earned and paid data and social listening to help you keep on top of what's trending and how to improve future content creation. It important to bring both creativity and insights to this role.
You will report to the EMEA Director of Social Media and Community Marketing and have close working relationships with regional and global teams.

You Will:

Plan social media content backed by creator and consumer insights, platform best practices, social trends and performance data
Oversee the EMEA social media calendars, setting a high editorial standard and best practices (such as format, messaging, tone of voice, frequency, timing)
Apply the Twitch tone of voice and speak in a relatable way to our community
Work with the creative team to ensure Twitch branding is reflected across our social media content
Proactively liaise between marketing, comms, partnerships and other important company partners to manage and prioritise content themes
Create clear briefs to our social media agency and manage on time delivery to a high standard
Oversee the regular reporting on social media activity internally and implement improvements

Bonus Points

You are Twitch user or streamer yourself
Familiarity with the gaming space
Have business-level proficiency in a second language (either French, German or Spanish)

Perks:

Private Medical Insurance
Dental, Vision & Life Insurance
Pension Plan
Maternity & Parental Leave
Paid Time Off & Holidays
Commuter Benefits
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programmes (e.g., gym memberships, etc.)
Lunch Served Four Times a Week
Free Snacks & Beverages

1e77fc66315fd04b.title: Social Media and Content Manager
1e77fc66315fd04b.description:
Social Media and Content Manager
Location: Crewe RSC

Department: Marketing

Salary: Competitive
All the teams in Ryman, in our stores and in our Retail Support Centre, demonstrate our passion for retail, by putting our customers first and sharing the vision to keep our customers at the heart of everything we do. We deliver results with energy, enthusiasm and passion. We are all resilient, innovative and adaptable team players.

Job Purpose
Be the leader of all social content for Ryman, you will be the voice of the brand to our customers. Creating and executing compelling, relevant and engaging content across all platforms and improving our presence on social media to attract new audiences. Listening and responding to relevant comments, chatter and noise and providing timely and accurate feedback to drive our brand awareness and sales

Role of Department
At Ryman the Marketing Department translates the commercial strategy into customer facing communications, across in store, Ecommerce, Education and Enterprise channels, ensuring that there are clear calls to action to drive sales, ATV and company profitability. As custodians of the Ryman brand, we are responsible for the visual identity including all in store POS and literature for over 195 stores, ensuring there is a joined up and consistent customer experience across our Ecommerce, social, CRM, PR and digital channels as well as any other customer facing communications. As well as supporting the wider TPRG with ad hoc projects and initiatives. The department is also responsible for driving awareness of own label products through outstanding packaging execution delivering continued reasons for customers to shop at Ryman.

Main Responsibilities & Key Skills
Develop and implement a social media strategy, including tone of voice and visual identity as well as identifying key KPI’s to increase reach, engagement and sales Co-ordinate, build and implement the brand content calendar for all social platforms, blogs and other channels – in line with overall trading and customer plans.
Manage and execute all day to day activity generating, editing and publishing sharable, relevant and engaging content across all platforms tailoring and adapting messaging to drive maximum exposure.
Develop and implement an influencer programme to support brand messaging, driving awareness and engagement across both new and engaged audiences.
Communicate with followers, respond to queries in a timely manner and monitor customer reviews, providing necessary updates and escalations.
Monitor, track and report performance across all social media platforms.
Identify and implement new platforms to grow the brands social reach and relevance for customers.
Work with trading teams to form strong relationships with suppliers to capitalise on content, creating and providing expertise and recommendations to increase revenue.
Develop local and regional store marketing initiatives.
Stay up-to-date and curious with current and new technologies and trends in social media, keeping an eye on competitor performance and driving continuous improvement to ensure the brand remains relevant.
Work with TPRG PR team to drive key messages to external partners, newspapers etc to drive maximum brand exposure.
Share and develop best practises across the TPRG group.
Budget responsibility for social media channels and content creation.

Key Personality Attributes

An enthusiastic team player, who works collaboratively.
Obsessed with social media and content, whilst balancing strong analytical understanding and creativity.
An excellent knowledge of all social channels and understands and can implement best practises, including a proven track record of growing and engaging communities for brands.
Understanding of paid social advertising.
A self-starter not afraid to challenge, and can work pragmatically with cross-functional across the whole organisation.
An excellent communicator, who is organised and methodical and who can influence and challenge the business to deliver outstanding social outputs.
Naturally curious, constantly looking for ideas, opportunities and ways to drive better brand engagement.
Great attention to detail, organisational skills and an impeccable eye for impactful campaigns.
Embraces and supports change, adapting quickly and used to juggling multiple projects simultaneously.
A can do attitude – prepared to roll your sleeves up and go that extra mile.
Experienced and comfortable working with senior stakeholders.
Experience of working across social media platforms and content creation ideally from a retailer/FMCG brand or agency.
Apply

8654c17cd9c2def9.title: Social content & community Manager Alpro
8654c17cd9c2def9.description:
About the job

No day’s the same, but let us try to describe how we want you to roll:

Brand strategy:
Fear not. We don’t expect you to troll the internet all day. However, you passionately translate our brand strategy and campaigns into snappy written content.
You master the brand’s tone of voice and safeguard the correct usage of our plant-based lingo across channels.
You spot opportunities to turn consumers into brand groupies and generate new ideas to drive the conversation.
You engage with our consumers and fans as if they were your closest friends in an engaging, positive and witty way. You always wear a smile but add some seriousness when the matter requires it.
Content planning and community management:

Together with the International Brand Manager, you develop and roll out written content for international integrated campaigns on our global digital channels
You partner with our International Media and Digital team, making sure the content is platform native and thumb stopping.
You manage our global channels (Facebook, Instagram & Twitter) and give them all the TLC they deserve. You plan social content and ensure it reflects the brand’s tone of voice, adapted to each channel.
When we say tik, you say tok. You launch our TikTok community and share the latest platform trends with the team. Fear not, we don’t expect you to dance.
Trend watching & tool management:

You manage our digital CX tool and track social media platforms for all relevant mentions and conversations. You stay in close contact with the local community managers and you dispatch whatever mention needs to be treated locally.
You spot trends like no other with our social listening tool. You have an eye for opportunities related to our brand and the plant-based territory, ensuring that new moments for engaging with customers are realized.
You manage our online knowledge database that centralises online Q&A’s for 35+ local markets and ensure we step up our game in translating our tone of voice across local content.
Stakeholder management:
You ensure effective implementation of our online tone of voice and conversation across our markets, campaigns and platforms.
You work in close collaboration with local digital brand managers and community managers.
You spar with local stakeholders to gather insights and relevant information for the build-up of online content.
You advise local teams in the domain of the brand’s tone of voice and do’s and don’ts when it comes to growing the community
You collaborate with the divisional marketing teams (International Brand Managers, Products Managers, etc.).
About you
If you’re passionate about building strong brands, if you love firing off the right words at the exact right time and if you’re a communicator at heart, you might be the one we’re looking for. Join the team that’s making Alpro one of the fastest-growing consumer brands in Europe as our - drumroll! - International Community Manager with English as Master language. In this role, you will join our kick ass Global Brand team as the go-to person that builds, grows and manages Alpro’s online communities of plant-based aficionados. You are based at Alpro HQ in Ghent or work remotely if you are not Belgian-based and will report into the Global Head of Brand.

In order for you to become part of our team and to nail the role, we believe…

You speak and write English (C2 Level) as if it were your native language and hold a master’s degree in Communication or Journalism (or equivalent through experience). Knowledge of Dutch and/or French are a plus
You’re able to spell supercalifragilisticexpialidocious out loud in no time – kidding!
You have at least 4 years of experience as a Community Manager in a similar role or alternatively a background in social media ideally from a similar industry.
You have a cutting-edge interest in social media and be abreast with its fast-changing nature.
You have strong interpersonal and authentic influencing skills.
You’re a strong communicator and an engaging collaborator.
About us

Alpro, the European plant-based pioneer of Danone, brings health through food to as many people as possible by producing healthy, tasty plant-based food and drink in a way that respects the planet. Our delicious plant-based products are made from soya, almonds, hazelnuts, cashew, rice, oats or coconut.
We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world and thanks to our efforts to combine social and environmental goals with financial success, Alpro is B Corp certified.


Working here you’ll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself. Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.


Join our vibrant teams and feel the Alpro vibe of positivism and openness, collaboration and passion for quality.


We Offer


Our core values - Humanism, Openness, Proximity and Enthusiasm embody the way we aspire to behave in everything we do. If you are an energetic person who believes in these principles, then Danone is the right company for you! Join our dynamic team and help us make our vision a reality by playing a key role in the performance of Danone and all its brands.

What’s next?

 Hit the “apply now” button now. You have until January 9th 2022 to apply. To comply with GDPR regulations, we cannot process your personal data without given consent. Therefore, we strongly recommend applying directly via our career website.

Need more information? Please contact Annelies Verbruggen, Manager Talent & Recruitment , via annelies.verbruggen@danone.com
all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.


#LI-UK

11dff117d99cd478.title: Influencer Marketing Manager
11dff117d99cd478.description:
ByteDance is a global technology company operating a range of platforms that allow people across languages, cultures and geographies to create, discover and connect. We now have a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages, which includes TikTok, Helo, Douyin, Resso, Lark, Toutiao, and BaBe.

This role will support our new platform. SoundOn is an all-in-one platform powered by TikTok, designed to better service music creators through each step of their career — from TikTok integrated promotion tools to universal music distribution, from diverse monetization opportunities to smart music creation.
SoundOn exists to give every music creator & label the power to authentically connect with new audiences and "do music" their way.

Duties:

Design and execute influencer marketing plans for key music programming tentpoles, leveraging influencer marketing, social media amplification, and digital media. Work cross-functionally with Artist Partnerships, PR, and Promotions.
Develop creative concepts for influencer marketing campaigns and build relationships with micro and macro influencers to create content around the concepts via both hands-on operation and agency partnership.
Analyze campaign data to track performance and evaluate campaign ROI.
Collaborate with product team to develop product-level solutions to better manage the influencer network, and help improve the influencers' income from promotional budget.
5+ years of digital/influencer marketing experience. Experience in digital marketing agency and MCNs are preferred.
You have experience running promotion campaigns on TikTok; prior experience working with TikTok creators strongly preferred.
You have a deep understanding of the UK music industry and you are well versed in the digital music space.
You have a natural aptitude for translating data into insights and trends and the aptitude to influence new strategies based on these insights.
You are well organized, dedicated, with the ability to plan and deliver on tight deadlines and pay outstanding attention to detail.
You have excellent communication and relationship building skills and time management skills
You are a great teammate and always have a positive and humble attitude.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

5870cb78aef95c2d.title: Social Media Manager
5870cb78aef95c2d.description:
Location: London with the ability to work flexibly from office/home
Who & What Are We?
We are a no nonsense content agency. We say ‘no nonsense’ because we believe that every business should be able to get amazing-looking, hard-working, well thought out content without having to pay the earth or jump through agency hoops. So, we’re direct, agile, cost-effective but also smart and CREATIVE (yes, in caps). We want to tap into the latest technologies, stretch native platforms until they break and create stuff that just makes people go ‘Wow’… because no nonsense doesn’t have to mean dull, right?
With offices in London, Manchester and Cheltenham we’re growing fast and love transforming our clients’ communications.
What will you be doing?
We are looking for an experienced Social Media Manager who lives and breathes social media platforms and content creation to join a rapidly growing agency.
You will be responsible for planning and managing the execution of clients’ social content strategies across social platforms (both paid and earned), delivering ongoing campaigns across video, animation, podcast, voice, design & stills.
This role is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join the team at a pivotal point in the company’s history. We are now building out a team of Content Strategists, Social Media, Data, Digital and Analytical Experts who have a deep understanding of content marketing & strategy, digital marketing and communications planning, allowing seamless delivery of content and campaigns across all channels online and offline for our clients.
With a real opportunity to work with and grow in a department of like-minded creatives, social experts and strategists this role also comes with great career progression opportunities as the business continues to expand. We’re looking for a ‘do-er’ and ‘go-getter’, someone who will take the reins and own it.
You Will

Lead on design, production and execution of social campaigns
Work as part of the Content Strategy team, to assist with the development and delivery of client content plans & social strategies across all key social channels, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn and Podcasts.
Working closely with our in-house Creative and Production teams to plan and deliver campaigns and content plans using all media formats across social for a wide range of clients.
Map, engage, plan and manage Influencer campaigns where required.
Scheduling/delivery of content across client channels, with Community Management where required.
Developing and integrating Paid Strategies where required.
Client liaison and management of all activity and processes required to proficiently create and run creative campaigns.
Comprehensive Monthly Reporting, analysis, and ongoing insights and recommendations to hit and exceed client expectations and KPIs.
Maintaining an in depth understanding of the marketplace and the social landscape to ensure delivery of best-in-class campaigns.
Support new business by delivering social audits, concepts and account reports
Help to develop the paid social offering to include the latest tools, technology and techniques, when required.
To closely monitor trends in the different industries relevant to our client base and creating stimulus to present to the wider agency teams on a regular basis.
Be responsible for the effective delivery of your projects, on time and on budget, whilst managing client relationships and expectations.
Keep up to date with new technical and creative developments in the content marketing sector with awareness of social trends and competitors.
Attend client pitches and partake in proposal submissions
Skills & Experience
Strong experience in a similar role.
Expertise in all areas of delivery is desired: Social management, influencer marketing, paid media, community management, creative briefing, team management and reporting.
Strong copywriter
Knowledge of the technologies and processes involved in running Paid Social campaigns across all channels (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn & TikTok)
Proven experience of creating strategies and campaign concepts, recognizing opportunities for unique and successful content, and generating new ideas that utilise video, animation, podcasts, voice and photography heavily.
Proven experience of taking learnings from performance and adapting strategies for constant improvement.
Experience of working with influencers.
Confident and articulate, with the ability to voice and share ideas and opinions both internally and with clients.
Confident in own abilities and be able to proactively influence clients and manage their expectations.
Facebook Blueprint certified; Google Advertising Fundamentals Exam – would be a plus

Characteristics

Strong communication skills both verbally and in writing.
Strong creativity with high attention to detail.
Confident in own abilities
Able to work in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment.
A problem-solver who is proactive, driven, and ultra-organized.
Self-motivated and ambitious.
Great team player with a client-centric focus and possess the ability to build strong and effective working relationships.
Punctual and willing to work hours as required on-location to ensure successful delivery of projects.
Sense of humour.

What’s in it for you?

Fantastic, friendly and close-knit team.
Apple laptop & mobile phone contribution.
Company pension.
23 days holiday allowance + bank holidays.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Company Profit Share Scheme
Development & training.
Monthly Recognition Scheme.
Annual awards.
3, 5 & 10 year anniversary awards & additional annual leave.
Regular company socials - anything from go-karting to clay-pigeon shooting! Strictly no ‘team-building’ torture!
Employee referral bonus
Flexi-Working
Summer and Christmas parties.
Monthly one to ones with your Line Manager and Biannual appraisals.
Free office parking
Cycle to work scheme

£30,000 - £38,000 DOE p/a plus benefits.
Are you in?
We’d love to get to know you so please include a funny or interesting fact about yourself in your application alongside either a video-based application or your CV, cover letter and any examples of work – Apply here

06ff5bed4867a971.title: Global Brand Account Manager
06ff5bed4867a971.description:
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.
Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?
We are looking for a Global Brand Account Manager to join our team here at Binance. The ideal candidate is familiar with the entertainment, sports, celebrity and eSports scene. Also, experience working with global/ world-renowned celebrities or entertainment agencies to negotiate on sponsorship deals with the purpose of raising brand awareness and inspiring global adoption.
This is a remote role and can be based in any global location.
Responsibilities:
Manage accounts for global sponsorship opportunities, which includes working closely with the partner to maximize the ROI, Brand Awareness and Brand Activation for both parties.
Be the day to day point of contact for the sponsorship opportunity and help them with any assets or information we require.
Excellent relationship building skills are required to ensure a mutually beneficial relationship is managed.
Working with internal teams and stakeholders to ensure marketing deliverables are met.
Adhering to our Commercial documents to ensure all commercial rights, deliverables and assets have been granted.
Clearly display the volume of new users generated from Marketing campaigns.
Provide strategic ideas and initiative about pivoting strategies when required.
Responsible for overseeing the Marketing efforts and providing best practice guidance on how to strategically position ourselves in the market for optimal results.
Requirements:
Strong Brand Marketing Background, with a competence on Marketing strategy that integrates Social Media, PR, Email Marketing, Out of Home, Digital activation strategies and campaigns.
Fluent English.
Excellent client facing ability.
Not required, but ideally a background in Crypto or an understanding of Web 3.0 Products such as NFT’s and Fan Tokens.
Experience in working in partnerships and seeing them through to execution.
More than 5 years of experience (at least 2 years in in marketing or strategy functions and at least 2 years in consumer tech, entertainment or management consulting companies).
Excellent skills in: quantitative analysis, written and verbal communication, project management and stakeholder influence.
Team player with strong interpersonal skills, but also able to work independently Thrive in a fast-paced environment.
High level of intellectual curiosity.
Working at Binance Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems International work environment and flat organisation Great career development opportunities in a growing company Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career Competitive salary Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

59e4e04dec863bfc.title: Social Media Content & Community Manager (London)
59e4e04dec863bfc.description:
What we’re all about
At Monese, we push the boundaries every day to help people build themselves a better future.
We’re the mobile app alternative to banks, empowering hard-workers and heavy-lifters all over the world to thrive. Think gig workers, side-hustlers, go-getters, and all those working towards achieving their dreams.
With over 2 million sign-ups across 31 countries, we’re here to build a community where no doors are closed – and we’ve been named ‘Best Challenger Bank' in Europe along the way.
It’s not easy to make big changes in the world, but we’re looking for the right people with enough ambition to help us go the distance.
What you’ll be doing
Here’s how you can join us on our mission:
By making a difference with your passion for social media, for content and for communities. By joining our growing community team, and spread your magic over our social content strategy and nurturing our online communities.
As our Social Media Content & Community Manager you’ll be responsible for planning, creating, editing and publishing content (with a heavy skew towards video and social media and other owned channels) on the official Monese social media networks. From creating monthly editorial calendars to implementing marketing strategies to deliver Monese’s brand message creatively, the Social Media Content & Community Manager is the link between our brand, Monese and our social media followers.
If you are a social media superstar, organised and self-sufficient, and loves creating engaging and witty content, reach out to us.
Role Specific:
Create content that nurtures community interaction and conversation
Design graphics for social platforms - capture and edit video for use on social media
Update and manage Monese's social media channels (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat, YouTube, etc.) per our social media strategy
Plan and oversee all organic social campaigns, including partnerships with influencers
Measure the success of our social media activities by managing, monitoring and reporting on the performance of the posts and audience reactions
Engage with brand followers and fans on social channels
Advocating our brand and actively going out within the online communities to connect with potential customers
Conduct social media listening and actively listen to our audiences, address concerns, demonstrate an authentic social presence, and maintain productive partnerships
Monitor trends in social media tools and applications and facilitate new and alternative ways to leverage social media activities
Track and report on all social media metrics
Manage marketing efforts across social media platforms
Coordinating with different teams to get the ideas executed
What we’re looking for from you
At least +2 years of experience and solid knowledge of content creation, growing social channels and social media platforms
Knowledge of social media management tools and social media monitoring metrics (SproutSocial & mention would be a plus)
Creative thinker & self-starter mindset, genuinely interested in continuous learning
Strong empathy to understand our audiences' challenges and issues and support them in finding solutions
Beginner’s mindset, driven by trial & errors and not afraid of failing
Great sense of humour, good at story-telling and passion for the social media industry
Excellent interpersonal, networking, communication, and problem-solving skills
Excellent English writing and editing skills, understanding the particular writing characteristics for social media, such as the use of keywords, hashtags, and the importance of brevity
What you’ll get from us
We love what we do, and we want to make sure you do too! Here are a few of the benefits we offer:
An unrivalled opportunity for growth at one of Europe’s leading tech startups
A flat structure with open communication where everyone has a voice
The chance to make an impact by helping to build a product used by millions of people across the world
A huge amount of autonomy and trust in a motivated international team
The opportunity to travel between our offices and collaborate across teams, cultures and communities (as travel corridors open)
A stack of modern technologies, including a MacBook as our hardware of choice
Generous stock options and highly competitive salaries
25 days of holiday every year to recharge your batteries
A learning and development support scheme with up to 10 days worth of paid time off per year
Flexible working between the office and home + flexing hours to fit the demands of life
Fun team events, activities, and office parties to enjoy with your colleagues
Your own Monese VIP account for free
A great employer pension contribution
Salary sacrifice options including a cycle to work scheme and season ticket loans
Enhanced and inclusive Family Friendly policies
Enhanced Sick Leave policy
Generous referral bonuses for your equally talented friends or ex-colleagues
We’ve got even more benefits in the pipeline for the end of this year including private medical cover, an increased employer pension contribution, access to a wellness platform and more!
How to join us
Sound like a role you want to get on board with? Click on the link to apply and share your CV and cover letter over to us!
At Monese, we’re an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We believe in employing a diverse workforce and making it central to our success.

95bef232442fa02a.title: Social Media & Community Manager
95bef232442fa02a.description:
QVC (part of the Qurate Retail Group) is so much more than a retailer. It’s a broadcast network. It’s a global ecommerce leader. And it’s a friendly, fun, inclusive place to work! As we take our path forward, come discover why QVC is like no other business in the world. Be part of a team that’s reimagining shopping, entertainment and social as one. Join us and find a place where you can be yourself, have fun and make an impact.
We’re looking for an experienced Social Media & Community Manager to join us here at QVC UK. working on a hybrid model from home and at our media and commerce office, based in Chiswick Park, West London. This is a key position at QVC – a business that is changing the way the World shops!

Reporting into Jayne, our Brand Marketing & Customer Engagement Director you will be responsible for a plan that outlines a social and people powered community strategy for the market, related goals and objectives, help determine course of action, assess results and evaluate outcomes in alignment with QVC International (QI) Social Media and Community guidelines.

In this role you will be responsible for:

Developing a data driven social media strategy to grow the role of social media platforms, leveraging communities – to expand and engage the QVC audience with clear, consistent messaging – to increase brand awareness via reach and engagement
Oversee content development with both internal team and external agency to develop / an editorial strategy that increases brand awareness on owned platforms
Lead Social Media Specialists to develop category level strategies
Lead Qurio Senior Specialist to develop and grow the platform alongside wider Qurio team
Work with QI social media agency and Sprinklr to ensure QVC is up to date with all relevant social platform functionality including but not limited to social listening, commerce and scheduling.
Work with Customer Insight and Customer Services to integrate platform data into the wider business
Partner with Customer Service to determine appropriate responses, and integrate engagement / two-way conversation with our audiences on social platforms
Collaborate with other markets and international social media agency on the creation and development of aligned reporting cadence
Study the fast-moving world of influencers to develop influencer marketing models designed to impact category and brand challenges.
Develop and maintain social media strategies with presenters.
Partner with Customer Services on specific platforms to identify customer feedback and determine appropriate responses and integrate engagement / two-way conversation with our audiences on social platforms.
 Work to integrate platform data and content-both digital and broadcast-as well as deepen community touchpoints across the business.
Partner with Customer Insights teams on Sprinklr dashboards to provide measurement and customer sentiment to drive business impact
Partner with Digital Store on Social Commerce implementation
Development of self and others; both technical and professional
Lead, coach and manage a team of Social Media Specialists

What we are looking for:

Social media expertise
Fluent in social media platforms
Creativity
Strong collaboration across functions
Strategic thinking
Analytical skills
Entrepreneurial spirit
Strong communication skills
Ability to influence within and across markets

To be successful in this role you will have…

Experience of leading a team and delivering results in line with strategy
Significant experience of managing social media and content strategy
Experience of working with upper funnel marketing campaigns that drive brand awareness and engagement
Advanced knowledge and understanding of social media platforms and their respective participants, and how each can be driven to meet business goals
Significant experience of overseeing and managing a range of social media platforms, and growing a social audience
Able to analyse and present information back to senior teams around social media performance
Good knowledge of customer journeys and the factors which deliver a successful online experience

ff2ab6d54c25c3d8.title: Global Social Media Manager
ff2ab6d54c25c3d8.description:
More than one third of the food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste!

At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: To inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. We are the world's #1 app for fighting food waste. We work with thousands of restaurants and food retailers to make their surplus food available to local consumers. The magic of Too Good To Go has been expanding rapidly across Europe and now also the US, with over 114 million meals saved across 17 countries to date.

We’re proud of what we’ve achieved so far, but did we mention the issue is huge? We are expanding our team as we speak. And that’s where you come in: we’re looking for an exceptional Global Social Media Manager to join the superstar team at Too Good To Go. This position can be based out of our offices in Copenhagen, Madrid, Paris or London.

Your mission

As a Global Social Media Manager you will be responsible for coordinating and supporting our local teams on planning, implementing, managing and monitoring the company's Social Media strategy in order to increase brand awareness, improve marketing efforts and increase consumer engagement across all our markets.

Your role

Owning Too Good To Go’s global voice on social media
Owning the influencers strategy of the company, driving successful strategies and ROI oriented actions in the markets
Working closely with our local teams to help nurture market- and language-specific social communities
Develop best SoMe practices and actions to be implemented together with our local marketing teams
Extracting the local campaign learnings together with the local SoMe teams and transform them into actionable campaigns for all our countries
Collaborating with our Brand Design and Creative Production teams to deliver impactful Social Media assets to complement our global campaigns
Reporting on your efforts, considering key indicators by action and channel

Requirements

You have experience managing large social channels for global brands and/or big agencies
Deep experience managing SoMe monitoring tools
You’re a excellent communicator and a true collaborator
You have a genuine passion for social media and for the language of the different channels
Hands on approach
You have the capacity to be innovative, take risk and drive constructive challenges to our local SoMe teams
You care about how work works, and believe in more progressive, dynamic and agile work cultures

Our values:

We fight together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we fight together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing

What we have to offer

A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
The experience of being part of an international company with 1276+ enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 17 countries – always ready to share knowledge and support!
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.

How to apply

We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste. That means we need to assemble a passionate team of problem-solvers who can help us make it happen. From customer care to sales, marketing to public affairs - we can give you the chance to use your talent for good.
Mission
Inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.
Vision
We dream of a planet with no food waste.
What we do
We're a social impact company fighting food waste.
WHO WE ARE
OUR AMBITION
ABOUT US
LIFE AT TOO GOOD TO GO
HOW DO WE HIRE?
We strive to provide a transparent, fair and personal experience. We’ll take care reading your application, and get back to you as soon as we can. Depending on the role you’re applying for, the exact application process may vary - but this is what you can usually expect.
Phone Call
Chat with a member of our People & Culture team.
Assessment
Complete a small task that's relevant to the role.
Interview
Meet the people you could be working with.
Hired!
Join the fight against food waste.

e3e16b207f36e37c.description:
Up to £24 per hour
Required from March to May
Manchester

83f970db0a600ecf.title: Social Media Manager
83f970db0a600ecf.description: Hey, we’re Populate! We spend our time creating kick-ass social media campaigns for our clients.We’re looking to bring on board a Social Media Account Manager who really knows their way around social and has strong knowledge across organic and paid. You're the face of Populate for your clients and as such, the ability to communicate effectively and in an engaging way is a must. We're here to build genuine relationships and also have some fun!We work with tons of different businesses, but most of our projects are focused around sports, e-commerce, music events and FMCG. We've done some pretty epic stuff which you can check out on our website, and we've got plenty more exciting projects in the pipeline. So naturally, your day-to-day is going to be pretty varied!To give you an idea of what you’ll be up to, this role comes with lots of autonomy and the ultimate strategic direction of your accounts is your responsibility. You’ll manage and carry out the day-to-day activities for your clients in line with the bespoke strategy you and the wider team have created.We work together on nearly every project so you’ll be crossing paths with our paid and creative teams daily. Spearheading the project and ensuring your finger is on the pulse is key. Are the paid campaign results on track to smash their targets? Is the creative content on-trend and in-line with your clients’ brands? Is your project management keeping everything organised, on-time and on-budget? These will be things you’ll need to be on top of for all your clients.You’ll also be responsible for analysing data to produce insightful commentary for your clients—explaining the ‘why’ and the ‘what next’ to clients is important here. We want someone who takes an ‘above and beyond’ mentality to their accounts and can think holistically. Being able to spot social opportunities and identify areas where we can add value for clients is also pretty handy.Our website is the best place to go to take a look at what we do and to find out about all things Populate! Here you’ll get more of a feel for our company culture, the faces you’ll be working alongside, the growth opportunities we give our team and our punchy attitude towards delivering results.*What to expect*Keeping on top of your clients’ projects; making sure they’re looked after effectively, managing both your own tasks and the core tasks of those that are also involved in the account.Working across various platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn, and YouTube.Working alongside our creative team, writing creative briefs, helping with the logistics of shoots, research and idea planning, occasionally required on set. Being the last sign off for content and ensuring it's created within the brand guidelines of your clients.*Working alongside our paid ads team, briefing the ads team, reviewing paid ad performance and relaying campaign performance and what the results mean to clients—this requires understanding the fundamentals of digital advertising to field basic questions the client may have.Keeping on top of new developments in the social industry and applying these to your work and client accounts.Gain a thorough understanding of your clients’ business’ and major trends shaping their markets.Ensuring work is produced to the best quality, on time and within budget.*Campaign planning and strategy.Summarising data and results and writing reports.Engagement—both proactive and reactive.Scheduling content using third party software.Crafting engaging copy, both long and short-form.Lots of comms with your clients—whether it's updating them on the amazing results we've been generating, taking them for a coffee and catching up about their daughter's latest escapades in the school nativity or chasing them up because we've been asking for the same piece of content for weeks!The Right Stuff3+ years of experience in social media management/marketing, ideally in an agency or consumer facing brand environment. Experience and knowledge across a mix of social channels, especially Facebook, Instagram and TikTok.Copywriting skills must be sharp with the ability to write in multiple tones of voices, ability to be concise and can spot a typo a mile off.A strategic thinker that has a good understanding of both social media strategies and the wider marketing mix.A confident communicator—both in person and over the phone.We have a lot of paid advertising clients, so experience of managing advertising campaigns is important—this doesn’t mean you’ll be building or implementing them! But you’ll need experience in writing campaign briefs, speaking with the paid team to make changes, analyse the performance of campaigns, a knowledge of key metrics (CPA, CPC, CTR, CPM, ROAS etc) and how they affect performance.Previous experience and proven ability to handle a busy workload, prioritise and be flexible is super important.You demonstrate initiative at every turn and have a real 'can-do' attitude.You smash out good work and take pride in what you do; you hiss at the ‘that’ll do’ attitude.Enjoy collaborating with others and working as part of a growing team.You're the kind of person who is always looking for and learning from new information and experiences.GREAT to have but not essential: Basic knowledge of Adobe Platforms (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop).Understanding of Facebook Ads Manager and Facebook Business Manager.Experience of working on multiple accounts in an agency environment is preferred.An understanding of Asana would be hugely beneficial.Why Populate?Salary: £23,000 - £28,000, depending on experienceCompany bonus available, dependent on performance and company profitPersonal development budget and dedicated development days28 days holiday + additional holiday perksAn extra day off for your birthday + Christmas EveWe're pretty relaxed here—doctors, dentist, house viewing appointments etc doesn't have to be taken as holidayWe all get sick from time to time; we offer your first two days of the lurgy paid, so you don't need to worry or spread it around to the team!Commission on any new business you bring inWork and collaborate alongside our close-knit team full of social media expertsNo-one to look after your dog this week? We have an open-door policy for your pup from time to time as they need love too!Great company culture; a supportive and feedback-orientated office environment equipped with team lunches and socialsAccess to our menu of company benefits, varying from blue lens computer glasses to private medical insuranceCompany-wide retreat once a yearOffice based in the city centrePension-related benefitsJob Type: Full-time
