a6380052cae42896.title: Social Media Manager
a6380052cae42896.description:
Job Title:
Social Media Manager
Job Description:
Role Overview
As the Social Media Manager working closely with the Head of Content you will craft and execute content for a variety of partners. You’ll be tasked with ensuring that content meets objective around reaching and engaging with sports fans across the globe.

Coupled with working with our data & insights team, you will also be required to report on performance of content and make recommendations based on these findings.
You’ll be comfortable communicating with clients and working closely with team members from departments including client support and production.
Key Responsibilities
You’ll take a hands-on stance in the development and execution of content for a range of our partners whilst relishing the challenge of working with our clients to help bring their partnerships to life with engaging content activated across social media and beyond.
Candidate Profile
You are excited by the prospect of bringing to life a range of sports partnerships and are passionate about delivering brilliant content for clients.
You have a deep understanding of the social media landscape with knowledge of the benefits and limitations of each platform.
You take pride in your work, thrive in delivering projects and are equally comfortable with the strategic thinking needed to develop content-powered campaigns as you are with the creative elements.
You also thrive under pressure, enjoy working on sports/events and like to be part of a close-knit team.
To be able to deliver this we need you to have:
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in marketing either agency side, client side or with a rights holder.
A strong track record of managing social media accounts for brands including branded content campaigns in sport.
A history of making big moments come to life in social media with a great instinct for what resonates with global audiences
A love of sports and deep understanding around at least 3 of the following: Football, Cricket, Rugby, Golf, Tennis and Motor Racing.
About dentsu international
Part of dentsu, dentsu international headquartered in London operates in over 145 markets worldwide with more than 48,000 dedicated specialists. We help clients to win, keep and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses. With best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. www.dentsu.com
Working with us
Joining dentsu international, you’ll join a team of 48,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, memorable experiences and opportunities to shape your future.
Inclusion and Diversity
We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about. So, whether you’re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.
We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.
Location:
London
Brand:
Mktg Sports
Time Type:
Full time
Contract Type:
Permanent

2a04d0bfce70865e.title: Senior Social Media & Influencer Coordinator - Katie Loxton
2a04d0bfce70865e.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY
We have the exciting, brand-new opportunity to join our Marketing team as Senior Social Media and Coordinator for our Katie Loxton brand.
You live and breathe social and are an expert in emerging trends, while keeping your feet firmly rooted in our target audience’s world. Always combining strategic thinking with creative flair, the Senior Social Media and Influencer Coordinator rreports to the Social Media & Influencer Manager and is responsible for executing the day-to-day management of our organic social channels and ambassador program priorities, helping hit our exponential growth targets.
You can predominantly work from home in this position, with regular visits to our Head Office in Banbury for key meetings and photoshoots. This role also involves travelling to location shoots on occasion too.

BEHIND THE BRANDS
We’re a family-run, entrepreneurial company with an exciting pace of life and a bright and friendly team. We are passionate about creating stunning products with a personal touch and innovating our business behind the scenes. We value creativity, collaboration and integrity.
HOW YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE
Social Media:

Taking responsibility for the day-to-day admin across all our brand social channels, including planning, scheduling and responding to customers, driving follower growth, reach and engagement.
Monitoring social platforms daily, requiring posting on the weekends, ensuring all posts are live, tagged correctly and product is in stock
Being an extension of our brand voice on social media, ensuring we are engaging with our audience live and escalate any customer queries to our Customer Service team when needed.
You are responsible for the management of the Katie Loxton social media calendar
Participating in the development of new social media strategies and brand campaign planning throughout the year.
Gathering data for weekly and monthly reporting, supporting the Social Media & Influencer Manager on reporting.
Work closely with the Digital Marketing Coordinator to create consistencies of content across organic and paid platforms

Content:

Collaborating and working with the in-house creative team, to brief content for all social platforms, implementing a social first approach.
Regularly create organic content for social channels including Instagram Reels and TikTok content. As well as attending events and photoshoots
Writing engaging copy for social media posts in line with the social media content calendar; ensuring that all content and TOV is on brand.

THE TALENT YOU'LL BRING

Minimum 3 years experience in social media and influencer marketing (experience of managing a global platform in the UK and US would be desirable)
Excellent attention to detail, both creatively and numerically
Creative flair and a passion for social media and content creation
Ability to think global, while acting local
Self motivated with excellent planning and organisation skills, managing calendars and campaign presentations
Strong knowledge of social media metrics and software
Strong copywriting skills, and an ability to adapt brand TOV
Ability to work under pressure and at a fast pace
Happy to work flexibly and with the ability to learn quickly and multi task
Strong communication skills
Passionate about fashion and lifestyle

PERFECTLY PACKAGED

A salary of £28,000 - £35,000 DOE
A broad benefits package including our staff favourite – a very generous staff discount across both our brands. See all of our benefits on our careers portal
Our staff exclusive interactive magazine
Opportunities to make an impact as well as learn and develop further
An innovative and friendly workplace with a team we’re proud to be part of. Find out more about us and our culture on our careers portal
We strive to be the best in our field and we know that happens by hiring the best people, which means a diverse and talented team. We don’t hire based on age, background, or nationality – it’s what you bring to the team that counts.

6833551dcab6a1f1.title: Social Media Manager (12 Month Contract)
6833551dcab6a1f1.description: Have you successfully created, implemented and managed social media strategies in a B2C environment?Do you have proven experience managing and leading a team?We are looking for a Social Media Manager to join our Marketing Team on a temporary contract. You will be responsible for managing all areas of organic and paid UK social media, and will be accountable for the Group's channels which consist of Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok and YouTube for Watches of Switzerland, Goldsmiths and Mappin & Webb.You will deliver the social media strategy and key objectives which include, reach, engagement and channel growth, ensuring that all content is luxury, elevated fire for the channel and has our desired customer and audience at its heart.About youPrevious experience working in social mediaProven experience in line managing and leading a teamProven success of creating, implementing, and managing social media strategies in a B2C environmentStrong platform and best practice knowledge of organic and paid social mediaExperience managing and co-ordinating external agenciesProven experience in delivering a large social first projectStrong analytical skillsProven problem-solving skillsCreative flair with a strong interest in innovation, taking an outside of the box approach to creativityContinuous up to date knowledge of social media channels and trendsAbout usWe put our customers first and we love what we doThe Watches of Switzerland Group is the largest prestige luxury jewellers and timepieces specialist in the UK with over 140 collective stores. The retail portfolio comprises of brands including Watches of Switzerland, Mappin & Webb and Goldsmiths. We have mono-brand boutiques in partnership with TAG Heuer, Omega Breitling and Tudor and you will find us at Heathrow airport with representation in Terminals 2, 3, 4 and 5 as well as Gatwick North Terminal.The business began its exciting global expansion in 2017 with the acquisition of Mayors Jewellers – who have Stores across Florida and Georgia and a history dating back to 1910. Following on from this we have opened a Watches of Switzerland Store, Rolex, Breitling and Omega boutiques at the Wynn Resort in Las Vegas as well as a Watches of Switzerland Store in Soho, New York, the ground-breaking Hudson Yards Development in Manhatten and Boston.RewardsHere at The Watches of Switzerland Group our benefits include profit related bonus and staff discount. We have internal training and development programmes to nurture you through your career and make the most of your talent. Opportunities are endless!Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

0e3c50b4f372ae9b.title: Communications Manager
0e3c50b4f372ae9b.description:
Main Purpose of Post:

Develop and deliver innovative and effective marketing, communications, PR and media management strategies and campaigns to support and promote the work of the Commission and its programmes. These will typically include public stakeholder events that may involve highly complex and sensitive information, where circumstances may be emotional or sensitive.
Continue to build on the current developments for the Bevan Commission website and social media and manage all the day-to-day activities.
Develop, maintain and manage strong and effective working relationships with a range of partners, communications leads and stakeholders including citizens, patients and carers, other Local Health Boards/Trusts, voluntary sector, private sector, Welsh Government and internationally.
Interpret highly complex elements of the Commission’s work to produce appropriate communication material for multiple different audiences and stakeholders.
Manage and oversee the delivery of all communications, media/communications campaigns, taking personal responsibility for the co-ordination, writing and distribution of press releases, newsletters and other promotional materials.
Provide advice, guidance and briefings to the Commission and partners on communication issues and the most effective approaches to successfully managing internal and external communications.
Work closely with the Vice Chairs, the Director and Commissioners to engage externally with patients, public, local communities, senior management in the NHS, Welsh Government, Local Authorities, Third Sector, and any other local and national patient groups.
Protect the reputation of the Bevan Commission by pre-empting negative news stories and manage misinformation from external sources, devising and taking appropriate action to rectify and diffuse confrontational issues with members of the press and public.
Work with the team and the Commissioners to maximise the Bevan brand, ensuring that the vision and values of the Bevan Commission and are highly visible throughout communications. E.g. by producing corporate and statutory publications/literature, annual reports, briefings and newsletters, providing advice and support to others on the brand in line with, equality and accessibility guidelines and cost effectiveness etc.
Financial management for communications as a budget holder, with responsibility for working closely with the Business Manager or equivalent for managing the budgets and complying with the University’s financial and procurement policies.
Responsible for developing and running an effective system for monitoring media coverage, analysing performance of internal and external communication, and recording and analysing all patient/public feedback to drive engagement and public affairs for the Commission to ensure performance targets and strategic objectives are met.
Devise and deliver or arrange for specialist engagement and communications advice and training as necessary (including marketing, media, corporate identity, reputation management, consultation best practice and legal duties on engagement in respect of the work) to address the needs of staff, the Commissioners, the Bevan Innovators, Hubs and others as identified.
Be politically aware and understand the complex NHS, academic and political issues and changing strategic situations.

Job Reference: AC05162

77c025634d245624.title: Social Media Manager
77c025634d245624.description: Location: This role will be a hybrid role with some travel to the Guildford campus.The University of Law (ULaw) is one of the world's largest law schools. With an impressive history dating back to 1876, we employ over 1,000 staff and have over 14,000 students studying on our undergraduate and postgraduate programmes, along with an alumni network in excess of 100,000. We were the first-ever independent institution to be granted degree awarding powers and in 2012 we gained university title. With a rich heritage and a reputation for innovation and contemporary teaching practices, we continuously focus on developing the best legal and business minds. In 2016, we opened our leading Business School, further enhancing our reputation as a full service legal, business and educational training specialist, operating from campuses throughout the UK, Berlin and Hong Kong and an Online campus.What really sets us apart from other universities is the guiding principle that future lawyers and business leaders should learn in a realistic, professional and contemporary context, with plenty of practical interactive engagement. That's why we keep our contact hours high and our teaching groups small.Due to significant student growth, we are looking to recruit a Social Media Manager to join us on our exciting journey.The Social Media Manager will work in our Content team and lead the management and strategic oversight of ULaw’s social channels and social media strategy. Working with the Senior Communications and PR Manager, and the wider content team, you will oversee the delivery of high-impact social content and campaigns that demonstrate our compelling stories, informs our audiences and serves to grow the reputation of ULaw globally. You will work with colleagues across the University to ensure effective content engages and excites our audiences. You will build publishing plans and calendars to produce a wide array of content across multiple platforms, approving and scripting social copy and owning tone of voice for the accounts ensuring all content is optimised fully to reach the right audiences on the most appropriate platforms, liaising with internal and external stakeholders to report on performance. In this role, you will deliver strategic, proactive and reactive social content to ensure effective engagement of audiences to meet reputation and recruitment objectives. You will need to be able to demonstrate experience of social media management experience along with audience segmentation delivering multi format content. The right candidate will have strong social media and digital experience; desire to innovate and strong organisational skills to deliver projects.We offer an excellent range of competitive benefits including a generous annual leave allowance, private medical scheme, contributory pension scheme, life assurance, training and qualifications, and travel loans. As part of the tutor development programme, we will also support you to study for a recognised teaching qualification within your first 18 months of employment.Please note, CVs will not be considered and only application forms are accepted for this role.No agencies please.Some posts within the University are subject to a DBS check - you will be notified of this during the application process.What do we offer?We offer an inclusive and supportive work environment and are committed to developing our staff through a variety of means including educational sponsorship, discounted course fees and a range of in-house training. We also offer a generous annual leave allowance and private medical insurance.Our approachDiversity and Inclusion is central to everything we do. We are actively committed to promoting and participating in good practice in the way we attract and retain staff, as we appreciate the value and benefits of a truly diverse workforce. Aligned to this is the opportunity to join one of our three self-organised staff networks for Black, Asian and Minority staff, Disabled staff and LGBTQ+ staff.We celebrate difference and recognise the benefits that this brings to our inclusive culture, including age, disability, gender identity and expression, religion, race, sex, sexual orientation and socio economic background. The University is committed to ensuring our workforce is reflective of our diverse student population and, therefore, we are striving to increase the representation of Black, Asian and minority ethnic (BAME) backgrounds across all roles and at all levels. All appointments will be made on meritReference ID: REQ000973Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: Up to £38,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to Friday

d019fb89e2de9a6f.title: Creative Project Manager
d019fb89e2de9a6f.description:
Why us?
£19-27k salary on a full time, permanent contract

 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

 33 Days Paid Leave

 Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

 High-end, fast computer

 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need
Summary
Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!

We are looking to expand our team with an enthusiastic, intelligent and talented individual who is interested in project management, social media and creativity.

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!
About us
Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.
Responsibilities
What can you expect?

Reviewing never-before-seen TV episodes before they’re released
Learning all there is to know about our clients’ TV shows, the content, the talent and the fans
Brainstorming engaging and funny video ideas
Collecting and cataloguing content references and innovating based on new social media trends and your own creativity
Downloading and organising footage as well as briefing other team members on creative tasks
Leading quality control on content delivered to clients to ensure consistency and adherence to branding guidelines, as well as offering creative feedback
Liaising with clients via email to pitch ideas, receive feedback and deliver content
Developing your own technical skills by learning from other team members and through independent research
Becoming an expert in social platforms as well as Storm Ideas products to suggest strategy and content that will engage our clients’ audiences and achieve their overall goals
Qualifications
What's important to us:

A 2:1 Bachelor’s degree or higher
Excellent written and communication skills
Confidence in managing fellow team members
Strong organisational skills
Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines while maintaining accuracy
Unparalleled attention to detail
A strong creative flair and sense of storytelling
Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities
High work-ethic and self-motivation
Basic understanding of Adobe Premiere Pro and Photoshop (this is not essential, but a willingness to learn is!)

The above list is just a guide for what the ideal candidate will look like. As long as you possess smarts, enthusiasm and some experience, please still apply.
Your working environment
Agility & Openness for Ideas

We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!

Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People

We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do. The Content Production team is 20+ people strong and made up of video editors, motion graphics specialists, project managers and graphic designers. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology and Industry

Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-notch Equipment

We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility

We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. We have flexible working hours so you can start your day anytime between 9am and 10am.

To best serve our US clients, we are looking for people who can work at least one late shifts (1:30pm-10pm) per week. So, some days you’ll need to be flexible to work later if there’s a key delivery to a US client, but any time can be taken back.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.
Salary
£19 - 27k per year, depending on experience and skills.
Employment type
Permanent / Full time. Either in our Edinburgh office or remote within the UK.
Benefits
IMMEDIATE BENEFITS

33 days’ holiday
High end laptop of your choice, Mac or Windows it’s up to you!
Your own choice monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
Paid training on the job
Annual Flu Inoculations
Team outings and monthly meets

AFTER 3 MONTHS

Up to £700 to spend on a chair, desk or any other necessary workspace equipment to kit out your home office.
£625 budget every two years to choose your own mobile phone + monthly mobile contract paid for
Enrolment in workplace pension scheme with matched employer contributions
Money towards glasses with Specsavers

AFTER 1 YEAR

Performance Related Pay Scheme giving an annual bonus of up to 100% of monthly salary whenever Storm Ideas is in profit
Access to the Cycle to Work scheme
Recruitment process
There is only one recruitment step - a meeting with Nina and Ciara, Content Production Managers (60 minutes via Zoom). During the meeting, they get to know you a bit better and try to understand if you’d be a good fit for the role, and at the same time answer all your questions.

And that’s it!

4666bf28bf0d6c01.title: Social Media Manager
4666bf28bf0d6c01.description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic, player-obsessed Social Media Manager to inform and engage the Forza Horizon community across our social media platforms. This is a unique opportunity to work with a super-engaged community on a AAA franchise.
You will have the chance to apply your creativity, communication and organization skills to build a fun experience on social media that our community of passionate Forza fans will love to engage with. You will work with other community team members across both Turn 10 and Playground Games to create an engaging, consistent experience for our Forza fans. You will also work with the Live team to plan social activities around upcoming features and content.
Responsibilities:
Plan, manage and coordinate all Forza Horizon social media programs and initiatives
Ensure consistency in tone of voice and personality across all social media platforms
Write engaging copy that is appropriate for the audience and platforms
Work closely with the Forza community team and other stakeholders to ensure alignment on communication and engagement goals
Prepare and send regular reports on social media performance
Skill summary:
Experience with social media content creation and/or management
Be a passionate gamer
Experience with Sprinklr or other social media management platforms preferred
Ability to work independently in a multi-discipline environment
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to further their career at one of the world’s most exciting games studios.

33d72a1acdb38b2c.title: Social Media Manager
33d72a1acdb38b2c.description:
5+ years social media experience
In-depth knowledge of Facebook Business/Ads Manager, Twitter ads, YouTube and LinkedIn (desirable)
Experience of social media campaign planning including working on major brand campaigns
Experience of executing Brand Lift Tests
Experience of using the latest social media monitoring/analysis tools and platforms
Experience of delivering successful paid amplification of influencer campaigns
Strong competency in Office software (Outlook, Excel etc.)
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Educated to a degree level

Amazon is seeking a self-motivated, highly creative and experienced social media manager to join the UK consumer communications team, to lead the continued evolution and enhancement of our Amazon brand social media activities on our UK handles (@AmazonUK).

The individual will be responsible for leading the social media development and execution across the UK, working with agency partners, internal UK stakeholders, and wider teams to establish creative best practise, guidelines and ways of working to ensure our brand social media content in the UK is engaging, interesting and effective.

The individual in this role will be required to work closely with colleagues across Corporate and Operations PR teams, as well as cross-channel marketing (XCM), to ensure that the range of key messages, events and content that are most relevant to our customers are surfaced in a way that is highly-relevant, targeted and socially native. Success in this role will be demonstrated through measurable improvements in engagement rate, paid media metrics and brand perception shifts, and therefore the successful candidate must be an expert at starting with the customer and working backwards.

The role will report through to the UK Consumer PR Lead, but will have strong reporting ties to the centralised EMEA Campaigns and Social Team who oversee pan-EMEA social media strategy and best practise.

The successful candidate will have an expert knowledge of social media, someone with a proven-track record of planning, delivering and reporting on a range of social media campaigns, across various social platforms. Their expertise should include; strong knowledge of paid best practise across key consumer social media platforms - e.g. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter (YouTube and TikTok also useful); experience running paid media campaigns for big brands including lift tests and A/B test setups; excellent campaign set-up skills from strategic recommendations to goal-setting and audience targeting; knowledge of paid content best-practise in both creative and formats; and reporting on paid activity in a simple and insightful way including both key brand/qualitative and commercial metrics. They should be a multi-tasker, creative thinker, a problem solver, goal-oriented and enjoy working in a fast-paced, start-up culture.

Key responsibilities include:

Lead the UK social media strategy for @Amazon brand handles acting as the key point of contact for stakeholders and wider teams
Work alongside EMEA Campaigns and Social Team to take central plans and guidance and adapt for the UK market
Collaborate with in-country teams across marketing and PR to optimise key reputational and brand message for social media
Lead the development and implementation of always-on social media campaigns for the UK that deliver measurable uplift against our key goals
Mange the social media agency relationship in the UK and co-ordinate activity
Be aware of, and educate wider teams on, best practise and industry developments in social media

Skills:

Creative thinker – working backwards from the customer, the ability to find creative and engaging ways to communicate messages across social media
Tactically aware – knowledgeable about what’s going on in social media and digital communications and how that impacts brand activity
Social media paid expert - a demonstrated expertise in running brand social media and how to maximise the impact of a paid, owned (organic social) and earned (influencer) approach
Diligent planner – focused on ensuring campaigns are maximised for success, optimised against goals and targeted to the right audiences
Measurement master – knows what it takes to demonstrate the positive impact of social at all levels of an organisation
Proactive in the extreme - enjoys taking responsibility and making things happen – often to a tight deadline
Highly organised - able to juggle able to juggle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously while managing essential admin and reporting work
Ownership - able to work in a fast-paced corporate environment, taking ownership of workstreams and tasks and managing them through to completion
Experience working in a pan-regional organisation like Amazon
Experience in developing plans and strategies for different audience sectors
Experience in new channel launches and growth marketing on social

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

a94aa4996326771a.title: Digital Content Manager (1.0 FTE)
a94aa4996326771a.description:
Digital Content Manager
The Royal College of Art (RCA) is an internationally renowned postgraduate art and design institution. Founded in 1837, it is also the world’s oldest art and design institution in continuous operation and the most research intensive. The RCA has been ranked by the highly regarded QS survey, as the number one art and design institution in the world for seven consecutive years. Among its core audiences – students, artists and designers – the RCA brand is legendary. The generations of world-leading designers and artists who have studied or taught at the RCA is a roster of international repute.
We are looking for an outstanding Digital Content Manager . The Digital Content Manager is a key strategic and operational role supporting the Communications and Marketing overall objective of positioning the Royal College of Art (RCA) as an internationally renowned research-intensive postgraduate art and design institution.
The postholder will take strategic responsibility for the RCAs social media channels.
They will take operational responsibility for the Royal College of Art’s activity across digital media, working to promote, maximise and uphold the online reputation of the RCA.
The postholder will develop relationships inside and outside the organisation and provide significant strategic input into the delivery of key elements of the College’s communications strategy.
The overall approach should be evidence-based and one that delivers effective communications to meet the RCA’s business imperatives.
You will have a strong experience in delivering impactful digital communication campaigns; with confidence in working with senior stakeholders. In addition, it is essential that candidates have:
Evidence of managing an array of complex projects working with different senior stakeholders at the same time, delivering key outcomes on time and to budget
Excellent digital communication skills, across a range of formats, but with a particular strength in social media
Experience of managing design, print or video production work
Strong analytical skills, with respect to effective, measurable communications and their evaluation
Strong written communications skills, and a good eye for accuracy and detail
Ideally a background in Higher Education or cultural organisations

1c57ced2d4af5852.title: Social Media Manager
1c57ced2d4af5852.description:
Reports to:
Senior Brand, Social and PR Manager
This is an exciting opportunity for a Social Superstar to develop and drive forward hush’s social media strategy and take day-to-day responsibility for all our social platforms. Working closely with the Creative Team, you’ll devise compelling social campaigns and thumb-topping native content in line with hush’s brand identity that will deliver meaningful engagement with our hush community.
The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving growth and engagement for brands through social channels. You’ll be known for your storytelling, creativity and innovative thinking, but equally someone who can dig into the data and has their finger on the pulse of emerging social trends, platforms and technologies.
Key Duties and Responsibilities
Define and implement the company’s social strategy, ensuring alignment with overall brand strategy and business goals.
Develop organic social media plans, campaigns, activations and tactics to support marketing stories, new product launches, and cultural moments.
Work with team members to brief and oversee the production of social assets with the inhouse Creative Team and/or external videographers and production teams.
Own and manage the social media calendar.
Schedule and upload posts across all customer facing platforms (FB, Insta, Pinterest, Twitter, and soon also TikTok).
Drive, monitor and respond to engagement with our online community in line with brand personality and TOV.
Community relationship management to increase our loyal following, engagement rates and overall drive traffic to the website.
Conduct social media listening and monitoring to understand brand sentiment, optimise channels and improve the success of plans using appropriate analytics tools.
Deliver innovation by exploring new features of existing platforms and / or expanding to new platforms opportunities.
Create best practices and guidelines for relevant teams.
Build and present regular reports and competitor analysis to key stakeholders.
Be a constant champion for social media in the business.
Ensure all social output is on brand and complies with tone of voice and brand guidelines.
Manage the social media budget.

Required skills
At least 4 years’ experience working in a similar role, managing a brand’s social presence (either in-house or agency side).
You will be fiercely creative with a great eye for design and a passion for ideas generation.
Highly organized and detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Experience of being on shoots and having a hands-on role in creating social first content.
A self-starter with plenty of initiative and a can-do attitude.
A flexible, approachable attitude with good problem-solving skills.
You will have a solid understanding of social media platforms, digital and knowledge of emerging trends, technologies and the social landscape.
Knowledge and understanding of social listening tools.
A great communicator who enjoys collaborating across multiple teams.
Strong numerical know-how for reporting and analysing stats.
To apply please send your CV to jobs@hush-uk.com with an up-to-date CV and a covering letter outlining your suitability for the role.

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications are encouraged from individuals regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

f3d2cf0297422638.title: Marketing Assistant
f3d2cf0297422638.description:
Company Description
Ubisoft Future Games of London is a Ubisoft studio that designs, develops and operates free-to-play mobile and digital console games. Founded in September 2009, Ubisoft FGOL create original and unique games such as the Hungry Shark series which has been enjoyed by over half a billion people worldwide.
We are a dedicated team with drive, passion and creativity, who enjoy being part of a forward thinking studio in an exciting and ever-evolving industry.
Over the next 5 years, we expect to be typically developing two to three projects in parallel, with regularly scheduled new releases added to our catalogue.

Job Description
We are offering a full-time position in London, and we are looking to fill this vacancy as soon as possible. UK based applicants only please.
Ubisoft FGOL is looking for a Marketing Assistant to join the studio’s established, creative, and exciting Marketing Team.
We are a dedicated team with drive, passion, and creativity, who enjoy being part of a lively, self-motivated, forward-thinking company in an exciting and ever-evolving industry.
Reporting to the studio Marketing Manager and sitting across Brand, Social and Art the Marketing Assistant will suit an innovative and driven person with great organizational skills, a passion for planning and setting tasks into motion to facilitate the team and has a vast range on interests, from general marketing and data collection to social media and art.
If you are a tenacious, sociable and detail oriented individual, get in touch! We are on the lookout to hire unicorns like you.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:
Provide support to marketing department
Support the team executing the marketing strategy
Work with marketing team to manage brand and marketing initiatives
Support Brand performing market research
Gathering existing resources and data for reports creation
Maintain schedules for marketing initiatives
Assist with social media and website content
Attend trade shows, company events
Providing project-specific administrative support
Gaming and Marketing Trends monitoring
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:
We are looking for an extremely well organized, energetic, ideas driven individual to be our Marketing Assistant. Providing support to the team and studio, working across all areas of marketing, you'll be involved in a wide variety of projects.
The Marketing Assistant position demands a skilled, confident, and dedicated all-rounder with the ability to work independently and as part of an always-busy team. You'll have outstanding attention to detail, strong initiative, and the level head necessary to work under pressure
This role presents an incredible opportunity to join a varied, fast-paced department at an exciting time for the business, so we require a quick-witted, experienced individual who can hit the ground running.
Assisting the Marketing team with all internal and external communications
Supporting the team with campaign driven marketing materials
Liaising with staff to ensure the smooth running of all projects
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
1/2 Years’ experience working in marketing or in a similar role
Understanding of overall Marketing projects and tasks
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Educated to degree level or equivalent, preferably in Marketing or Business Studies
Competency in Microsoft Office programs
Hard worker with commitment, dedication, and initiative
The ability to work well under pressure, independently and as part of a team
The creativity and confidence to introduce new ideas
Active listener with the natural ability to listening/questioning
PLUS
Passion for Game and the Mobile F2P Market
Knowledge of Trello or similar planning and organizational tools
Data analytics and collection basic knowledge

Additional Information
COVID 19 note:
Both Ubisoft and FGOL are committed to the health and wellbeing of our staff. We are currently working remotely during the stages of lockdown the UK has been subject to. Our offices have been set up to meet strict health and safety standards appropriate to the challenges of COVID 19, and we currently keep any physical attendance to a minimum. Our policies are constantly reviewed and may change over time as the risk level varies.
BENEFITS:
Ubisoft FGOL offers its employees some great benefits which include:
Flexible office working hours
25 days of annual leave + 8 UK Bank holiday + Christmas company day(s) off
1 day off if you get married (Wedding Day)
Mobile and Tablet Allowance
Game Allowance
Duvet Day
Personal Travel Allowance
Home Office Furniture Loan Scheme
Sick pay
Training Budgets
Contributory pension scheme
Private healthcare, Reduced gym membership, life insurance, critical illness & Disability cover
Childcare vouchers
Season ticket loan (for tube/rail costs)
Profitability bonus
Recruitment Referral Fee awards

2dfc8579ac9ed057.title: SOCIAL MEDIA & INFLUENCER MARKETING EXECUTIVE / MANAGER
2dfc8579ac9ed057.description:
Salary: Competitive
Location: Berkhamsted
Start Date: ASAP
Experience: Previous experience preferred but not essential
We are seeking tenacious, highly-motivated and innovative Social Media & Influencer Marketing Executives / Managers. The individual is responsible for supporting the wider team in the creation, planning, execution and tracking of internal marketing and client campaigns.
This role has plenty of opportunities for advancement, so would ideally suit someone who is ambitious to progress to a more senior role in marketing. The role is based in Berkhamsted with opportunities to travel to meet clients and be involved in influencer events.
Responsibilities
Develop and execute creative strategies for client Social & Influencer campaigns, collaborating with the team to devise and lead unique campaign concepts and exciting approaches to content.
Work with the team to develop the vision and strategy for client Social Media channels, influencer programmes and content strategy.
Manage and execute social media plans across key brand channels (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube).
Manage planned activity to deliver robust and profitable campaigns, maximizing the biggest opportunities for brands.
Manage implementation of client Social and Influencer programmes, working with in-house team to deliver value-adding, lead generating, brand building activity – and to help drive awareness, trial, purchase, penetration and retention of client target customers.
Lead Influencer identification and target lists for client campaigns.
Manage end-to-end influencer activations to meet or exceed client KPI's -including framing the campaign strategy, prospecting and curating talent, managing contract negotiations, influencer relations and post-campaign reporting.
Manage campaign budget to ensure campaign profitability and ensure deadlines and key milestones are met.
Execute and develop robust test & learn plans, based on analytical insights, to improve performance.
Requirements
Keen interest in Influencer and Celebrity marketing
A positive, highly-motivated self-starter, with a natural and passionate interest for digital media and content.
Strong communication, networking and relationship skills, with the ability to develop long-lasting relationships with talent.
Naturally confident and sociable liaising with stakeholders.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment, supporting new products/businesses and global clients.
Well-versed in the concepts surrounding influencer marketing and performance marketing.
Tech-savvy and intuitive with great ideas to reinforce our influencer marketing campaigns.
Highly collaborative with strong communication skills.
Excellent organisation and project management skills.
Previous experience in Influencer Marketing is preferred but not required.
Apply: To apply please send a copy of your CV and highlight the role of interest careers@brandchests.com

bb46773677846734.title: Social Media Manager, Europe
bb46773677846734.description:
Join the Major League Baseball international team in Europe as we embark on the next chapter of international growth. As we 'aim to transform America's favourite pastime into a global passion' we are delivering new activities to drive fan engagement across our three strategic pillars of Content, Participation and Live Events and are looking for a 'Social Media Manager' to deliver a key part of our content strategy.

The social media manager will be central in delivering content and across our 'Baseball +' communications territory. This is the combination of baseball and culture to create meaningful, progressive and accessible content to increase the relevance of baseball to 'Next Gen Sports Fans' (Gen-Z).

The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in sport and be well-versed in multiple facets of youth culture. Broad awareness of baseball is preferred, but the willingness and curiosity to delve into the world of baseball is essential.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

As the Social Media Manager for MLB Europe, you will bring a balance of creative storytelling and analytical powers to create engaging 'Always On' social media plans that meet required market-specific brand guidelines and marcomms objectives:

Increase awareness of MLB Europe amongst new audiences
Position MLB Europe as a brand that is challenging conventions and pushing sporting entertainment forward
Increase consideration of MLB Europe amongst Next Gen Sports Fans
Increase followers of MLB Europe social channels & engagement with our content
Continue to engage & strengthen the relationship with existing fans of MLB

You will work in collaboration with internal and external teams to define and execute against our organic and paid social strategies to raise awareness and foster engagement across local (@MLBEurope) Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook channels, with additional content distributed across our global channels, namely MLB's YouTube and potentially Tik-Tok channels.

In addition to reaching new audiences, you will strengthen and grow our social community by ensuring our channels are fueled with high-energy, engagement-driving content that sparks conversation and action while adhering to our creative positioning.

The Social Media Manager will report directly to the Head of Content, Europe and work closely with an in-house Social Media Coordinator and Motion Designer. You'll collaborate with multiple agencies, MLB international marketing teams, as well as key in-market partners from consumer product, sponsorship and broadcast.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead day-to-day workflow for planned and reactive organic content
Maintain a high standard of quality across all @MLBEurope social media channels, including copy, design, style guidelines, link tagging - and ensure copy is reviewed, compliance approved, and error-free
Work in collaboration with other MLB team members and agency partners to ensure MLB Europe's initiatives have 360-degree social support and alignment across all necessary channels
Assist with content curation and community management
Contribute to editorial planning and content development, balancing a content mix focused on the intersection of baseball and culture
Oversee paid social activities, from planning to implementation and reporting; Liaising with agencies and our in-house team who will execute
Partner with analytics (in-house and agency) to provide strategic paid recommendations on future creative content, formats, and messaging - optimizing budget across platforms to ensure we have the best ROI
Recommend potential influencer strategies to grow engaged audiences across local @MLBEurope channels
Track, monitor, and optimize performance against key KPIs
Own and evolve social media guidelines individualized for specific strategic goals
Provide best practices for social channel platform performance and content formats
Work with the Head of Content to develop a measurable social strategy that ladders up to our international business goal, delivering on brand values and driving innovation.
Evaluate new/rising social platforms and educate others on the priorities and opportunities
Track and measure success of social media initiatives delivering weekly overview, monthly reviews and quarterly learnings reports and analytics, collaborating with insights team on marketing campaigns
Maintain community management standards, moderation and escalation process to ensure design and communication are consistent with standards.

HOW YOU CAN MAKE AN IMPACT

Be a passionate and energetic social guru with experience working in sport and relevant youth culture sectors (e.g., fashion, music) either in-house or within an agency.

Be proactive about bringing new, innovative ideas to the table on how to grow reach and engagement with our target audiences, backed-up with sound research and analysis.

Have an understanding/emersion in contemporary culture and style who can elevate projects in order to engage and inspire our core target demo of Gen-Z sport fans.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Marketing, Design, Public Relations (or related field)
5+ years' social media experience at media, agency or in-house
In-depth knowledge of the major platforms' organic and paid features – spanning analytics, optimization, ad-formats, and bespoke content planning
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work with internal and external partners at all levels, presenting ideas clearly and concisely, both written and verbal.
Excellent strategic planning skills with the ability to identify and prioritize projects with competing timelines
Keen sense of brand voice/strategy and how to bring it to life
A passion for sports, with an awareness of all UK, European and major worldwide sporting events.
A natural affinity with Gen-Z audience
Experience across reporting tools e.g., 'Social Bakers/Emplify/Spredfast'
The role will require a level of process and compliance monitoring
Strong research skills
Thorough knowledge of G Drive, Google Documents, Sheets, Slides and confident with Microsoft Office programs, especially PowerPoint.
Highly organized with a positive attitude and a strong desire to get things done

OUR VALUES

Inclusive - Baseball is fun to play, and any one of any ability can take part. There is a welcoming and family-friendly atmosphere at our events and ballparks.

Innovative - Technology is core to the sport and international markets provide a testing ground to pioneer and shape new activities.

Elite Sport - MLB is a world-leading sports league, and one of the most competitive and compelling on the planet.

Authentic - Baseball has a rich history and unique traditions both new and old. These traits are to be celebrated and used to showcase the sport to new audiences

Integrity - Working as a team and playing fairly are core attributes of the sport.

Lifestyle Driven - MLB's Club marks transcend sport as lifestyle icons that tap into popular culture. Telling the stories of these emblems, the cities they represent and their association with baseball is a powerful and socially relevant way to position the sport.

Community Focused - MLB has the power to bring communities together and create social change.

Embracing Diversity - The league is made up of players from different nationalities and backgrounds. Showcasing these stars and expressing their character fuels interest in the sport.
All in-office and ballpark-based positions are subject to MLB's mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy

f3e05a0439484675.title: PPC & Paid Social Manager
f3e05a0439484675.description:
Looking for your next challenge in the world of Pay Per Click? Are you a Google Guru, a Facebook Frontman and an Instagram Idealist? Then we have the perfect next chapter for you in your journey through the world of Search Engine Marketing.
Boom Online Marketing is a leading digital marketing agency in the East Midlands, and is part of the rapidly expanding The Digital Maze group. We are currently looking for an experienced and proactive PPC & Social Media Account Manager to join our in house PPC team.
The ideal person will come from an agency background in a relevant role, managing Paid Media campaigns. They will have good problem-solving skills and an analytical mindset, the ability to work in a logical manner, and be able to switch between tasks for different clients with ease. The role requires someone who is capable of managing their own time and priorities, responding to client requests at short notice, and carrying out their own research.
You will be a valued part of a knowledgeable and supportive team, who all possess a strong desire to learn from each other and contribute ideas and development skills in-house to make all our lives easier.
This is a remote position with a couple of days in our office in Long Eaton per month, for meetings and monthly check-ins. All applicants are required to be able to work in the UK. We aren't currently accepting candidates who reside outside of the UK.
Essential Skills
Experience building sound strategies & proactively take strategic initiatives on the managed accounts.
Experience setting up and managing PPC campaigns, including Shopping campaigns on Google Ads and Microsoft Advertising platform.
Experience with Paid Social, particularly Facebook and LinkedIn.
Creativity for ad copy and ability to identify relevant information from websites.
Ability to manage own workload.
Good working knowledge of the standard tools and platforms.
Over 2 years' experience in a PPC management role, ideally in an agency.
A strong understanding of all aspects of online marketing.
A good understanding of conversion rate optimisation.
Desirable Skills
Experience using Google Ads automation and Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Google Ads scripts.
Knowledge of Google Data Studio reporting.
Google Ads Certification.
What We Can Offer You
25 days holidays per year, plus bank holidays.
Free day off for your birthday.
Salary will range from £28,000 - £34,000 per year, depending on experience.
Profit share bonus scheme.
Workplace pension.
Paid Health Awareness apps.
Hybrid working (remote & office).
Flexible working hours.
Excellent career progression within a growing business.

0eb37e845ba2389b.title: Social & Digital Content & Media Manager
0eb37e845ba2389b.description:
The key purpose of this role is to manage the regional development and implementation of fit for future social strategies and guidance, driving excellence and consistency in social content and execution across brands and markets for EMEA. This role will ensure the integration of social content, media and ways of working across the consumer journey and enable consistent brand experiences across ecosystems at a regional and local level. The role is a hands-on social expert who will work directly with markets and stakeholders to continuously drive excellence in execution across social in an evolving landscape.
What are we looking for?
3-5 years experience in a relevant marketing role where content and social media development and execution were a key part of the role.
Proven experience developing and implementing successful technical social, platform and media strategies.
Ability to analyse data and trends and turn these into insight to define appropriate recommendations and strategies.
Experience in social brand building capability within an organisation.
Excellent creative, design and copywriting skills with the ability to create engaging social plans and content. Ability to understand, replicate and develop the unique identity and TOV of multiple brands and flex tone and storytelling accordingly.
Ability to set and achieve goals and manage multiple projects and priorities.
Attention to detail. Ability to thoroughly review and approve content based on quality, fit for platform and alignment to brand & business guidelines.
Ability to build strong relationships across internal departments & external partners and manage a complex network of stakeholders.
Comfort with ambiguity and ability to navigate complex and changing environments within a global organisation.
What will be your key responsibilities?
Lead and evolve regional owned and paid social strategies and approaches across multiple channels, including but not limited to guidance on platforms, content, influencers and community management. Collaborate with various agencies and partners to maximise our expertise and ensure our social strategies and content remain fit for purpose within an evolving landscape.
Work with our insights teams to develop and lead a test and learn programme for social, including investigation and trial of new platforms and content types that will drive our brand and growth objectives.
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders across the business to ensure connected and effective social strategies and integrated brand ecosystems which deliver against broader marketing strategy. Be the key liaison in the social team for internal stakeholders and drive connection with Media, Brand Teams, Corporate Affairs, PR, Consumer Care and Digital Commerce.
Manage the integration and alignment of media and content for social at a regional and local level, owning media budgets and choices for social content based on defined regional media strategies and thresholds.
Define our approach to social commerce, working in collaboration with our Digital Commerce Centre of Acceleration to connect content to commerce throughout the consumer journey and drive conversion from social channels.
Drive social excellence and consistency across the region, managing the relationships with local markets and supporting the development and implementation of regional structures, processes and governance. Support and guide local markets in the deployment and management of social campaign, reactive and influencer content.
Educate and engage internal stakeholders on the value and power of social media, as well as social best practice, ensuring a collective understanding on the roles and performance of our channels across the business.
Scope additional and evolving requirements and needs to support social execution and excellence across markets and support the development of a fit for future regional social model that enables excellence, scale and governance.
Drive social excellence and expertise within the Social team and beyond through a continuous learning agenda. Keep up to date with evolving social media features and trends as well as keeping a close eye on and taking learnings from what others brands are doing across different channels.
Work in collaboration with the wider content team and in partnership with agencies to brief and develop multi-format, multi-platform social first campaigns and compelling social content toolkits, aligned to brand strategies and driving awareness, cultural relevance, engagement and conversion.
Manage and measure social performance, defining and tracking KPIs and benchmarks to measure the impact of social and translating data into recommendations to optimise content and drive incremental change.
Be the social and digital brand guardian for MW, knowing the brands, the audience and the guidelines and restrictions we operate within (health and wellness, legal and marketing restrictions etc.) and championing these across the business and with all our partners.
What can you expect from Mars?
Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

cb370cd96e98b39b.title: Social Media Strategist, Global Brand, Global, Enabling Functions, London
cb370cd96e98b39b.description:
Basic information
Location
London
Service line
Enabling Functions
Date published
23-Dec-2021
Req #
8128
Job description
Your opportunity
Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with other experts in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?
Want to make an impact that matters? Consider Deloitte Global.
Global Brand develops tools and resources to create an exciting and engaging brand identity consistent with our core values. Our digital solutions and strategies provide best-in-class presentation for elevating brand awareness to enhance our global presence while promoting collaboration and connectivity.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Your role
Central to this role is to serve as a subject matter expert on Deloitte’s off-platform ecosystem of channels, comprised of audience touchpoints across social media, mobile apps, podcasts, and digital advertising.
You will work closely with technologists, product managers, change and adoption specialists, and business intelligence teams to advance the use of enterprise technologies supporting Deloitte’s channel ecosystem.
In this role, you will provide support and management of Deloitte’s key social media programs, create best practices and training materials for the network, and implement new global digital marketing guidelines and governance.
You will manage strategic projects such as channel rationalization, brand ambassador program refresh, and other strategic projects influencing the broader member firm network.
Use your communication skills by leading and educating internal stakeholders and cross-functional team members, as well as managing a large-scale project end-to-end is a must.
Oversee and manage service/support programs, education/training, vendor management, social media management tools, etc.
Serve as Social Media SME to the Member Firm community of Marketers providing regular channel and platform updates on Community Calls and Forums.
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location: London based role
Work pattern: This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role can be worked on a full-time basis.
Your professional experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Fundamental understanding of digital marketing platforms and tools
Experience with enterprise social media technology
Digital marketing/social media experience within corporate communications or agency environments
Informed on digital marketing trends and industry best practices
Strong project management, organizational, and time management skills with impeccable attention to detail
Very comfortable communicating and delivering social and digital concepts to sometimes uninformed audiences
Superior interpersonal, problem solving, and customer service skills
Your service line: Deloitte Global
Across disciplines and across borders, Deloitte Global supports our network of member firms by developing and driving global strategy, programs, and platforms, and creating new solutions and transformational experiences. Deloitte Global professionals makes an impact that matters to the world of Deloitte. We share a passion for igniting change and a strong service orientation that shapes our organization and those it supports.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.
WPFULL SLICSS

5c74835777a8b99e.title: Social Media Manager (UK)
5c74835777a8b99e.description:
At Team Whistle, we're on a mission to build a global sports and entertainment company at the dynamic intersection of media, technology and commerce that elevates and inspires our audience and community of partners. Every day. Every way.

Team Whistle is looking for a Social Media Manager located in the UK to join our Content team, reporting to the Sr. Director of Content. This is an opportunity to join a growing team, manage social media handles for clients in the sports/entertainment space, and grow your strategic thinking skills.

This is a one year freelance role with the intent to hire that will immediately serve one of our sports clients. Experience or passion for F1 racing a plus.

Responsibilities:

Lead the development of social media strategies by turning data and analytics into relevant and optimal recommendations. Develop social media goals and KPIs and understand how to reach them.
Develop, schedule, publish and analyze content across multiple digital platforms (TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, Snap, etc.).
Consistently ideate creative concepts and social media franchises that are on trend and relevant.
Brief social media producers on new content ideas and concepts in order to bring ideas to life.
Manage day-to-day content calendars to keep track of upcoming social media posts. Schedule and post content once approved.
Manage client approvals on social media content and route any necessary feedback to team members.
Write social media copy that is engaging and relevant. Have the ability to transition voice and tone from one client to another.
Lead community engagement efforts (commenting, sharing, responding) across client channels. Monitor discussions, posts, and comments.
Consistently analyze content performance so you can adapt, refine, and adjust as needed. Understand what is working, what is not, and how to improve.
Thorough understanding of monetization capabilities across social media platforms.
Be an advisor for new programs; a respected thought leader to help teams throughout the company crack new content areas and formats.
Understanding of how titling and thumbnails can affect a video's performance.
Execute social media publishing strategies ensuring that all posts are accurate, punctual, safe and on brand.
The candidate is at the cutting edge of the cultural zeitgeist; understanding internet, social and meme culture and how to credibly and sensitively work within it whilst maintaining brand safety.


Skills/Requirements:

Experience working in sports. Knowledge of football, leagues, F1 racing a plus.
3-5 years of working in social media or relatable agency experience
Experience managing talent social media accounts, specifically in the sports space
Must be fluent in all social platforms, including engagement best practices, formats, specs and paid promotion opportunities
Strong writing experience with the ability to develop strong social media captions that are relevant and engaging
Strong understanding of social media best practices.
Ability to provide creative direction and feedback to create native social media content.
Experience working with creative teams, especially video editors and designers
Experience creating TikToks, Reels, Shorts a plus
Fluent with social analytics tools such as FB Insights, YouTube Analytics, Twitter Analytics, Simply Measured
Highly organized with ability to seamlessly juggle multiple high-priority projects at once
Team player with strong work ethic, keen to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Must have excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills
Ability to perform tactical tasks effectively and with minimal supervision
You demonstrate enthusiasm, passion and strong interests in sports, entertainment, advertising, and learning more about Gen Z / Millennials
Proficient in Google drive (docs, slides, etc.)
Willingness to work additional hours as needed
Fluent in English, French a plus

Team Whistle UK Proudly offers the following benefit Options:
Pension schemes - automatic enrollment (applies to part-time employees as well);
25 days of paid holiday, in each holiday year, exclusive of the usual public holidays and subject to proration based on date of hire (applies to part-time employees as well and calculated according to days worked per week);
Whistle Wellness days - additional time off at discretion of leadership;
Employer-paid medical and dental coverage (taxes are paid by employee);
Latest tech - Apple products.

9ad9e799cce22aff.description: Carl Friedrik is a product design company challenging traditional luxury. We design and sell premium accessories and travel goods.We're looking for an ambitious marketer to assist with and manage digital marketing channels, as well as explore new growth areas.About the roleThe Performance Marketing Manager will have the opportunity to drive growth at Carl Friedrik by evaluating, executing and scaling new initiatives. This will primarily relate to performance marketing channels.The successful candidate will be encouraged to develop our performance marketing strategy, ensuring that we maximise ROI and stay on track to meet goals.Your responsibilitiesIdentify, test and scale growth initiatives.Be responsible for a few key performance channels (Paid Social, Search, Display).Learn how to analyse performance across the business, from email marketing performance to NPS surveys.Manage campaigns, analyse and optimise performance.Build performance and business intelligence reports for management.Work directly with the founders, playing a key role in shaping Carl Friedrik's growth strategy.*Ideal candidate*We move in a fast-paced and rewarding environment and are looking for a highly-motivated individual that will thrive in our small, high-powered team.An analytical mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role. You should enjoy working with data to find patterns and opportunities. You should be knowledgeable in Excel and ideally have experience with analytics and BI tools (Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Tableau etc).We also encourage you to apply if you are creative and can connect ideas to business goals, organised and take a proactive approach to your work.ExperienceYou have completed a degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or a related field from a top university.Minimum 1 year's experience in marketing, eCommerce or other high-performance areas such as consulting or finance.More about Carl FriedrikWe are challenging the outdated practices that characterise the luxury industry.
