Everyday accessories should be functional and a joy to use — so form always follows function in our creative process.Accessories must also meet the demands of modern living. So we only collaborate with the finest materials and craftsmen. The result: products that last a lifetime.Carl Friedrik in the mediaNew York Times: “Best refined briefcase for daily use: Carl Friedrik”Forbes: “The new king in the leather goods space”Featured in HBO’s Emmy award-winning drama, Succession.*Benefits*Competitive salary, equity package and contributory pension schemeAnnual company trip + frequent team social eventsFlexible location — London, Barcelona or even remotePremium co-working space in Central London with gym and restaurantFunding for learning and professional developmentJoin a fast-growing, agile and international team, passionate about innovation and making a difference*Start date: *February - March 2022Job Type: Full-time

32b2154df85e5dbd.title: Social Media Manager
32b2154df85e5dbd.description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Since 2015, Revolut has introduced more than 18 million customers globally to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls, to global currency exchange and accounts for kids, customers simply get more with Revolut. Revolut Junior was launched in March 2020 to help teach kids money skills for life.
We approach communications the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to new feature presentations, our goal is to both inform and delight.
Put simply, we build things we want to use ourselves, that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a social media manager to help make Revolut Junior into a household name in our core markets! As a social media manager, you will deliver exceptional content over multiple social channels to help increase both Revolut Junior’s brand awareness & brand consideration in the mass market, maximising the opportunity that rapid evolution in social trends present. You will collaborate with a talented team of product, brand, and design experts as well as work closely within our growth team to deliver on our goals.
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Identifying all the approachable and hottest social media resources relevant to our target audience.Creating, scheduling and publishing content across multiple social media channelsBeing engaging, funny, responsive and of-the-moment to create viral and shareable momentsUsing your platform knowledge and creative skills to create boundary-pushing, attention-grabbing social content using the latest affordances on each channelBringing all of Revolut Junior’s product offering to life creatively, and promoting financial education in an engaging way for kids and teens
Calmly and carefully dealing with customer and tech issues, if neededYour daily routine will consist of media planning, copywriting, content management (text, pictures, videos) and tracking the efficiency
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
Experience in social media roles delivering highly engaging content and social followings in a world class consumer-facing business known for high quality social media executionProven experience of creating world class social content resulting in uptake and coverage in mass-market media outletsProven record of setting up and developing social media accounts across Youtube, Snapchat, TikTok and Instagram
Genuine enthusiasm for IT, high-technology business and fintech industry: you are aware of all the latest news and trends;Comfortable working in a high performing, analytical and results-driven environment
You’re fluent in English and your copywriting skills are impeccable
You’re a natural storyteller, creative and know how to build awarenessYou’re a team player, well organised and keep cool when working to tight deadlines

0a79b4aeb00d877b.title: Social Media & Influencer Coordinator (Living Proof. & Murad)
0a79b4aeb00d877b.description:
We are looking for a Social Media & Influencer Coordinator to join our team!
Location of the role: Hybrid - London (SE1) & Flexi Home Working

Brands you will be working on: Murad & Living Proof.
Overview:

An exciting and dynamic role, focusing on two global beauty brands within the UK market: Living Proof & Murad. Reporting into the Social Media & Influencer Manager - Living Proof, the role will focus on Social Media and Influencer outreach across Instagram, Facebook, Youtube & Twitter with a key focus on Instagram.

The role will support in managing the organic and paid social media channels, looking after the everyday community management, and playing an active role in developing their online presence. You will also assist in all proactive and reactive paid and gifting opportunities with influencers, and work on creative gifting send-outs & ideas with the PR team and assist on including influencer partnerships, content creation and affiliate activity. You will work closely with the Social, PR, Marketing and Operations teams to deliver strong influencer & social media results that impact the business commercially as well as providing support to Social Media Managers on both brands.
The role is varied, fast paced and a fantastic opportunity for the right candidate. You will have the ability to help shape our UK approach to social through your insights, creativity and implementation.
Responsibilities & Duties:

Influencer Outreach

Identify, outreach, and engage with key influencers for paid partnerships to increase brand awareness, social engagement, and traffic to the Living Proof & Murad UK websites.
Using tools and expertise knowledge seek out key influencers aligning with brand values and key KPIs.
Support the Social Media & Influencer Managers on both Living Proof & Murad with the execution of our Influencer strategy including paid partnerships, growing our micro/nano community of influencers, content creation and affiliate activity.
Work collaboratively with the PR team for all Influencer gifting activity.
Manage influencer orders for paid activities + micro/nano influencers, product send outs and administration for the team.
Campaign management tasks such as maintaining a database of influencers, populating a gifting log, liaising with operational staff.
Deliver and report on all influencer activity across sponsorships and content, reporting on key KPIs weekly and monthly and on an ad hoc basis when required.
Contribute to trend focussed meetings, identifying key trends within the beauty influencer space and wider industry insights.


Social Media & Community Management

Day to day social media & community management across Instagram, Facebook & Twitter for both Living Proof & Murad.
Responding to customers & influencers across the UK social media channels (Instagram, Facebook & Twitter) for both Living Proof & Murad.
Work alongside the Customer Service team to ensure customer queries are dealt with in a professional and timely manner.
Managing asset creation & uploading approved social posts to Facebook, Instagram and twitter.
Work independently and alongside the Social & Design teams to ensure a healthy pipeline of assets across all channels.
Social Listening and Tracking: introduce new ways to better understand what resonates with our community on social to maximise audience growth and engagement.
Build an online community: comment and interact with relevant conversations across social media platforms to keep followers
Research and organise on-brand giveaways with like-minded, luxury brands.
Monitor and develop reports on competitor brand activity.


What we are looking for:


Experience within beauty, fashion or lifestyle social media.
Proven experience executing social media and influencer strategies.
A deep knowledge and experience in creating content for Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, Twitter.
A strong eye for engaging social content (both social organic & paid social).
Content creation skills including photography, video and editing.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Experience with organic and paid reporting tools, such as Facebook Ads Manager.
Strong analytical skills; accurate and information reporting on marketing activity.
Ability to effectively work in a fast-paced environment with both marketing and e-commerce colleagues and partners.
Effective planning and time management skills and a keen attention to detail.
Innate willingness to roll up your sleeves and get the job done.


What we offer:


Flexible working culture to fit around your lifestyle.
Generous staff discount across our brands!
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays.
Summer Fridays – Finish at 3pm!
Competitive salary & discretionary annual bonus.
Vitality Private Healthcare Insurance.
Cycle to Work scheme.


As an equal opportunities’ employer, Unilever Prestige Hub Brands/REN/Murad/Kate Somerville/Living Proof is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees regardless of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse workforce because, in our view, diversity enables better business outcomes. We also believe that a more inclusive workplace, where people of different backgrounds work together, ensures better outcomes for all staff. From application to interview, we place inclusion at the heart of all we do. In particular, we strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join Unilever Prestige Hub Brands/REN/Murad/Kate Somerville/Living Proof.

ff19520b42323df1.title: Social Media Manager
ff19520b42323df1.description: We are notonthehighstreet.__We’re home to 5,000+ phenomenal small creative businesses that we are proud to call our Partners. But, now more than ever, this community needs our support. So we’re doing all we can to shine a light on these dynamic entrepreneurs, waving the flag for small businesses and generally championing their socks off.__On top of our brilliant Partners, products and customers (not to mention our incredible team who have been busy beavering away from home since 2020), the last couple years have seen great progress with our tech platform and customer experience. We are now looking to build on this momentum to drive our business to the next level. And that’s where you come in.*The role...*We’re looking for a Social Media Manager to work as part of the brand and social team. This role will specifically be responsible for strategic planning and executing our social campaigns for our gifting occasions throughout the year. This role will integrate our paid, organic and influencer channels under one unified social media campaign. You will report to our Senior Social Media Manager to help deliver our exciting new social media strategy.What you'll be doing: Strategically planning and managing our social media campaigns considering objectives, channels, formats, audiences and testing opportunities to drive a significant increase in brand awareness and considerationBriefing creative teams and agencies on social first creative concepts and assets across paid and organic, ensuring channel best practices are adhered to across each piece of contentWorking closely with our Senior Paid Social Executive on social media buying and campaign optimisationsManage always-on campaigns ensuring iterative testing and learning is driving optimisations on a regular basisWeekly and monthly reporting on social campaign performance and identifying opportunities for testing and improvementEngaging our community of followers and driving growth through active community management on each channel using our friendly brand tone of voice throughout all communicationsMove notonthehighstreet from a brand that joins in social conversations to a brand that starts the conversationWorking knowledge of social media management and advertising platforms including Facebook Business Manager and Curalate (or similar)Working closely with our Social Media Executive to ensure our organic content ladders back to our overall strategyAttend shoots to create socially native content particularly video formats such as Instagram Reels and TikTokBuild strong relationships with key internal stakeholders, agencies and platforms to identify growth opportunitiesProactively produce reactive content to ensure we are always staying abreast of new trendsProvide coaching and mentoring to a social media executiveShare our pride and continuous ambition and excitement for notonthehighstreetSome key skills & experience you'll needYou’ll have extensive relevant experience within a social media role either at an agency or in-houseIdeally experience in the retail or eCommerce industry, or demonstrably similar fast-paced environmentYou will have a strong understanding of key social media disciplines such as paid, organic and influencers and how the interact and compliment each otherYou will have a solid understanding of how to build a social media campaign strategyYou’ll be a master of how to write creative briefs and how to review creative work for social-first contentYou have a testing and analytical mindset, you want to know what works, why it works and how to improve it in the futureYou can take full ownership of managing a project knowing when to pull the right people inYou’ll have a fine eye for detail, constantly checking work and acting as a brand guardianYou’ll have experience working in a fast-paced environment, have excellent time management and have the ability to juggle multiple projects at the same time...And something else about you: You have a creative mind with meticulous attention to detailYou know the difference between formats, platforms and audiencesYou’re organised and thorough with an ability to work with teams to turn opportunities into realityOur perksIt’s important to us that our people are well looked after, which is why we offer everyone BUPA healthcare, life insurance and a pension plan. Because having a break is important for your physical and mental wellbeing, our holiday allowance is 25 days (plus bank holidays) AND your entitlement increases an extra day for every 2 years you spend with us.The team spirit at NOTHS House is legendary, and while we all miss the in-office massages, hair cuts and the abundance of free fruit, we’ve taken to our virtual world with gusto and bring the team together regularly for online socials!Hybrid ModelWe endeavour to support our people to make sure work….well, works for them. And the pretty big issue of the recent global pandemic has propelled us into working more flexibly than ever before. With the office reopening in October (YAY!), we’re using the lessons learnt over this period to evolve our approach to flexible working, and we’ve introduced a hybrid working week. So the NOTHS team get to work flexibly for the majority of the week and visit beautiful Richmond once or twice a week to ensure we all still get together as one #teamnoths. Plus, as of 2022 we’ll begin trialing fully remote months in January (to avoid the snow) and August (to enjoy the sun).*Diversity and Inclusion*Everyone’s welcome at notonthehighstreet – whoever they are, wherever their background.As part of your application you’ll be asked to complete a demographic survey to help us learn more about who wants to work with us. We really care about diversity and inclusion, and while filling this survey out is completely optional, it’s really appreciated and will only be used to help us figure out how to make our team(s) even more inclusive and attract more brilliant people to join us!*Apply to join #teamnoths*We’d love to hear more about you, your experience, and most importantly, why you’d like to join our team - a thoughtful cover letter explaining why you want this job will do!For now, our recruitment and induction processes are fully remote, taking advantage of the wonders of modern-day technology. If you are successful in your initial application we’ll explain more about next steps, as this can vary slightly from role to role. Good luck!Job Type: Full-time

27953036360bff60.title: Social Media Manager
27953036360bff60.description:
Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? Would you like to be part of a high-performing team of motivated individuals working towards a common goal? Are you passionate about developing high impact social media strategies and deeply familiar with online behaviours to drive customer growth?
Home based - some travel to our Dundee Office will be required.
Reporting to the Campaign Manager, but reporting lines may evolve as the company grows.
Part of a passionate team within a supportive, creative culture with ambitious growth plans.
About us
The Snappy Group is a technology-led Q-Commerce solution provider, delivering £100m of annualised sales for our business partners across various verticals. We have grown to 1,150 partners and some 700,000 users. We have ambitious plans for continued growth.
The two main verticals in which Snappy Group operates are the growing £41bn UK convenience grocery sector, where we work with retailers across most major groups (Regional Co-ops, Spar, Nisa, Premier, One Stop, Londis, Budgens), and the £87bn hospitality sector (clients include Hilton and Subway), disrupting both markets by offering a genuine alternative to the larger Q-commerce platform behemoths.
What we offer you
As a social media specialist, you will shape our social media strategy to meet our business objectives to drive new customer growth. You will become Snappy Shopper's voice on social media — elevating the brand and telling our story in meaningful, authentic, and engaging way. You'll be involved in conceptualising and the creating all social content and become a trusted voice for our customers across the UK.
Under your supervision, our social channels will become a destination for our community to engage and interact with Snappy Shopper. In addition, you will be accomplished in bringing ideas, campaigns, and moments to life on our social channels.
An opportunity to operate in a fast-growing tech-first business where you support the achievement of outcomes benefitting both our and our partners’ businesses.
A chance to shape the representation of our brand across all our audiences.
The opportunity to grow within a company which empowers its people to develop.
Role & Responsibilities

Develop and execute cross-platform social media content plans that resonate with our customers and are aligned with our brand vision and business commercial goals.
Responsibility for turning social followers into loyal customers and utilising analytics to understand onwards journeys, content boosting, and segmentation of audiences.
Manage our content calendars, reporting and optimisation across all social channels.
Continuously monitor emerging trends and use insights to create new dynamic content ideas and tests to expand our follower base and grow consumer engagement radically.
Work collaboratively with our Content team, Campaign Manager and Digital Performance team to bring new ideas, share knowledge and contribute to ongoing improvements.
You will manage community engagement and respond to social media comments, including resolving customer queries/complaints generated via social media while working in close collaboration with Customer Service team to provide best experience to our customers.
Manage governance of the social media content as required by the Campaign Manager, and other key stakeholders.
Track and produce weekly, monthly and quarterly reports on social media performance using metrics such as follower growth, engagement rate, positive net sentiment analysis and competitor benchmarks while continuously testing to maximise results.
Qualifications & Experience
Proven ability to develop a social media strategy in growing a follower base and building engagement.
2+ years relevant experience in creating, implementing, and ongoing development of social media strategies.
Create and manage a monthly social media content calendar of engaging posts.
In-depth knowledge of how paid and organic content strategies work together.
Experience managing influencer campaigns and how they can be used to extend reach.
Have experience or are willing to resolve customer queries generated via our social media platforms.
Prior experience in creating graphic/video and photo content, recruiting influencers, and working with creative teams is a plus.
Experience using social scheduling and analytics tools to measure and report on the effectiveness of social content.
Personal qualities
An innovator, always looking to identify and adopt new social media trends and able to make ongoing recommendations for improvements and adapt accordingly.
Thrives on creativity, organisation and collaborative working style in a lively, fluid and entrepreneurial environment.
Outstanding written communication skills, including copyrighting, proofreading, and editing skills with a close attention to detail for maximum social impact.
A keen eye for design and a passion for branding.
Strong organisational skills including working in a self-directed manner.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while demonstrating sound judgement under pressure and being adaptable to last minute changes
A start up mindset and spirit: we win as a team, we move fast, and we get things done.

9c4abbab916e1b59.title: Social Media Account Manager
9c4abbab916e1b59.description:
Why us?
£26-35k salary on a full time, permanent contract

 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

️ 33 Days Paid Leave

 Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

 High end laptop or PC and top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse

 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need
Summary
Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!

We are looking for a Social Media Manager with the skills and enthusiasm to manage a variety of our clients’ social media accounts with unparalelled attention to detail and a deep understanding of their strategy.

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!
About us
Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.
Responsibilities
What can you expect?

Overseeing the scheduling of social media posts for high profile client accounts
Communicating daily with clients to understand requirements, process any feedback, and deliver outputs
Coordinating with clients to ensure posts go out with all of the correct information, on time and that meet our standard of quality
Overseeing reporting and analytics for client accounts
Reviewing all elements of a drafted social post to ensure the details are correct before scheduling
Being an expert in knowing our clients’ brands, programming and priorities
Putting in place and continuously improving quality practices
Optimizing team efficiency
Serving as a team leader with a strong focus on performance, insights and process
Training team members across our tasks
Qualifications
What's important to us:

2:1 Bachelor’s degree or higher
Deep understanding of managing brand accounts on at least two of the following social networks: YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook
High level of expertise with collaborative tools for managing workflows and processes such as Monday.com, Trello and Airtable
Experience in working with a range of clients – agency experience much appreciated!
Client communication experience – best would be if you communicate regularly with the client, parse their feedback and solve their problems.
Experience in managing the team
High level of expertise with third-party scheduling tools, such as Sprinklr, SproutSocial, Creator Studio
Excellent oral and written communication skills, particularly the ability to communicate clearly with clients
Ability to prioritise workload and complete tasks to deadlines
Strong organisational skills, unparalleled attention to detail and time management
High work-ethic and self-motivation
Excellent numeracy skills and ability to analyse data quantitatively and qualitatively
High level of expertise with the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel and Powerpoint
A keen interest in the social media industry

As long as you possess smarts, attention to detail and enthusiasm, please apply.
Your working environment
Agility & Openness for Ideas We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!
Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do. The Social Media team is 30+ people strong and made up of account managers, project managers, social media specialists, social media coordinators, social media analysts, and more. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology and Industry Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-Notch Equipment We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. We have flexible working hours so you can start your day anytime between 8am and 11am.

You’ll have a daily standup with the team of the project you are working on. To best serve our US clients, we are looking for people who can work at least two late shifts (1:30pm-10pm) per week and at least one weekend day every four weeks. So, some days you’ll need to be flexible to work later if there’s a key delivery to a US client, but any time can be taken back.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.
Salary
£26k-35k per year, depending on experience and skills.
Employment type
Permanent / Full time. Either in our Edinburgh office or remote within the UK.
Benefits
Immediate Benefits

33 days’ holiday
High end laptop of your choice or PC equivalent, it’s up to you!
Top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
Paid training to further your skills
Annual Flu inoculation
Team outings and monthly meets

After 3 Months

Up to £700 to spend on a chair, desk or any other necessary workspace equipment to kit out your home office.
£625 budget every two years to choose your own mobile phone + monthly mobile contract paid for
Enrolment in workplace pension scheme with matched employer contributions
Money towards glasses with Specsavers

After 1 Year

Performance Related Pay Scheme giving an annual bonus of up to 100% of monthly salary whenever Storm Ideas is in profit
Access to the Cycle to Work scheme
Recruitment Process
First, we will invite you to an interview (60 minutes via Zoom). During the meeting, Caspar, our Head of Social Ops, and Duncan, our Social Media Director, will get to know you and try to understand if you’d be a good fit for the role, and at the same time answer all your questions.

After the interview, you may be given a short test to evaluate your expertise and attention to detail.

And that’s it!

5062f2083a02107a.title: Social Media Manager
5062f2083a02107a.description:
Being a Social Media Manager with us:

We at BRYTER are serious about the future of enterprise automation. To achieve this we want to attract the best people and offer them the chance to do what they do best. We trust you. We want to express exactly this, the BRYTER culture we cherish, not only inside our company, but to audiences across the world, and you'll be the one helping us get there.

You will be the voice of the BRYTER brand manifested through our social media channels. You will own all digital touchpoints of the company and help build our online community. You will work closely with Content and Design team to deliver our brand message through social media.

At BRYTER we are remote-first, and always have been. Being remote-first means we have a diverse, encouraging and hands-on culture and we are looking for a bright, high-energy individual with a passion to learn and contribute to the success of the company as a whole.

Where we hire

While we are a remote first company, we are currently eligible to hire FTE in the following countries: Germany, UK, US, Ireland, Netherlands, Poland, Serbia, Spain, and Switzerland. We do intend on expanding this list to the new territories, as our company scales in the future, so please do keep in touch with us, even if you are not based in those countries.

Responsibilities:

Develop and implement organic social strategies for our primary social media channels: LinkedIn and Twitter.
Create, schedule and publish content across multiple social media channels.
Use your platform knowledge and creative skills to create witty, engaging social media content.
Participate in the creation and publication process of content in various media in close collaboration with our Marketing, Content and Design teams.
Respond to community members and customers and coordinate support from Customer Service, Sales and Marketing teams where needed.
Protect and enhance the BRYTER brand by monitoring social conversations, trending stories and industry news; work with the Brand and Marketing team to develop conversational content as appropriate.

Qualifications we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree.
2+ years' experience as a Social Media Manager or in a similar role.
Excellent knowledge of LinkedIn and Twitter, as well as a broad knowledge of other social platforms.
Strong storytelling skills as well as excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.
Strong analytical skills.
Experience writing creative, witty and engaging content.
Experience adjusting tone to suit different audiences.
Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional teams, particularly with colleagues from online marketing, content and design.

What we offer:

The opportunity to shape the social media strategy of a hypergrowth SaaS player.
Dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that encourages and fosters career development and fast learning.
Full remote working environment.
Flat hierarchies and hands-on mentality.
Opportunities to build and develop your personal network.
Opportunity to influence and drive our Marketing and Communications strategy and participate in scaling a great product to global reach with extremely fast growth.
A competitive salary reflecting intense and demanding engagement. Participation in the Company ESOP.

Please attach your CV, a short cover letter, salary expectations and earliest starting date. We are excited to meet you!

Who are we?

We supercharge enterprise services by enabling business experts to build and distribute powerful applications. Our truly no-code platform gives enterprise teams the tools to build self-service applications to provide faster, more accurate services to their colleagues, without programming. Our product is especially geared to professionals in law, compliance, accounting and finance, who use our software to automate complex, recurring decisions and scenarios. Global brands from McDonalds and ING, through to professional service firms like Deloitte, PwC and KPMG, use BRYTER to deliver services digitally.

What is it like to work at BRYTER?

We are a remote-first Software-as-a-Service company, with people across the world. We believe that teams are more important than businesses and we are convinced that the right team can have the greatest impact. Our management team has successfully built, scaled and sold companies before and wants to create an environment where everyone can grow to their full potential and flourish.

We want our team members to take responsibility, to understand the mission and, ultimately, to be happy. That is why our organization is optimized to foster employee happiness, allowing everyone to have as much ownership, autonomy and mastery as possible. If you want to hear it straight from the horse's mouth on what this means, how working at BRYTER is like, our CPO and Co-Founder Michael Hübl has recorded a webinar, where he shares a bit about our remote-first working culture.

Our employees can choose to work from home or anywhere they prefer. We encourage everyone to take part in conferences, to share their suggestions across the business and to learn. Whilst we are remote-first, we have office hubs in London, New York, Berlin, Frankfurt and Dublin.

Being remote-first means we work extra hard to foster relationships, including daily coffees (only rule is don't talk about work!) and an in-person get-together every quarter where we spend the time strategizing, planning as well as just talking, having fun and getting to know each other better. To date we have always done this in Frankfurt, Germany, where we have one of our offices. That's why we sometimes call the time that we get together, on-sites. However, during the COVID-pandemic, these get-togethers have become virtual as well.

b1b030f248b4d793.description: For the fans, by the fans – Low6 inspires innovative and creative solutions that redefines future sports mobile gamification. We build a number of leading B2C games including Ultimate Fan ( the No.1 Top Grossing UK Sports App) as well as a number of B2B2C games for the likes of the PGA TOUR, UFC, NFL Cincinnati Bengals, NBA Detroit Pistons and Glasgow Rangers FC.Low6 was the recipient of “Innovation of the Year” at the 2021 EGR Marketing & Innovation iGaming Awards as well as winning “Rising Star” and “Virtual and Fantasy Sports Operator” at the EGR Operator Awards 2021.The RoleReporting to the Digital Marketing Manager, you will take charge of Low6’s portfolio of social media accounts, producing exciting engaging content and campaigns that drive measurable business results. You’ll be digitally savvy, up to date on the latest social trends and sports news as well as have experience engaging with, building and growing communities. An excellent communicator with a keen eye for detail, you’ll be able to manage a number of projects simultaneously.Your day-to-day:Develop, plan and execute Low6’s social media activities across all current and potential channels.Work with the wider marketing team to produce a continuous stream of engaging and informative content to attract, convert and retain customersImprove the look and feel of all social media channels.Act as a brand ambassador across social channels.Monitor and respond to social queries from the community.Support company-wide marketing campaigns with social media activity planning and reporting.Develop social strategies around key campaigns, sale promotions and launches.Identify and measure key KPIs and metrics to continuously improve performance and report back to the team.You will have:4+ years social media experience working across multiple brands or products simultaneously.Huge passion love of Sports!Social media creativity – copywriting skills and producing good graphic design.Strong organization skills with the ability to prioritize your workload and work to tight deadlines.The ability to analyze and collate data, produce reports and work with internal stakeholders to achieve KPI’s.The flexibility to work in a fast-paced environment under pressure.Strong verbal and written communication skills with attention to detail.Intermediate experience of Photoshop and/or FigmaAbility to add/edit video/motion graphics is desirableJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £35,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleOn-site parkingWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Marketing: 4 years (preferred)Application deadline: 16/03/2022Reference ID: Social

c8ff135f5ec0d8c4.title: Social Media and Events Manager
c8ff135f5ec0d8c4.description:
Social Media and Events Manager required to join leading Fintech organisation working with their Marketing and Comms team. You'll be a pivotal member of the marketing team, working closely with the Digital Marketing Executive, Copywriter and Marketing Director, and splitting your time between the two areas, making for a varied and interesting role.
Required skills include:

Proven background in managing and growing a social media following - for a B2B audience is desirable
Managed or been closely involved with events and/or trade shows in the past
Innovative and with creative flair, you'll have accurate and compelling written and editorial skills, with expertise in designing digital content for different audience groups, purposes and formats.
Impeccable grammar and communication - both written and verbally - with the eyes of a hawk for detail - you can spot a typo a mile off
Be confident in using a range of content management systems, social media platforms, design and analytics tools.
Are confident, polite and thorough in your written and verbal communication with senior stakeholders across the business, and also confident in leading conversations with external agencies, suppliers, clients and events organisers
You’ll be a true self-starter and whizz at managing your own time effectively to balance the two sides of the role and manage a wide range of projects with shifting priorities to a high level
Super organised and a brilliant multitasker
Have a questioning, analytical mind, and be happy to work with data when it comes to monthly reporting
Knowledge of online marketing channels and tools
Create long lasting relationships with clients and the team by going the extra mile
Have a knowledge of the wider marketing mix

For further information please contact Katie Collins

c943de6bfb0e928b.title: Social Media Manager
c943de6bfb0e928b.description:
Founded in 1856 by Thomas Burberry, Burberry is a global luxury brand with a distinctly British attitude. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success.
JOB PURPOSE

The Social Media Manager will be a team leader of the Organic Social Media team and part of the wider Social Media and Channel Innovation team. You will have a proven track record of demonstrating exceptional knowledge and understanding of the Social Media landscape – including content ideation & optimisation, publishing algorithms, building and engaging communities, social listening & reporting, planning & execution of socially-led campaigns, understanding of the latest technologies impacting key global platforms and deliver results with a drive for testing and learning.

You live and breath social, with your finger on the pulse of what’s trending and build & engage social communitiies around those trends. You are naturaully curious, always seeking out best practise examples, and love to break down barriers with new ways of doing things. You will manage the day-to-day implementation of our channel strategies, with a focus on emboldening our defined Social KPIs.
You are strategic thinker and results driven – having exposure to the broader creative, marketing, PR and event teams within Burberry, and are able to confidently interpret business / marketing requirements, using social insights to develop specific social strategies and briefs. You will be results-driven and effectively agile in pivoting campaigns to reach results.
You will be an expert communicator and able to build working relationships seamlessly. You’re attention to detail is second to none, and will ensure flawless execution of global and regional social activities.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage and develop the organic social media team (x2 Social Media Manager, x2 Social Media Coordinator, x2 Social Media Assistant)Support the Social Media Director with Brand and Business social strategy and the implementation thereofManage the day-to-day implementation of all channel strategies, focussing on our Social KPIsIn partnership with the Social AD, lead the relationship with the brand creative team to come up with big, cut-through ideas for innovative social first campaignsWith the team, build world class, highly innovative and inherently social campaigns for all key projects, that are insight-led and resonate with our target audience & community, driving reach and engagementSupport the team on all elements of reporting and driving a culture of report effectiveness across all KPIsAlongside the team, responsible for all content planning, delivery & execution and community engagement managed by the team ensuring content best practice and flawless exectutionSupport the team in dirving our brand advocacy programWork with a broad range of social tools to deliver campaigns and analyse their impact – from listening to content-planningWork closely and collaboratively across the social media and wider marketing teams, including Digital teams, VIP, PR, events and content teams to champion social-first ideas and execute activations, events and strategiesManage our external agency relationships, ensuring they are fit for purpose, reviewed regularly and renewals or transitions are timely executed without disrupting business needsBuild deep relationship with social platforms to identify new opportunities and develop innovative activations ahead of competitorsInsatiatable appetite to hit targets by monitoriong performance regularly to understand effectiveness of strategy and creative, making recommendations for continuous improvement and the ability to effectively communicate any strategy pivotsFind new and exciting ways to engage customers via social media channels to drive awareness, conversation and affinity to BurberryChampion brand values and messages across all relationship and social activations by demonstrating a considered and sophisticated understanding of the brand and luxury retail market

PERSONAL PROFILE
Extensive experience growing and managing social brand channels at scaleExpert knowledge of all Western & Eastern social media platformsA strategic and analytical thinker that can interpret numbers and data into actionable insights and learningsA creative thinker who can come up with original, highly shareable social ideasAn innate understanding of what Social First content isAn understanding of the Paid Social Media landscapeDemonstrates a strong work ethic and willingness to learn; enthusiasm is a mustHighly organised, managing multiple campaigns/projects at onceA natural communicator – confident in presenting social campaigns and activities to different parts of the business and managing key stakeholdersAbility to interpret, prioritise and deliver actions with a sharp attention to detailCan work under pressure, with the ability to be reactive and flexible in a fast-paced environmentExpereince in Fashion and cultureDegree level education

You’ll need to be available to work a minimum of two days per week, and this will mostly be based at our Shepperton head office.ABOUT YOU:· Self-starter with a can-do attitude· Lot’s of initiative ·On top of the latest social media trends· A TikTok connoisseur· Great sense of humour· Great a multi tasking with great organisational skills· A love for digital content· A quick learner· Ability to work well within a team· Solid communication skills, both written & verbalABOUT THE ROLE:· PAID internship· Managing the day-to-day running of all social media channels· Assisting with the logistics of all social media shoots· Support with research of concepts and execution of all social media content· Sourcing ideas and imagery for Instagram· Working closely with the project manager to understand our brand vision· Access to our senior team to expand your knowledge· The job is based at our Shepperton office, however you should be comfortable and have the focused environment to be able to work from home some days of the weekJob Types: Part-time, InternshipSalary: £7.00-£12.00 per hourAdditional pay:Performance bonusBenefits:Flexible scheduleFree or subsidised travelWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayEducation:GCSE or equivalent (preferred)Experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 year (preferred)social media: 1 year (preferred)Reference ID: AWR Social Media InternExpected start date: 14/03/2022

bea2528e494a8e46.title: Social Media Producer, Casual
bea2528e494a8e46.description:
Job Description

Virgin Radio is the best place to work in the world, why wouldn’t you want to be part of it?

Broadcasting from the top of the News UK Building in London Bridge, Virgin Radio UK is the home of The Chris Evans Breakfast Show with Sky and The Graham Norton Radio Show with Waitrose.

We’re looking for a world class Social Media Producer to come and take our morning social presence to the next level. Reporting to the Digital Manager, you’ll be working directly with The Chris Evans Breakfast Show with Sky team on bringing the show to life on the timelines of its existing fans, and crucially, potential new listeners!

Your role:

We are looking for a creative, journalistically-driven social media producer to produce lively, impactful social media content for Virgin Radio UK, with a particular focus on The Chris Evans Breakfast Show with Sky.

We want someone who lives and breathes social media and has a good understanding of and passion for great radio. You will be the link between the show and its listeners, and help maintain a circular relationship between us and them!

On a day-to-day basis you will:

Create social media posts that showcase the best of our output
Write accurate, engaging copy
Produce creative videos, graphics and other shareable multimedia posts to enhance our visibility
React rapidly to on-air output and support the show team by reflecting fast-moving topics as they develop and change
Collaborate with producers and presenters on social-specific ideas and see them through from conception to delivery
Communicate directly with listeners to answer their queries, provide consumer support or help turn their engagement into content

What we’re looking for from you:

Experience in writing and creating compelling, successful social media content, especially on Twitter, Instagram, TikTok and Facebook
Passion for music, entertainment and social media
Experience of working in the media sector and/or radio a bonus
Technical proficiency in multimedia technology including video editing systems, Photoshop etc
Proactive and motivated, with a willingness to take on any task
Positive collaborative approach to working in a busy studio environment
Availability to work morning shifts from our London Bridge studios

What's in it for you?

We love our business and what we do. We want you to love work as much as we do so we promise to offer on-the-job training and development enabling you to be the best you can be.

We are Wireless: Our people create award-winning national and local radio and podcasts which have become destinations for millions of listeners across the UK, Ireland and beyond. Our success is rooted in delivering content our audiences love. talkSPORT is the world’s biggest sports radio station, partnering with the Premier League and other leading sports bodies to deliver live commentaries and analysis from the best in the business. Virgin Radio UK is the home of The Chris Evans Breakfast show, Graham Norton at the weekends, and the best music. Times Radio and talkRADIO are the UK’s most exciting national speech radio services, offering fresh choice in news and current affairs across multiple platforms. From FM104 in Dublin, to Cork’s 96FM, our Irish local radio brands are distinguished by their connections with their communities.

Life at Wireless

We champion diversity and inclusion, we strive to maximise and encourage every individual’s potential and ensure everyone feels valued. We support this through our Diversity Board, D&I strategy & training, creating more diverse content and our intern and apprenticeship programmes. We also have 8 employee-led networks; Cultural Diversity, News is Out, GenZ, Sustainability Champions, News for Parents, Women in Tech, News UK Christian Fellowship and we are awaiting the launch of our Women’s Steering Group.

We take pride in looking after our amazing talent at Wireless supporting the Health and Wellbeing of our staff. We offer private medical insurance covering pre-existing conditions, discounted gym memberships, ClassPass at Home, weekly virtual HIIT, yoga and run club classes, and a ‘Bikes for Work’ scheme, as well as offering opportunities for physio/massage, counselling and legal support.

In addition we also offer:

A generous pension scheme with employer contributions of up to 5%;
25 days holiday and up to 4 volunteering days per year;
Maternity leave up to 18 weeks full basic salary & paternity leave up to 2 weeks;
Wide range of training available, plus full LinkedIn Learning access.
We want to ensure that everyone we meet has the opportunity to perform to their best when interviewing, so feel free to let us know, at any stage, whether you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, and we will do our best to accommodate.

1cea8fd2ae715647.title: SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER
1cea8fd2ae715647.description:
SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER
Psycle is looking for a passionate and creative Social Media Manager to join its marketing team. As Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing, implementing and
managing our social media strategy in order to increase our online presence and build an engaged online community.
We are looking for individuals with experience in a startup environment who are looking for a next role within a larger business. This is an end-to-end role, from working on strategy and planning, to content creation, building a community and reporting results to the wider business. You will have your finger on the pulse of what’s trending online, and an idea of how Psycle can engage with these trends.
Responsibilities include
Develop, implement and manage our social media social strategy, in line with key business objectives.Create monthly content calendars that reflect who we are as a brand.Oversee visual content creation for social media channels including but not limited to photography, dynamic video (reels, infeed and IGTV content) written and graphic content.Identify the appropriate content requirements; ensuring this is captured through own photography and filming skills, or supported with freelance content creators and scheduled shoots.Keep abreast of the latest social media best practices and technologiesStay up to date with fitness brands and competitor activityActively engage with our instructors’ social media as well as with appropriate influencers and influential brand accountsCoordinating with internal stakeholders (Heads of Concepts, instructors, studio
teams) to develop social content to promote their departments and engage
community
Build community relationships through social engagementMeasure the performance of social media activity against set KPIsWrite copy for all social media contentProduce original content such as ‘behind the scenes’ assets and other social first deliverablesCommunity management
Requirements
At least 3 years of experience as a Social Media Manager, with a track record of follower acquisition, and engagement improvement.Excellent knowledge of Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, LinkedIn, and other social media best practisesExperience of briefing and managing end-to-end content creation via third parties
(freelance creatives, agency etc.)
Able to capture high quality ad-hoc video and photography contentExcellent copywriting skillsGood understanding of social media KPIsPassionate about the fitness industry and a strong understanding of the boutique marketCritical thinker with excellent time-management skillsA team player with great interpersonal and communication skillsPositive attitude and ability to multi-task in non-traditional office environment
What we are offering
£30,000 - £35,000 depending on experience
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays
Unlimited free walk in classes at all of our studios
Free only access to Psycle at Home
Our head office is based near Tottenham Court Road, we work from home on Fridays

If you would like to apply for this role please email your CV and cover letter to careers@psyclelondon.com
About us
Psycle is a boutique fitness group with four sites across London. In 2021 we launched our online digital platform, Psycle At Home, which has enabled us to bring the infectious energy of our studios into people’s homes.

Psycle is an equal opportunity employer. We are passionate about creating an inclusive environment that promotes and values diversity for our employees and community

1fc836bd47531de3.title: Web Content Manager
1fc836bd47531de3.description: As a web content manager, you'll ensure all necessary content is included on a website and is laid out in a way that suits the user. You'll also keep everything up to date and accurate. The content you'll manage can include web pages, images, videos, blog posts, guest articles, reviews and occasionally social media and marketing copy.You'll sometimes produce copy and edit the site yourself, but on larger sites you'll normally act as a coordinator, commissioner and project manager, overseeing the work of other writers and editors. You'll produce content schedules and audits, which writers and editors use to keep copy up to date and to create new content at appropriate times.You'll be an expert in your organisation's content management system (CMS) and will produce user guides and deliver training, as well as work with the CMS developers and internal IT staff to ensure the system has been configured to meet the needs of the organisation.Web content managers also organise user testing and market research projects to ensure that the website's content is suitable for the audience.highly organized, with the ability to work on multiple projects at onceexperienced with one or more CMSstrategic, and able to oversee large projects and coordinate the work of othersan excellent writer and editor, with good spelling and grammar and the ability to adapt to house stylesable to research, collate and summaries information from different sourceslogical and analytical, with an ability to spot patterns, gaps and repetitions in web contentable to communicate confidently and clearly with a variety of stakeholderstechnically minded, with an understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other web technologiesknowledgeable about the website's users and industrywilling to stay up to date with developments in your subject area and in developments in the digital world.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temp to perm, Apprenticeship, Internship, GraduateSalary: From £10.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Diploma of Higher Education (preferred)Reference ID: WCM322

e1f488ab827903f6.title: Urban Outfitters Social Media Assistant- London, UK
e1f488ab827903f6.description:
URBAN OUTFITTERS - JOB DESCRIPTION
JOB TITLE: Social Media Assistant
REPORTS TO: Social Media and Content Marketing Manager, Europe
Urban Outfitters started out as a single boutique in 1970s Philadelphia with creativity and uniqueness at its core. 50 years on, and 55 stores across Europe later, we’ve become a destination for emerging design, unexpected styling, One-Of-A-Kind vintage and homeware that makes you want to hit the share button.
We speak to a social community of over 10 million forward-thinking individuals, bringing together a nostalgia for the past with an enthusiasm to shape the future. The UO community are culturally aware, they shape the music scene, they live a digitally native life and they wear style trends before anyone else. At our core, we empower our customers and staff to express themselves, unapologetically, living life in a way that's truly authentic to them.
We are always excited to bring new talent into the room, especially if you share our values:
Progressive — we move with the mood
Creative — we champion limitless minds
Inclusive — we open our platforms to all communities
Responsible — we work to reduce our impact on the environment
Compassionate — we care for each other beyond the 9 to 5
Sound like you, why not join us?
Role Summary
This role will play a vital role in the execution of Urban Outfitters social media channels across Europe. Assisting across all key areas of social output, this role will be involved in content creation, planning, and scheduling across multiple platforms. This role will be highly collaborative with a keen eye for detail and a forward-thinking approach to social media trends and what makes followers hit the ‘share’ button.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Responsible for day-to-day scheduling and posting of all UO EU social media channels including UO Instagram, iets frans… Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube and Facebook
Collaborate with the Social Media Coordinators, copy team and graphics department to ensure smooth running of weekly schedules including captions, shoppable links, tags and creative across all planned and reactive posts
Work with the wider team to develop, create and execute exciting social first content
Video creation and editing in-app and across key programmes
Conduct weekly research to proactively raise social trends, platform changes and new formats
Partner with the wider marketing, talent and partnerships teams to brief social content
Daily community management across all key channels, liaising with customer services and escalating comments to wider PR and marketing teams where appropriate
Support with daily, monthly and ad hoc social reporting to ensure close monitoring of content performance
Attend shoots, events and live activations to support with content creation, editing and live posting/streaming
Channel management includes evenings and weekends where required
What You’ll Need:
Must be a social native with a passion for social media, what drives the nuances behind each channel and how brands can leverage this to grow
Experience using social scheduling platforms such as Hootsuite, Sprinklr, Social Bakers and Sprout ideal but not essential
Video editing experience using in-app tools, InShot or Adobe suites
Outstanding organizational skills, time management and a meticulous attention to detail
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to identify trends; have finger on the pulse of fashion and culture that’s relevant to UO
Ability to deliver work on time and as promised with a strong ambition and work ethic
The Perks
Work-life balance:Flexible start and finish timesBring your dog to work
