d705ca8b1c442cb0.title: Social Media Manager (Paramount+)
d705ca8b1c442cb0.description:
Unleash your potential in a place you belong
Paramount+ is coming to the UK! A direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service, combining live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment, from our iconic, ViacomCBS brands, like BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon & Paramount Pictures. What better time to get involved in ViacomCBS’ biggest game changer in the history of the company!

Come and join a culture where content, people and ideas merge. An exciting and open place where your talents can truly thrive and where our employees make it unique.

Is this the role for you?
The Social Media Manager will partner with the Head of Social to oversee all social media for Paramount+ in the U.K., covering a broad range of disciplines, including paid and organic, social platform strategy, community management, as well as social analytics and insights.

What will you be doing?
The role will create and execute innovative and effective social campaigns and content that drive core KPIs of awareness and intent amongst new audiences, and retention among existing subscribers. In partnership with the wider U.K. ViacomCBS Marketing team, the Social Media team will localise global assets as well as develop and deliver best in class locally developed social content. The team has direct responsibility for the U.K. SVOD social marketing to drive the Paramount+ business objectives.

Execute and deliver to the social strategy for Paramount+ in the U.K..
Manage local content development, devising best in class paid and organic campaigns and ensuring timely creation and publishing of content.
Partner with Marketing, Performance, PR and Content teams to ensure all social activity is connected and intertwined with their activity.
Work hand in glove with the wider local and international ViacomCBS social media teams to ensure Paramount+ content and campaigns are fully deployed across relevant ViacomCBS owned brand pages.
Form long term social partnerships with key U.K. media partners, talent and influencers to broaden Paramount+ voice within the social ecosystem.
Be responsible for delivering social reporting covering a number of reports and trackers across our profiles and broader social ecosystem, tracking core growth and engagement KPIs.
Effectively use audience insight and analysis to develop social media activity that targets, engages and drives results.
Work closely with the Community Manager.
Manage and track regional & U.K. social media budget.
Manage multiple projects and stakeholders at any one time.

What are we looking for?

Demonstrated social media experience at a manager level
Deep knowledge and understanding of key social platforms incl. analytics
Solid understanding of broader marketing and media disciplines
Ability to formulate, manage high profile, paid and organic social campaigns
Previous agency management experience
Previous freelance resource management experience
Previous budget management experience

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working within the Entertainment industry (TV, SVOD or Theatrical)
Meticulous organisational skills
Strong presentation and communication skills
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Strong business sense
Experience within a multi-national matrixed organisatio
Everything else!
We offer an inclusive environment where you can really be yourself and find your niche. You’ll get to work alongside streaming platforms you can be proud of, with content that touches millions of lives. Plus, you can learn about the things we’re doing to make the industry more sustainable, and enjoy lots of perks:
A monthly streaming fund
All the health and financial benefits you’d expect, and some you wouldn’t
Flexibility to own the way you work
Mental health activities and support
All manner of BBQs, socials and events

Find our more about Paramount + from leaders
What are you waiting for? Put in your application!

Our Values:
Our values are intertwined and work together to drive the business outcomes we seek, and once combined we believe these will power our company forward.
Optimism & Determination : We share a positive belief that we can navigate and thrive in the landscape ahead
Inclusivity & Collaboration : We Embrace new and divers voices, act with care and work together to capture opportunities and manager through challenges
Agility & Adaptability : We think entrepreneurially, are resilient in change and move quickly to anticipate and create what’s next

ViacomCBS is an equal opportunity employer.
At ViacomCBS, the spirit of inclusion feeds into everything that we do, on-screen and off. From the programming and movies we create to employee benefits/programs and social impact outreach initiatives, we believe that opportunity, access, resources and rewards should be available to and for the benefit of all. We work hard to ensure that everyone with whom we engage receive equal protection from all types of harm or abuse, regardless of age, disability, gender, racial heritage, religious belief, sexual orientation or identity; an obligation we take very seriously.

We are proud to be a Disability Confident Employer, and we take our responsibility in safeguarding children and adults seriously. We guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria of the role applied for. For those who will be required to interact with children, we will carry out background checks prior to joining.

Should you need any support during the recruitment process, please advise your recruiter or email UK.recruitment@vimn.com where we will support your request as suitably possible. Additionally, if you have a disability or a long-term condition (including hidden conditions such as mental health, autism, dyslexia, etc), our amazing partner Evenbreak can provide additional help and advice. Find out more at https://hive.evenbreak.co.uk

232ad03320037ffc.title: Account Manager - Education
232ad03320037ffc.description: WHO ARE WE? The Student Room Group (TSR) is the largest, most useful and best-loved online student community there is. Millions of students turn to us first for advice, info and support on work, learning and life’s ups and downs. And that means we’re uniquely privileged to connect educators and employers to switched-on young people actively seeking out answers and meaningful connections.WHAT DOES A SALES ACCOUNT MANAGER AT TSR DO? Working within our Sales Team, you will be responsible for managing a defined list of University clients. You will build horizontal and vertical relationships within your client accounts (and their media agencies) to understand your clients challenges and provide compelling marketing solutions. You will maintain and grow revenue by nurturing and developing our long tail prospective clients.The Student Room's product range is a blend of traditional online advertising, annual profiles, lead generation tools and research products, which help clients connect to our booming online youth community. You will develop into an online advertising expert, so that you are completely confident in digital marketing terminology and the new and emerging technologies within the sector.KEY ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES· Proactively drive sales, be passionate about our products, develop and retain our customer base through calls/emails, research, known contacts, networking and account management.· Develop strong, long lasting relationships with key decision makers with a focus on the Student Education industry· Ensure all CRM, pipeline and sales activity log requirements are completed efficiently and thoroughly ensuring KPI's are met· Share market feedback with internal stakeholders· Work collaboratively with the rest of the sales team and our client services team to ensure efficient management of clients’ campaigns from start to finish· Regularly monitor your personal objectives· Deliver engaging, effective sales presentations that provide a clear message to all existing and prospective clients· Develop and maintain good levels of market knowledge/leads through networking, event attendance, trade press etc.· Organise and deliver monthly client meetings with our University Partner Package clientsThis job description is not intended to be all-inclusive and will evolve with the ongoing needs of the company.THIS OPPORTUNITY WILL SUIT SOMEONE WHO HAS· A passion for working on behalf of and for positive outcomes for young people· Experience working with targets and KPIs· A self-motivated, driven and goal-oriented approach and takes responsibility for their success· Ability to evidence their proven sales successes and achievements to date· Ability to embrace and adapt to change· Social confidence with the ability to connect and understand different types of people· Excellent communication skills both face to face, in writing and can deliver effective presentations· Creative and curious mindset and is prepared to ask questions and think outside the box· Drive to achieve commission and is financially motivated and the commitment to become the best version of themselves at workDesirable: · Experience in working in digital and online media sales in fast growth, competitive environments (highly desirable not essential)· Degree or equivalent (desirable)WORKING AT TSRWe really care about our employees’ development, happiness, wellness and work life balance. We offer a welcoming, friendly and supportive working environment in the heart of Brighton, plus we enjoy lots of great benefits including:§ Generous commission structure based on both personal and team targets§ 25 days holiday per year, plus bank holidays§ Your birthday day off§ Opportunities for ongoing learning and development§ Flexible working hours and arrangements§ Group Life insurance§ Generous pension scheme§ Private healthcare§ Cycle to work Scheme§ Regular social, team and charity fundraising eventsTo apply for this position to join the team, please send your CV and a cover letter (including your salary expectation).Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, this role will be fully-remote to begin, with a phased return to our offices by Brighton station. Moving forward, the role includes the possibility / option of remote working on either a temporary, permanent or mixed basis.For the most up to date details regarding all of TSR’s current vacancies please visit http://tsrmatters.com/find-out-about-us/join-the-team/ follow us on twitter and Facebook @TSRcareers, or find us on LinkedIn.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £27,000.00-£30,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Commission payBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsCompany pensionCycle to work schemeLife insurancePrivate medical insuranceWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:A-Level or equivalent (preferred)Experience:sales: 1 year (preferred)Work remotely:Yes

7e109aae45c19b25.title: Social Media Manager
7e109aae45c19b25.description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by our job advert.


We’re Community Fibre and our mission is to bring better internet to everyone. You won’t find any old and slow copper technology here. Our network, which we own and have built, is 100% full fibre. We install it directly into our business customer’s premises and into our consumer’s homes. We provide market-leading broadband speeds, at the best prices with a real focus on customer experience - we are consistently the No1 Internet Service Provider on Trustpilot as rated by customers. And as a result, we are growing fast.


We are passionate and love working with local communities, the clue is in our name! We want to bridge the digital divide in society and make Gigafast internet accessible to all. We also love it when local residents become team members of Community Fibre - over 20% of our talent is from communities that we serve.


We are not the new kid on the block, we were established in 2013 and have been disrupting the Broadband industry in London since then. Some recent key achievements include:


We raised £400m investment in 2020 from large institutions to secure our ambitious growth plans.
We have acquired over 500,000 wayleaves across Local Authorities, Housing Associations and Private Landlords in London to support that growth.
We have deployed our 100% full fibre network to over 300,000 premises to deliver the growth, which is rapidly moving towards 1 million in 2023.


We’re proud of our achievements so far, but we are not complacent and definitely not stopping here. To help us get to our future, we’re looking for forward thinkers, people with big ideas, people passionate about technology and most importantly hardworking team players to join us and be a part of our growing business.
Job purpose:


**ROLE TO START JUNE 1ST**


Community Fibre, a London-based 100% full fibre broadband provider is looking for an experienced Social Media Manager that will play a crucial role in our brand awareness, brand perception and community engagement, to ultimately drive growth.

Working in close collaboration with the Senior Social Media & Brand Manager, you will develop and execute our owned and earned media strategy to stimulate conversation in social networks, blogs, and other communities channels to engage our brand audiences: residents, landlords and businesses. You will manage different types of projects that support the execution of our brand and marketing plan, increasing brand awareness and engagement.


In this role, you will work collaboratively with other members of the marketing team and various departments in the company. You will be given plenty of opportunities to develop your own ideas, to be part of projects from initial briefing through to final delivery, and to grow and develop within your own role and as our digital capabilities expand.


If you live and breathe social media and you approach projects with a digital-first mindset, then we want to meet YOU!


What you’ll be doing:

Gather prospect/customers insights and trend research to support the definition of strategies that will shape the perception of our brand
Oversee the setting of brand guidelines, style guides, company storytelling, product branding and make sure that consistency is maintained across the company
Manage, with the support of our social media agency the day-to-day handling of social media channels such as LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and YouTube, by validating the posts and making sure that all responses are addressed in a timely manner, or directly responding to followers when necessary
Support the social media agency and the Customer Support team by providing relevant messaging and content to manage the conversation on social media platform
Define, plan, and deliver creative and engaging social media content, focusing on relevant topics linked to Gigafast broadband and London centric
Identify opportunities to expand our reach through additional social media channels, relevant blogs, influencers, brand partnerships
Set up targets and implement a weekly reporting
Promote the use of social media channels within the company
Liaise between various internal and external stakeholders (for example the press media agency, the social media agency, the digital paid media team, digital inclusion team) to maximise the earned media


The experience we’re looking for you to bring:

Proven experience for more than 5 years in social media channels and brand content management
Up-to-date with the latest digital technologies and social media trends
Creative and hands-on experience in content management
Familiar with video editing and design tools
Excellent copywriting skills for different audiences across a range of channels
Strong attention to details
Excellent stakeholder management experience
Capacity to define a strategy and implement it. Not afraid to be hands-on


Why join us:

Be part of an exciting scale-up business where you can bring your ideas and bring your knowledge; we value your contribution.
We all love time off whether that’s going on an exotic holiday or a staycation, you’ll get 25 days holiday to enjoy, increasing by 1 day for each year of service up to 28 days.
Birthday leave, our treat to you.
Keen cyclist, join our cycle to work scheme.
Flexible WFH policy.
Enjoy the perks of Vitality health.
You get to work with an amazing bunch of people.


What happens next:

You’ve done your bit so sit back and relax, we will review your application and come back to you.


If we think you’re not quite right for the role you have applied for but maybe a better fit for another, we’ll let you know.


Want to know more about a career at CFL, check out our careers page: https://communityfibre.co.uk/jobs


We are an Armed Forces friendly organisation. We are an equal opportunities employer that values diversity in our team, we welcome applications from all backgrounds.

4b9c9c8c619bcb0c.title: Social Media and Influencer Manager
4b9c9c8c619bcb0c.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY
We have the exciting opportunity to join our fast-paced, ever-growing business as Social Media and Influencer Manager.
Reporting to the Head of Brand Marketing, you will be responsible for driving exponential growth, developing creative engagement strategies and the management of our social channels and ambassador program for both Joma Jewellery and Katie Loxton brands across our global business.
You live and breathe social and are an expert in emerging trends, while keeping your feet firmly rooted in our target audience’s world. You will combine your strategic thinking with creative flair. The Social Media and Influencer Manager is a cross-function and crucial role for all our brand marketing activations, from global campaigns to local tactics and conversation drivers.
You will partner with the Head of Brand Marketing and Head of Marketing to continually refine our social media strategy – this should include best practice tactics to meet ambitious growth targets and drive brand equity.
You are able to work from home, but will be required to commute to our Head Office in Banbury, Oxfordshire for key meetings/events and team days.
BEHIND THE BRANDS
We’re a family-run, entrepreneurial company with an exciting pace of life and a bright and friendly team. We are passionate about creating stunning products with a personal touch and innovating our business behind the scenes. We value creativity, collaboration and integrity.
HOW YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE
Social Media Strategy & Management:
Improving social reporting within the business to ensure we are highlighting and sharing the key figures that represent our successes and key learnings, including implementing more robust month on month reporting to better demonstrate long and short term achievements.
Overseeing the management of all social channels across our brands, driving continuous growth, reach and engagement to achieve forecasted KPI’s (with focus on Instagram, Facebook and Tik Tok).
Driving and overseeing the social media calendars and plans for our brands, ensuring we’re taking a strategic approach to all social content, including how we amplify brand campaigns and stories, as well as driving UGC and encouraging audience interactivity.
Leading and developing targeted large scale and always on social media growth campaigns with the wider brand team, working with regional teams to execute for maximum impact.
Working closely with the Digital Marketing team to ensure consistencies of content across organic and paid platforms, ensuring paid campaigns align with and reinforce organic assets and messaging.
Being the authoritative voice on social media within the business and stay up to date with new social tools and functions, upcoming social networks and platforms and content trends.
As the business continues to grow internationally, helping to define and shape the international social media strategy, guiding how we execute multi-territory content and activations.
Regularly create organic content for social channels, including Instagram Reels and TikTok content. As well as attending events and photoshoots to produce inspiring content to drive brand interest and engagement.

Community & Influencer:
Leading on the development and continuous growth of our global Brand Ambassador program, to drive social following, engagement, brand awareness and commercial performance.
Building and nurturing strong, long-term partnerships with celebrities and influencers, whilst ensuring continued research into new influencers.
Working with US Brand Manager to identify and recruit suitable influencers, brand partners and content creators in-line with global marketing goals.

THE TALENT YOU'LL BRING

Minimum 5 years experience in social media and influencer marketing – experience of managing a global platform in the UK and US would be preferred
Excellent attention to detail, both creatively and numerically
Creative flair and a passion for social media and content creation
Ability to think global, while acting local
Self motivated with excellent planning and organisation skills, managing calendars and campaign presentations
Happy to work flexibly and with the ability to learn quickly and multi task
Previous experience with line management

PERFECTLY PACKAGED

A salary of £40,000 - £45,000 per year
A broad benefits package including our staff favourite – a very generous staff discount across both our brands. See all of our benefits on our careers portal
Our staff exclusive interactive magazine
Opportunities to make an impact as well as learn and develop further
An innovative and friendly workplace with a team we’re proud to be part of. Find out more about us and our culture on our careers portal
We strive to be the best in our field and we know that happens by hiring the best people, which means a diverse and talented team. We don’t hire based on age, background, or nationality – it’s what you bring to the team that counts.

0e69e499dbb2d5ad.title: Social Media Manager
0e69e499dbb2d5ad.description:
Social Media Manager
Birmingham Hybrid
£25,000 - £35,000
I am recruiting for a social media whizz to join an award-winning Agency based near Central Birmingham as the new Social Media Manager.
The right candidate will have an uncompromisable love for Social Media, an undeniable knack for communication and the ability to work across accounts seamlessly and professionally. Whilst this is an account management role, the client is looking for someone who is willing to oversee the day to day management of organic socials. If this is you, keep reading!
A first-class understanding of all social media forums, focusing specifically on Instagram and Facebook
A demonstratable understanding of organic social, including Content creation and copy
At least two years experience in a similar role
The ability to pitch ideas, offer consultancy and deliver industry-leading work, producing faultless campaigns/strategies
Happy to work across teams to ensure a seamless process from conception to completion, including Designers, Sub-editors and analysts
The confidence in your ability to keep up to date with emerging platforms and updates, in order to continually stay ahead of the competition
Evidence of experience in managing your own accounts, working consistently to achieve or exceed your KPIs in an organic social role
A portfolio that documents all your previous social media successes would be looked upon favorably

This agency believes in looking after and rewarding the team, which means role a number of great benefits including enhanced holiday leave, flexible working opportunities, and the opportunity to buy/sell holiday, mental health wellbeing, free counseling just to name a few. For a full list of these click the link to apply and get in touch!
Keywords: Social, Social Media, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Linkedin, Pinterest, Account, Account Manager, Organic Social, Content, Copywriting, PR, Public Relations, Copy, Video, Photo

bf53cd81606a8b19.title: Community Manager
bf53cd81606a8b19.description:
Some careers have more impact than others.
If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be.
Global Communications, designs and implements communications strategies which support HSBC’s business objectives, in line with our values, and enhance and protect our reputation among key stakeholders.
We are currently seeking an ambitious individual to join our team as an Community Manager, working together with colleagues to define, manage and achieve divisional business targets.
Role Purpose
We are currently seeking an ambitious individual to join our Group Reputation team, working together with colleagues to define, manage and achieve divisional business targets.
Group Reputation are responsible for protecting the reputation of the bank, by delivering world-class issue handling, crisis management, and scenario planning, for our most pressing known and emerging risks. We are also responsible for enhancing the reputation of the bank, through a compelling narrative about growth and transformation and a credible voice on our identified reputation themes, addressing our target audiences directly.
In this role, you will:
Create world class content for our corporate social media channels that is additive to HSBC’s reputation, partnering with a broad range of Communications colleagues to ensure social content lands with maximum impact and ongoing audience engagement via our social channels
Work closely as part of a team with Planning and Publishing colleagues and other HSBC departments that rely on social media to develop effective and appropriate runways of content for social channels
Work with our senior leadership to help key stakeholders shape and manage their social media profiles, helping to grow our thought leadership on the themes that positively differentiate us, and building external and internal advocacy for what’s best about HSBC
Work across Communications through the project management of key campaigns and moments, helping to ensure that outputs and outcomes align to content objectives and support audience engagement
Requirements
To be successful in the role, you should meet the following requirements:
Experience of writing social media copy, ideally at a complex global organization
Experience of generating and commissioning creative multimedia assets that enhance and augment that copy and narrative messaging
A proven history of helping grow social media followers and engagement across the core channels (LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram)
The ability to create, at pace, social media content which will be relevant to and appropriate for HSBC’s key target audiences
Knowledge of key content creation, planning and reporting tools, such as Sprinklr, Monday.com, Canva, video editing tools, image creation tools, platform ad managers
An understanding of the role of social media within a matrix of owned, earned and paid media
A proven ability to work with stakeholders from multiple teams within internal and external functions, including senior leadership
An ability to work within an ambiguous environment, prioritise and reconcile competing demands and resolve complex issues
You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.
https://mycareer.hsbc.com/external
HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.
Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.
As a business operating in markets all around the world, we believe diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why HSBC is committed to being an inclusive employer and encourages applications from all suitably qualified applicants irrespective of ethnicity, religion, age, physical or mental disability/long term health condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by local law in the jurisdictions in which we operate. Within the work place you will have access to various employee resource groups which aim to promote and achieve a healthy work / life balance and support our diversity ambitions. HSBC has in place processes in order to avoid nepotism, which means to avoid creating circumstances in which the appearance or possibility of conflicts of interest may exist within the hiring process.

78420c8c6cc8657b.title: Social Media Brand Manager
78420c8c6cc8657b.description: Blackpool Food Bank is a registered charity who is passionate about rescuing edible surplus food and supporting families who find themselves in difficulty in these challenging times. The charity has undergone considerable growth over recent years as its services have broadened and we are now a distributor/supplier of food to a wide network of organisations also providing food poverty support.We were a leading player in the launch of what was formerly the Blackpool Food Partnership providing food provision for the Blackpool area in partnership with the Local Authority, ecumenical partners, charities and community groups. This network has expanded to include services delivering across the Fylde Coast.We are looking for a creative and organised individual to combine marketing and social media management skills to elevate our social media platforms and develop informed marketing strategies and brand assets, which will include interacting with end-users and our food partners, creating on-brand interactive and engaging content and assets for both digital use and print purposes and lead our marketing strategy.The post holder will take responsibility for leading the brand identity, creative campaigns, and social media platforms, working alongside the Senior Leadership Team (SLT), playing a vital part in the strategy and direction of the organisation.Key Responsibilities:Leading the strategy and content creation for our social media platforms, including the execution, and posting of content to all social media channels, ensuring a consistent message across the board and the day-to-day running of the social media platforms. To include responding to messages/questions in a timely manner to ensure the organisation’s reputational integrity.The ability to collect data and analyse engagement and interaction across social media platforms, respond to emerging trends to improve future content and report on progress to Senior Leadership Team.Develop and maintain Brand Guidelines and tone of voice that help to keep all areas of the organisation “on-brand” across any internal and public facing assets.Using CAD/graphics skills to produce a variety of digital and print assets, ranging from social media content to regular newsletters for our partners, liaising with external printers etc where required to produce promotional materials.Research and monitor activity of other organisations and trends within our sector to benchmark us and implement good practice where you see opportunity to do so. This might include expanding into other social media platforms where appropriate.Required Skills/Attributes:Strong knowledge of how to use, manage and maintain social media platforms on behalf of a business/organisation. Facebook, Instagram and Twitter knowledge particularly important currently.Understanding of and ability to lead the execution of marketing and promotional activities for an organisation.Strong knowledge of CAD/graphic software (Adobe or equivalent) to produce social media content, promotional materials and assets for digital and print purposes.Competent photography and video skills, using smartphone device for social media content.Good knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).Experience, whether a BA degree in related subject area, or industry experience, which you can demonstrate via a portfolio of work and CV.Ability to review progress, analyse data and trends and implement changes to improve the organisation’s marketing and communications.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Self-motivated, creative problem-solving skills.A professional level of pride, attention to detail and accountability in your work.Job Types: Part-time, Fixed termContract length: 12 monthsPart-time hours: 21 per weekSalary: £10,000.00-£12,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekend availabilityApplication deadline: 25/03/2022Reference ID: BFB-SMBM

Funko’s inimitable designs span: vinyl figures, apparel, plush toys, board and card games, keychains and more. Funko also owns brands including; the innovative Snapsies™ toy, the Japanese inspired Paka Paka, Wetmore Forest and more. With a world renowned in-house production and creative team, the Funko brand will only grow from here!*Funko EMEA Overview*Funko EMEA’s HQ is based in West London’s Hammersmith, UK and its brand-new state-of-the-art distribution centre is based in Coventry, UK. Keep up to date over at Instagram (@LoungeflyEurope)!*Role Purpose*Support Funko's EMEA business from a digital marketing perspective and assist the Marketing Team on various campaigns and voice.Leading community management across our channels: engaging with fans, responding to queries and maintaining brand loyalty.Assisting with content creation for the social media channels, including and presentation creation.Managing samples that come to the office directly from the factories for marketing use.Supporting with community activities at consumer shows such as MCM Comic Con London.Run weekly competitions across social platforms; sending samples to competition winners and licensors.What You’ll Bring: Excellent written and verbal skills.Good knowledge of the various social media platforms Funko works across: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tik Tok.Great Interpersonal Skills to build strong relationships with the various teams internally.Personable and pro-active with a flexible and adaptable approach.Good understanding of marketing principles.Well-organised with a customer-oriented approach.Excellent knowledge of MS Office and other relevant programmes.High attention to detail.Ability to recognise demand levels and prioritise accordingly.Basic understanding of Photoshop Is preferred but not essential.Effective time management.Understanding or interest in pop culture is a must!Job Type: Full-time

c2ee7af64c137500.title: Senior Social Media Manager
c2ee7af64c137500.description:
A fun, innovative and empowering skincare brand is looking for a highly creative, charismatic new Senior Social Media Manager to join the team. This is a remote-based role working from Ireland or the UK.

The Role

As Senior Social Media Manager you’ll lead the social media content planning and creation for all social channels, including Instagram, Facebook, TikTok and LinkedIn. You will liaise with the marketing team to ensure consistency and accurate representations of the core brand values. You’ll keep up-to-date on new skincare and social media trends, coming up with creative and innovative new social media strategies that fit the tone of the brand.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a small but ambitious brand that is growing rapidly.

How you’ll dazzle us

The ideal candidate for this role is someone who lives & breathes social media and is up to date with all the current social trends. To thrive in this role you’ll need at least three years of relevant experience and know how to run excellent social media campaigns on all platforms.

You’ll have a brilliant understanding of reporting and analytics and will be comfortable presenting campaign results and impact. You’ll also understand the importance of planning and defining structure to keep the entire company visible of the Social Media plans and actions.

We are looking for someone with a creative sparkle and a can-do, high energy spirit. You’ll need Media and Content production experience, and ideally will have experience using the Adobe Suite. Previous experience working in the skincare sector, either for a brand or at an agency, is essential.

What happens next

If you are highly motivated with a passion for all things skincare and social media, apply now via the form below!

ef31c50fc8107917.title: Marketing Project Manager (Remote)
ef31c50fc8107917.description:
The marketing project manager will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and implementing projects within timelines set out by the C-level management and head of marketing. You will also effectively monitor and present project updates to relevant stakeholders, clients (token projects, third parties), or project team members (Marketing team, developers other PMs). Your work will be to support the growth and execution of the marketing strategy. You will also be expected to also work to support ongoing operational marketing for new products and features such as landing pages, announcements, educational blog posts to support the new feature.

It is your responsibility to ensure that various teams are working in sync and should a date need to be changed due to legal requirements (legal review/c-level sign off), you manage that change amongst the teams to ensure launch and communications meet our strict legal requirements.
You will be expected to regularly review the efficiency of new project deliverables and discover new ways to make product launches more efficient. You will also be required to arrange meetings with the marketing team to review analytics and results with the marketing team and manage to discover new ways to optimise product launches.
Job description

Point of contact for Project Managers and keep them informed of marketing developments
Keep the senior leadership informed through ongoing reporting to help meet business needs
Marketing strategy planning for pre/post-launch of a product/feature
Manage Marketing tasks in Asana, keeping track of the development and ensuring deadlines are met
Ensure all content is in line with our communications strategy working closely with internal departments for close review and final sign off
Develop a strategy for Cycle Time Analysis to better understand the time needed to successfully launch a project
Use this data to analyse where delays may occur and how we can improve processes and communication internally to avoid this.
Member of the Project Management Institute (PMI)
Motivated team player who actively seeks challenging projects and proactively shares experiences and knowledge towards the team’s goals.
Good understanding of multichannel marketing and how users interact with each channel
Experience in using data, research and customer feedback to improve a campaign to inform future activities
Experience in planning and developing digital marketing campaigns from start to finish working with a number of teams to ensure a marketing campaign is ready for project launch
Experience using a number of email marketing solutions
Work closely with the marketing manager and social media strategist to enhance and maintain the company's social media presence
Be able to write captivating copy to engage existing users and attract new users to the website
Google certification would be an advantage
Knowledge of the cryptocurrency industry and trading would be an advantage but not necessary
Work to strict deadlines for project launches and experience using project management tools such as Asana.

d4c63d857de89683.title: SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER
d4c63d857de89683.description:
LOCATION
Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk
CONTRACT
Permanent, full time
JOB STYLE
Hybrid or full office based
SALARY
Up to £30,000pa plus benefits
STARTING
According to notice
PUBLISHED
24 Feb 2022

JOB DETAILS

Michelle Denny Recruitment has an opportunity for a creative Social Media Manager to join a small but perfectly formed team in Bury St Edmunds, managing the media for an international business who specialise in the movement for classic car & motorsport industries. Potentially working between office and home, the salary package is up to £30,000pa, which also comes with an additional set of benefits.
The scope of the job is exciting and wide, with the project of transforming the current social media output to bring the UK, US and German brands all into line, taking ownership of social marketing, managing the content, blogs and analytics.
Main responsibilities:
Manage UK, US & Germany websites, liaising with developers
Development of customer interface for articles, blogs and video content within the motor industry, including classic cars & motorsport
Manage any website redesign needed, with regular upload of new pages and blogs
Create engaging blog content
Explore ecommerce options and develop ideas to enhance business
Build a social media strategy and develop a social media calendar for media campaigns
Create a budget for all marketing by country
Develop additional forms of marketing and advertising
Regularly check the performance of all PPC and deliver reports with recommendations
Manage Infusionsoft (CRM – now Keap) and analytics


You’ll need:
A working knowledge of Facebook (Meta), analytics, writing blogs and ideally WordPress
Adaptability and great communication skills to liaise productively with the GMs of UK & US
Creativity and drive to develop and keep the company at the forefront of digital assets to drive the business forward
The ability to occasionally travel internationally
Great creativity and friendly team spirit!


The Social Media Manager role carries autonomy and the opportunity to creatively enhance an already buoyant & busy business using a fresh and creative approach. Salary is up to £30,000pa with pension, private health plan, plus an enhanced 24-day holiday plus public holidays.
To talk through, please contact Michelle Denny or simply apply online.

757bfd14a44ee62d.title: Account Manager (Matchmaker)
757bfd14a44ee62d.description: If you’ve ever been called a hopeless romantic, can’t help but smile when two people fall in love on the Bachelor, or find yourself saying “I know someone you really need to meet!” then keep reading! VIDA Select has the perfect work from home opportunity for you...VIDA Select has been at the forefront of the matchmaking industry since 2009, and our modern dating service allows our clients to sit back and relax while we find their soulmate on dating sites and apps. And that’s where you come in - we’re hiring remote Account Managers (Matchmakers) to join our team!As an Account Manager (Matchmaker), you will work with clients to understand what they are looking for, oversee the execution of our online dating service, and identify people who meet your client’s “ideal partner” criteria. Ultimately your goal is to help them find “The One!”This is a full-time position. Our company time zone is EDT. It’s key that you can work US EST hours to serve our clients. Depending on where you are located, you will need to work one shift or split the shifts into two, depending on your preference.If it’s one shift, the working hours are 12 pm - 9 pm EST (5 PM to 2 AM BST).If it’s two shifts, morning shifts can be done between 7 - 11 am EST (12 PM to 4 PM BST) and evening shifts can be done between 5 pm - 10 pm EST (10 PM to 3 AM BST).You can set your own schedule within that time frame, as long as you are getting your workload in, so there is flexibility day to day.To start, the position is 7 days a week but upon completing the initial orientation period, you’ll have a regular day off. You will be paid a competitive hourly rate depending on your experience and background.For the right person, there is room for growth within our Matchmaking department. While you will start as a Matchmaker, there is a path to growth to managing a team of Matchmakers as well as working with our most elite, VIP clients, as warranted by performance milestones and client feedback. VIDA is growing rapidly, and leadership opportunities are available for the right person as well. We promote internally, and are currently looking for natural leaders to join the team. If you enjoy leading people, improving and simplifying processes, and have a knack for technology and automation be sure to let us know!VIDA Select is a 100% remote company, with contractors living all over the world. You’ll be working with a team of Matchmakers, Writers, and Scouts.Are You Right For The Job?VIDA’s clients come to us because they want to find their perfect match - and that starts with the Matchmaking team! We need people who:Are detail oriented, reliable and able to work remotely without direct supervision.Are proactive, effective, persuasive communicators.Have excellent English skills, both spoken and written.Have a stable, reliable and strong Internet connection.Previous sales/customer service/account management/social media management/project management experience.Excellent management and organizational skills.Are passionate about helping others, and have a natural interest in connecting people.Thrive in a team environment, and want to work for a company that values personal growth and continuous improvement.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentPay: £8.94-£12.67 per hourAdditional pay:Commission payBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from home

0c10852be2a4cfc9.title: Social Media Manager
0c10852be2a4cfc9.description:
Salary: £40,000 - £45,000 Location: Greater London,South West London Job Type: Temp to Permanent
Great opportunity to work for a well know high street retailer on an interim, temp to perm or perm basis.


THE COMPANY
A well-known UK retailer founded in London in in the 1800's. With high street and online presence, they sell a rage of house wares and electrical appliances.




THE ROLE
As Social Media Manager you'll be planning engaging and brand enhancing content that will drive traffic both online and instore. You'll be the guru of all things social. Responsibilities include:


? Develop a social media strategy and KPI’s to increase reach, engagement and sales.
? Manage organic and paid activity across Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok, YouTube and Pinterest.
? Developing a content matrix that will both drive the brand whilst optimising commercial and brand collaboration opportunities with suppliers.
? Grow and manage a multi market network of influencers, designing and implementing a brand ambassador programme.

YOU
To be considered for this Social Media Manager role you'll have a genuine passion for social, experience working in a fast paced retail environment and be a result driven commercial marketer as well as:

? You are highly articulate in written and verbal communications, and have a highly organised and efficient approach to work.

If this sounds like you then apply NOW!
Please only apply for this role if you are eligible to work in the UK.

431907870882116f.title: Senior Social Media Manager
431907870882116f.description:
Department: Campaigns
Location: London
ENHANCING THE CBI’s PRESENCE IN SOCIAL MEDIA

Role Summary

Social media is a critical component of the CBI’s overall communications strategy, for all our audiences, including political and other external stakeholders and in respect of our digital offering for our members.


The role will have the responsibility for our main CBI brand accounts across current (and any future) platforms, and will lead on all proactive and reactive elements of our social media experience.


The role of Snr Social Media Manager will be responsible for increasing the CBI’s impact and effectiveness in the key social media channels. Reporting to the Director Digital, this role sits within our Campaigns function and is responsible for leading small team.


The Snr Social Media Manager will work closely with stakeholders across CBI to design and maintain an effective communications strategy, working closely with the rest of Campaigns to ensure maximum impact for all communications output.

Key Responsibilities

Developing an effective approach to social media across the CBI, the role will;

Develop and deliver the social media strategy for the CBI
Develop, refine and iterate social listening and analytics to support the objectives of the CBI
Line manage the Social Media Executive
Ensure the social media team has an agile and innovative approach to managing social media, engaging audiences to enhance the CBI’s overall reputation and specific commercial objectives
Be the in-house expert on all matters relating to social media and will develop the channels relevant for the CBI and its audiences
Ensure that the CBI social media capability is enhanced by providing training and guidance for CBI staff in the best practice for using social media channels
In conjunction with HR, will develop and maintain the CBI’s policies on the use of social media

Designing impactful social media engagement, the role will;

Take responsibility for ensuring that all social engagements are on brand and on message
Be obsessive about using data to plan, track and refine all engagements with audiences through social platforms
Ensure that all social activity is aligned, consistent and considers wider digital channels to demonstrate a joined up narrative and experience for CBI audiences
Provide support where possible for other interventions and events – where direct support is not possible, the role will ensure that relevant CBI staff are appropriately trained to maximise the social media impact of all CBI events and interventions


Maintaining a sustained presence within social media, the role will;

Constantly scan social platforms to ensure that the CBI is present in the most appropriate places, where our audiences convene, and that we have clear purpose and value add in those platforms
Use data (through social listening and data/insight) to ensure we have built an engaged audience
Work with EXCO (including Director General) to ensure individual social presences are used appropriate and in conjunction with the main CBI accounts

Ensuring that we use social media to illustrate the full diversity of the CBI and its members, the role will;

Ensure that CBI employees are encouraged, as far as possible, to use social media to illustrate the diversity of CBI membership both in terms of regions and nations, size, sectoral coverage, age, race and gender
Ensure that CBI employees receive appropriate training to help achieve this aim


Evaluating the impact of our work in social media, the role will;
Work alongside other colleagues to develop joined up story with regards to performance across social and other digital channels.

Direct Reports: 1 direct report

Internal Contacts: Senior CBI staff; policy, commercial colleagues; HR, marketing and Finance teams.

External Contacts: Social Media Platforms, CBI members, journalists and other policy influencers

Knowledge & Experience

What an individual must know or understand to be able to fulfil the role’s requirements

Essential

Experience in leading the design, development and implementation of social media strategies
Expertise in social media channels including data/analytics
Strong understanding of the social media landscape in the UK


Desirable

Good relationships with relevant social media platforms
Experience of working in a digital marketing environment
Digital Community Management
Awareness/interest in UK economy
Journalism experience

Skills

Below are the CBI skills and levels of skills expected for this role based on the pay band it sits within. View the CBI Skills Framework for further information, including descriptions and indicators of each skill.


Planning & organisation
Research & using information

Interpersonal

Strategic & business thinking

Communication

Managing & leading others

Practicing

Advanced

Practicing

Practicing

Advanced

Practicing

Behaviours

The behaviours and characteristics required to be able to fulfil the role’s requirements


Collaborative – Listening, seeking views and sharing information; constructively challenging when appropriate
Taking ownership – Ensuring delivery and holding others to account; can influence, irrespective of hierarchy
Agile – Proactive and responsive to provide a strong member service; responding positively to shifting priorities
Commercial – Awareness of the wider business environment
Innovative – Exploring, sharing and integrating best practice; generating new ideas and challenging a mind-set of “what we’ve always done”
Analytical – gathering information and using logic to analyse, problem solve, evaluate risk and make decisions

0743d73ce76de149.title: Social Media Manager
0743d73ce76de149.description:
Are you a confident communicator and ambitious all rounder on the prowl for your next challenge? Are you equal parts creative thinker and proactive practitioner? If this sounds like a bit of you, you just might be the Social Media Manager we’re looking for to help us manage and grow the varied client social accounts here at Sayhello.
As an established marketing agency with a dynamic, start-up energy, we’re known for devising, developing and delivering comprehensive solutions using a combination of tactics that help our clients meet their unique business goals. There are many strings to our bow from social media (paid and organic), digital, brand development, advertising, experiential, web management to experiential and shopper.
Taking up a key role as an Social Media Manager with heaps of initiative and a willingness to get stuck into any challenge, you’ll be detail-oriented and ready to hit the ground running. You’ll also be a people person with the ability to strike up great relationships with clients and colleagues alike.
As A Social Media Manager:
You’ll have an agency background, and will seamlessly step into your responsibilities as you begin to manage all of our clients number one fans, followers, customers and potential new customers. You will work closely with all teams in Sayhello and portfolio of clients and through communications over social platforms you will help them to understand more about their consumers, customers, fans and followers than ever before, whilst always keeping an eye on the brand. You’ll be integral in delivering content, publishing calendars, media campaigns, responding to consumers, evaluations and supporting senior members with strategic social frameworks and new ideas in social.
In addition, you’ll need:
Ability to demonstrate some campaigns and channels that you look after
The ability to truly understand our clients’ fans, followers, customers and consumers with the foresight to see how to drive reach to others like them
Strong written and verbal skills
Excellent organisational and time management skills
Excellent project management skills
A strong attention to detail
To understand the unique requirements of working for a small agency
The ability to work collaboratively
To love what you do. We really care about the work, our clients and our team. We want someone who feels the same way
Key Responsibilities
Working with the senior team to develop social media strategies with the aim of increasing brand awareness and customer engagement
Analysing the long-term needs of our clients social media strategy and offering ideas, outlining any necessary changes to the overall digital marketing plan to help facilitate greater success.
Creating captivating content (with the creative team) for all of our clients’ social media profiles, which may include blogs, articles, posts and multimedia content (working with the copywriter on these)
Staying up-to-date with the latest social media trends and digital technologies
Developing monthly reports on emerging social media trends that will be presented to the clients
Developing and overseeing competitions and campaigns to draw attention to a brand
Setting measurable goals for campaigns, measuring and showing the Return on Investment (ROI)
Monitoring and responding to customer feedback, comments and social media posts
Working very closely with the creative team, liaising with other departments to create a holistic and effective social marketing framework for Sayhello Agency.
Requirements
A minimum of 2 years’ agency experience working in an agency on social media
Previous experience working in an agency environment
Excellent organisational and time management skills
Excellent project management skills
A strong attention to detail
Above all, we’re looking for a positive, can-do attitude.
What you’ll get in return
21 Days which increases to 25 days after 2 years +1 Agency day (24th Dec)
The chance to bring your own creativity and style to the mix
A positive and fun work environment
The opportunity to work with a mix of well-known and up and coming brands
Breakfast, snacks and endless coffee along with a well-stocked beer/gin fridge
Private Health Insurance via Vitality
Workplace pension scheme
Work computer and iPhone
A bonus structure
An office dog – work in progress!
We offer competitive salaries and benefits based on your experience and skill set. So, if you’re up for a new challenge and like the idea of joining a great team where you can really showcase your skills whilst learning more, drop us a line and say hello at gen@sayhelloagency.com
Don’t forget to tell us all about yourself, what makes you tick, and your salary expectations.

Department: Universal Music On Demand (UMOD)

Music is Universal
It’s the passionate and dedicated team at Universal Music UK who help make us Britain’s leading music company. From A&R to finance, legal to digital, sales to marketing, Universal Music is the place to grow and develop your career within a truly commercial and innovative business that leads in everything it does.

Everyone is welcome to apply for our roles, and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment because of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, belief, age, marital status, background, pregnancy or caring responsibilities. We also recognise the importance of diversity of thought within our teams and are fully committed to embracing the talents of people with autism, dyslexia, ADHD and other forms of neurocognitive variation.

We will always seek to make appropriate adjustments to recruitment, workplaces, and work processes to be fully inclusive to people with different needs and working styles. If you need us to make any reasonable adjustments for you from application onwards, including alternatives to the online form or to disclose a neurocognitive condition, please email universalmusiccareers@umusic.com
The A Side: A Day in The Life
Universal Music On Demand (UMOD), the award-winning, chart-topping, boutique commercial UK label, is looking for an enthusiastic team player who is passionate about all kinds of music and marketing with an emphasise on hip-hop culture - for diverse, innovative ventures. The successful marketing intern candidate will be creative, positive, proactive, detail-orientated, have exceptional communication skills and want to make a difference in a small but impactful and very driven team.

Supporting the team across disciplines and activities
Multi-media platform marketing campaigns
Content and creative asset creation
Detailed research projects
Data analysis across various metrics
A myriad of presentations
Ideation and brainstorm sessions
Accurate and timely dissemination of information
Event planning and organisation
Product initiation and development
Building relationships with colleagues, artists, DJs, managers, brands, suppliers, studios, partners etc.
Forward-thinking social media strategy and channel management
Commercially minded, retail-focused activity
Administrative duties
Using Universal’s Uniport finance system to order and pay for goods and services
Prepare information and presentations for team meetings, including room bookings and testing AV systems
Booking couriers, cabs and meetings, greeting guests, arranging refreshments etc.
Understanding and learning to use various internal data, production, audio/visual content, CRM, playlist curation and delivery systems
To carry out any other ad hoc reasonable requests as directed by the team
Person Specification
Necessary
Strong organisational, accuracy and communication skills
Awareness of all commercial music, notably a huge passion for modern hip-hop culture
Social media content creation and strategy awareness
Understanding of basic marketing practices
Aptitude for numbers and data
Experience in a professional work environment
Working knowledge of core MS Office packages
Understanding of the digital and physical music landscape
Desirable
Business-related social media experience and data analysis skills
Work with content management systems and analytics platforms
Visual and/or audio design and editing skills
An existing network of contacts (labels, artists, managers etc.)
Bonus Tracks: Your Benefits

25 paid days of annual leave
Interest Free Season Ticket Loan available
Holiday Purchase scheme

Just So You Know…
The company presents this job description as a guide to the major areas and duties for which the jobholder is accountable. However, the business operates in an environment that demands change and the jobholder's specific responsibilities and activities will vary and develop. Therefore, the job description should be seen as indicative and not as a permanent, definitive and exhaustive statement.

99eeb622961b1515.title: Media Manager
99eeb622961b1515.description:
Position Snapshot

Media Manager
Gatwick
Competitive salary (Up to £50,000 depending on experience + 17% car allowance) plus potential bonus and fantastic benefits
This is a full-time permanent opportunity, but we are always open to discuss individual’s flexible working needs so please speak to us during the recruitment process to understand what this could look like for you.
Position Summary

We are recruiting for a talented and ambitious Media Manager to join our Marcomms team. This is a rare opportunity for an agency side Manager or Media Manager client side to take the next step into the FMCG world and be part of working with iconic brands like KitKat, Nescafe and Nespresso.

As a Media Manager you will drive the performance of the categories by developing strategic media communications plans and effective media activation with Marketing, our media agency, and media partners. You will also be given responsibility to illuminate the future by championing channels like social, programmatic or search to drive innovation and best practice.

A little bit about us
Marcomms’ (Media & Digital Team) focus has 5 pillars;
Consultation –provide expertise to Marketing along the communications process from briefing, media planning to media activation.
Campaign Management – management of campaign process ensuring appropriate campaign benchmarks are set and delivered
Agency Relations & Media Partnerships – Marcomms creates synergies between the categories at Nestlé and the agencies and partners (Media and Digital). We do this to drive best in class thinking and to create effective and efficient plans.
Test and Learn & Measurement–responsible for incorporating new technology and innovations across Nestlé UK&I via test & learn campaigns and measurement. Responsible to drive ROI thinking within the categories.
Value – Manage media efficiencies to ensure each category receives allocated amount
A day in the life of...

As a Media Manager at Nestlé you will work across and manage at least 3 categories. In your role you will:

Build strong effective working relationships with marketeers, to understand their business and requirements to ensure media communications is effective and efficient
Work alongside the category to challenge agencies to deliver effective and efficient media strategies, through deeper insights into the target audience, solid rationale behind channel and communications planning
Play a pivotal role in day-to-day campaign management/monitoring, ensuring campaigns are consistently delivered.
Manage campaign process measuring campaign delivery versus objectives, ensuring comprehensive evaluations are produced.
Drive strategic continuous improvement, efficiencies and effectiveness across integrated media plans through self-driven & ad hoc projects.
Ensure all campaigns incorporate all of our Communications Guidelines & Best Practice: responsibility & sustainability, digital, measurement.
Drive new test and learn initiatives across Nestlé. A key part of this is ‘Shared Learnings’ and publishing case studies for the categories.
What will make you successful

The successful candidate will be currently a Manager, with +4 years’ experience, working in media and or digital agencies. They will have excellent knowledge and understanding of integrated media communications and experienced in influencing and managing stakeholders across different business functions and levels.

They will also:
Have UK experience in media planning and or buying functions plus full knowledge of emerging Digital/eCommerce landscape (preferred)
Have the ability to influence with impact in cross-functional / matrix structures internally & externally
Be naturally curious with an eagerness to learn
Have a high tenacity to drive forward change
Have agency management experience (ideal)

Benefits

What can we offer in return? Great benefits you’d expect from a business the size of Nestlé – in the shape of a competitive salary and benefits package, bonus scheme, flexible working scheme, 25 days holiday plus bank holidays plus flex leave, pension scheme and a real focus on personal development and growth.

The closing date for this role is 14th February 2022.

We will be considering candidates as they apply and we will occasionally close job advertisements early in the event we receive sufficient applicants, so please don’t delay in submitting your application.

At Nestlé, our values are rooted in respect – for our employees, our customers and our consumers. That’s why championing diversity and inclusion is so important to us; when we embrace different perspectives and give everyone the chance to be the best they can be, we can think in new, creative ways that grow and enhance our business. We are committed to equal opportunity for all and we may collect relevant data for monitoring purposes during our candidate registration process. Be yourself, everyone else is taken!

Right to work in the UK
In accordance with Home Office guidance successful candidates will be required to evidence their right to work in the UK before commencement of employment. The successful candidate therefore must be able to demonstrate their right to work status for the UK during the recruitment process. We have assessed this role and it could be applicable for sponsorship under the Skilled Worker route. If you do not have the right to work in the UK and you are unable to gain this independently, we may be able to provide sponsorship under the Skilled Worker route in line with the Home office guidelines. We encourage you to review the UK Home Office guidelines ahead of submitting a job application to review whether you meet the eligibility criteria under the Skilled Worker route and understand the immigration fees that you would be responsible for when making a visa application. If you require sponsorship, please discuss this with us as part of the recruitment process.

cd5eb975d69d2427.title: VAC2789 - Senior Social Media Manager (FTC 11 Months)
cd5eb975d69d2427.description:
VAC2789 - Senior Social Media Manager (FTC 11 Months)
Reference Number: VAC2789

Contract: This position is fixed term for 11 months, covering maternity leave.

Please note, the deadline for submitting applications for this vacancy is 11:00pm on the closing date.

About Alzheimer's Society

Dementia devastates lives. By 2021, 1 million people will be living with the condition. But dementia won't win. Until the day we find a cure, Alzheimer's Society will be here for anyone affected by dementia - wherever they are, whatever they're going through. Everything we do is informed and inspired by them.

We are the UK's leading dementia charity. Every day, we work tirelessly to find new treatments and, ultimately, a cure for dementia. We provide expert information, training, and support services to all those who need our help. And we are creating a more dementia-friendly society so people with the condition can live without fear and prejudice.

About the role

You’ll play a vital part in positioning Alzheimer’s Society as the leading dementia charity in the UK at an exciting time for the charity, preparing for the launch of an ambitious new strategy. You’ll also better ensure Alzheimer’s Society is known for funding research into the cause, cure, care and prevention of dementia.

During the contract period the post holder will play a crucial role in embedding our new social media strategy to support this work, working across teams to get buy-in for a data and impact-driven approach to activity.

As well as managing day-to-day activity across key channels, the team works with a wide range of stakeholders across the organisation to build great user-focused social engagement strategies into our campaigns, spanning owned, earned and paid activity.

The role and wider team are also responsible for ensuring that colleagues have the right tools, skills and guidance to use social effectively to support a wide range of business objectives.

About you
We’re looking for a self-motivated, proactive social media expert with experience managing a team using social to deliver on a wide range of objectives. Key areas where you’ll be confident in using social include: creating great experiences for our supporters and service users, generating high levels of engagement and conversion as part of complex digital journeys and crisis and reputation management. You’ll also be able to identify opportunities to create reach and visibility for Alzheimer’s Society and the role we play to support people affected by dementia.

As well as being able to quickly pick up and run key projects, you’ll have excellent people management and communication skills, and proven experience influencing at all levels to embed change.

Working with a range of internal and external stakeholders in a complex organisation to build collaborative relationships will be one of your strengths, as will your ability to develop great, results-driven social engagement strategies across a range of channels and touchpoints.

Our employees work hard every day to make a true difference in people's lives. We are proud to support them with a range of benefits, recognition and many options for working agilely, all contributing to a strong work life balance. We also have various learning programmes to support you in your development and help you grow to realise your potential and shape a career with Alzheimer's Society.

b3eeab4b205f512c.title: VAC2983 - Digital and Marketing Manager Dementia Friendly Programme
b3eeab4b205f512c.description:
VAC2983 - Digital and Marketing Manager Dementia Friendly Programme
Alzheimer’s Society’s Dementia Friends programme is the biggest ever initiative to change people’s perceptions of dementia. Our dementia-friendly communities programme encourages everyone to share responsibility for ensuring that people with dementia feel understood, valued and able to contribute to their community.

Alzheimer's Society is the UK's leading dementia charity. We provide information and support, improve care, fund research, and create lasting change for people affected by dementia.

About the role

We have an exciting opportunity for a great candidate to join our Regional Engagement team as Digital and Marketing Manager for Alzheimer’s Society’s Dementia Friendly Programmes. You will lead the digital and marketing function for these high-profile programmes and line manage the Digital and Marketing Assistant.

You will ensure smooth running of the programmes’ digital platforms (including website, email platform and social media) - leading on digital development projects to improve functionality and user experience - and you will be responsible for the Dementia Friends website product routes.

You’ll be responsible for overseeing the programmes’ marketing campaigns and for managing and developing resources, marketing materials and stewardship journeys. You’ll develop the content strategy and have overall responsibility for our Dementia Friends social media channels.

You’ll be a key part of the Marketing and Engagement team but you’ll offer support and expertise across our Regional Engagement team and work with the wider fundraising directorate to maximise our income and impact.

About you
Our ideal candidate will be creative, driven and passionate about the power of digital and marketing to reach and engage audiences. You will be up to date with all the latest trends and tools, from social media to user research.

You will have experience of managing a digital, marketing or engagement function and of planning and overseeing the delivery of this activity. You’ll be able to work on your own initiative cross-organisation and with external agencies and you will be great at building relationships with a variety of stakeholders.

You’ll know great content and have experience in overseeing or managing social media channels. You’ll be equally confident and have experience in leading large-scale digital or IT projects and managing digital platforms and/or databases.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a wide-ranging role where you can bring your knowledge and expertise to shape the programmes, develop your skills across the digital, engagement and marketing mix to play an instrumental part in reaching new supporters and volunteers and to mobilise their support to make change for people affected by dementia.

Our employees work hard every day to make a true difference in people's lives. We are proud to support them with a range of benefits, recognition and many options for working agilely, all contributing to a strong work life balance. We also have various learning programmes to support you in your development and help you grow to realise your potential and shape a career with Alzheimer's Society.

06643eef345e92b2.title: Social Media Manager - Startup
06643eef345e92b2.description:
Social Media Manager - Startup
London & Remote
Our client a leading beauty brand is currently looking for a Social Media Manager paying up to £46,000 + Bonus 10 - 15% + Options + education benefit up to £3,500 + private healthcare and will be based remote.

You will manage all organic social media activity and plan and implement social media strategies. You will create unique content and distribute the content across channels. You will also develop the influencer marketing strategy and work with the rest of the marketing team.

To be considered for this role you will have hands on social media experience and have experience developing influencer marketing and social media strategies.

e877934bfbd71c60.title: Social Media Manager
e877934bfbd71c60.description:
Krank is in search of a qualified Social Media Manager – an execution leader throughout all platforms with the intent of producing brand recognition for consumers and nurturing a community. You will interact with Krank consumers using engaging and compelling social content. As one of the main brand ambassadors, findings will be leveraged as you work with internal content and creative groups on plans that boost the company’s presence on social networks.
Duties
Establish and measure the social media strategy of Krank in accordance with the company’s objectives of brand promotion.Lead the SadaPay community throughout the company’s channels.Track social platforms for significant concerns and respond with consumer updates in a timely fashion.Be a representative of the brand, making sure your voice is in a harmonious tone with the company’s core values.Manage our social media content schedule.Work with internal content and creative groups to post unique content that connects with our market and has its own voice in a competitive market.Be knowledgeable about the path Krank users take.Track KPIs by leveraging data-driven analytics, gather novel perspectives, and grow the company’s social strategy.Be proficient with social media, remaining updated on social tools and trends, and offering suggestions on social executions for promotional campaigns.
About the Applicant
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or a related field.At least 3 years of social media experience.Preference will be given to candidates with startup experience.Established history of evolving the presence of a brand on social media.Extensive experience and up-to-speed with social media platforms to produce brand recognition and nurture a social community.Not mandatory: experience with e-commerce or direct-to-consumer promotion.Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Job Type: Full Time
Location: Remote / UK

6e989e51318f61ea.title: Social Media Manager- FTC
6e989e51318f61ea.description:
Salary: £42k - 47.5k per year
Reference: 48882
Social Media Manager - 11 month FTC
Fully Remote
£42,417 - £47,660 plus London allowance of £3600 if applicable


Pitch is delighted to be supporting this exceptional charity as they look to recruit a fantastic Social Media Manager to cover a maternity contract. This is a fully remote role and requires the management of 4 direct reports, so previous experience of managing people is essential.

As the Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring that all communications across the social channels are engaging and up-holding the charities values. Your team will be responsible for day to day content sourcing and scheduling, managing community engagement and responses under your guidance, but you will be responsible for strategic level projects and delivery.


Here is a preview of some of the projects you will be responsible for:
Embedding a more pro-active social media plan that aligns with the needs of the charity and is more structured to align with the different user channels.
Delivering on a new reporting system.
Supporting on the Facebook fundraising hub with an aim to drive more activity.
Working with stakeholders on how regional social media activity should be delivered and managed.
Leading on all large campaigns ensuring consistency across other communication channels.
To be considered for this role, you will need to have worked within a pure social media role for a decent period of time and have strategic and delivery focused experience. You will understand the importance of managing a brand through social media, have worked on content and community management and have experience with integrated social media campaigns with other communications channels. You must be able to influence senior internal stakeholders to embed social re-development plans.
This role is fully remote and if you have a London postcode, you will also be entitled to a London allowance on top of basic salary. If this sounds like a role you could flourish in and you are immediately available, please apply today!
