02f671f890c735ad.title: Brand Manager - CVRM
02f671f890c735ad.description:
Brand Manager - CVRM (Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolic)
London
Competitive salary & benefits
Closing date: 24th March 2022
Do you have expertise in, and passion for implementing a brand strategy? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolic sector in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you!
At AstraZeneca UK, we bring life-changing medicines to patients across England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. As a member of the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry (ABPI), all of our sales, marketing and communications activities are subject to the ABPI Code of Practice. If you’re inspired by the possibilities of science to make a difference and ready to discover what you can do – join us!
Our move to Pancras Square offers us the strongest possible platform to transform the lives of patients in the UK, as the country’s leading biopharmaceutical company. It will bring AstraZeneca UK closer to our customers, partners and stakeholders in the UK’s healthcare environment, as well as foster greater collaboration with the wider AstraZeneca footprint.
Business Area
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.
We are on a journey to bring life-saving medicines to patients. Our role in contributing to decreasing mortality rates globally is clear – shaping the future by spotting a scientifically-led commercial opportunity and acting now to operationalise and scale it.
What you'll do
Supporting the development and implementation of the area brand campaign in the local market, through sales team and channel working
Working with key clinical advocates including Specialists, and lead GPs to ensure implementation of brand strategy
Collaborating with key partners including area lead market, medical teams, cross functional team, channels and sales teams to implement brand campaigns
Delivering key marketing campaign items e.g. promotional campaign material, remote detail material, service items, training support, meetings support material, materials development, approval, production and distribution.
Essential skills and experience:
Significant pharmaceutical commercial experience with a strong performance track record
Strong sales/marketing leadership with a successful track record of growing market share
Creative marketing capabilities together with rigorous commercial business sense
Desirable:
Good experience of the UK market, with its unique NHS system
Why AstraZeneca?
At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.
So, what’s next?
If you are inspired by the possibilities of science to make a difference and ready to discover what you can do by joining us on this exciting journey and believe you can contribute to this bold ambition – join us!
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

5bfb1eaecf4b5631.title: Media Relations Associate
5bfb1eaecf4b5631.description:
Overview
J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across Banking, Research, Markets, Payments and Securities Services. The Marketing & Communications team within CIB is responsible for Media Relations, Internal Communications, Social Media, Content and Client Marketing.
Position summary
This successful candidate will work in the Media Relations function within the CIB, and interact closely with all other parts of the Marketing & Communications group. They will support the Banking and Research businesses on a day-today basis and will report directly to the Head of Banking Media Relations in London, while coordinating closely with Media Relations and Marketing colleagues who lead support for the Research division in London and around the world. In addition, the person will provide reporting and analysis support on a regular basis to measure the wider team's impact in the market.
More about the role:

Proactively managing day-to-day relationships with financial journalists and helping them as they write about capital markets with commentary from the bank's spokespeople.
Ensuring journalists have controlled access to the firm's extensive network of Research analysts and their reports.
Responsibilities as part of this role include:
Developing and maintaining relationships with key members of the press; creating and maintaining media lists
Proactively pitching for press coverage around thematic Research reports and Investor conferences
Fully managing logistics for media interviews or conversations, and supporting our spokespeople throughout these interactions
Collaborat ing across the Marketing & Communications organi s ation on executive communications, social media and content development
Assisting in creating quarterly measurement reports for the regional Marketing & Communications team
Responding to incoming calls from clients, vendors, students, etc. looking for general information
Handling audit and other Compliance requirements for pre-approvals, disclosures, and logging of public appearances by spokespeople

Qualifications

BA in Communications, Public Relations or Journalism preferred
2-3 years of experience preferred, ideally in supporting financial services companies
Excellent organisational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritise high volume, high priority initiatives in a deadline-driven environment
Ability to make good judgement calls
Ability to work independently to execute on projects while taking direction from multiple managers
An obsessive attention to detail, a deep respect for journalism, and a curiosity to learn more about banking
Commitment to maintaining the firm's high standards related to risk, compliance and its Code of Conduct
Advanced understanding of media monitoring tools for reporting purposes
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

b170f0b19bbb1127.title: Social Media Analyst
b170f0b19bbb1127.description:
Why us?
£21-28k salary on a full time, permanent contract

 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

️ 33 Days Paid Leave

 Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

 High end laptop or PC and top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse

 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need
Summary
Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!

We are looking for a Social Media Analyst with the skills and enthusiasm to produce high quality insights and reports on our US TV clients’ social media performance and strategy across a range of social networks, including TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!
About us
Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.
Responsibilities
What can you expect?

Being responsible for a variety of client-facing reports and insights
Gathering and analyzing performance data from social media networks to generate reports
Developing master of a variety of analytics tools, including Sprout Social, Social Insider, Facebook Creator Studio and YouTube Studio
Creating visually appealing and consistently designed reports and presentations
Generating tactical and strategic recommendations for our clients’ social accounts
Following client and competitor accounts on social media to better understand effective social media strategy
Working with our managers to improve the overall quality of our reports and provide more value to our clients
Updating and maintaining documentation on all our reporting processes
Qualifications
What's important to us:

2:1 Bachelor’s degree or higher and excellent school grades
Excellent numeracy skills and ability to analyse data quantitatively and qualitatively
Ability to prioritise workload and complete tasks to deadlines
Unparalleled attention to detail
Excellent written and communication skills
Strong Excel and Powerpoint skills
Social media experience is a plus, but not a necessity as long as you're interested in learning about the industry

Nice to have:

Experience in creating and executing on social media performance reports
Experience with the social networks’ native analytics tools, such as Facebook Creator Studio, YouTube Studio, TikTok Analytics
Experience with 3rd party social analytics tools, such as Sprout Social, Sprinklr, Social Insider

As long as you possess smarts, attention to detail and enthusiasm, please apply.
Your working environment
Agility & Openness for Ideas We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!

Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do.

The Social Media team is 30+ people strong and made up of account managers, project managers, social media specialists, social media coordinators, social media analysts, and more. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology and Industry Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-Notch Equipment We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. We have flexible working hours so you can start your day anytime between 8am and 11am.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.
Salary
£21k-28k per year, depending on experience and skills.
Employment type
Permanent / Full time. Either in our Edinburgh office or remote within the UK.
Benefits
Immediate Benefits

33 days’ holiday
High end laptop of your choice or PC equivalent, it’s up to you!
Top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
Paid training to further your skills
Annual Flu inoculation
Team outings and monthly meets

After 3 Months

Up to £700 to spend on a chair, desk or any other necessary workspace equipment to kit out your home office.
£625 budget every two years to choose your own mobile phone + monthly mobile contract paid for
Enrolment in workplace pension scheme with matched employer contributions
Money towards glasses with Specsavers

After 1 Year

Performance Related Pay Scheme giving an annual bonus of up to 100% of monthly salary whenever Storm Ideas is in profit
Access to the Cycle to Work scheme
Recruitment Process
First, we will invite you to an interview (60 minutes via Zoom). During the meeting, Caspar, our Head of Social Ops, and Fanny, Analytics Manager, get to know you and try to understand if you’d be a good fit for the role, and at the same time answer all your questions. After the initial interview, you may be sent a short reporting task to complete (if you're open to it).

You may then be asked to have a final interview, where you will meet Duncan, our Social Media Director (30 minutes, Zoom).

And that’s it!

8f3ee67dff504caf.title: Head of Social Media

Citi Private Bank is seeking a VP, Social Media & Email Lead. Working in the Global Digital Marketing team based in Canary Wharf, this role will manage and lead the Bank’s social media and email channels.

a8742c715f7cd77d.title: Project Manager - Media
a8742c715f7cd77d.description:
The Digitas Media Team delivers media services to clients across Display, Programmatic, Paid Social, Paid Search, SEO and Affiliates across teams in Edinburgh and London. The team works with a broad range of clients varying from retail to travel and B2B.
Our mission is to create wonderful digital experiences by connecting media with data, technology and creative to win in the moments that count.
Role Summary
Reporting to the Media Director, the Media Project Manager is responsible for ensuring the digital media planning, buying and activation for clients is delivered on time and to spec. The Media Project Manager will be expected to contribute across all channels but will be beginning to develop expertise in one or two specific areas.
The Media Project Manager will be owner of client finance, team resource and scope, and make recommendations based on budget and operational levers. They should have a comprehensive understanding of the various media platforms and the advertising opportunities across them. They will support Senior Media Managers and Media Directors with the review and assessment of campaign performance and will need a strong understanding of the principles of digital media and the common measurement approaches.
They will be expected to lead weekly client status calls, maintaining a clear status sheet, trello board or similar and ensure tasks are completed on time and to budget. They will contribute to client meetings – providing rationale for recommendations and insights into performance.
The Media Project Manager will typically work in a multi-disciplinary team and have exposure to all digital channels and a number of different clients but begin to develop expertise in a single channel. They will be to provide guidance and counsel to junior members of the Media team.

e71db2496144051b.title: Social Media Manager
e71db2496144051b.description:
SwiftXccess is looking for self-starters that are thought leaders with a proven track-record of success in fast-paced payments technology environments with demanding timelines. The role will require strong technical skills across applications, infrastructure, data and security; an understanding of architectural trends such as microservices, cloud-computing and open source frameworks with a strong focus on innovation. At SwiftXccess we are leading the innovation to solve major issues affecting digital financial services. We have an ambitious five-year plan, along with the resource and funding to transform digital payments.

About the Role
We are looking for a creative, analytical and strategic individual to drive growth across new and existing social media platforms. The successful candidate will drive awareness, engagement, and conversion through social initiatives. The position will utilize a combination of paid social program management, influencer management, community engagement, viral marketing, and on site opportunities, to drive the SwiftXccess social strategy. Successful candidates will possess a deep understanding of social media tactics and strategies, along with experience in overall online marketing.

Responsibilities:

Identify and create programs and promotions to grow membership and engagement within the social media and community space that align with SwiftXccess objectives
own new platform and follower activities growth
develop and execute branded influencer campaigns and content strategy to drive upper funnel awareness and reach
own paid and boosted planning and execution, including tagged ads, boosted campaigns and brand-led reach campaigns
develop reporting and tracking process with Agencies
work collaboratively with global teams on social-led campaigns to maximise scale across platforms.
content planning and shoot co-ordination with Editorial and Agency teams, (inc influencers sourcing and uploads),
Budget, forecast, analyze and report on campaigns and contribute to monthly reporting
Package and place original and syndicated content (video, etc.) through appropriate social channels.
Monitor on-line conversations to determine reach and impact with on-line consumers.
Work across departments to ensure alignment of all initiatives across all channels

Skills and Experience:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Advertising or related field required
5 + years of concentrated experience with digital marketing platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, SNAP, Tik Tok, Twitter, mobile, social media, social commerce and display; proven ability to significantly drive engagement and conversion.
Multi-tasker who is well organized, with impeccable written and oral presentation skills

Excellent project management skills

Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to influence management

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Online Marketing, Influencer marketing, Blogs, Social Media, & Web Analytics (Adobe preferred)
Background in B2B B2B2C fin-tech, payments, eCommerce.

Location
London, England or Remote and available during Business Hours; This role is open to remote work as our teams are distributed. We are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy and will establish a cadence of on-time delivery with high-quality work.

SwiftXccess is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to ensuring a safe and inclusive workplace by welcoming people of all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We encourage people from traditionally underrepresented groups to apply. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodations in the application process, please let us know.

90caec69ed58e0e3.title: Football Social Media Manager
90caec69ed58e0e3.description:
Fans love Midnite because of all the epic ways to win. Unlike the alternatives out there, Midnite doesn’t feel like a website built 20 years ago. Our customers use our world-class sports, esports, and game wagering platform to interact with the games they care about. We're looking for an experienced Social Media Manager based in UK to join our market leading team! If you you spend countless hours using Instagram and Twitter and would rather watch the Premier League over a Netflix series... read on!
In this role, you’ll be responsible for the curation and posting of content on the @MidniteFtbl brand social channels with a focus on Twitter and Instagram. You know everything there is to know about Football and you are a creative and strategic thinker who is results-oriented with a proven ability to develop and implement successful organic social media campaigns. You'll be responsible for the growth of the channels by helping lead growth activations alongside some of your favourite YouTube football personalities and our in-house partnership and design teams.
Requirements
Passionate about Football: with expert knowledge of the global football ecosystem, players, teams and surrounding communities with a deep understanding of UK football humor, nuances and boundaries. You identify with the audience and that's why you're great at hooking fan attention.

A Social Media Expert: with excellent knowledge of the esports industry. You've got experience in creating and executing brand campaigns and you've had experience posting on all sorts of social media platforms, including Twitter, YouTube, TikTok, Instagram.This is what you do in your spare time, no sweat.

Adobe Wizard: You know your way around Photoshop and After Effects and can knock up a well-timed meme, no problem!
Self Motivated: We're looking for someone who is really driven to forge or further their career in Social Media and Marketing within sports, this isn't just a possibility - this is exactly what you want to do. You'll have a desire to learn and feedback is valuable to you.
Flexible: We're looking for somebody who is comfortable and able to work outside of standard working hours sometimes. That means weekend and evening work.
Benefits
A ground-floor role in which you’ll be integral to our company culture and help shape the direction. You’ll be part of a growing community of Midnite employees, partners, investors, and advisors, all focused on our common goal. We love to do things together with regular company-wide meetups, games night, and team retreats.
Grab a piece of the pie. We offer competitive equity packages, from performance-based stock grants to Employee Stock Purchase Plans that allow teammates across the globe to feel like they own the place.
Comprehensive Health insurance via Vitality so you can stay healthy.
25+ paid holidays and use-what-you-need sick days.
Paid maternity, paternity, and adoption leave.
Flexible long-term work options (remote and hybrid).
Generous stipends for headphones and your remote work setup.
Our team combines years of experience building world-class betting technology with deep esports and sports domain expertise. We are as intentional about building a durable company and inclusive culture as we are about perfecting our product, and are serious about flexible work and professional development.
About us

Midnite is a next-generation betting platform that is built for today’s fandom. We are a collective of engineers, quants, designers, and marketers who all share a passion for esports, sports, and gaming. We exist to bring fans together and enhance their interactions with their favourite games through the rush of winning money. Whether you want to back your favourite football team or put some money down to win your next game in Call of Duty, Midnite lets you get some skin in the game. Designed and built from the ground up with the newest technologies, we made Midnite for all levels of fandom. Making Midnite intuitive, immersive, and immediately understandable is hard work. But we believe that by keeping this our north star, we can make something truly awesome.


We are backed by some of the world’s top investors that have brought you companies like Draftkings, Betfair, Revolut, Just Eat, and many more. With a central hub in London, we are a remote-first team spread out across the world all working together to shape a new era in wagering. Join us and become part of a passionate group of builders who are obsessed with crafting exceptional products for fans all over the world. We'd love your help.

8f8651333f731508.title: Social Media Manager
8f8651333f731508.description:
The Manager, Social Media for Vogue Business leads the social strategy and social posting of Vogue Business’s social channels which include Instagram, Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter & Pinterest.
This person will be embedded with the Vogue Business team and partner seamlessly with editors and writers. They will sit alongside editors and be pivotal to enabling the success & growth of the newly-evolved teams.
Reporting to the Global Director of Social Media for Vogue (based in the US), the Manager is part of a community of global Vogue Social Managers. They will work closely with the community and the global social storytelling team.
This role is big picture – overseeing social storytelling and content distribution – and is hands-on – with daily posting and scheduling on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and other platforms (depending on local platforms).
This person has an eye for powerful Vogue visuals, strong writing skills, social storytelling skills and understands the Vogue voice.
The Social Media Manager will have a proven history of growing social audiences and knowledge of analytical tools. This person understands how data can inform a smart editorial and social strategy, and is an expert at juggling multiple projects, managing deadlines, distilling social numbers into actionable insights, and advocating for strong social content across the organization.
The ideal candidate has experience partnering with Edit, Creative and Commercial. They will be a clear communicator and show sound judgement. This person will display all the behaviours outlined in the Audience Development Competency Model.
Goals and structure
This role is part of the Global Audience Development, Social & Analytics team at Condé Nast. Audience development maximises consumer value by delivering the content and services that meet audience needs across platforms based on strategic analysis. We grow, engage, and retain multi-channel audiences by informing content, product, and business strategy and maximising distribution opportunities to drive holistic revenue globally.

Key Duties & Responsibilities
Guided by the Global Vogue social strategy, this person will adapt and realize that for Vogue Business’ social strategy
Manage day-to-day posting, editing and optimization of content on multiple social media platforms including LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook and Twitter
Master Vogue’s editorial voice and tone which may be different between platforms
Select imagery, video and visual content that engages audiences
Execute on best-in-class social storytelling
Seamlessly integrate with Content/Edit and guide teams daily on story positioning (for Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, for example)
Create and foster communities on social platforms
Manage social swaps with internal Conde Nast brands, other Vogue teams, as well as external partners
Report on content performance and present social insights and best practices to various stakeholders
Work with the commercial team to agree any commercial posts (in line with Vogue’s social x commercial guidelines)
Adjust social strategy according to KPI pacing and report on any wins and losses
Brainstorm new ideas and plan rollout strategies for testing with the audience development team

Essential Skills & Requirements
Relevant social media experience, preferably with experience working for a digital publisher
Strong writing skills for captions, headlines and visual storytelling
Proven ability in visual storytelling that drives engagement
Strong editorial judgment
Community management experience
Excellent organizational skills, focus, and attention to detail
An established ability to synthesize and communicate information quickly
Must complete an edit test (writing samples are a plus!)
Experience with video editing and asset creation
Able to work outside standard working hours (occasional evenings and weekends)
Experience in working on audience development strategies for video and audio
Ability to clearly articulate and present to editorial colleagues and all levels of management
Ability to navigate a complex and matrixed business
Entrepreneurial, digitally savvy, with exceptional analytical, quantitative, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills
Desired: Experience of working cross-culturally. A second language is a plus.

4ad73ea352612056.title: Social Media Manager - B2B
4ad73ea352612056.description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Since 2015, Revolut has introduced more than 18 million customers globally to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls, to global currency exchange and stock trading, customers simply get more with Revolut. And in July 2017, Revolut Business was launched to help customers get more from their business account.
We approach communications the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to new feature presentations, our goal is to both inform and delight.
Put simply, we build things we want to use ourselves, that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a social media manager to help make Revolut Business into a household name in our core markets!. As a social media manager, you will deliver exceptional content over multiple social channels to help increase both Revolut Business’ brand awareness & brand consideration in the mass market, maximising the opportunity that rapid evolution in social trends present. You will collaborate with a talented team of product, brand, and design experts as well as work closely within our growth team to deliver on our goals.
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Identifying all the approachable and hottest social media resources relevant to our target audience.Creating, scheduling and publishing content across multiple social media channelsBeing engaging, funny, responsive and of-the-moment to create viral and shareable momentsUsing your platform knowledge and creative skills to create boundary-pushing, attention-grabbing social content using the latest affordances on each channelBringing all of Revolut Business' product offering to life creatively, and promoting financial education in an engaging way for kids and teens
Calmly and carefully dealing with customer and tech issues, if neededYour daily routine will consist of media planning, copywriting, content management (text, pictures, videos) and tracking the efficiency
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
Experience in B2B social media roles delivering highly engaging content and social followings in a world class consumer-facing business known for high quality social media executionProven experience of creating world class social content resulting in uptake and coverage in mass-market media outletsProven record of setting up and developing social media accounts across Youtube, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram
Genuine enthusiasm for IT, high-technology business and fintech industry: you are aware of all the latest news and trends;Comfortable working in a high performing, analytical and results-driven environment
You’re fluent in English and your copywriting skills are impeccable
You’re a natural storyteller, creative and know how to build awarenessYou’re a team player, well organised and keep cool when working to tight deadlines

93b2e0e479e5fadf.description:
Job Description
We are looking for a London-based Social Media & Events Manager with relevant experience in digital marketing to join our highly skilled team full-time. As our Social Media & Events Manager, you will be expected to coordinate our strategy to increase brand awareness and nurture relationships with key stakeholders within the digital marketing industry.
Within this role you will also be accountable for:
Social media strategy: secure and manage the design and implementation of the social strategy aligned with the business goals, as well as development and management of social media calendar considering marketing objectives and priorities.
Management of social media accounts: securing an strategic management of social channels by the team, setting high standards to the development, editing, scheduling and publishing of content, as well as aligned directions to communication with followers, responses to queries and engagement with strategic accounts across all channels. Moreover secure alignment with the design team for production and review of all assets and content.
Development of content strategies: support the team in increasing brand awareness, as well as in marketing improvements to contribute to overall goals through solid, consistent and valuable digital approaches, overviewing inputs generated from in-depth research and motivating the team towards constant updates about the industry, current technologies, trends in social media and design, benchmark and audience trends.
Promotion strategies: securing the development of specific strategies to promote internal events, white papers and conferences, as well as special campaigns and awards that might need the social team support, setting an effective alignment with the Marketing and Business Development team.
Case Studies development: secure an strategic creation workflow of Case Studies, managing script alignment with the Copywriter, video production with the MG Studio team, agency deck updates and website pages and content development for all social channels along with an strategic calendar of publication and promotion.
The Power-Up Series production: manage the overall development of The Power-Up Series, as the brands main physical and virtual TLS event - securing an strategic guest panellist procurement and a consistent production across all touch points, including topic research and alignment, concept and overall structure and alignment with the MG Studio, Business Development and Marketing teams.
Webinars and Roundtables production: manage the development of internal events focused on lead generation, aligning the strategies with the Business Development team and securing high-quality topic research, content structure, promotion strategies implementation and efficient event workflows across digital platforms, as well as alignment with the
MG Studio team for tech and production purposes.
Analytical reports: securing the development of insightful analytical reports using main data and insights available; including key highlights and strategic takeaways, whilst constantly inspiring the team to improve content and increase the audience base and engagement.
Budget Management: responsible for aligning the department budget with the Marketing Manager and the Business Development team, considering the overall structure and communication strategies to secure strategic investments.
Skills
To be successful in this role we would expect you to be able to demonstrate the following:
Desirably you hold a Bachelor degree in Public Relations, Marketing or a related field;
4+ years of work experience in a digital marketing or advertising agency;
Managerial experience is strongly preferred;
Experience with events planning and production is strongly preferred;
Written and verbal skills – you comfortably create captivating storytelling and sell your ideas in a structured way;
Strong knowledge of social networks within the digital marketing and influencer marketing industry as well as public relations;
Ability to manage content development connected to the ever-changing digital landscape and updated with the latest trends;
Ability to identify and present ongoing KPI’s and success metrics, with strong analytical skills;
Highly skilled in planning, prioritising and have excellent attention to detail;
You can work autonomously, staying positive when under pressure, and empowering others to do the same;
A strong personality who is able to work autonomously and within the team;
Good communicator with a versatile approach to navigate through different scenarios;
You enjoy working with team members from diverse backgrounds, nationalities, different skill sets and areas of focus.
About MG Empower
Welcome to MG Empower! We're a relationship-focused Influencer Marketing Agency whose purpose is to empower brands and individuals to go above and beyond.
We're changing the way brands behave, disrupting the traditional marketing model and generating exceptional results by capitalising on rapidly evolving customer preferences for content and communication.
Founded by Maira Genovese in 2017 to leverage the untapped opportunity surrounding the rising phenomenon of the 'influencer'. Within 5-years, MG Empower has evolved to become the trusted marketing partner for some of the world's most influential brands.
MG Empower transforms into a Global Digital Powerhouse by operating from its headquarters in London and opening a new office in New York. We are expanding our area of expertise into a fully-fledged line of business that includes human spark, data intelligence and first-party content.
MG Empower partnered with some of the world's most influential brands, including Amyris, Inc., Bumble, Chopard, StarzPlay, Deliveroo, TikTok and Bytedance. We created outstanding digital marketing campaigns based on our proprietary influencer CRM built on 4+ years of data and a network of over 5 million influencers. It currently operates in 5 continents, 40 countries; we speak 17 languages and employ 50 talents.
We're a young and ambitious agency growing quickly and want fantastic onboard talent like you!
Our Values
Empowerment – Empower you and others.
Excellence – In everything we do. Internally or Externally
Envision- The future and make it happen. Together.
Energy – Is key. Your energy, our energy.
Empathy – To you and others.

Childrensalon believes there is beauty in diversity and difference, as resembled by our wonderful team. Our vision of being the most inclusive, diverse and humane company is very important to us as is our culture of fairness, openness and transparency. We are committed to the career progression and advancement of every team member as well as welcoming the best external talent in the industry. We offer a fun, challenging, collaborative, family-oriented work environment in our fast-paced and rapidly growing business and in turn will provide you with the opportunity to grow your career and make a difference.
Under the direction of the Head of Content, and in alignment with the business overarching strategy and brand identity, you will oversee and manage all of the social media content and deliver visuals that reflect the Childrensalon aesthetic and creative flair combined.You will create engaging content to advance the brand identity, broaden awareness and increase visibility amongst international audiences in partnership with the Social Media Manager (Insights).
Together with the wider marketing and editorial teams, you will drive the impact of our social media presence, strengthening Childrensalon's reputation as forward-thinking leaders and the authority in lifestyle content that reflects our values of family, creativity, innovation and heritage.
 Responsibility areas:
Create engaging content, imagery and tone of voice that feels authentic and relatable to our customer base and their lives as families and emphasises our brand values.
 Manage the implementation of the organic social strategy across multiple channels, such as Instagram, Facebook and YouTube, driving growth and high-level engagement.
Champion and guard Childrensalon’s tone of voice across all social platforms, adapting the right tone for the different channels based on established needs and strategy.
Suggest innovative ideas to bring Childrensalon to life across our channels, driving customer growth and brand awareness in all targeted international territories.
Monitor social trends and incorporate findings into planned campaigns and initiatives, reporting to wider organisation on current community trends and sentiment.
Work closely with the wider Creative and Marketing teams to ensure consistent and impactful campaign execution.
Liaise with the Production and Creative Design teams for development of all assets to deadlines.
Plan regular live streams and other outreach projects alongside the PR & Outreach team.
Support the creation and maintenance of Childrensalon house standards for all in-house social media photography.
Managing and developing the Social Media team, mentoring junior team members to develop their skills and expertise.
Key Attributes:
Passion for Social Media with a brilliant eye for creating authentic content, imagery and tone of voice.
Understanding of parenting and how parents engage online and how to best translate our values of family, creativity, innovation and heritage into engaging experiences for families.
Creative thinking and innovative ideas.
Social Media Management and Community Management experience with focus on children or parenting.
Independent creation and successful execution of community-focused marketing campaigns with specific business goals.
Well versed in the value of campaign marketing and how it contributes to wider brand/commercial objectives.
Develop a deep understanding of all departmental strategies, tools and systems to ensure alignment with overall brand messaging and business objectives.
Fundamental understanding of commercial awareness.
Continuous monitoring and understanding of the fashion luxury industry, global retail environment and e-commerce trends.
Effective time management and project management skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Extremely well-organised, methodical and efficient, with a good dose of common sense and initiative.
This role is based at our Head Office in Tunbridge Wells with some remote working.
Childrensalon offers a highly competitive salary, company pension plan, health plan, fully subsidised gym membership, in-house yoga classes, company shuttle, generous holiday allowance and company discount.
Childrensalon is an equal opportunity employer and is determined to ensure that no applicant or team member receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race.
If you are interested and think you would thrive in this role, please apply to careers@childrensalon.com with your CV and covering letter about why you would like to work for us. Previous applicants need not apply.

431aebb0b51d01c3.title: Social Media Manager
431aebb0b51d01c3.description:
Details
Reference number
187761
Salary
£41,882 - £43,487
Grade
Higher Executive Officer
Information Officer
Contract type
Permanent
Business area
DWP - Communications
Type of role
Communications / Marketing
Press Relations
Working pattern
Flexible working, Full-time, Job share, Part-time
Number of posts
1

Location
London
About the job
Summary
The work of the Department for Work and Pensions makes a difference to the lives of millions of people, right across the country.


In the last year Universal Credit has stood up to the enormous challenge of the pandemic, providing a vital safety net for around 6 million people; our Plan for Jobs is helping hundreds of thousands or people into work, restoring stability to people’s lives; we’ve introduced the Pensions Schemes Act which will make pensions safer, better and greener; and we’ll soon be bringing forward our Disability Green Paper and National Strategy for Disabled People, promoting inclusion and fairness for all.


The Department’s work is often national news and we are recruiting for a Social Media Manager, to be part of our supportive and high-performing Digital Media and Press team.


The DWP Communications Directorate provides professional advice to ministers and departmental officials.


It also produces high quality communications via multiple channels to help meet the objectives of the department and the government.


The DWP Digital Communications Team and Press Office work closely and collaboratively with the rest of the Communications Directorate to find the best ways to inform the public about the work of the Department and the support and services we provide.


This post will be based at Caxton House, London.


This job role may be suitable for hybrid working, which is where an employee works part of the week in their DWP office and part of the week from home. This is a voluntary, non-contractual arrangement and your office will be your contractual place of work. The number of days that anyone will be able to work at home will be determined primarily by business need but personal circumstances and other relevant circumstances will also be taken into account. If you are successful, any opportunities for hybrid working, including whether a hybrid working arrangement is suitable for you, will be discussed with you prior to you taking up your post.
Job description
We are looking for a Social Media Manager with a positive, can-do attitude to join our growing team of Digital Communications Specialists who value creative thinking and new ideas.


You will be a results-driven, strategic thinker with exceptional knowledge and understanding of the Social Media landscape who can come up with original, highly shareable social ideas.


You are naturally inquisitive, always looking for best practice examples and enjoy breaking down barriers with new ways of doing things.


This is a fast-paced and hands-on position, you must be able to work well under pressure and to tight deadlines, as well as adapt quickly to changing circumstances.


In this role you will be expected to create engaging social media content, develop campaigns, and evaluate digital communications.
Responsibilities
Essential Criteria:


You must:


Be a passionate social media expert, with a keen interest in the evolving social and digital media landscapes and how different channels are used by various target audiences.


Be able to handle demanding priorities to ensure that content across all platforms is accurate, visually compelling, and of high quality.


Be able to demonstrate teamwork in the creation of digital plans, strategies and engaging creative content.


Be able to demonstrate experience in conducting effective evaluation of digital and social media activity and incorporating the results into future strategies and solutions.


Have a proven track record of driving significant engagement using social media.


Be capable of managing multiple, concurrent projects, estimating and allocating time effectively, and meeting tight deadlines.


Be willing to assist team members with additional activities when required, such as assisting with video creation and graphic design.


Desirable Criteria:


Experience in graphic design using Adobe Creative Cloud or editing video using Adobe Premier.


Experience of recording video content using professional camera systems or mobile devices.


Familiarity with accessibility and usability issues.


Project Management skills.


Line management experience.


Please note – If there are a high number of applications an initial sift will be carried out based on the first 4 Essential Criteria listed at the top of this section.


All offers of employment are conditional on successful completion of Counter Terrorism Checks (CTC).


Candidates should not resign from their current job until these checks have been successfully completed.
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Communicating and Influencing
Working Together
Technical skills
We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:
Insight
Ideas
Implementation
Impact
BenefitsLearning and development tailored to your role as a Communications specialist
An environment with flexible working options
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension
23 days annual leave year allowance in year one. However, this may vary for existing civil servants based on their number of years’ service


London Salary £41.882 (Band Minimum) – £43,487 (Band Maximum)

Civil servants applying on promotion will usually be appointed to the salary minimum or within 10% of existing salary.
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is counter-terrorist check.

See our vetting charter.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Strengths, Experience and Technical skills.
The selection process will assess both what candidates are good at and also what they enjoy to help us assess candidates’ behaviours, strengths and their potential.


Selection will be by a written sift, followed by an Interview and a short presentation


The Sift stage:


As part of the application process you will be asked to complete a CV and Personal Statement of no more than 1250 words with an appendix. Further details around what this will entail are listed on the application form.


Your CV should set out your career history with key responsibilities and achievements.


Your Personal Statement (Max 1250 Words) should explain how your personal skills and qualities make you a suitable candidate for the job. Please provide evidence of your suitability for the role on the Statement of suitability, with particular reference to the Essential criteria listed. Within your Personal Statement please provide 5 links to examples of your work published on different social media platforms.


Both the CV and Personal Statement of suitability will be assessed against the Essential criteria listed in the responsibilities section.


Please note – If there are a high number of applications an initial sift will be carried out based on the first 4 Essential Criteria listed on in the responsibilities section and slide 7 of the candidate pack.


The interview stage:


Candidates successful at the sift stage will be invited to an Online Interview using MS Teams. This will consist of a blended behaviour and strength based interview, which should take approximately 45 minutes.


You will be asked to prepare a short presentation to deliver at the interview. Further details will be provided if you are successful at the sift stage and invited for an interview.


You will be assessed during the interview using:


2 Civil Service behaviours – Communicating and Influencing and Working together.

4 GCS Technical Behaviours – Insight, Ideas, Implementation and Impact.

Strengths


Behaviours

Behaviours are the actions and activities that people do which result in effective performance in a job. Please consult the Civil Service Behaviours for more information on each of the behaviours being assessed at interview. It may help to use one or more examples of a piece of work you have completed or a situation you have been in, and use the WHO or STAR model to explain; What it was, How you approached the work/situation and what the Outcomes were, what did you achieve? Or What was the Situation? What were the Tasks? What Action did you take? How/what did you learn through a Review?


GCS Technical behaviours

You will find further details of these in the GCS Professional Competency framework attached.


Strengths

Strengths are the things that we do regularly, do well and that motivate us.

The Civil Service Strengths Dictionary is a set of defined strengths that are relevant to the culture and type of work that we do.


Civil Service Strengths are not defined by grade.


Sift and Interview Dates:


The anticipated timetable is as follows:


The sift will commence W/C 14/03/2022 and 21/03/2022


Interviews to Commence W/C 18/04/2022


Please note that these dates are indicative at this stage and may be subject to change.


Further Information


A reserve list may be held for a period of 6 months from which further appointments can be made.


Any move to DWP from another employer will mean you can no longer access childcare vouchers. This includes moves between government departments. You may however be eligible for other government schemes, including Tax Free Childcare. Determine your eligibility at here


Reasonable Adjustment


If a person with disabilities is put at a substantial disadvantage compared to a non-disabled person, we have a duty to make reasonable changes to our processes.


If you need a change to be made so that you can make your application, you should:


Contact Government Recruitment Service via dwprecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk as soon as possible before the closing date to discuss your needs.


Complete the “Assistance required” section in the “Additional requirements” page of your application form to tell us what changes or help you might need further on in the recruitment process. For instance, you may need wheelchair access at interview, or if you’re deaf, a Language Service Professional.


If successful and transferring from another Government Department a criminal record check may be carried out.


In order to process applications without delay, we will be sending a Criminal Record Check to Disclosure and Barring Service on your behalf. However, we recognise in exceptional circumstances some candidates will want to send their completed forms direct. If you will be doing this, please advise Government Recruitment Service of your intention by emailing Pre-EmploymentChecks.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk stating the job reference number in the subject heading.


All offers of employment are conditional on successful completion of Counter Terrorism Checks (CTC).


Candidates should not resign from their current job until these checks have been successfully completed.


New entrants are expected to join on the minimum of the pay band.


Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening, subject to a check on the Internal Fraud Database (IFD). This check will provide information about employees who have been dismissed for fraud or dishonesty offences. This check also applies to employees who resign or otherwise leave before being dismissed for fraud or dishonesty had their employment continued. Any applicant’s details held on the IFD will be refused employment.


A candidate is not eligible to apply for a role within the Civil Service if the application is made within a 5 year period following a dismissal for carrying out internal fraud against government.


If you are experiencing accessibility problems with any attachments on this advert, please contact the email address in the 'Contact point for applicants' section.


Before applying for this vacancy, current employees of DWP should check whether a successful application would result in changes to their terms & conditions of employment, e.g. mobility, pay, allowances. Civil Servants that would transfer into DWP from other government organisations, following successful application, will assume DWP's terms & conditions of employment current on the day they are posted, unless DWP has stated otherwise in writing.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
This job is broadly open to the following groups:
UK nationals
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals from the EU, EEA or Switzerland with settled or pre-settled status or who apply for either status by the deadline of the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals working in the Civil Service
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals who have built up the right to work in the Civil Service
certain family members of the relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals
Further information on nationality requirements
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
Apply and further information
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.
Contact point for applicants
Job contact :
Name :
Evlambios Christophi
Email :
Evlambios.Christophi@dwp.gov.uk
Recruitment team :
Email :
dwprecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk
Further information
Appointment to the Civil Service is governed by the Civil Service Commission’s Recruitment Principles. If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with these principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should in the first instance contact DWP by email: HR.BUSINESSASSURANCE@DWP.GOV.UK. If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the Department, you can contact the Civil Service Commission here to visit Civil Service Commission

7262283c4b70319c.title: Social Media Manager
7262283c4b70319c.description:
This role will be responsible for our social media strategy; ensuring inspiring, creative and relevant content is shared across Oxford Nanopore's social media channels, with the aim of increasing brand awareness and customer engagement!
Duties include but are not limited to:
Developing social media strategies to incorporate, campaign priorities, key events, corporate communications and brand. Channels to include, but not limited to: Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, Reddit.
Manage Marketing Executive, ensuring content is accurate, tone is appropriate and continued rich pipeline of creative content is delivered to address relevant audiences.
Maintain a diverse content schedule, tailored to different channel audiences.
Develop paid programme across channels in line with organisational priorities, run budget and support Marketing Executive with delivery.
Provide social media training to employees.
Identify trends and opportunities to develop innovative and engaging communications!
Understand the vision and tone of voice of the company, where the customer is at the heart of our community and we support the sharing of customer stories by customers.
We'll expect you to have..
A BSc degree in life sciences or marketing/communications, or similar.
Previous experience with shown success in handling multiple social media channels and creative content, along with extensive experience in management of paid programmes on social media.
You will have excellent written details, an eye for design and detail and be highly organised. This role will suit an enthusiastic, self-starter that enjoys working in a fast paced team environment!
Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.
#LI-EC1
Oxford Nanopore's goal is to bring the widest benefits to society through enabling the analysis of anything, by anyone, anywhere. The company has developed a new generation of nanopore-based sensing technology enabling the real-time, high-performance, accessible and scalable analysis of DNA and RNA. The technology is used in more than 100 countries to understand the biology of humans and diseases, plants, animals, bacteria, viruses and whole environments.
Oxford Nanopore was founded in 2005 as a spin-out from the University of Oxford and now employs around 650 employees around the world.

bfd02cef685f220a.title: Social Media / Community Management Intern/ Work experience
bfd02cef685f220a.description: Hello, we’re BANG! Curry. Our founder Shelly grew up on Brick Lane, right in the heart of London’s bright Bangladeshi community. She knew that she wanted to bring her mum’s well-loved recipes to her own family so she set out to do exactly that. Fast forward to now: BANG! Curry provides curry kits to homes across the country.At BANG! our motto is ‘the more you put in, the more you get out’. That’s why we’ve put three generations of home cooking into each flavour-filled kit. That’s why we only use the most lip-smacking natural ingredients. And that’s why we’re all about inspiring people to take our curry kits and make them their own. BANG! Curry isn’t just a stir-in sauce – it’s cooking. The chopping, stirring, getting your hands dirty kind of cooking.The Social Media / Community Management Intern roleWe’re looking for a talented Social Media / Community Management Intern to work alongside our Social Media and Content Manager to invigorate BANG!’s online presence and increase our brand awareness.As part of the BANG! team, we’d love for you to get stuck into a wide variety of digital activities and projects including: supporting the team with social media channels (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn), growing our online presence and reaching new audiences, competitor research and influencing our content strategy.Not only will you support us in getting BANG! Curry into kitchens all over the country, but you’ll gain hands-on experience in social media and community management and help shape the growth of our online presence.ResponsibilitiesEngage with other accounts in the industry to increase BANG!’s brand awarenessOutreach to increase following on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedInMonitor and analyse social and digital activity from competitorsAssist with the set-up and ongoing management of a BANG! Curry Facebook groupGrow our online community into a thriving community full of loyal fansHelp create new opportunities for growth and user acquisitionRequired skills / experience:Outstanding organisational skillsExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsTrustworthy and self-motivated, with a “can-do” attitudeThe ability to work well independently and use initiative, as well as the ability to work alongside a teamPrevious experience in social media / community management OR a good understanding of all social media channels, alongside a desire to enhance this knowledgeA genuine passion for social mediaA LOVE for food – bonus points if you’re a curry lover!DetailsYou will be working completely remotely. You just be fluent in English and eligible to work in the UK.To applyPlease send your CV and cover letter. Creative applications are very welcome!Job Types: Part-time, PermanentPart-time hours: 16 per weekSalary: £50.00-£75.00 per dayAdditional pay:Bonus schemeLoyalty bonusBenefits:Discounted or free foodFlexible scheduleSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWeekend availabilityCOVID-19 considerations:Bang Curry works closely with its employees and supply chain partners, to ensure appropriate social distancing and cleaning processes are in place, to reduce the risk of infection and minimising disruption to our businessEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)Experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 year (preferred)social media: 1 year (preferred)Social Media Marketing Occupations: 1 year (preferred)Language:english (required)Application deadline: 15/03/2022Reference ID: Social Media - Community Management InternExpected start date: 15/03/2022

Social Media Manager required to join a growing start-up company focusing on blockchain technology for mobile networks. This would be a great opportunity for someone with an understanding of blockchain or Crypto technology, or a strong social media background with a desire to learn.

Demonstrable experience growing social media platforms

ff0a1853a1dc0089.description:
Social Media Manager - Fragrance
Remote
Our client a fragrance brand is currently looking for a Social Media Manager paying up to £45,000.

ea23a29dd9a1edf3.description: About UsFuse Universal isn’t just another learning company. We’re rudely shaking up the way that people and organisations learn and communicate, right across the world. Our unique Integrated Learning Platform allows businesses to shape their learning around their goals by tapping the inherent knowledge of the experts and peers within their organisation.Used by over 150 progressive organisations worldwide — including Hilti, Vodafone, Panasonic, Scandic, and Avon — Fuse sparks active engagement for deeper learning experiences that ignite your people’s performance.About this roleFuse Universal (Fuse) is searching for a self-motivated, proactive, Client Success Manager to join our Client Success Team to devise client-focused initiatives that deliver long-lasting business value.From an effective onboarding plan and account planning, through to renewal, expansion and upsell conversations, the role stretches across all elements of the client lifecycle. Your role is to create advocates of your clients who share a deep passion and understanding of the use of new learning technologies that drive performance and delivers results within their organisations.In your approach, you are diligent and obsessed with delivering business value to your clients, coupled with providing advice and best practice guidance for maximising their use of the Fuse platform. Your clients KPI’s and success criteria is at the heart of everything that you do and you are able to prove real business value by measuring product success against these criteria.Working within the Services function, it will come as no surprise that you play a critical role in the building and nurturing of client relationships. At Fuse, the Services team are deeply ingrained in the client’s journey right from the start of the sales process. As a CSM, you will be responsible for engaging with new and existing clients duringThe implementation process to ensure that their learning solution is prepared to launch successfully, and aligned to their needsIn-life, working with the broader Fuse business to drive user adoption and engagement, lasting business value and world-class service that ultimately leads to client retention and expansion.Creative, energetic and self-driven, you understand your clients and their business needs and, in return, you gain their trust as a respectfully challenging partner. You can manage multiple accounts and projects at different levels of complexity and lifecycle, and you have an in-depth knowledge of the platform and its value proposition. You can work collaboratively across multiple teams, positively influence platform best practice and prioritise key tasks and activities.If you love making clients successful, we would like to talk to you.About the teamThe Client Success team forms a crucial part of our Services function here at Fuse. The CS team works directly with our clients to devise operational and strategic initiatives that deliver long-lasting business value. As a team member, you are a client advocate, and your role is to build strong relationships with key stakeholders that enable you to support nurture, grow and retain the client.Your ResponsibilitiesAs (chiefly the Leadership, Sales and Product teams) to formulate and execute mitigation plans to eliminate churn risk proactively.RequirementsFor the role of CSM, we’re looking for the following acumen - industry and outcome focused and aligned to business objectivesStatistical mindset, curious, analytical and driven to drive value with the ability to measure business value and draw insights
